Besakih: The ticket price includes the entrance fee, a motor scooter ride up the to the temple itself and a guide. We have our own sarong (essential kit if you want to visit several temples in Bali and show respect for local culture). At the entrance you will probably be surrounded by…
Sacred: Great place to spend few hours in a cool shadow of tropical rain forest. Cute monkeys are everywhere and taking a photo with them is so much of fun :)
Kuta: One of the world's most famous beaches and no trip to Bali, is really 100% complete, without a visit to the saltwater. And, Kuta Beach is so much more than just sand and sea. It is also a bustling commercial and social hub, for both international tourists, as well as the local…
Mount: Highlights of Ubud Tour. Although we didn't do a trek up to the top, we still enjoyed the beautiful view of Mount Batur and Kintamani lake on a bright sunny day. Also enjoyed some local fruits like passionfruit, mangosteen from local shops. Not to be missed attraction on Ubud…
Aling: This waterfall is about 20 minutes South of Singaraja in North Bali. It costs 1250 K IDR for the waterfall and adventure package - which is what you should do.   There are a lot of uneven steps down to the falls and jumps so it is not for the unfit or mobility impaired.  The…
Grandmas: Rooms were great. Just what you need for a place to hide away after you explore Kuta. Close to beach. Security at the hotel is incredible and Septi and Ari made sure we were well looked after. Always kind and welcoming.
Amnaya: My girlfriend Rita and me spent 2 weeks in this fabulous hotel. They were so kind as to give us a free upgrade for a suite for the time of our stay which was a very generous offer, and the staff truly tried to fulfill all of our wishes in an instant. Especially Darma and Ari from the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. You get 5* service, many waiters and waitresses greet you by your name after a while. We really felt at home <U+0001F3E1> there. Breakfast was amazing, it’s not a buffet but you’re full for the whole day from it. Definitely need to try the Chef’s Special and the Soft Shell Crab <U+0001F980>.  Afternoon tea at the pool is superb, and the whole place is just minutes from the beach. These two weeks passed by as if they were just seconds. Will definitely go back there next…
Radisson: It's hard to just say a few good things about this place as after spending 7 days here with my girlfriend in march.  The heart and soul of this place is the staff, more attentive, customer service minded and helpful staff is hard to find even in Bali. Ega at the reception and Reana at the restaurant bar shined a little extra. That being said ALL of the staff were absolutely amazing.   The rooms? We had the suite and boy was it worth it. A huge balcony going around our room, with the most insane view of the ocean. Massive room with a great bed and aircon.   The restaurants were great and we ate here almost everyday because of the lockdown and Nyepi.   Location is also amazing if you plan on going to Omnia (the hotel has deals) or Sunday beach club.   This is a real 5 star and…

Besakih: This is such a beautiful temple. It’s really big, and there’s such a peaceful atmosphere to walking around. We were there during a ceremony, which was so special to see too.   It’s a ton of walking, but it’s so beautiful. Be careful of all the tourist traps. People try to insist…
Sacred: Very beautiful jungle forest where you can walk and enjoy the ambience and watch how monkeys do the daily activities. Be careful if you want to feed the monkeys as its not allowed there, but the monkeys was not aggressive, so we brought some peanuts with us and made some funny…
Kuta: Massive beach with plenty of space for everyone ! quite relaxing and very sunny most of the times ! the sea thought is very rough and you cant swimm because the waves are big and there is many people surfing! if you are a surfer is amazing !
Mount: Although having arranged and organised our Mount Batur Sunrise hike with Discova, the 3am pick up still found us groggy and slightly under-prepared. Nevertheless, on the 2 hour drive from Ubud our Discova guide talked us through what to expect from the climb. Upon arriving at…
Aling: This waterfall could be a great option if you chose to vist North Bali. You can trekking with a really low ticket price but if you're going to swim and jump down the waterfalls, you're gonna need a local guide with a price that is a higher, but trust me it's worthy.
Grandmas: Friendly and accomodating staff. Septi from the reception and Adi, one of the servers most especially.  On our second day, I requested for yogurt and granola (which was one of the main courses the previous day) but it wasn't available. (The hotel changes their main course menu every two days.) I appreciate that Adi checked the kitchen for me and when it wasn't available, he promised that he'll, have yogurt and granola ready for me the next morning. And he delivered. I really appreciate it.  I love that breakfast menu is concentrated on local dishes too, letting the guests have a taste of Indonesian cuisine.   The beds are comfy too. Water pressure and temperature is good. The only downside for me is that the lighting in the room was quite dim so it was a little challenging when…
Amnaya: I have traveled around the world since retiring ten years ago, and during that time have stayed at dozens of hotels from Cape Town, the Caribbean, Dubai, Hong Kong, South East Asia,  and all points in between, and I can honestly say that this hotel stands out as one of the very best I have experienced..it is brand new, the rooms are luxurious and spacious with over-sized comfortable beds and large flat screen TV's with cable and include nice touches like installed water softeners. Staff are extremely attentive and helpful, and there are elements of quality usually associated with five star marquee brands at a fraction of the cost; The restaurant and food are fabulous, the pool is beautifully designed, and the gym is equipped with the latest high tech equipment, with the beach…
Radisson: best hotel I have ever stayed in!! Every aspect of the hotel was absolutely beautiful and immaculate, really couldn't have asked for a better stay (despite the circumstances of having to stress about getting a flight home due to Covid-19 the staff made the stay as relaxing and pleasurable as possible!)

Besakih: The temple itself is situated at the base of Mount Agung,an active volcano, and right at the edge of the exclusion zone as the volcano continues to erupt and has done so the last few years. Be mindful of current warnings as if there is an eruption there's essentially one road…
Sacred: Well set up and great place to view the monkeys antics in a beautiful setting nice place just to walk around
Kuta: Kuta Beach is very hectic. I used to have a long stroll here. Nice for people watching.  It is crowded with tourists, there are those who just want to sit and drink all day long.  I did find the beach was relatively clean, there were people enjoying the surf or just messing…
Mount: Climbed the mountain on Christmas Day. It was an eventful, thrilling and tiring trek, yet very rewarding.  Woke up in the wee hours ard 2am to prepare. Started trekking ard 4-5+am. It was pitched dark. Its good to bring along torchlight or headlight. The whole trek took about…
Aling: This one cost 125k per person but was well worth it.  We were given two guides, who walked us down to the first waterfall.  Here you can don a lifejacket and slide down a natural waterslide, and jump off a 5m platform into the water.  Then they take you to the 10m platform, then…
Grandmas: Very Recomended hotel in Bali. Special thank’s to the staff Tina, Bawa, Wisnu, Ali & sanjaya,  good job guys! Excellent  service  <U+0001F929> Very cheap price & nice room. Breakfast also delicious. I’ll be back soon
Amnaya: The luxury chains need to take a leaf from Amnaya; they know the true meaning of hospitality.  There's hardly anything to fault at my stay at Amnaya Benoa. Absolutely delightful. The staff were all personable and incredibly well-trained.
Radisson: The hotel is very beautiful...love the huge room also the pool. All the staff was really helpful. The spa treatment was really nice as well. Wangi did a great job. And Handre at breakfast was so nice. Overall, it was wonderful stay, highly recommend!

Besakih: This is one of the iconic temples in Bali!  It's a lot of stairs and very beautiful.  I would say it's a MUST SEE!
Sacred: I never thought I would love my walk around this place. They have preserved it very well. Monkeys are cute but naughty as well, very playful. Staffs around are very helpful with photos and directions. Oh, and there is a small gallery with collection of art works of various…
Kuta: Amazing God , amazing beach, so many peoples like to use their time for waiting a sunset every day.  If you stay at Kuta. Go there guys :)  I Will go there again because when i take a picture that day ia cloudy.  Covid 19 makes all beach at Bali close
Mount: Climbing Mount Batur was not on our itinerary, despite a sunrise hike being the most popular thing to do in the area. I'd read up before our trip and the active volcano seemed reasonably challenging to hike and there was always the problem of us not really having the correct…
Aling: This place is not just for seeing waterfalls, but is the best nature waterpark in Bali. You can have a lot of fun there. On the top you get guide, they are really friendly and they show you 3-4 waterfalls. It is possible also jump from them if you have courrage<U+0001F60E> in the end you…
Grandmas: The service at this hotel is the best I've ever experienced. The staff is so incredibly helpful. They said ok to every request we made. They got us extra towels, let us store our bags late, found us umbrellas, did our laundry, got us all kind of special breakfast items. They wrote us a hand-written note to apologize. What !?! I can't thank Septi, Grace and Gusti enough. Thanks for the umbrella at night Tina! Thank you Angur! Yoga or the hotel managers at this place are doing a fantastic job. As people have pointed out, the rooms are on the smaller side but the service and dedication of the staff at this hotel more than makes up for everything!
Amnaya: We had a fantastic stay at the Amnaya Benoa Resort hotel. The service is great all the time. The rooms are very spacious and well furnished with nice amenities and everything working (TV, airco etc.). The food and breakfast were great. A nice pool, nothing too big, but normally also not too busy because of the relative hotel size. Nice smells everywhere and clean.  Special thanks to Arnawa for his personal service.
Radisson: I stayed here for 2 days in March 2020. All of the staff were excellent, very kind and accommodating. Location was good, close to a couple of beaches and the Uluwatu Temple. They also offer a free shuttle service (though I was unable to use it due to the nCoV closing down these spots). I would definitely stay here again.  Pros: - Good location with free shuttle service - Excellent staff - Great pool area - Breakfast was good, varied selection - Large, comfortable, clean rooms  Cons: - None!

Besakih: The temple is on the southern slopes of Mount Agung, the principal volcano of Bali. When you arrive there will be many people around. After you buy the ticket, ($60,000 Rupiah each; which includes entrance, a sarong, and one way trip up the hill to the entrance gate by scooter),…
Sacred: One of our first stops in Ubud and it didnt disappoint, you just have to watch out for the monkey. As I sat down to rest on a wall, I was approached by a monkey who wanted me to hold it. I quickly realized that they work in pairs. One butters you up while the other eyes you up…
Kuta: You should go there because:  - When in Bali, one must do the touristy thing of visiting Kuta Beach  You should leave immediately because: - All the beach vendors know you are a tourist and will swarm up on you to get you to buy whatever it is they are well - Even after you…
Mount: I joined a sunrise trekking tour last year,it was organized by Batur Volcano guesthouse where i stayed in June.it is one on one guided tour,the price is reasonable,the tour start at very early morning,my guide Yoki came to my room and  knocked the door to wake me up,i was…
Aling: Wow what can we say the waterfalls were beautiful and getting to slide down a waterfall was a once in a lifetime.   The 3 cliff jumps 5,10,15m me and partner both did which was andrenaline packed but we loved it!   Also thanks to the amazing guides we jumped off the 15m and our…
Grandmas: The check in process was really quick and sweet (they give you a little cold tea on arrival which is a very nice touch). The hotel room was so cosy and clean, like a mini 5* hotel. I paid £10 for one night and it’s the best £10 I spent. They organize airport drops offs for 60K which were so good.  Special thanks to Putra, damma & Wisna
Amnaya: Travel woth two small kids (1y and 3y). Amazing place!  Great a la carte breakfast (pictures on attachment)! Clean and quite. Only thing, there’s not so many places to go outside the hotel.  Beach not good, dirty.
Radisson: Very nice resort that is suitable for both couples and families. As all resorts it’s not very personal though, and do not eat at the restaurants. Breakfast was good and a lot to choose from. Great gym and yoga! Pool area was awesome and the staff in the pool bar as well. Rest of the service was meh. Would not go again but that is based on the fact that it is a resort. Great for everyone who likes lying by the pool. Awesome area in Uluwatu, close to take a Grab or Gojek to all good restaurants. Uluwatu is NOT good for sunbathing.

Besakih: I had heard of a lot of harassment faced by tourists by the locals of this area. However, things are not the same anymore. The ticket price now includes a guide and therefore, no one harassed us for money.   The guide was a good person who took us around the temple, however, he…
Sacred: Wonderful place to spend some time with a little monkeys! Just be carful and do not feet them. Since ITs not all of them are small and cute , some of them might be big and aggressive! especially If if you are hiding the food!   Temple is very big and it will take some time to…
Kuta: Stayed in Kuta for 4 days at the beginning and 4 at the end of our holiday and found the beach to be clean. Lovely spot for people watching.  Lots of choices for eateries and for drinks. The boardwalk that winds for miles along the water front makes for a fantastic ramble.
Mount: Fabulous place and the veiws were just amazing despite the fact that we got caught in seasonal rain.
Aling: We used a motorbike to travel from Medewi to the Falls. It took about 2 hours and was as much fun as the jumping and sliding. The mountain roads are narrow and steep but generally safe. You just need to be careful.   The Falls are beautiful and the diving platforms are well…
Grandmas: Hotel Staff are very nice service with a smile, most specially to Front Desk : Septi, Ari,Grace,Arta,Wisnu, Tina, Martin  and Amazing breakfast special mention to Anggun, Suparma (the best chef), Nice place for stay... really enjoyed my stay....overall i would highly recommend this hotel <U+0001F60A><U+0001F970>
Amnaya: Staff are incredible, rooms superb and thoroughly cleaned every day by Yogi and Harts, great guys who went that extra mile. The complex manager was really friendly and made time to make sure we where ok every time we met him. Food was good, restaurant by the pool or in your room , nothing was too much trouble. Yoga facility amazing and we had free reign as with the gym. Massage within the complex fantastic, although cheaper else where I would advise using the hotel facilities which are wonderful. Definitely return again. Lovely people who care about their guests
Radisson: First stay at the Radisson Blu in Uluwatu. Awesome hotel overall. The two restaurants are great and the buffet breakfast change every day which is good if you are staying a week or more.  The pool area is amazing and the staff are all fantastic. Would surely stay there again if I am in Bali.

Besakih: It's difficult to predict the weather however it would be a huge bonus if you go when the sky is blue and no clouds. That would help to see the Mt Agung which would make the trip even more special.
Sacred: No stay in Ubud would be complete without a trip to its famous Monkey Forest, the name alone sparks the imagination. Its goal of preserving a forested area peppered with traditional buildings and temples all for the purposes of protecting hundreds of families of monkeys is a…
Kuta: As a result of tourism, the beach is a rubbish tip each morning. Getting worse every year and have decided not the frequent Kuta anymore because of this. Better places to holiday that care for their environment more.
Mount: We did this as part of our Honeymoon and we couldn't end up with a better guide.   We had a great experience on our hike with the fantastic guide KARMA! He's careful, safe and will to please. A fantastic guy who's always on the lookout for your safety!  The only negative…
Aling: I read lots of conflicting info about this place so I thought I’d let you know the drill.  It is about 15 minutes drive out of Lovina up in to the hills. When you arrive there is a small carpark and a reception area. To enter the waterfall area unaccompanied it is RP20k (AUD$2)…
Grandmas: This place is customer orientated and it makes a huge difference. The staff are friendly and hard working. Breakfast is amazing. Rooms are clean and functional. Grandma's makes for a comfortable stay in Kuta.
Amnaya: Absolutely superb hotel! It looks and feels amazing but the staff here make it truly special! From the first greeting when you arrive to every single encounter after they have all been so friendly and attentive.  We had two very minor issues (small leak in shower and mix up with hiring bicycles) and the staff went above and beyond what would be considered necessary to rectify these. The emphasis on customer satisfaction is outstanding!  We enjoyed a couple's Tropical Fruit treatment from the spa and this was fantastic. It lasted 2hours and was tailored to our personal preferences. Again, the staff were brilliant and we would both highly recommend this.  A special thank you to Arnawa who was a brilliant member of the team, very friendly and helpful.
Radisson: This is a fabulous property with nice big rooms and lots of storage space. We were slightly disappointed with the selection of items in the buffet breakfast and the bread toaster was always burning the toast because the bread was jammed in it. However, these are minor points and the whole package on offer is very good and excellent value for money.

Besakih: From the moment you arrive everyone is very pushy and asking for money, you will be asked to tip on top of your ticket price (which you don't have to do). We actually had money stolen from a zipped bag before we entered the temple. The temple itself is very old but there are…
Sacred: Great day out. However do make sure you have no loose items the monkeys do steal things. Just common sense needed
Kuta: Kuta beach is OK, not the type of beach for me, worth a walk if staying in Kuta, after walking along the beach I just found it a dirty with litter, not the beaches fault obviously, people need to respect the beach and take there rubbish with them, however it would help if there…
Mount: A must-do when you're in Bali! We came during March 2020 so there weren't very many people (we were told only 150-200 people compared to the usual 1k+). The hike itself is a bit difficult and slippery due to the small pebbles, but get a good guide and you'll be okay. It's…
Aling: The best waterfall i have been to i Bali. Super Nice/fun place to go. You kan watch the great waterfall. Cliff jumping in the river from 5, 10 and 15 m. They also have 2 natural water slides. One perfect for kids and a big one for everyone
Grandmas: All staff Will welcome you at the best on first day you arrive and room is very nice on a budget rate!   Thank to  The warm front office Septi, Grace!  The super friendly security team Ridwan and Sudana the living guide of Bali night Club <U+0001F603> !
Amnaya: the hotel exceeded all my expectations. The service is wonderful! Iluh, Nuri, Ceri and Widdas was the best to make everything perfect for us! You feel spoiled!! The room is spacious and beautiful. You have all you need. The pool area and the restaurant are amazing!  I’ll definitely back!
Radisson: This is a first class hotel in every respect. The staff are exceptional, without exception. Attentive, polite, with excellent English. Rooms are large and the beds are extremely comfortable. Pool is fabulous. Special mention for Widi, Adit and Desy at the Filini Italian restaurant.   Visited Some of the local beaches and they were extremely disappointing. Difficult to get to, often dangerous steps and, when you get there, very few facilities.

Besakih: Beautiful buildings on this temple complex even with the cloudy weather we've had. A must do of Bali <U+2665><U+FE0F>
Sacred: Monkeys will bite you even if you are not interacting with them. I was walking the path and one ran up behind my leg and bit me, breaking the skin. (I did not have any food or anything on me).  The front desk did not have much to clean the wound; however, a nice girl gave me…
Kuta: It’s the tourist Mecca of Bali, especially for young backpackers and people who want to party to the extremes.
Mount: We didn't expect the temperature to be a low 14c and the area somewhat obscured by a haze. It was still clear enough to enjoy  and appreciate the spectacular scenery from various vantage points known to our driver. It is still an active volcano, no tremors felt or rumbles on the…
Aling: I’ve been to several waterfalls in Asia and i can say that this one is the one that i enjoyed most. You can swim and jump from heights in the place. There are 4 waterfalls close to each other, i managed to jump in 2 of them but the others were higher so couldn’t make it:) It is…
Grandmas: It's a decent, lovely and great 3 stars hotel in Legian. Strategic locations, nice staff and great bedroom. At first i should've only stay here for one night but then i extend my stay until 4 more nights! How comfortable i am? My room view is straight to the Legian street.  Despite some technical issue, Mr. Yoga really help us to solve our problems and gave us the best hospitality we could have.   Breakfast was so so. Nothing special but there's just something here that makes me want to stay for more! Hope to get back soon.
Amnaya: This hotel is amazing. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The pool is beautifull, the breakfast and the restaurant very nice. We really enjoyed staying with you.   We were at Amnaya the first day of our holiday and came back for two more nights.   Thank you so much. Special thanks to Ceri, Arnawa and Julius for helping us.   Meike and Sara.
Radisson: We started our Bali trip with a week in Uluwatu at the Radisson Blu, and were really pleased with our stay! I'd definitely recommend this hotel for a relaxing vacation.  Positives: - Large, modern rooms and beautiful spacious bathrooms! I loved the big bathtub! - Good selection at breakfast (eggs, Asian dishes, fruit, yogurt, cereal, meat, bread, sweets, and cheese--though adding some oatmeal would be nice!) - Large pool and lush territory with lots of flowers and greenery. You'll be able to hear frogs at night and maybe even see a monkey hanging in the trees on the edge of the property! - Great location close to some beautiful beaches and powerful surf. Also lots of great restaurants nearby! - Daily shuttle to Uluwatu temple for the fire dance - Complimentary drinks and snacks…

Besakih: If you like seeing temples you have to see this temple. Situated high up in the mountain and a view to kill for from the top. Mother of all temples <U+0001F600>
Sacred: So fun! The monkeys will only get irritated if you get too close to them, so just don't bother them and they won't bother you. You can still take photos with them, and just be careful if you have food in your bag on in your pockets. You don't really need a guide. It's easy…
Kuta: Kuta Beach Bali is ok! Go a bit north And the Beach is Wider and better in Many Ways! As Well as the Waves!
Mount: A hardish trek mainly due to time of the night and humidity and the speed of the guide who wanted to sprint up.  The views are stunning, the monkeys are hilarious and the hawkers and dirt bikers are annoying. There were a lot of people up there so it isn't a peaceful place…
Aling: Aling Aling is a holy waterfall, and swimming is not allowed in it. But next to only 3 or 4 minutes walk (names in the attached photos)there are small waterfalls where the jumping/diving and swimming is allowed and is very nice.
Grandmas: We stayed here the night we arrived, very late. It was a great place to sleep and settle in before going over to Nusa Lembongan early the next morning. It's nice, modern and clean - very cheap and a great place to stay.
Amnaya: 5 star staff. Really. Beautiful materials and design. Rooms 5 star look-a- like. Food is amazing so is the fantastic spa. Swimming-pool an oasis and you’ll love views in room regarding the build of all furniture and balconies.
Radisson: It is with a heavy heart that I leave this review as this place could be amazing if it wasn't for numerous hiccups...  The pool and architecture is amazing and staff in general were friendly but why this would never be a five start resort are: - The aircon is not efficient, after several call outs it is clear that the system does not go colder than 24 despite having a control in the room.  Also miscommunication between in that were promised a better room to compensate for this but that never realised. - No one to help with luggage with arriving - 20min to check-in - Soap no being replaced by house keeping when cleaning the room - Bacon and other hot food items being cold during breakfast It could seem that the above is pettiness but one would expect better of 5* and Radisson Blu.

Besakih: This is 1200 years old temple of Bali!! The location is breathtaking, one should plan the visit in the second-half, so as to catch the sunset and beat the heat. The entire tour can take about 1-2 hours, the location is picturesque, one can spend some fine time and return with…
Sacred: A must-do in Bali, for animal nature buffs. Yes, the monkeys are the stars, but those who are into; botany, architecture, stone masonry and or sculpture work (see my YouTube V-log), will be equally enthralled. It is also, just a great place to go for walk.
Kuta: we were there in Feb, beach was nice but too many people here, wasnt comfortable for relax. many people offering things to buy.
Mount: worthy this strenuous trek is! Spend a good amount of time on the top and admire the beauty of the nature, the sunrise, and more. We had the best time! From the top of the hilltop, the sky is still dark and you can only see a few lights in the surrounding villages. Mount Agung –…
Aling: Aling Aling is one of the waterfalls that can jump and skate from a height with fresh water and clean
Grandmas: The hotel was good, I am very happy with the hotels service. The staff polite and helpful like family. The restaurant staff remember my name and my room number where I stay only 2 night. I remember the staff name is Arta,Youdi,and Ade. Thanks Will be back
Amnaya: We stayed at Amnaya Resort in Benoa for seven nights and we loved every single night. The staff was very helpful and friendly and helped us with everything from beach recommendations to restaurants. The breakfast was amazing and the gym as well. The pool area was a bit small but very calm and cute.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend some nights in the calm Nusa Dua area with professional help. A special thank you to Wini, Ceri, Suli and Hassan for all the help!
Radisson: We stayed here 3 nights and had a fantastic stay. The rooms are big, clean and the pool area is very relaxing. The food is also good. We especially liked the Mac‘n‘Cheese, Red Velvet and the Beef Rendang at the Artichok Restaurant. Specially thanks also to Windhu and Diego for making taking good care of us. We would recommend staying here and will come back.

Besakih: You will be pressured to give money. Then pressured some more as the guide looks in your wallet. Then pressured again for a bigger tip. Expect to pay at least $40 US dollars more than the price of admission. May no one ever convert to this religion, and may there be apostate…
Sacred: very cute. my favorite spot in Ubud. the sanctuary is very big and a lot of monkeys inside. but don't touch the monkey.
Kuta: My husband and I spent 8 days in Kuta, Bali and stayed at a hotel opposite Kuta Beach (over the road). We had the best sunset views of Kuta Beach and water the warmest we've ever experienced (we travelled quite a lot and visited many countries but this beach wins hands down -…
Mount: Me and my friend went for this mount batur trekking, it was surreal and such an amazing experience. Our trekking guide is very helpful and he is very sweet his name is karma, he always make sure that we safe. So thanks to him we had really really great experience and enjoyed the…
Aling: Perhaps, one of the best waterfalls I've been. Dowside, you must have to pay for a guide to go inside, no other way! but the scenic is terrific. Cliff jumping, lots of adreline!!
Grandmas: Our stay here was awesome, 2 nights is not enough to compliment all the positive things they have there. It was clean, in central location, near all the shops, cafe's spa's, beach and attractions, and the service from their staff was beyond excellent. Will definitely stay here again!
Amnaya: Wow.  This place is beautiful.  Friendly staff, Eka in reception was helpful and arranged our airport transfer.  Spa was lovely, restaurant was good.    Easy walk to the beach, although I think a shuttle is na option.
Radisson: I went to Bali 20 years ago and had a very different experience.  This was a holiday where I got to see the generous spirit and peaceful happiness this beautiful culture possess.  The Radisson Blu Uluwatu was such a relaxing venue and the dtaff went above and beyond.  We were SO relaxed a couple of hours after arriving!  We floated in the pool and enjoyed pizza and happy hour.  We have never been more relaxed in our adult lives. The scenery from this part of Bali is nothing short of spectacular.  There are hidden gems in short walking distance but make sure you have your breakfast because the stairs down to some of these gems can be a physical effort.   A big thank you to Radisson Blu staff for making this holiday so memorable - special thanks to Mega Septiana at Guest Relations…

Besakih: Gorgeous temple but very bad experience because of the locals. First of all, you must expect about 5 local women to surround your car to buy surong or umbrellas. Then, the staff at the ticket office will try to cheat you with the change. She gave me 60K less!! They will assign…
Sacred: We loved our visit to the monkey forest in Ubud. We drove on our moped and there was plenty of parking available outside the forest. Tickets were cheap and getting there was super simple. Be prepared to get waved down by people trying to get you to visit the nearby coffee…
Kuta: Nice and clean, wide beach. Sunbeds with umbrella for 50k per one sunbed and 100k for two per all day. Lot of food mini street food bars and wide choice of surfing schools (200k per two hours). Just be careful in the ocean its dangerous when low tide is starting
Mount: One of the best vulcano mountain located in Bali,here if you do camping you can see sunset and sunrise with the best and beautiful view of another mountain and view of Batur leake
Aling: Great fun awesome guide fun jumps and a good natural water slide and a beautiful waterfall to boot well manged and a fun experience
Grandmas: I was here with my boyfriend, we stayed here 2 times in our 3 week long trip. Everything was great, rooms were clean, staff was very helpful with everything we needed. Big thanks to everybody, expecially to Itha, Yoga, Septi, Grace, Anom, Sanjaya, Martin, Bayu, Gusti, Arta, Ali, Agung and everybody else I forgot to mention. Thank you guys and see you again!!!! :-)
Amnaya: I was very amazed by the warmth and friendliness of the staff. Service was excellent and the place itself was stunning. Although would have wished for more vegetarian food options, the servings were beautiful.   Would definitely stay there again for pure relaxation.   Special thanks to Hasan, Gede, Ari and Widi
Radisson: We had a wonderful stay at the Radisson Blu. The room was luxurious, spacious and had everything we needed. The staff was very kind and attentive and made us feel pampered. Our favourite thing about the hotel was definitely the pool- so big and just the right temperature.

Besakih: In one phrase: my less favorite place in Bali. The infrastructure was not impressive at all!. Was our first place to visit in Indonesia, we entered to the temple without guide, so the guides inside will approach to you and tell you that they don't receive salary that they need a…
Sacred: This is definitely one of the highlights when you stay in Ubud. It's a popular, touristy place but worth a visit regardless. If you like monkeys - there are plenty of them here! There's also an art exhibition and the park itself is quite nice as well, with bridges, statues, a…
Kuta: There’s too much litter on the shore, and local people working on the beach are too annoying with their services, every minute they’ll come to you suggesting bikes, taxis (yeah, I’m relaxing on the beach, why on earth would I want a taxi?), sunbeds (if you’re just walking),…
Mount: Its a sunrise on a wayyyy over crowded mountain with cash grabs all along the way. Definitely do another hike if you can.  The use of a guide is recently mandatory as well.  One positive is that it is a good view of a sunset if you are lucky and monkeys come out at the top to…
Aling: I was looking forward to visiting these waterfalls, they look stunning in the photos. I was suprised how populated the environment leading up to the waterfalls was. Once there, the roar of the water cascading down and the spectacle was superb. What spoilt if for me was the…
Grandmas: We stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The only downside was that there's no pool, but the staff were very helpful in directing us to the one nearby that costs a small amount to visit. We didn't take advantage of all the services the hotel has to offer, but it offers a lot for travelers who want to just relax and stay in all day, and travelers like us who really only came back to sleep. The location is perfect, not too close to the "crazy loud party" area of town, but near a lot of spas and eateries. We'd happily stay here again next time we're in the area.
Amnaya: Amnaya Resorts Benoa Nusa Dua The place is incredible the tranquility calming effect  The interior and exterior are incredible design very artistic amazing love it  The staffs are great service, friendly polite and helpful  Very clean and fresh the foods is absolutely delicious   and healthy options fruits is given everyday into your room and in the morning breakfast so much foods   you don’t feel like having lunch or so through the day I’m more energetic because of all the foods   And so thoughtful of amenities herbal lotion shampoo conditioner shower gel even salt bath and scrub my skin is so soft and so smooth  all in all was a wonderful experience highly recommended thank you <U+0001F60A>
Radisson: Very nice place. Huge Clean rooms, very grand. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Pool is a very good layout and depth with some shade. Could have stayed here for days. We will definitely stay again.

Besakih: The biggest and most beautifulltemple on Bali, still very impressive on the location. And now everything was well organised, no agressive salesman. Stop at 1 km before the entrance, parking, buy a ticket with a FREE sarong and we were brought to the entrance, 1 km on the…
Sacred: When we visited Bali, one of us was on crutches with a broken ankle. This made ALL tourist attractions very difficult and tiring to navigate. This was one of the most expensive places to get into but that being said - just getting to see these little guys up close made it so…
Kuta: Huge beach with a lot of people around... many surfers around a bit hard to swim from the waves but nice to stay take a beer and do some sun therapy’s
Mount: Amazing sunrise in Bali, one of the most beautiful sunrise in the world!   It takes around 2 hours climbing the mountain, I think that it was one of the most incredible experience of my life, I recommend you to do it.
Aling: Aling Aling waterfall is situated in North Bali near Lovina. One of the nicest fall within lush green. Approximately 1020 meter from sea level. Rough finished cemented stairs ,so many ups and downs with many waterfalls here and there. On the way the sound and scenery of the…
Grandmas: Our first time travelling to Bali (family trip) and this hotel was recommended to us by the tour package we booked along with it.  We stayed at this hotel from the 6-10 February 2020 Amazing hotel and service they have a really good breakfast! which my grandmother really loved! Along with that Puspita, Yodi and Dedi from the breakfast restaurant were very helpful since we had a 3 year old child travelling with us and cannot wake up early for breakfast they packed some food for her.  Although just a suggestion, maybe if you guys would consider one day... would've been a lot better actually if the restaurant also serves lunch and dinner as well since they have really good food.  And i would like to thank Steel from housekeeping department as well for making those cute towel…
Amnaya: This hotel will not disappoint . From the time you walk in the ambiance in this hotel hits you . Beautifully designed, nothing left out. The rooms are huge , king bed, dinning area, outside lounge on balcony and the bed is amazing , pillows are huge and fluffy!! The bath is amazing to lay back and have a long soak , with bath salts and bubble bath sitting on a tray with a loafer .. the bathroom product all smell Devine ! The pool area and gym are a wow. I have never seen such a well designed gym in Bali . This hotel is a must stay . Cleanest hotel in Bali without a doubt !!
Radisson: I definitely come back. Spa treatments was best ever. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Views was peaceful and beautiful. I switched a hotel during my stay in Uluwatu because the other hotel was awful.

Besakih: We organized our driver to pick us up at 6Am from our Kuta Hotel. This was the best move.           We arived at 7.45Am. Our driver managed to take us up to the top car park as no one else was here. So we didnt have to rent scooters to get to the entry. The entry office for…
Sacred: A trip to Bali is not complete without visiting these precious monkeys!  Give yourself a lot of time as the sanctuary gets busy!  Don't wear shiney anything (jewelry) as the monkeys will stop at nothing to grab hold of it and not let go.  DO keep your purses closed as they like…
Kuta: Great place to surf for the beginners. There are tons of surfing schools to choose from. Hopefully you can find the right person.
Mount: What an experience! Yes it is an early start if you want to see the sunrise but it is definitely worse the climb. I am not very fit but you just choose your own pace and the place is definitely very spiritual.
Aling: We booked the short tour with guide. The jumping and slides are great aswell as the guide. It's obvious that you don't need a guy to find this place but the guy introduce you in the slides and jumping and make sure that you leave after 2.5 hours that the place is not over crowed…
Grandmas: I had stayed here before this trip but the convenience to eateries shopping and live music is fantastic. Staff extremely happy and helpful, very good breakfast... Will be back in the near future, good ace for us to park our vehicle as well.
Amnaya: I was in Nusa Dua for a conference in one of the big global hotel brands and given my personal preference of staying in less known hotel brands, I was not disappointed.  The service was great and my room (I was automatically upgraded to the room with a bath) had nice touches.  It is just a shame I did not have a chance to enjoy it more.  The staff were very helpful and accommodating.  The only thing I would say is that the library is rather small if one needs an air-conditioned place to work outside the room.  In addition, the room could do with a working space.  But then again, I would say this hotel is not really for business
Radisson: I can’t say enough- I loved my stay. Gorgeous property and very well kept. The staff were all kind, thoughtful, and attentive. Interesting area with a lot to explore on foot. Huge room and super clean! One of my top/favorite hotels ever.

Besakih: As many reviews say, the entrance is 60.000 which includes guide, entrance and bike ride to the temple... Well non of that is true... The driver of the scooter asks you for a tip for one minute drive, you get there and the people are so pushy to buy stuff that I said I had no…
Sacred: Bali always has a view to charm its tourists with the nature and its spectacular innocence of how everything is being kept there. If you are scared of monkeys; dont go there.
Kuta: One of the famous beach. We had a beach cleaning so far. And it quite fun actually. Especially when we did a positive thing for the mother earth
Mount: Mt. Batur and the lake are very beautiful. That's the only positive thing I could say about that place. If you  want to climb the volcano crater without a guide, the locals will stop you. And they are not very friendly. There is NO official entrance fee, insurance, and any…
Aling: The best waterfall I have been to in Bali. Yes you do need to pay as a guide is provided and I think that a guide is important as the main waterfall is sacred and the guide will advise where you can and cannot go. When it comes to the slides, the jumps into the ponds, and access…
Grandmas: Everything was great about the hotel. The rooms are on the small size but is immaculate. The price is amazing. The staff is very friendly. Tina at the front desk is amazing and very helpful. She went above and beyond on everything. The porter was very friendly and was able to answer questions about the area. A+++
Amnaya: Even though we stayed there only for 3 nights, I can strongly suggest this resort as for its amazing staff as for its structure. The room was outstanding and the restaurant delicious. Hope to come back one day!
Radisson: The hotel facilities and hotel room are really beautiful. The breakfast is delicious and the staff are very friendly. There is a free shuttle bus to padang padang beach with is great for beginner surfers.

Besakih: Parking - 2k  Ticket (60k) includes: - guide (!) - transport to the top (from where you buy the ticket, which is near parking area) - sarong (!)  Guide. If you don’t really care learning about Balinese tradition be sure to IMMEDIATELY (where you first show the tickets) say that…
Sacred: This place is fun, but there were so many people there interacting with the monkeys and not always being very nice. There was no one to monitor it, and so it was fun and beautiful but kind of stressful if you care about the animals.
Kuta: Very smelly and dirty, but locals are friendly and local food vendors are soooo yummy, great beginner's surf beach with board hire and lessins being very affordable
Mount: I booked my tour on Viator for the Sunrise Trek through the local Como Bali Tour company.  They are nothing more than a bunch of thieves who care absolutely nothing about you or your safety.  I got picked up at my hotel at 2am and taken to a filthy restaurant for fly infested…
Aling: The highlight of our trip! We were picked-up in Ubud and the drive took about 2 hours. Agus our driver was great company and made our experience very easy and comfortable. There are a mix of different height waterfalls to jump from (5m/10m/15m). Our guide David was very…
Grandmas: Very good hotel we really enjoyed but they need to improve their break fast item .  Bathroom are ok well maintained  Price was very reasonable. Laundry service also good . Wifi worked perfectly. Their behaviour was so mind blowing
Amnaya: This resort exceeded every expectation that my family had prior to checking in. The room was absolutely beautiful not to mention the cool layout for the bathtub and shower. Great toiletries which were topped up daily. The fact that we got upgraded to a junior suite was just an added bonus. The deco for the room for our check-in and my wife's birthday was absolutely splendid.  BEST hotel breakfast I've experienced so far. You get to pick off a set menu which had a sufficient variety of freshly cooked meal for at least a one week.  You get an appetizer, mains, fruits with yogurt, one pastry, coffee/tea, and juice. What's not to like? Thumbs for reducing wastage by not having a typical buffet style breakfast.   Excellent service from the friendly staff as well. They made us feel…
Radisson: Wow wow wow. What an amazing experience from start to finish. The pool food staff room everything was perfect. Thank you for a memorable experience definitely recommend the Radisson Blu. Can’t wait to return again.

Besakih: veri intresting place n large...its the biggest temple in bali located in the slove of mount agung the highest volcano in bali
Sacred: We went there the 4 of us (wife & I with our 2 boys 11 & 13) with no expectations not really knowing what it’s like and we were blown away how genuinely amazing it was to observe the monkeys in their almost natural habitat!
Kuta: Although I was warned about all of the hawkers accosting people in Kuta Beach nothing prepares you for the reality. It is constant and can leave you feeling quite stressed and harassed. The beach is pretty enough but there are definitely prettier, save your energy for one of…
Mount: Absolutely amazing experience! The view from the top of the mountain is stunning. The hike is approx 2 hours and is VERY steep starting at about the half way mark. There are a lot of loose rocks and the volcanic ash makes the hike difficult! Everyone on the hike appeared to be…
Aling: my hubby and I went out to the waterfalls.  we took a personal driver and car.  It was about 2 hours from Pemuretan - where we where staying in Northern Bali.  you pay for your entry and a guide to go with you.  The guide watches your stuff for you and also helps you with the…
Grandmas: I have stayed here probably 6 or 7 nights in the last six months. I use it for one night transit stays when flying in and out of Bali. For this it is great. Super cheap and a great location on the quieter end of Jalan Legian. Close to shopping and restaurants.  The rooms are basic but it is all thats needed. The rooms on level five can be a little noisy though. There is no restaurant so no room service but these days with GoJek its not really a problem. There is no pool but I have once paid, i think 100k, to use the pool next door. with that payment you get a towel, drink and a meal so really not that bad.  If i was staying longer i would probably stay elsewhere but for this kind of one night stay it is great.  Service has always been very very good.
Amnaya: We decided to stay at this boutique type hotel as it was a change from the usual larger resorts that we have stayed in, in Nusa Dua. The hotel was quirky, new & the architecture was a fusion of modern & traditional.We were given, as requested a quiet room at the back of the hotel & were pleased to be upgraded to an Amnaya room with a bath.The small pool, though located a short distance from the main building & across a common area, was tranquil & aesthetically pleasing & well designed.The restaurant provided a substantial breakfast albeit Indonesian themed. Fussy eaters may find the menu difficult but despite this the meals were beautifully presented & of excellent quality.Throughout the resort the staff were excellent. One day the teas/coffees were not replaced but on request…
Radisson: Brilliant hospitality, rooms and location. It was a perfect experience for my family and i. Enjoyed every bit of our stay at this hotel. The friendly staff ensured our stay was made comfortable. I plan to come back again.

Besakih: A large spread out temple, with some amazing views and Mt Agung as a backdrop. Well worth a visit, and don't forget to bring a sarong!
Sacred: I really loved monkeys those were really fun to see. Actually they caught my sunglass but i had another one. Be prepared not to loose your stuffs. Very calm forest with full of wild animals. I took selfie with bats and giant snake. Totally, I would recommend. Great place with…
Kuta: A beautiful beach to see sunset and do surfing on white Sandy beach. We can do surf even we are a beginer. Easy to find food and cold drink. Many local people doing massage as well. Love this place very much
Mount: We got a guide and planned for a 4H hiking with him upfront, visiting the place it was super cool and natural. They also keep it very clean and neat. I loved this place.
Aling: firstly we are forced to pay, under penalty of death, threatened by rude aborigines with machetes, we were still going with a passage where it was written nowhere to pay.  yet, down below the same natives forbade us to jump, or even to bathe.  they said it was necessary to have…
Grandmas: We stayed for 3 nights as a couple & a friend in 2 rooms. We did have a problem the first night with street noise but we were moved very easily & quickly to a much quieter area. We also received a lovely apology note and gift. The breakfast can be added also for a very small cost. The location is really great for shopping and restaurants nearby. I definitely would recommend for a few quick nights or for the budget conscience. The rooms have everything you need and are comfortable.  Special mention to Septi & Grace for their wonderful service. Thanks again.
Amnaya: We stayed 4 days in Bali and booked room at both Amnaya Kuta and Benoa. Had a great time here for our trip.  I love the yoga room upper the gym and my friend loves the swimming pool and bar area.  We tried Balinese and Bamboo massage at their spa in the mean time waiting for check-in at 3pm. Sarini, Sefti and Rasmi were taking such a good care for us.  The resort just opened in November so everything is brand new and good quality.   I definitely will stay here again if I have a chance to visit Bali again.
Radisson: Very nice area, swimming pool, cozy rooms with all necessary equipment. The hotel has two very good restaurants. There are beautiful beaches and restaurants near the hotel which you can reach in a few minutes by renting a scooter. Very kind and helpful staff. Everything was perfect!

Besakih: Its such a good choice to come here. We come here after visiting Kintamani for lunch. The ticket is only Rp. 60.000,- per person and you will get a sarong and a local guide to accompany you but if you do not want the guide to follow you its okay tho. I will absolutely be back…
Sacred: Our visit to Ubud took us to the Bali swings, a visit to a coffee plantation and then on to the Monkey Forest.  It is a chance to see wild monkeys wandering around the forest and also various plantations, trees and temples.  The monkeys roam wild although the rangers know how to…
Kuta: Kuta Beach was a little disappointing, very dirty with lots of washed up rubbish and murky water,  lots of touts all the way along trying to sell things, the sand was quite painful to walk along too I think there are much better beach's along this coast if you are look further,
Mount: Well,  Let's go from Starting.  Firstly find a good group. If you don't have a good group to climb and you are sharing your package with a treking company please ask them to adjust you with your age group of people. I by mistake got stuck with an old lady and her mom and another…
Aling: The location is very far from Kuta, however, it is worth the trip! Cliff jumping checked from my bucket list. They have 3 heights about 5m - 10m, 10m - 15m, & 15m - 20m high. Can't remember the height, but indeed it is very high. Highly recommended for high thrilling activities…
Grandmas: From the guards at the stylish entrance to the desk staff, via the people working in the restaurants, every staff member is very well-trained and incredibly welcoming, helpful and friendly. They put most hotel staff in Europe to shame. The cool, pastel colours of the interior are a welcome escape from the harsh sun outside and the sound proofing throughout the open - courtyard interior is so good that you don't realise that you are on a main road. The rooms are lovely with towels and bedding in glow white. You can arrive in the clothes you stand in since everything is provided for a great stay down to toothbrush pack. The room price is a steal at around 15 dollars double, with a great, unlimited breakfast at 4 dollars. This is a faultless hotel in a wonderful location surrounded…
Amnaya: We stayed 4 nights at the property and absolutely loved it. If we go back to Bali, we won't even bother looking for any other place. We will go straight here!  Location: The hotel is situated on a busy street but somehow you cannot hear the traffic noise in the hotel at all! There are plenty of restaurants and bars that line the street.  Room: we were upgraded to the Junior suite and boy, it was outstanding. Can't fault a thing. Ensuite bathtub, big sit out deck with sun beds, great in room amenities - just perfect.   Resturant: A lot of reviews rave about the breakfast and they are all right. Our room rent included breakfast which is a massive fare. Entree, main course, juice and coffee! Plus freshly baked breakfast of course. All beautifully presented and lovingly served.  …
Radisson: I've just returned from my one month holiday in Bali where I had the pleasure to spend some nights at Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu and I just love it.  The place is really beautiful and the staff is super nice.  Excellent breakfast and excellent customer service.  The rooms are spacious and open, everything is super clean.  The hotel has a huge pool surrounded by sunbeds and 2 open bars and 2 opened restaurants during the day.  Eventhough it doesn't have a private beach, they do offer free shuttles to Padang Beach, which is really nice. Also, the hotel offers free shuttle to Uluwatu Temple where you can enjoy a Kecak Dance at sunset, it's a must, don't miss it! Also, you can reach a small beach just as you go out of the hotel, there are quite a few stairs down so make sure you wear…

Besakih: Its really incredible, first time come to bali, to see the biggest temple in this island, and finally will be back again. To all my friends visit this place
Sacred: We lied right next the Monkey Forest for about 15 months It was always a "barrel of monkeys", Sometimes at the break of dawn, on our upstairs balcony...There was an old man on the corner that we called the "monkey minder" because he tried to keep the monkeys in the Monkey…
Kuta: So difficult to relax here. We spent one day here and woukd never return. Constant harassment to buy junk
Mount: You can choose a 4, 5 or 6 hours hiking tour. You have to take a guide, all are well trained and they know the right paths. Coming down is more heavy because stones and sand, but you guide will help you, or he will arrange a ojek..
Aling: nice and enjoyable stop at the waterfalls  good local guide guiding you around. plenty of amusement, especially for youngsters
Grandmas: The location was really good, near to many restaurants around, near to the beach, shops and many more. It's very central. Breakfast was amazing with great choices, also they provide free shuttle bus, activities. But the hotel doesnt have pool so we need to buy 50k for the voucher to access next door's pool.  I'd like to say thank you to all the staff for being really nice and helpful Arta, Grace Puspita, And Special thanks to Yandi for fixing my door at night. Thank you so much grandmas legian is the best i ever stayed!
Amnaya: Room is impeccable clean, big (can ride my bicycle inside) and daily maintained.  The personnel is so helpful: anything you need, they will give you the proper information and support: I felt treated like friend, not like cold guest. Great! About SPA: please take some massages there... oh, boy! Really professional and relaxing. I didn’t even know that there are so many possibilities. From the simple (but amazing) Indian Head Massage to The Romance Package (2,5 hrs!) everything is great. Everyday I tried something new, and it was worth it. Also, tea, cookies, a special gift and the permanent smile of the ladies in the Reception (Natalie, Rasmi - an excellent masseuse! Etc... ). The resort is very well guarded and the Reception personnel is there 24/7 for me. (Thanks à lot, Eka,…
Radisson: My wife and I stayed for 4 days at the Radisson Blue, Uluwatu (Bali) in Feb. 2020. We really enjoyed our stay as well as the massive pool and two good restaurants at the resort (which I feel says a lot since these types of places tend to be either overpriced or bad quality) - they had good quality and fair prices, everything considered. When we had a few minor details to comment about our room we immediately got upgraded and got late checkout - overall the staff is super serviceminded, really helpful and really kind.

Besakih: Besakih is the bigest temple of bali,besakih temple the mother temple of bali,located on slouv of mount agung
Sacred: Beautiful, shady, very well run, this is a great place to visit. Particularly good so see the Rangers interacting with the monkeys, who are extremely well cared for.
Kuta: Filthy doesn’t cover it really. Sorry dirty nappies plastic bottles and just rubbish everywhere. So was told it’s because of the rainy season.  Just crappy and I so wanted to swim in the ocean but when you see this filth everywhere and it’s not moved it’s a tad off putting .  My…
Mount: VALENTINES DAY SPECIAL: Have you ever imagined what it feels like, you and your partner do something that has never existed in Bali, even more so on the day of a million love (valentine). with a long duration of time promising for fun activities, from the beginning of the…
Aling: We stayed in Lovina which is a quiet area in the north of Bali with not much going on. The beauty of this sport however is that it is 20 minutes from these stunning waterfalls! This place provides a perfect blend of beauty and fun! There are 3 hikes you can book when you get to…
Grandmas: I litteraly liked everythinv about this hotel. It was my first time in Bali, being solo as well and i was a bit nervous. The staff made me very welcome, also very helpful. Special thanks to Bawa, Bayu for taking care of me. Thanks to Windu he's so nice when i request cleaning in the evening.  It's really amazing to stay here.  Also a lady when I checked out Ari. THANK YOU GUYS!! YOU ARE AMAZING
Amnaya: This hotel is brand new and amazing. It is very spacious but so tastefully decorated that makes you feel comfortable everywhere. You get to choose the breakfast from a la carte menu. Food is so delicious. We got lucky and were upgraded from deluxe room to king suite. Room just took my breath away when we walked in. I don't think I ever slept on more comfortable bed before :)  Highly recommend you to stay in this hotel.
Radisson: If we had an option for 4 1/2 that’s what it would be.  Overall an amazing stay! From the moment we arrived the staff were incredible. Especially putu, Harry and windhu.i could name more if I could remember.   The rooms are beautiful and spacious and the food exceptional. The Italian restaurant and artichoke and the pool bar all do great food! From pizza to Traditional curry’s and noodles etc. My husbands fave were the beef sliders with the Asian slaw. Mine the Singapore noodles. The arancini at the Italian were amazing. And the crab spaghetti. I could go on.   The only thing that let it down for us was the breakfast. A lot of it wasn’t that hot and for us there wasn’t a huge choice. We have stayed in quite a few 5* resorts and this one defo lacked variety.    The pool area is…

Besakih: It is the biggest temple area in Bali. Many called it 'Mother Temple'. It's grand, and very beautiful scene surrounding it. You'll love the scene for photography. But the important thing I've experience, is about the services from local trader that a bit pushy for visitor to…
Sacred: Quite a intriguing place to visit. A lot of free roaming monkeys. Don’t be wearing any jewellery or loose items as the monkeys may snatch these. The monkeys will jump on you even when you least expect it. So be prepared. I don’t mind animals so I enjoyed it whereas my wife stood…
Kuta: The beach is sandy, makes it the great place to learn surfing. The bike parking area near the entrance is for a fee, so many park just beside the street till the Beachwalk mall or on the beach itself.   Unfortunately it has also disadvantages. One of them are people constantly…
Mount: Amazing views from the top. Takes about two hours to get to the summit. Plan your visit on a clear day. The sunrise is amazing! Monkies at the top!
Aling: Absolute Must Do Waterfall. Like to swim/dive/jump? Just Do it... Jumping or diving possible from 5m, 10m or 15 meters.
Grandmas: Location is excellent just a few minutes walk from Legian beach. Lots of food and drink options nearby.  Staff are extremely friendly  Shuttle bus is provided too   Single room was ok. Clean and relatively comfortable   Downside is noise. So loud and hard to sleep even with earplugs
Amnaya: Towards the end of a very long, tiring journey from the UK - including delayed flights - I was beginning to wonder whether a trip to Bali for some winter sunshine was worth the bother. Getting ripped off by the taxi driver from the airport didn't help my mood. But all my anxieties melted away on arrival at the Amnaya Resort Benoa. To summarise: the welcome was warmer than the Bali sunshine; the facilities were amazing; the room itself was lovely (cleaned every day); the not-overly-chlorinated-swimming pool was excellent and not too crowded during my two week stay; and the free, fresh air yoga (Fridays) was a real treat. The breakfasts (service, quality and selection) were a particular highlight. The table service was a joy and the coffee (from Bali) was the best I've ever tasted…
Radisson: The only thing that beat the incredible scenery and environment was the sincerity of the staff who beam kindness and are eager to please in any way. Nari was more than happy to complete any request we had and brought extra joy to this already breathtaking trip.

Besakih: The temple is situated in East of Bali on the slops of Mount Agung. Unfortunately,the temple do not permit tourists.There were more than one thousand local people when I went there,all in Traditional Balinees dress. It looks very beautiful from outside.
Sacred: My second visit to the Monkey forest. It alot of relaxed walking with much to see and be entertained my monkey families.. There is an art gallery, a fish pond and a waterfall which now block to visitors. There are many temple complexes and lots of opportunities for  photography.…
Kuta: Dirty and noise, people with dirty chear want to sell you to sit down on them. You can´t sit on the beach beucause it is soo dirty, everything is so dirty
Mount: Mt Batur is one of the valcanos, I did not find anything very exciting about it, you can stop here enroute, hiking might be exciting, but we dis not try it.
Aling: We were a family group of 8 - mostly young adults with a couple of ageing parents and we had a great time here. We chose to do the two hour visit and had a couple of guides with us. They led us from one fall to the next and showed us where and how to jump/slide. They were…
Grandmas: We stayed here for the first time and booked in for 7 days. The location was so good just a short stroll to the beach, shopping, restaurants and bars. The staff, all of them are just beautiful, Etha and Arta  thank you for your kindness. Yodi, you and mate do a fantastic job with the cleaning. The breakfast was sensational with so many choices and everything prepared and presented so well. It was so good here we booked for another 7 days.  At $35 a night with breakfast do yourself a favor and don't miss it. We will always come back here.
Amnaya: Everything was perfect during our stay at the resort. Our room was exceptional clean, delicious brekfest together with really nice and kind staff (Sari, Iluh, Gede and Eka) are just exaples that helped us enjoy our holidays.
Radisson: First time to Bali; just wanted to relax and this was a perfect choice.  Very spacious rooms - we had a studio suite which was fantastic - huge room, well appointed; huge wrap around balcony. Free form pool was wonderful and we spent a lot of time around it. Breakfast is good with a Buffett serving usual range of continental plus cook to order dishes. Pool bar also offered snacks and drinks throughout the day. Filini restaurant was great for a modern Italian style meal. SpaQ was excellent and the gym was also well equipped, clean and modern. Overall like all great experiences, the staff make the difference - from arrival to departure and every day in between, they were smiling, welcoming and helpful.... Thank you for a wonderful stay. Note: great little 'back gate' to lead you…

Besakih: Set in stunning surroundings, Besakih Temple is considered the mother of all Balinese temples. The entrance fee is 60k Rupiah and all visitors must cover up by wearing a sarong, these can be purchased at one of the many stalls or rented for a nominal price. Included in the…

Kuta: When im still a child i go to this beach very often. After 20 years i come back here and found the beach is changed.  Now there is a lot of trash. And surround this beach is already changed to a superhotel kompleks. I used to be feeling the breeze tradition of bali. A lot of…
Mount: One of the best excursion of our Indonesia trip. Trekking to Mount Batur to view sunrise was adventurous and super exhausting but it was once in lifetime experience.  We had chosen our anniversary date for the trek and it was the best choice ever made.  Trekking is to Mount…
Aling: Out of all the waterfalls we visited in Bali, the Aling-Aling waterfalls offer the best mix of adventure and beauty. It is a series of waterfalls. You can choose the length of your hike at the entrance and pay accordingly. We chose the 2 hour version and had a great time. You…
Grandmas: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Grandmas Legian is located in a busy area, so it’s no so quiet for those seeeking for tranquility. But for us, this is actually a plus point as there are many stores nearby so we could just walk around in the evening. Since the hotel does not have their own parking lot, you have to rely on their complimentary valet service, which is great! (Shout out to Pak Setiawan & Pak Iman!)  All the staff were friendly, and speaking fluent English therefore really helpful for my friend from Thailand who visited Bali for the first time! The breakfast was quite delicious I would say, and offered quite some variety. It was unique to serve traditional cakes, which is a good way to introduce our food to foreigners.  I would like to give a shout out and big…
Amnaya: I was upgraded to their suit and it was amazing. I stayed in few high end 5 star properties in Bali earlier, but Amnaya topped them all with its hospitality. It felt like home. Staff were very helpful. I will stay there again.
Radisson: Arriving at the Radisson my travel partner and I both had bad feelings about the place when we assessed the lack of guests present and how secluded the Resort is from all other resorts and cafes etc.   At check in, our room was delayed so we were asked to wait, we were also offered a $500AUD deposit to use for our 5 night stay to use for food and beverages then receiving the remaining back after our stay. This was proposed to us in a way that seemed as though it wasn’t optional, until further discussion we discovered that is wasn’t necessary and more of a revenue generating tactic.   Our king size bed was not a king size bed, it was TWO single beds put together, this made the whole middle of the bed, about a foot in width, extremely hard and uncomfortable.   Our room that was…

Besakih: This temple is worth a trip and we visited late afternoon, which is a good time as the crowds were gone. We had a clear view of Mt. Agung on which slopes the temple sits. A guide was assigned to us and he took us by a path between the temple compounds to a high level where…
Sacred: Fun afternoon spent walking the Monkey forest. Lots of monkeys with babies to watch. Beautiful trails and paths with plenty of information and history. Keep a hold of your phone and don’t wear sunglasses or dangling earrings many stories of them being taken.
Kuta: We went in March 2020 and there was rubbish everywhere.  Not sure if this is common or a seasonal thing but there was rubbish everywhere.  It’s also hard to just go far walk down the beach as you are hassled every 20 meters with people asking us for a surfing lesson, drink, ice…
Mount: Waking up at 2 in the morning and walking up a very steep mountain for 2 hours may not be everyone’s cup of tea, but if you can this will be a very memorable moment of your Bali holiday. The sunrise is just awesome and is definitely one of those humbling moments. Take a light…
Aling: These are the falls to visit if you like jumping from tall ledges or riding over waterfalls like on a slide.  the falls are very pretty but if you aren't into adventure I would recommend Sekumpul instead.
Grandmas: Only stayed one night but had everything I needed for my stay.  Central location, which can mean that the noise from outside can be heard in the room.  The hotel do provide earplugs to help with this.  Staff are very helpful.  If you don't have the breakfast included in your room rate I would give it a miss.  Very average and much better options close by.
Amnaya: From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel at home.  The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The bed sleeps very good. And the shower was perfect.  The swimmingpool was also beautiful and big enough. You can order a drink or something to eat also.  We were traveling with our baby 5 months old. The stairs at the entrance and from the reception to the elevator and the stairs to the swimmingpool can be a problem for some people. I can lift my daughter in her stroller alone. The reception and security will always help you with the stairs. But to the swimmingpool you must ask someone to help you. Breakfast always give me a smile.they welcome you and help you with a table. the menu enough choice. Looked very good and tasted also very good. The staff at breakfast is also…
Radisson: This hotel was a great surprise for the rate! Impossible Beach down below, hotel coordinates scooter rental (which is a must have to avoid corrupt taxis), and close proximity to all the great restaurants and cafes. Buffet Breakfast was great and had a lot of gluten free options!!

Besakih: Visting the temple is a must the oldest temple also known as the mother temple. In the entrance ticket fee sarong and guide is included. The atmosphere at the temple is awesome. During my visit learned that it had 3 levels and many interesting informations about the mother…
Sacred: We really enjoyed the Monkey Forest!!  The price of admission was reasonable. Lots of photo opportunities at the temples and with the monkeys.  The monkeys were either engaging or aloof to our presence(One got away with my lipstick).  There are large ones and small ones, as well…
Kuta: I give the beach Frendly 7 Points wy Not 10 Becoze of Litering and you have to Pay for Toilette 3000ir and the CR IS so dirty discusting and for that you have to Pay.. But the atractions in the beach are Good and the Sand IS very fine..peoples are nice
Mount: We decided to do the Batur sunrise trekking and we got paired with an excellent guide and a small group of people (5 in total) as a group we had a good laugh and our guide was really fun and nice whilst making sure we stayed safe. The sunrise was beautiful to watch and we were…
Aling: Amazing experience! Go here!!! We got the 3.5 hour guided tour of blue lagoon, Aling Aing , & the waterfalls by the natural slide and cool Clift jumps . Our guide Agus was incredible ! He showed us the trees on our walk down, took great photos of us and encouraged us to partake…
Grandmas: It was our first time in bali when we decided to stay here, the area was very busy but it's ok, that's nothing when you meet the beautifull staff who always had the beautifull smile Like Adnyana, Bawa, Wisnu, Windu and all the staff that i can't remember thank you very much for assisting us to get what we need when we holiday you are super.....
Amnaya: This new hotel is by far the best I've ever stayed at. I felt like a celebrity with all the free complementary drinks, cakes and out of this world service. The hotel is stunning with couches on pool areas, beautiful decor, a spa and the most gorgeous suites. Our junior suite had little welcome notes everywhere, and someone came to prepare our room for the evening with a little messege and handcrafted gifts. We watched tv from the bath tub and lounged around our room in our gowns they gave us. We ordered room service for dinner and it was delicious. You never wait long for anything you order or ask for. They treat each guest as if you were their highest regarded guest. The breakfast is incredible and was included. They have afternoon tea served with 5 small delicious balinese…
Radisson: Situated in a quiet corner of Uluwatu, Radisson Blu Bali is a place that offers you stunning views of the ocean, delicious food, and luxury amenities. This is only a few minutes’ drive away from most of Bali’s attractions. The hotel is designed using a mix of traditional Indonesian designs and simple architecture, which results in a sleek modern look. Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu has two on-site restaurants: Artichoke, which offers Indonesian and international cuisine, and Filini, which offers Italian cuisine. In addition, it also boasts of three bars, a fitness center, swimming pool, and a spa.

Besakih: Let me first say that this place is astonishing and has great view on the volcano. The temple is big and therefor worth a visit. However, besides just paying an entrance fee, which states to include sarong, entrance, scooter ride to the temple AND a local guide.  Nothing is more…
Sacred: I was hesitant about going to the Monkey Forest because the last thing I want is some monkey crawling all over me and possibly biting me. I am happy to say I would gladly go back here. There are a lot of staff around that are occupying and feeding the monkeys. Also the grounds…
Kuta: Beach is quite nice, but sand is not smooth and white, more grainy and shaded. Water not too clear, with what seems like a layer of silt on the seabed. Good for some surfing. Laze in the shade of the beach with a coconut. Be prepared to be constantly accosted by sellers.
Mount: This place has a beautiful lookout and you can get some great views of the volcano. Be warned that as soon as you stop there are very aggressive sellers who will bagger you and follow you around so be ready to walk and ignore. I did get some lovely pictures from an old man who…
Aling: Wow, this tour has to be done if you’re in North Bali. We booked the driver thru our host and just had to pay the entrance fee to each waterfall. There were so many waterfalls to see that we couldn’t see them all due to Daniel being sick and it looked like rain was heading our…
Grandmas: Me and my wife first stayed in Grandmas plus airport hotel then we moved to Grandmas legian hotel. Both hotel staff were very friendly and rooms were clean and comfortable.we went for the our 1st wedding anniversary and the Grandmas legian hotel manager yoga has made nice deco in our room. Need to give special thank to ADE and Steel for the nice deco done in our room. All the things were perfect and we enjoyed our time there. We highly recommended any to visit to your hotel and feel the comfort. Food also very delicious in both hotels. Love to be there again. Thank you Grandmas group bali <U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F>
Amnaya: Me and my wife stayed at the hotell in 9 days during christmas. The hotell are absuluttely amazing. The stuff, the breakfast, restaurant and poolarea are fantastic. Maybe totally the best hotell i have stayed.
Radisson: We had a very wonderful stay at Radisson Blu Bali. We stayed there for 2 nights and got free upgrade to Ocean View Suite which was super super awesome. The room was 149 sqm. Well equipped and brand new! The spectacular ocean view from the room was priceless! But if you are a smoker, it would be a litlle problem for you to have smoke at this hotel. They only allow people at some parts of the hotel. You can not even smoke on your balcony. The food was very delicious, very wide variety of breakfast as well. All the staff was super friendly with "yes you can" attitude. Especially Windhu from the artichoke restaurant, a very nice guy. There was a beautiful beach right behind the hotel called Impossible Beach which you can directly access from the back door of the hotel. Definitely…

Besakih: Definitely get there early. We arrived by 09:00 - the stalls were closed and there were only 4 other people visiting at this time.   You will pick up a local guide along with your ticket and sarong. Ours was informative but a tad pushy on what he thought was a reasonable tip…
Sacred: Loved this place. Really beautiful grounds and a lot of little rascals. It's also convenient to walk from the south to the north of the monkey forest to get to the other side of town. As long as you don't mess with the monkeys they won't mess with you. Really loved this place.
Kuta: This is the most popular beach in the area and does have some things going for it – for example the Sun sets. For these, get yourself down around 6 pm and grab a couple of cold beers from there very many vendors. These guys are great fun who seem to teach surfing in the day and…
Mount: you must visit this place if you are in Bali, you will many tour guide to this place and i suggest to book one as they know this place better to get better view for pictures this place is best during sunrise and sunset
Aling: Tip: If you do not plan to jump off the waterfall or slide down it, ask for the cheaper ticket 20K IDR in May 2019. For just visiting the waterfall you do not need a guide, nor do you need to pay the more expensive 125K IDR.  The waterfall is well another waterfall. We have seen…
Grandmas: #NAME?
Amnaya: Fantastic hotel and facilities are all new so very well maintained and clean. Very cooperative and prompt in service hotel staff (served by Janu, Gisin, Gede). We got a complimentary upgrade so it was even more satisfactory. Benoa beach is mainly known for water sports and it is just 4 min walk from hotel. Very good for couples who want to relax. Free shuttle to Nusa Dua and mall. For family with kids only swimming pool are the options and no playground or so is the only missing part I would say.
