Lot of Indian, Italian, Mexican and of course local food options just minutes of walking distance from hotel. Certainly recommended for a 2N stay at min.
Radisson: Visited this wonderful hotel over Christmas and stayed for a week. It is an incredibly beautiful resort - really has nothing to complain about!  The rooms are large and our room where overlooking the beautiful pool area, the area was amazing!  The restaurants were very good, including the breakfast! And do not forget to try the Italian restaurant which has received very good ratings overall of restaurants in the area of Uluwatu.  The staff are incredibly helpful and professional, always a smile on their lips.  Really recommend this hotel if you want to feel a little extra luxurious and enjoy your vacation!

Besakih: After nearly 2 hours by car you are arriving Besakih and the entrance to the temples. We payed for the tickets and thereafter we was passing 100th of so called guides and ladies with gift baskets and flowers for sale, without looking on them. We totally ignored them and after 2…
Sacred: Absolutely fantastic place monkeys everywhere you looked & so tame loved seeing them in natural surroundings & so well cared for had great fun when one of the monkeys was having a look in my bag you have to keep hold of your sunglasses etc as they will steal anything the setting…
Kuta: Ive been coming here since 1983 as a young girl.  Now I Visit with my daughter and grandkids...  we all love watching the surf <U+0001F3C4><U+200D><U+2642><U+FE0F>  can be dangerous rips so swim safe
Mount: visited with jata (Bali Trekking Guide and Tour) i really like the place and the whole experience is something which i cant explain in words. it's a must visit place for its amazing views
Aling: We brought our entire family (with little kids) and we all loved it. The walk is only about 15 minutes, so although it does have a decent amount of stairs, it does not go on forever and most people should easily be able to do it. The waterfalls are beautiful and it is definitely…
Grandmas: This is by far the most impressive hotel for the price that I have stayed in anywhere in the world.  The staff know all of the guests by name and room number.  Breakfast alone is worth the cost of the room. Clean, and a great location - you could not ask for anything more.
Amnaya: Best decoration boutique hotel i’ve stay in Bali :) They are new hotel with Indonesia style decoration. Excellent service. Tasty breakfast too! The have a library and spa too with Bali decor! Very like the concept of the interior decor!
Radisson: We stayed here on 18 Jan.   Good - Entrance of hotel: Looks beautiful with the pond and the view overlooking the cliffs of Uluwatu in the far distance  - Design: Very clean modern design - Security: Felt safe with the 2 guards at front entrance - Cookie: The cookie at the main entrance is so delicious. You have to take one when you are at the lobby!  - Late Checkout: We could check out late at 2pm, which is nice  - Gym: Nicest looking gym I have seen in all the hotels I have been to - Food: The Ayam nasi at Artichoke is to die for  - Room:  -- We were told the room we booked is the smallest but still gigantic at 600 sqft.  -- Our room was on the ground floor so the balcony opened up to a pond with nicely landscaped plants overlooking the middle of the resort.  -- Liked several…

Besakih: Visited today and did not have a bad experience like older posts.  It is about 1.5 hour drive from Ubud, got there dropped off by our hired driver who was great and went to pay. It is 10K Rupiah if you don't have your own sarong (respect the cultures you visit!) and then any…
Sacred: If you are in Ubud it is a must do thing!  The heavy tree cover keeps you cool, the jungle running up and down the ravines with all the stone work is just like an Indiana Jones movie.  Very memorable......Be warned though, the monkeys WILL try to take things out of your bags /…
Kuta: White sands, followed by coconut tress and the infinite clear blue water. Vendors offer their products all the time. Beach chairs are free with any order places foe around $4. Lovely beach.
Mount: Booked through a hostel when staying in Ubud we were a group of back packer friends.  This walk was hard - we asked prior to booking and were told the hike was fairly easy. Admittedly, we are not in tip-top shape but at the same time are fairly averagely healthy 20 year olds. It…
Aling: Probably one of Bali’s coolest and most adventures waterfall/waterfalls. High jumps an fun to slide in the waterfalls. But watch out so you don’t hurt your back when jumping from the highest one.
Grandmas: I love everything which grandmas has given to me. Attention, fast respond from the team, delicious breakfast, comfortable room and many more. I was staying in the quite room. I should say that the breakfast was really incredible, the menu changed everyday. Special thanks to Grace, Yulius, Yoga, Wisnu, Arta, Bayu, Ita&Yudi are the best customer service. While Ade and Sanjaya did a great job of cleaning my room. To those who i dont remember, thank you so much all.
Amnaya: I had a great time at  the Amnaya Resort Hotel.Everything was superb,from the freshly cooked to order breakfast to the gorgeous rooms and lovely relaxing pool area.A special mention must go to all the amazing staff who were always there to help with a genuine smile!.Unfortunately I can not remember all their names,but I would like to say a special thank you to Eka,Yiuk,Gisin and Sari! Thanks again for a wonderful unique experience.Neil.
Radisson: I feel like home when I was there, room was awesome and clean every day in the same time just try to leave the room for 30 and you will find it clean also the breakfast always fresh the view is great.  I hope to come back again

Besakih: Nice temple but a lot of con artists!  I got the ticket for 60k rupiah which included a  sarong and a tour guide. At the and of the tour the guide (con artist) demanded a tip because he told us that he only gets payed 2% of the ticket,then we felt bad and we gave him 100k rupiah…
Sacred: you will be in the middle of the monkeys, so please follow the advises and don't bring any drinks or food, otherwise you maybe attacked by them.
Kuta: Years of environmental neglect in Indonesia is “paying off”, the beach is a rubbish dump coming from sea. Plastic galore, what a waste, what a disaster. Not getting into the water, here.
Mount: we took the midnight trek up-to the peak to see the sunrise. We very lucky to be able to see the sun rise from behind Mt Agung unhindered by clouds. The view was quite nice. I am dismissive of sunrise and sunset points as I think of them as a gimmick to lure tourists. But the…
Aling: Aling aling waterfalls is located in north Bali. There are 4 waterfalls. It has 3 jump levels: 5,10 and 15 meters. It has natural slides also. Beautiful surroundings with local guides help included in your ticket packages who are very helpful and kind. Must visit place for…
Grandmas: The staffs were so friendly, the room was small but it's so comfortable and well equipped with kettle, tv, good and cold air-conditioning, small fridge, etc. The location is perfect, close with many restaurants, beach and some good places. Special thanks to Yulius, Grace, Ari as a great receptionist. Arta and Febri were great too while handling the breakfast  Yoga widana who gave me little teddy bear with the nice words.  Yogi was a great housekeeper who cleaned my room everyday.  Definitelty will come back! Thank you Grandmas :)
Amnaya: We where on our honeymoon and choose to stay at Amnaya. When we came, this wonderful lady Iluh check us in and give us a upgrade to the most beautiful room, it was clean and nice everything worked like it should. She have told the staff that we where on a honeymoon so they have put a gift at our room with a handwritten note with a lot of roses it was so romantic.   After a day at this very nice new hotel we where of to go again and we needed to check out, Gisin help and made sure that everything was good with the room and our suitcases, very helpful young man.  When we waited at the lobby mr. Gede (manager) came and talking to us and asked if we needed any thing? We got te and water but the thing we noticed was the he really was interested in how our stay was and just really was…
Radisson: Spacious resort with such an aesthetic design on location, amazing spa facilities with talented team, good breakfast spread with a lively team to assist every morning, friendly smiles upon arrival and comfortable rooms.

Besakih: As soon as we get there there is a ticket office that you pay for your entrance and the ticket includes a sarong (a skirt that you have to wear inside the temples) and a tour guide.  All good till here. The tour guide did not have much knowledge about the things we were asking…
Sacred: This place was lovely for a couple of hours out.  Main entrance was very well organised and lovely and clean with lots of information.  Lots of signs of caution!  Went into the Forest and it was so nice to walk around and see all the Monkeys up to all sorts of antics.  We did…
Kuta: Lovely beach but so many touting for business at the back of the beach which makes it not a great place for relaxing - plenty if water sports and you can buy drinks and food I prefer south Kuta beach which is quieter
Mount: The trek was quite intense but we did no research beforehand. Bring lots of water (there’s plastic water bottles but we refuse to use them), and food, get lots of rest and wear comfortable clothes and shoes. Our guide Dante was so amazing. So patient with our rest stops, so…
Aling: We visited today and was impressed, they do charge a fee of 125k to go in with a guide, we actually weren’t told that you can go in for cheaper without a guide but our guide was very nice and helped me to cross some of the difficult sections where I would have ended up falling…
Grandmas: I had the pleasure of staying at grandmas plus hotel legian for six nights. I must say that the stay was great. Rated as three star but it’s definitely at least a four star hotel. Breakfast was excellent. The rooms are rather small and cramped but rest of the plus points cancels out this. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Bali who wants to stay in a quiet surroundings. People at the reception and the breakfast dining area need special commendation. I’d like to make special mention ok the following: komang  spa manager, Ardita housekeeping, Bayu front desk and Yoga the manager Aru front desk.
Amnaya: excellent hotel with nice staff, amazing swimming pool, different variety breakfast and free afternoon tea with cakes. Rooms were in 5 star level with nice balcony, spacious room for family or couple.
Radisson: After being offered the original room I reserved and prepaid for as an upgrade and then sitting at a table of three being served partially by the server sitting my dish at the empty seat. I don't think I'll be visiting anytime soon in any country I travel to.

Besakih: This mother of all temples in central Bali is inevitable a place to visit. It is advisable to go early, because later the complex is flooded with tourists. I was there at 9.30 end it was nice and quiet. The scooter parking is free, but be prepared to pay for the entrance…
Sacred: We went to the Monkey Sanctuary on a very hot day in Bali..However, the beautiful jungle like park kept us cool and happy.  So wonderful to see so many well cared for monkeys with ample food and water, beautiful natural surroundings for them to keep busy...and just a beautiful…
Kuta: Wow. This is a very nice beach. No wonder it is always crowded. The sand is clean. The surf is perfect. And the sunset wow so beautiful.
Mount: Ive been here like i dont know how many times hahaha, never been bored here. And this is my second review. This mountain's view is amazing! You can see Abang, right in front of you across the lake. Agung is a bit hide at the back of Abang. If you're lucky, you can see the legend…
Aling: Want to warn everyone!  We visited Aling Aling on our holiday in April. Four adults and three teenage children.  We are an active family that likes competition and we didn´t think about the risks in Aling Aling.  Our tour to Aling Aling ended up in a disaster! The way the jumps…
Grandmas: Loved everything about this hotel. Rooms are smaller but perfectly adequate & cleanBed comfortable & shower really good. The location is excellent. I participated in egg painting & Changan sari making put on by the hotel which were small but lovely activities. Breakfast was really nice with a great range & changes to hot food & menu options daily. Tina, Grace, Alta gave excellent customer service & advice while Pesa & Steel did a super job of cleaning my room. All staff are to be highly commended, couldn’t fault them. Would return.
Amnaya: Brand new, beautiful hotel in Nusa Dua. The attention to detail in the hotel, by the staff and in the restaurant was the best I’ve had.  You could not ask for a better hotel in Bali. Highly recommended!
Radisson: The hotel was amazing! Lovely pool and food. Beautiful room, it was more than i expected. But a lot of frogs was screaming outside in the night, little bit anoying, welcome to Bali )) I want to recommend this place for everyone.

Besakih: Thanks to all past reviews, I followed their tips and had no issues.  We paid only the entrance fee of 60K per pax, and all on our own.  We never take their bike or sarong, but walked all the way up slope (quite steep) cus we were not allowed to drive up as tourists.  We…
Sacred: We went in the late morning and the monkeys were pretty active.  Everything everyone says about securing your phones,  bottle water,  snacks is true. The monkeys will come up and steal it straight from your pockets and hands.  Pretty funny when someone isn't paying attention to…
Kuta: Everyone always talks about Kuta when you mention Bali, but the beach really isnt that good.. Rubbish, Dogs and Aggressive sellers
Mount: The sunrise trek is a must do. We booked through getyourguide and their staff were amazing!   Their tour took us up a different route away from the motorbikes that some people complain about and included a stop at some hot springs and a coffee plantation on the way back to our…
Aling: Most fotogenic, natural, clean and adventurous waterfall in north part of Bali. Try it's callenging jumping and sliding area...you will be satisfied.
Grandmas: The hotel is great value for what you get, the room are great, good shower, AC work perfectly.  Reception Grace and Yulius where welcoming and very helpful and all staff are friendly, always smiling.  Recommended!
Amnaya: I visited the restaurant and was served by Piki on two ocassions. She was absolutely fantastic!! Always had a smile on her face, attended to all our dinning needs and couldn't do enough for us!   She is an absolute star and i hope management give her the recognition she deserves.
Radisson: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay at Raddison Blu. The resort Is very well maintained with delightful landscaped gardens, huge tastefully decorated rooms and a massive pool to top it off. There are many different areas to relax around the pool so it never really feels crowded. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The only criticism I can think of was the lack of  variety and freshness on offer at the breakfast buffet. I found myself walking around in circles not particularly being enticed by anything on offer. However, the service was excellent and the coffee was great.

Besakih: 60.000 rupies to walk in with a so-called guide... the guide just walked us past places and was not able to answer simple questions... very questionable! In this temple you cannot walk around unless you want to pray: you are limited to a path up and down stairs which are lined…
Sacred: Monkey tried to grab my sunglasses.  It was awesome.  You could sit next to them and the more friendly of them would be totally cool with that.
Kuta: Not a great beach at all. A very dirty shoreline and a heap of dude's trying to rip you off. Better of going to Seminyak. People pestering you to buy things everywhere you go.
Mount: Really enjoyed the early start and Sunrise Hike. Quite beautiful to see the Sunrise over the clouds. Definitely recommended.
Aling: We went with our daughters aged 12 and 15 on our first day in North Bali.  We found the waterfalls stunning.  My daughters swam and jumped off the five and two meter ledges.  My husband and I took the less expensive ticket and just watched.  There are big jumps and small ones;…
Grandmas: Grandmas plus legian is a greta clean and happy accommodation in a good position The rooms are clean and bright and the breakfast is just the great way to start a day. athe arrangements for pickup at the airport was perfect and the driver very friendly
Amnaya: We enjoyed here very much. It is not a Resort hotel but very good 4 star hotel. Very nice experience, we locved everything about Amnaya Resort Benoa. Thanks to all the hotel staff and management. We will reccomend to everybody who will come to Bali.
Radisson: Cannot fault this hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Unbelievable facilities. The pool is great, the food better and the rooms are superb. The view overlooking the ocean is amazing too. Would not hesitate to go back.

Besakih: Besakih temple is almost 1.5 hours drive from Ubud. After reaching the temple, you would have to buy tickets that includes a guide and one-way motorcycle ride of about 1 KM to the temple.   Temple is huge but similar to other Bali temples. If the weather is clear you might get…
Sacred: Arrived at feeding time so the monkeys wern't as active. The fact that there is a simple fence seperating the sanctury from the town is trippy. Still an interesting experiance and would encourage anyone to go.
Kuta: Having visited Kuta for the last 4 years I have to say this was the cleanest I have seen the beach. During my month long stay there were days when quite a bit of rubbish was washing up but it appears to cleaned up with a tractor daily. Quite busy with locals trying to sell…
Mount: I read lots of reviews on here and my husband and I decided to do this trek. We are both in our early 30s and are fairly active at home but not regular hikers. We paid 400,000 IDR each and had a private tour guide pick us up from our hotel (if you're staying in the area Villa…
Aling: We were looking forward to see the waterfall in real life as in pictures online it looked amazing. But reality was shocking. Starting from a man who sold us tickets (he even didn't mentioned to us that we can get tickets without the guide and activities just for IDK 20,000!!! Of…
Grandmas: My second time stay here & never dissapointed me. If you guys expected 5 stars hotel facilities this is not for you. The room is pretty small but for $29 we got buffet breakfast for 2. It's best deal in Legian so far. Thank you to helpful staff Yoga, Bawa, Yullius. And all the staff there for warmest hospitality.  For sure I'll be back for my third time & more.
Amnaya: Got a free upgrade from Deluxe to Junior Suite. The room was spacious with excellent coffee maker.   We got our pack breakfast ready every morning when we step out for our sight seeing given that we step out very early in the morning. What surprise is that they served local snack during tea time and it is part of the room rates.  My wife and I really enjoyed the hospitality and services provided.
Radisson: Was one of the best hotels I have stayed at. Great breakfast, restaurants, pool and room. Service was very friendly. Love the additional activities they offer such as sunset yoga and cooking classes etc

Besakih: Don't buy a sarong, dont buy any gifts. The tour guide you have to pay with the ticket was completely useless, he vanished after 2 min. The temple though is really amazing.
Sacred: Had a ball going here and seeing all the monkeys. Be careful though and follow the instructions, they can be naughty. But the monkeys look well cared for. The forest is lovely and cool too.
Kuta: We took a quick walk here, a lot of friendly locals offering surfing lessons. I wasn't able to try surfing but I had a great time talking to the locals.Bagus<U+0001F919>
Mount: Just dont waste your time and energy. It is really hard, crowdy and OVERpriced. But the view is really good...this is the only one thing that is good, but...not by the cost of 3 hours climbing
Aling: Wow superb spot !! The trek in the rainforest , seeing the waterfalls and the lagoon are simply magnificent... If you are a thrill seeker then a jump off a 10metre cliff into the pool below is well worth the thrill. We use a local guide his name is Agung @ …
Grandmas: Location is perfect,we always can go for a walk along the beach side.The staff there so amazing! We feel so welcome d there especially Yoga,Grace,Yulius,Steel,Dedi Arta they got a huge variaty of breakfast choices there and taste so delicious.We will definitely recommend other people to stay here and we'll definitely come back here in the future !
Amnaya: Very good and helpful service and location is nearby watersport activity. Breakfast is outstanding. Free Afternoon tea with traditional indonesian snack is really another great plus. Got upgraded to junior suite, the room is excellent and has nice mattress. a good place for relaxing. Gym and pool are well equipped. For massage spa, booking in advance is required.
Radisson: We enjoyed 3 nights at this lovely property. Helpful courteous staff, beautifully well-designed pool with shady areas at most times of the day, plentiful seating for all guests, great food choices - particularly at Choko Pool Bar - what more could you ask for ?  Our Deluxe Panoramic room was enormous with seating areas inside and on our private balcony. Everything was immaculately clean and well maintained.

Besakih: There are indeed a lot of lovely temples in Bali. This one does not fail in any way and the backdrop of the mountain adds to the beauty.  I don't understand why people give this a poor review. Yes you get people trying to sell you things but no one forces you in any way. You're…
Sacred: Unsure how i feel about this, i saw some of the park staff goad the monkeys to get a reaction and a life from the tourist. You have to have your eyes everywhere as one monkey jumped on my back and hugged me like a backpack - not as cute as it sounds as it wanted to take…
Kuta: Safe swimming.. to swim is not easy in the ocean.. Kuta beach is well organized.. clear water.. clear sand.. sunset is really awesome.. before my trip to Kuta I read reviews talk about Kuta beach is not good option..I can say that Kuta Beach is good option if you want to swim…
Mount: The top of the volcano is a fantastic place to see the sun rise well worth the hike <U+0001F601> A organised trip from the hotel  with transportation and a very reliable guide well worth the the trip
Aling: Well worth the trip to visit Aling Aling so much fun and refreshing to jumping into the water :)  Highly recommend
Grandmas: It was fantastic choice for this hotel all staff were friendly and helpful like Grace ,Tina,Gusti,Arta,Ade,Odi,lesmana,Yoga and Yulius ( sorry if I forgot someone) Breakfast was delicious and place was good for that I hope to visit it again
Amnaya: We had booked the Amnaya Resort Benoa in Nusa Dua, Bali for only one night before we departed for home. It barely cost us USD 50 for the night. When we checked in, the resort looked nothing less than a splendid 4 star resort. The basic room we booked was massive and by massive I mean like insanely massive! The room design was very unique with a bathtub in one corner by the bed. A rotating TV table separates the room into it's living room/dining room and bedroom like feel. The amenities are excellent and the staff hospitality is 5 star! They even helped us get food ordered well past midnight when nothing in the area is open. Having said that, there are various bars and restaurants around the resort on the same street for a wide variety of cuisines. The breakfast at the resort is…
Radisson: The hotel is one of the most beautifuls that I have ever been, very clean, good food and the service is espetacular, they are very kind and very efficient. The other very nice thing is that they are very sustainable and this is a point that I consider very much nowadays in my life.

Besakih: I’ve been to this temple a few times but now the amount of tourists that are there just for the Instagram photos is ridiculous, people lining up for hours to get that shot of Mt Agung through the temple and not even bothering to see the other parts of the temple or learn…
Sacred: This is a Beautiful forest with a lot of free range monkeys. The staff were helpful and very observant as to how the tourists and monkeys interacted with one another creating a relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere.
Kuta: Absolutely horrible beach.. trash is everywhere, ocean is dirty.. everywhere are plastic bottles and broken glass ! Horrible really.. So sad view :(
Mount: I hired a guide to take me to Mount Batur from my hotel in Kuta. We arrived in the late afternoon and I rented a villa at a nearby resort. We started the climb at 7:30AM and stopped at a couple of temples along with the way. About halfway up, we stopped at a makeshift hut with a…
Aling: Aling Aling Waterfall and Cliff Jamp is located in Sambangan Village,north of Bali. There are a lot of waterfalls in Bali but the Aling Aling Waterfall involves some serious cliff jumping and natural slides. It’s one of the few places in Bali where you can actually send some…
Grandmas: Grandmas Hotel was very clean. The staffs that helped us with our stay were really great. Special thanks to Odi, Arta, Tina, Grace, Ari, and Yoga. It honestly felt like home. And for every request I would make they would make it possible right there and than. Also there food were excellent. Authentic Indonesian food with many selections. I would recommend this to my friends and family and matter of a fact to everyone. See you guys soon and thank you again for the great hospitality. <U+0001F60A>
Amnaya: My wife and I booked the Amnaya Resort Benoa through Booking.com as part of our honeymoon trip to Bali.  This is a brand new hotel and when we looked online we didn't find much information about it.  We were told it had opened about a month prior to our visit in early December 2019.  There were a few things they were still working on, but the hotel is extremely nice and the rooms were well equipped and spacious.  The staff were extremely courteous and helpful!  The breakfast was excellent and several options were provided depending on your tastes.  The hotel offers a free afternoon tea time with different pastries/sweets each day.  The hotel has a very nice pool and bar area as well as a nice fitness center and they even have a yoga studio.  The hotel is located along one of the…
Radisson: The hotel is excellent, top 5 star hotel. Great staff all members really helpful, rooms really clean, with Bali beautiful design and spacious. There are 2 delicious restaurants available so for more than 2 days not much variety of food. Uluwuatu is far from Ubud, Seminyak or Kuta and the traffic is awful so is better not to go so far from the hotel, hence it would be better if they offer other type of activities. The are 2 beaches near: impossible beach that is walking distance aprox 15 mins, however it has many stairs and the path isn’t nice. The other is Padang Padang and the hotel offers a Shuttle, however is full of people and surfers.  So is great hotel but no for more than 3 days and 2 nights, otherwise one can get bored and more in this time of the year that rains a lot.

Besakih: What a worthy trip it was for my hubby and I to visit this mother temple. The view of Agung, knowledge of the guide and the absolute beauty of the temple was really worth it. Even the trip to get to the temple really boasted the jungle splendor of Bali. We got a private driver…
Sacred: I love monkey forest!! I recently went for my 3rd time and it didn't disappoint. It's been upgraded since my last trip, a much nicer tourist friendly entrance and they've changed some rules. In the past we were able to feed the monkeys, they no longer allow this for safety.…
Kuta: Good not one of the best beaches in bali but plenty of people enjoy can get quite crowded sea ok lots of places to eat nearby
Mount: Some recommend a guided tour to climb the old volcano. It is of course a more comfortable solution than doing it by yourself. The tour prices vary, from around 30 USD up to 200 USD. What the tour companies provide is basically the same: an early transportation in a minivan, and…
Aling: My costumers feel satisfie to spend their time here. They Will recommended this place to their families and friends.
Grandmas: Hotel in the center of Legian, Clean  The staff from reception was very profissional Rooms very small but with evething you need , Breakfast is execelent.  In the main street, a lot of restaurants and bars , 3 minutes walking to the beach I recomend this Hotel
Amnaya: My review is based on the suite. It was lovely for the extra few dollars. Although I find the bathroom odd with a curtain to block it off from the room, but this would eliminate much mound getting into the bathroom having the flow from the aircinditioning to help in the humid weather. Staff are all lovely,. Food in the restaurant was very good, although the first night we arrived my husband was wanting mie goreng- but they had sold out. Disappointing. Included breakfast was excellent. Swimming pool very nice. Overall I would stay here again if staying in the Tanjung Benoa area. For the price it is a lovely bargain hotel. Although not on the beach otherwise it would cost heaps more.
Radisson: Scenic, beautiful, right on a cliff with a tortuous yet exciting path to the beach (and very close to the Padang Padang beach)  - the views from the ocean facing rooms are breathtaking. Spent 8 nights with family - relaxed - lovely bars, great food and awesome staff.... Service is superb, always ready to help, great one touch support line. Loved every moment of our stay. Kids club was helpful - the staff helped arrange cars for our trips within Bali and helped us try motorbiking too... Radisson Blu is the place to be in Bali - away from the hustle and bustle of more busy beach places like Kuta, Nusa Dua etc - yet accessible....me and my family loved our stay here.

Besakih: The most amazing templu in bali.it is really big and beatiful.i dont know what people are compleining about.after you buy ticket for 60 000 idr you are taken by scoter to the top(2 min ride).if you dont want local guide a simple no thank you and they wont  come.inside there are…
Sacred: Must-do experience in Ubud. Amazing temples with monkey running everywhere. My boyfriend and I had a great time walking around, seeing and getting up-close with monkeys. We didn't try to touch or feed the monkeys, but one of them still ended up getting on my boyfriend and even…
Kuta: Beach was close to where we were staying, we chilled her most days when not venturing out of Kuta, always found a spot to relax, amazing sunset not many people sellers on the beach and to be fair if you say no most of them disappear quickly.
Mount: This volcano last erupted in 1974.  You can only have a view of it from far.  For trekking on it, you require special permission.
Aling: Aling-Aling waterfall very beautiful and natural, located North Bali ( Singaraja), 90 km from Denpasar , for going there we need 2,5 hours.Ticket entrance start from 125K/pax , and you can activity jumping and swimming.And if you need guide because the entrance ticket including…
Grandmas: The staff were so friendly and helpful in all respects, especially Grace and Tina who gave us tonnes of advice on where to go next and how to get there and made us feel really welcome and the stay that extra bit special! (All of the staff were so friendly and smiley) The rooms are clean, beds comfortable and well equipped with a TV, kettle, fridge etc and cleaned daily. Breakfast is definately worth the add on, with a buffet of local dishes, venoisseries, toast, juice, coffees, fruits etc and also a choice a la carte of a plate from an option of 4 which changed daily and was always delicious! Great location, a short 10 minute stroll to the beach and also has free benefits of free shuttle at certain times to some spots. We extended our stay by two nights and found it hard to…
Amnaya: Amazing stay. Sari and team made me feel special. The breakfasts were AMAZING. three course a la carte. So good! Room service excellent. Room spacious and comfortable and beautiful. One of the most stunning pool areas I've ever experienced. Such a great team and unbelievably great food.
Radisson: Resort located within walking distance of Impossible beach and offering free shuttles to Padang Padang beach and Ulluwatu Temple. Beautiful hotel (built 2017) very well maintained. Excellent pool and outstanding service from all employees. Special thanks to Diego, Windhu and Harry, who made us feel like at home during our stay at the Radisson. This hotel is ideal for a relaxing week away from the busy areas of the island. Congrats to hotel management for the beautiful hotel and amazing service.

Besakih: We have been here many times over the years and there is a lot less hustling these days. For $6 a scooter drives you up to the Temple and gains you entry. The complex is massive and dates from the 8th Century (local guide). It pays respect to Shiva, Vishnu and Brahma, the…
Sacred: So good to see the monkeys roaming free in a lovely setting and so close to the main bit of Ubud, walking distance with some great bars lining the streets on the way
Kuta: Kuta Beach is a surfer's paradise <U+0001F603>. Sun, sea and waves <U+0001F30A> For others, long beach with white sand but not so many sun beds. Some litter on the sand and water, but not so much I had feared. A bit unclear where you can swim if anywhere... Lot of red flags but people don't seem to…
Mount: So this is one of those must do hikes in Bali and the views are wonderful on the way up and from the summit of Mount Batur.   But the regular route is super crowded and motor bikes go up and down trying to convince trekkers to grab a lift. The motorbike fumes are awful and this…
Aling: Great place to slide in a waterfall (literally in it!) jump into the water from 5, 10 and 16 meters. Entry fee 150 000 IDR, includes tour guide and life jacket. Do not hesitate to leave your phone to a tour guide. Those guys know how to capture perfect moments!!!
Grandmas: Very good value for money, very very helpful staff, incredible breakfast with many options. Room a bit small, but comfy bed. I think the staff professional behavior compensate for the rooms dimension.  Definitely would recommend this hotel. More than what we have expected to have here (our last night before departing Bali).
Amnaya: If you need a place to relax, and find peace, you should visit here, I strongly recommend you! This place looks different and unique. It’s not so big but you can have your own world here. Staffs are young and professional.  Room is very clean with softy fragrance. All shampoo, mild bath, skin cream, hand soap… comes from Bhava Spa (it’s inside the resort). Balcony is cute and in the morning you can hear the bird sings (if you choose the room near the garden). I had a short trip to Bali, so, I chose staying in here and use all the facilities of the resort. Bhava Spa is amazing, I chose Tropical fruit Tango package to release all my tiredness. Staff is very gentle, polite, skillfulness in massage and I almost fell asleep. Fragrance comes from oil, cream made me feel comfortable. I…
Radisson: booked king ocean vw got confirmation. With twin beds. Called to fix got 2nd confirmation. Arrived to find we were downgraded. manager wanted no part of a solution only debate. Told only one person was allowed in room. As a gay couple it left us to argue for just room we had confirmation for. If you get a confirmation check it carefully. The management will NOT accommodate on site.

Besakih: Also called the mother temple this complex is quite picturesque. The entry ticket you buy includes a sarong, a guide and a scooter ride up till the main entrance (however one needs to walk down back). If you are a hindu and want to perform the prayer do buy the offerings vendors…
Sacred: I must say not to often do you get a selfie w a monkey, however, i didn’t like the energy at this place. The monkeys were sneaky and the locals were panhandlers. They tell you not to feed the monkeys bc they want u to pay them to take a selfie and the only way to do that is to…
Kuta: Very beautiful beach and clean and very blue  when you go there to relax carry money with you if you wish to rent a chair or shade there are touts here like  everywhere else in Bali it's worth it in the tropical heat if it's a lil' but toot much for you.
Mount: There is no doubt the view at the top is spectacular, especially for sunrise. The route up takes about 1h 45m to the very top 2200m and has one or two moderate sections. The air gets thin at the top too. The route down is a different story! At a guess, over 50% of people fell…
Aling: Nice waterfal, with quite an easy/moderate walk to it. Not as stunning as Sekumpul Waterfalls, but lovely nonetheless! You definitely don’t need a guide, there is a paved path and steps leading from the car park to the waterfall.
Grandmas: Excellent location and brilliant staff at this compact and easy to stay in location. We found the staff to be very helpful, the rooms were clean and tidy but the location is a big shining point.   We had a small issue with AC that was rectified the next day when we returned to our room.   Breakfast was a mix of Al a carte and buffet with a main being from a menu and the buffet of cereal, fruit, toasts etc.   Just be aware there is no pool.
Amnaya: I travel a lot but amnaya resort was one of the best among all my experiences. Fantastically beautiful room and facilities, very friendly staff and wonderful service. Nothing to complain. Our family all enjoyed the stay and made our holiday very special. thanks!
Radisson: This property is over an hour from the airport on a good day. One journey we spent an hour and a half getting to Radisson Blu from Nus Dua Many locals visit the temple in Uluwatu and can make the journey to and from shopping destinations and site seeing very long and laborious from this resort at different times of the day. If you want peace and quiet and don't want to go any where this property is ideal, and staff are excellent. .

Besakih: Once you buy your ticket, you’ll be taken to the main entrance via scooter. You will be harassed by people selling offerings for the temple the moment your scooter stops (before you even step off!). Politely decline and walk away.   The temple itself is an interesting building…
Sacred: This experience is amazing.  Learning about the culture and history of the Sacred Monkey Forest, while seeing these unique animals free roaming is an experience we will never forget.
Kuta: Very nice beach with lovely sand with a great market attached too so you can grab a few Bali bargains as you walk to the beach
Mount: We had a Mt. Batur Trekking. You will be amazed by its beauty once you reached the top<U+0001F60D><U+0001F60D> Lovely, and had a precious moment with your love ones.  Before you go for trek, first must have stretching<U+0001F602> Bring water and extra towel because you will be sweating all the way<U+0001F602><U+0001F602><U+0001F602>…
Aling: Got here with some friends from Lovina beach, when we arrived they asked us to pay them 125k per person just if we want to jump or swim there. 20k is just for visiting and seeing the place, you cannot swim or jump from there, they are taking money just for nothing, there are…
Grandmas: ( + ) - Location, Location, Location..... Perfect !!! Very close to the beach (Kuta Beach). Near Legian, Kuta, Seminyak area for maksimum experience in F&B, Shopping, Night Life, etc - Staff very very friendly, humble, and professional They really need you comfort and enjoy during the stay. - Good Taste for FnB Try the Italian Restaurant in the Hotel, they offer good food with nice ambience. My breakfast was super, with choices special menu from the kitchen, and buffet also. - The Room was clean and comfort. Small room, but they have good mattress, comfort linen. Small bathroom, with complete toiletries. Good quality of shampoo and soap. - Green hotel  ( - ) The hotel is located at an intersection. Use the ear plug provided by the hotel during your sleep, to minimize the noise. …
Amnaya: If you don't mind staying off the party area around Kuta, then this resort is an excellent choice. All of the staff is very keen on helping you out making your stay as pleasant as possible. Breakfast was fantastic. I personally loved the home made granola and the avocado sandwich. Dinner was good too with plenty of choices. My waitress Ayu, who spoke English very well, quickly learned my favourites on the menu or had recommendations. Always a big smile, friendly and everyday a joy to talk to.
Radisson: Loved every moment. Professional staff made my week’s stay simply perfect. Highly recommend to solo or family travellers that wish to have a tropical experience.  Thank you and on my next trip I’ll definitely be back

Besakih: Only downside is at every step you will find people trying to get money out of you. Just be clever and avoid that at all cost. However, I give it 5/5 because this review is for the temple only. Beautiful temple with such rich history. Definitely worthy of one day trip. Roam…
Sacred: Very nice scenery, but they fire slingshots at the monkeys which make them aggressive and hassle the tourists.
Kuta: Spoilt by all of the plastic that comes in on the tides; they are trying to stop it but it is an ongoing problem, every day fresh rubbish appears. But good to sit and watch sunset with a cold beer in your hand
Mount: It's intense! But so worth it!  We were picked up by a driver at 2am and got to the mountain by 4am where we met with our guide and started the ascend.  The 2 hour hike is pretty intense, lots of cardio so we were stopping a few times during it for water breaks. There is an…
Aling: If you are looking to jump off from 5m, 10m and 15m into the waterfall then this is the place you should go! Test your limits here! Kroya is a good place for photos!
Grandmas: Nice value for money... Clean, comfy bed, AC and WiFi work well, they give you 8 options for a breakfast plus buffet. Very friendly and helpful service - special thanks to Tina (very caring!), Wisnu, Grace and Martin!  p.s. No balkony or pool, but you know that from the very beginning. Can still hear a bit of street or internal dining area from the room. Nothing terrible, but not the total silence.
Amnaya: Positive:  Service is excellent all the staff is giving their best to serve the guess.. nice breakfast (not many hotel offers alacarte breakfast and this came with fresh and complete sets of menu and all is great, please keep this!) got complimentary spa, and voucher discount of 150k  The only negative is that the pool is located in other side of hotel building
Radisson: Let me start by saying I rarely take the time to write on Trip Advisor because, life. But our stay at this hotel was *so* good that I felt compelled to write a glowing review. That's how good it is!  We travel a LOT for business and so we have a pretty high barometer when it comes to hotels and this hotel is INCREDIBLE. We left so relaxed and feel like this is the place we will be constantly using to compare with others.  We used Luxury Escapes for this 7 night stay and loved all the generous inclusions. We ended up rarely leaving (which is not normal for us, we usually explore a LOT).  STAFF: From the moment you check in to the moment you check out absolutely nothing is a problem. Even the airport pick up in warm and swift. You receive a delicious welcome drink on arrival (so…

Besakih: A great visit of the most beautiful and biggest Bali's temple. We arrived early in the morning. It was a peacefull mopent outside of the time.
Sacred: This place was such a neat experience. Its nothing like a zoo considering you're in the monkeys home. This is like a true rainforest and it is such a great experience to see everything. I would highly recommend this little tourist destination especially if it is your first time…
Kuta: A sight to behold! The beach is good for surfing. There's food and drinks along the shore. Didn't miss to do ome jogging in the morning while the sun is not yet up. Waited for sunrise in the beach
Mount: It was an amazing trek but get a guide, and if you can, get Wayan M (message me if you want his number- not sure if he wants it online). He was an excellent, very patient guide, and will make sure you will get to the summit just before sunrise (even if you give up, he won't). :)…
Aling: A fantastic excursion in a beautiful setting. So great we actually went twice during our stay. A great place to swim and enjoy the cool, clear waters. If the cliff jumping is not your thing, definitely take the plunge and do the slide down the waterfall!! Safe and exhilarating!!…
Grandmas: Recently stayed at this hotel the staff are so friendly and polite particular mention to Manager Yoga,Grace (reception),Arta,Ita,Dedi all wonderful service with a smile.Rooms are great,clean,modern, food very nice made for an enjoyable stay highly recommend and will return next trip.Stephen King New Zealand.
Amnaya: We arrived at the Amnaya resort for the last part of our journey in Bali! Booked to stay here for 5 nights and only wished we could have stayed longer.  Benoa is an area completely different to everywhere we stayed prior.  The reception staff greeted us as soon as we walked in and provided us with a cold juice, sweet and cold towel.  Checked us in quickly and even accommodated us arriving early (very early) so thank you!  As this was the last part of our journey we went for the Junior suite.  To say we were pleased was an understatement. The room was incredible!!! We couldn’t have asked for anything more. It had everything from a coffee maker to a huge bath and a rotating TV. We were shown where everything in the room was and then someone brought our cases up.  We were also…
Radisson: It's a wonderful property with well-trained staff that made our stay memorable. Our meals in both the restaurants were great - both for adults and kids. Although the hotel was running full house, the layout of the property was such as it didn't feel crowded at all. Will definitely be back.

Besakih: The temple is nice however not so big as I thought. The entrance fee is 60k, it included a private guide, sarong, and a short bike ride to the temple entrance. At the entrance you find people trying to force you to buy things to donate to the temple but you can simply avoid them…
Sacred: Visited with my hubby and for the cost it was definitely a worth while visit the Grounds are well kept and such an entertaining day the monkeys fairy made me smile.. Especially when they grabbed my bag off my hubby and I couldn't help for laughing.. Would fully recommend a visit…
Kuta: The most famous beach in Bali. The people here are very friendly. Here have many restaurants and hotels. Here also have a traditional means of transportation namely "Delman".
Mount: Such a blessing for me that I can see the magnificent view from top of Mount Batur. The weather is nice around 19*C and its only 45 minutes for me to get the top. Sunrise is rising around 5.45am on that time and really good to see it while having a cup of hot chocolate.
Aling: aling aling waterfall is the situated at the northern part of bali island,, 3 hours drive from airport,, this place is so amazing and suitable for those who like try the challenge by jumping from the high and try slidding by the rocks
Grandmas: This is my second time stay in Grandmas Legian. First time was on February and I booked through Booking.com.  This october i came back again and i decide to book directly due to the price is cheaper if I book directly.  I've stayed for 6 days and it's still what I want. The breakfast is getting better with up to 9 options for additional main-courses! Last time was only for 4 (I remember because my favourite was egg benedict.  The reason why I come back is definitely location! Close to anywhere i want to.  I want to say thank you so much to all of you who took care of me. I know that some of you are new but you treat me like you know me for a long time ago.  Massive thanks to the hotel manager Yoga, he is such a humble person.  Thanks to Grace, Yulius, Bayu, Bawa, Sanjaya, Arta &…
Amnaya: The hotel has recently opened so is immaculate! The staff were so lovely, welcoming and all round great people. The food was amazing and rooms were incredible! the hotel is stunning! Would recommend to anyone and would have loved to have stayed longer if we didn’t have to go home.
Radisson: Excellent hotel with very friendly staff. The rooms are quite spacious and a good variety of food is offered. The breakfast is very good. Nice place to relax and a good starting point for the exploration of Bali.

Besakih: this temple is an absolute gem and deserve your full attention. Go there with a certified guide so you won’t be asked any money by a local-dishonest-so called-guide. It is really worth it. The set of temples is amazing, peaceful, it tells a lot about the culture and beliefs of…
Sacred: Interesting place to see, monkey can be a bit agressive if you don’t follow the rules. Worth 1 hour to spend.
Kuta: I enjoyed the beach. Very nice. Lots of tourist go there to spend the day. Not too crowded. Good beach to relax at.
Mount: We stayed at Bukit Catu Hostel, a cute place to stay and an ideal place to begin to climb the mount. You have to climb the mount with a guide. You don’t need to be very sportive to arrive to the top of it but you need to be healthy. It is really a must do and it’s worth it , the…
Aling: Rare that a seasoned traveller like myself can be inspired by an environment and a tour guide as I was at aling aling and our guide ‘Bob’ . Thankyou . If you are in Bali make the track to the north and visit this amazing waterfall and river system . It is not only beautiful to…
Grandmas: Amazing staff... my special thank goes to front desk staff Mr Yulius and Mr Bawa for their superb customer service skills, Mr Bawa helped us out to have a quick change of our clothes even though we checked out from the hotel ... thank you guys .. you made our stay wonderful...
Amnaya: The hotel is brand new and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to the junior suite for our two night stay. The suite was incredible and for the price we paid we didn’t mind some disruption with the construction work ongoing. It is clear that the hotel is currently offering discounted rooms in order to attract good reviews prior to their full opening next year.  We found the staff to be really friendly and helpful with our enquires. The pool is lovely with solid beds situated partly in the pool or full sized beds to lounge on. The only downside is the pool area is quite small if the hotel is at full capacity.  We found the food served was delicious- the breakfast offers a huge selection to choose from. It was almost too much to stomach!
Radisson: I can’t really fault this hotel. Everything was as it should be at a Radisson.  Staff were excellent throughout, the SpaEsc is marvellous and worth every dollar. Breakfast is an efficient affair catering for most tastes. Great fresh, healthy choices and the egg station is a well oiled machine.  Artichoke and Filini also very good. The Lookout bar makes fabulous cocktails (seriously, the best Mojitos in all of Uluwatu!), and its a nice place just to sit and read and write whilst enjoying the views.  The large pool never seems particularly crowded, and poolside service is smart.   My single only gripe is that the delicious empanadas that were on the menu previously have disappeared! They were superb. A top floor balcony suite is well worth it, with private decking on 2 sides. Lots…

Besakih: The temple is amzingly beautiful and sacred. You may take a guide about 60K.  This is very big. I went there very early and nobody was there. You might want To buy offerings and encense before so you can pray there... i made it on my way To Amed from Ubud
Sacred: Great couple of hours had exploring this place.  In a word “Amazing”.  Hundreds of monkeys roaming about and the grounds are beautiful and clean.  Very easy walk for all ages.  The staff that look after the monkeys are great.  They feed them and let visitors take photos up…
Kuta: It was my first time to Bali and I couldn’t believe how dirty the beach was with plastic. Also the people on the beach would not stop bothering me to buy stuff. Least relaxing beach of my entire life. Beautifully sunset
Mount: Great hike up to mt. Batur, wonderful views, stayed in Black Lava Hostel and took a guide from there - totally recommend that!!!
Aling: I do not know ? your brain? only 7 usd you say expensive really meets again with you human traveler backpaker that harms the world of tourism, you are very damaging to the image of the world of tourism. 7 usd for your insurance inside because you jump from a height of…
Grandmas: The location of this hotel is between kuta and legian on a very busy crossing along the Legian mainstreet and a road to the beach. There are restaurants, shops, eateries, pubs and minimarkets all over the place. The beach is a few minutes walk away. The hotel has no swimming pool, but you can use the swimming pool at the Sol hotel (small fee) which is almost next door. The rooms are small, clean and has everything you need (ac, fridge, kettle etc.). Wifi is free and the speed is above average. Breakfast is very good (actually amazing) for a hotel in this category! There is also a good italian restaurant on the ground floor. Staff is professional, friendly and helpful. There is not much storage space in the room and it could be noisy if you have a room at the street side (they…
Amnaya: We are staying here for the last four nights of our holiday. I wish we found this hotel earlier so we could stay longer. Luckily we have 2 nights remaining.  The customer service level is so unbelievable high! All staff just know exactly what you need to relax en remember everything (not just your name). Breakfast is amazing (and luckily there is a gym too)!!! The room is so nice and clean and the toiletry products smell so good! Tomorrow we have a treatment at the Spa. That looks amazing too!  The only thing I would change is the temperature of the water in the pool. That could be a bit more cold. I couldn't think of anything else.  Thank you for ending our holiday in Bali so fantastic!
Radisson: We booked this property because it was a new build and had the Radisson tag. And I must say this is a very well designed resort. A mid-large scale resort with 6-7 buildings low rise buildings circling a super massive pool. We are not the ‘laze around the pool’ but enjoyed it so much that it is exactly what we did for our four days here. We didn’t even see that of Uluwatu (which there isn’t a lot), just spent all our time here.  The staff is kind and courteous and breakfast has a decent spread, though you might get bored of it by the fourth day.  The service is great as well, we were met with smiles and a genuine helping attitude from the staff in all instances. The only reason it comes down a notch is because we were frustrated by the Airport pick-up experience. We booked a…

Besakih: Spectacular views and a cultural gem. Not crowded. Access from village for all the family by motorbike.
Sacred: In the Monkey Forest you can see the monkeys live free, in fact when you walk around the forest they could be just near you. The target of the forest is the principle of Sri Hits Karan. It is a physiological current of Hinduism, the meaning of which is formed by uniting the…
Kuta: When I was kid, Kuta Beach is a must place to visit when I went to Bali. Unfortunately it is now very busy and touristy, Still recommended point to enjoy the awesome sunset in Bali. Surfers are easy to find in this beach. Close to shopping and dining ares.
Mount: I have only spent a few hours here but i will return. I'm not much of a mountain climber but this area has so much more to offer. I would like to stay at 1 of the Lakeside Hotels and check out some of the many restaurants along the Highlands. The Geo Park should be another great…
Aling: Aling aling waterfall is one of the best waterfall in Bali The locatied is in sambangan village singaraja regensy about 100 km nourth side from ngurah Rai international airport
Grandmas: I am so happy to stay at this hotel. The staff is excellent and very friendly!!! Breakfast was  very delicious and the Room was very clean...  Thanks to Ari, Arta, Sanjya and Julius..  I will come back again !!!
Amnaya: My partner and I spent two nights at Amnaya Benoa - but only by chance.  We had booked a hotel about a kilometre down the road (Bali Relaxing Resort). The resort looked appealing enough from the outside, and the grounds were clean and well maintained. However, when we checked in to our room, we discovered, much to our horror, that things were going to go downhill very quickly. The air conditioner leaked, the power went off intermittently, and my partner found hairs on the bedsheet.  We were uncomfortable and wanted to leave, so began searching online for alternate accommodation. We found Amnaya Benoa on booking.com. Admittedly, at first I was skeptical - it scored a perfect 10/10, but was really affordable, and only had a few dozen reviews. On google maps we saw Amnaya was on…
Radisson: The staff were so friendly but professional. The pool was always just the correct temperature with lots of access points and lots of loungers cabanas and sofas. The Fellaini restaurtant had an menu that was extensive and varied and our meals were delicious. Breakfast has selection for vegetarians and gluten free options! It's a short 10 min hike to the impossible beach via the back gate, where you get to see the pure pristine Uluwatu sea!

Besakih: We had to make a decision between visiting Besakih or Lempuyang Temple. After reading some negative reviews of both we decided that life is too short for 3-hour queues for photos at Lempuyang, so we decided to go to Besakih despite reading some negative reviews about scammers at…
Sacred: Beautiful forest with friendly monkeys if you stay away from their babies...just like humans!(I am also unfriendly if a stranger wants to play with my babies!)
Kuta: We walked from Legian beach along the coast to the end of Kuta beach before cutting in to walk around Beachwalk Mall and the Kuta town. The beach was absolutely covered in plastic and rubbish, we were walking along the beach for nearly half an hour and all along the high tide…
Mount: Had to wake up at 2am for this, but it’s well worth the effort. The view was great. The hike up Mt Batur wasn’t too bad as long as you have some basic fitness. If not, just take more rest stops on your way up. Can get chilly at the top, so wear an extra layer of clothing if you…
Aling: I've been coming to these waterfalls for a few years. Easy to ride to near the falls on your motorbike - especially from Lovina or Singaraga. There's about 5 levels and each one is different.  If you're thinking of jumping off the rocks or sliding down any falls, wait to see…
Grandmas: Staff are very welcoming, I was received by Tina and she was very kind and helpful. I only stayed one night as I was waiting for my flight home and this hotel it only a 15min drive away from the airport. the room was cosy and comfortable, very impressed with the shower and tv choice. location is lovely and lively.  if I ever come to bali in the future I will be staying at grandmas again xx
Amnaya: This venue really is perfekt for rejuvinating. Arrival was delightfull. We booked the very convienient pick up service from Amnaya Resort. Janu was happily awaiting us, wearing the traditional gown. First Impression to introduce us to the magnivicent balanese culture. The drive was perfect and he informed us about the island which was great since it was our first bali experience. Janu also did a great job with check in and facility explanation. Arriving at Amnaya in the night we could enjoy the beautiful light set up, the design team made good and tasteful choices creating this ambiance. All facilitys are nice. We booked our romance massage packet in the spa area and it was perfect. The therapists did a great job, really understanding our individual needs and giving us an…
Radisson: The Radisson is the most beautiful hotel. The aspect and architectural features of the hotel simply take your breath away when you arrive. The staff are AMAZING. Especially Widiani who greeted us at reception when we first arrived. Upon hearing that this was a special trip, she organised a lovely surprise in-room for us - a red rose on the bed and a chocolate cake. Always smiling, always helpful. Nothing is too much bother. The staff are the stand out at this beautiful hotel. The other amazing feature is the tropical oasis pool, generous gym and amazing spa which offers incredible massages!

Besakih: It was an amazing road trip to the temple. It was special to me because im the only one who was with my tour guide and he really nice Balinese.and when we reach the temple he took me a lots of photos. The biggest temple i  Bali or locals called it the “MOTHER OF ALL TEMPLES IN…
Sacred: Monkeys were aggresive. Staffs were friendly. Nice place, took some pictures on the bridge and under big tree. Nice overall.
Kuta: The beach is always full of people and so many traffic. Seems like everybody loves this beach. Many good restaurants are there, we went sometimes to the Romans, roso vivo but sometimes we also went to mc donald as easy and fast. Seems like this is the center of Kuta as so many…
Mount: Wear at least a jacket and good shoes for climbing. It was 2am pick up from our hotel, the drive to location included a 20 minute stop at a roadhouse for breakfast (fried banana and coffee or tea) Arrived at the base, greeted by plenty of locals, some selling jackets, guides etc…
Aling: Great day throwing some gainers and backies into natural pools and waterfalls. Guide was for the first time in Bali friendly, knowledgable and value for money. However, the depth of the 10 (8) meter jump was exagerrated, with all of our feet hitting the bottom. 15m jump was deep…
Grandmas: The hotel was fantastatic as well as the breakfast. The beach is nearby. The personal is very friendly and the rooms are pretty clean. Thanks a lot to Bayu, Grace and Lita. We really can recommend the hotel.
Amnaya: Amazing hotel, standard of customer service is very very high. Staff are very friendly and welcoming. It was my birthday and stuff sang happy birthday and brought out a cake for me. Food is great and prices are affordable. I would highly recommend a stay in this hotel, the best hotel I have stayed in during my 3 week stay in Bali.
Radisson: We were not staying at this resort but decided to go to Fellini for our celebration dinner for our 50th wedding anniversary.  The service provided was excellent and the waiter even organised for a decorated cake for us.  The menu was extensive and varied and our meals were delicious.  We enjoyed our meal so much we came back again another night and dined at Artichoke.  Another great meal and service.  Thank you.

Besakih: This is a beautiful sight and worth the trip to up.  However, there are lots of times where you are asked for money and things that are not required.  You will be charged entrance to the general area 2000idr for parking (we were on a moped).  You have two options further down…
Sacred: Monkey Forest in Ubud is a natural forest sanctuary that is home to a group of grey long-tailed macaques. The monkeys are very playful and they are very used to humans here, mostly because they are fed. They are not really afraid of us, so you can play with them. The park itself…
Kuta: took an afternoon just to unwind from shopping. Great watching the ocean.  Lots of surfing. Beautiful trees provide ample shade. String of small restaurants with good food. Nice ambience
Mount: Started our journey at 1:30am, and began trekking at 3:30am. All worth it for the stunning sunrise views.
Aling: I went to the Aling-Aling Waterfalls with a large group of friends while we were on holiday in Bali. We drove to the falls on motorbikes from Ubud, which took around 2.5-3 hours each way (we were probably slower than average because of our large group size). The drive there from…
Grandmas: Hello from Thailand, I just want to say, indeed the rooms are small, but I guarantee, comfortable enough to stay even for a long day. thank you to each staff for their kind, always smiling make me feel comfortable. I think all Balinese are very friendly. special thanks to frontdesk Tina and Bayu, for checking me in, and the bellboy Martin, he is so funny, and also breakfast staff Ita and lastly if I'm not mistaken the house keeping Idoi. actually all the staff are nice. It's just me, can't remember all of you. Will come back and see you on December.
Amnaya: Hotel is wonderful,service is coming to perfect,breakfast is extremely tasty After reconstruction that is continuing now I'd become best in the category without own beach area Thank you for u'r pation and support Hope to see u soon
Radisson: We travelled to the Radisson Blu Bali Ulawatu as we have stayed in several Radisson's throughout our travels in many countries. This resort was quite new, so we thought to check it out. Hired a taxi to take us there for my burthday lunch. We travelled quite a way to get there, found it was quite away from any areas close to civilization. Found it was too far away and didn't offer many activities that we were interested in.

Besakih: Our visit to this temple was hassle free and we didn’t experience the hassles that others have reported on TA. Our villa driver took us there and his father-in-law was a temple guide who lived on the street up to the temple and he took us round. So on this basis we probably had…
Sacred: A nice walk through the forest with old temples and lots of monkeys . Very informative and well organized
Kuta: Very lovely beach with nice surf and local vendors selling souvenirs and offering massages. Cold beers are cheap and the sunset is fantastic
Mount: Don't let the 2am wakeup call discourage you from doing this...it'll def pay off. Watching three sunrise from the very top is so worth it!
Aling: The walk to the waterfall and down all the stairs (no handrail in most places) was a bit challenging for me at my mature age, however I had wonderful help from Uda our guide.   My friend did a small jump into the pool and crossed the river to go up to the top of the waterfall. …
Grandmas: A cozy, clean,comfortable hotel. Rooms are small but perfectly clean. Breakfast was good not so many options but good. Great location close to the beach, many good resturants around. Great, friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed our one week stay there alot.
Amnaya: Staff very friendly. Breakfast artistic and very good. A lot of gift from hotel (Oleh-oleh). Top rooms. Clean , silent and all comfort. I had one of the best massage of my life. The price for all this was very very good! Suksma
Radisson: Stayed in Radisson Blu over Christmas and we are truly spoilt by their hospitality! I felt the relax and zen vibe upon check in! We got upgraded to a suit on Level 3 and offered Christmas macaroons too. The pool is huge, with a lot of sun decks and lounge areas. Breakfast has selection for vegetarians and gluten free options! It's a short 10 min hike to the impossible beach via the back gate, where you get to see the pure pristine Uluwatu sea! Will come back to zen out again!

Besakih: Having read previous reviews I was sceptical about the how authentic Tanah Lot would be and concerned about being ripped off. However we had a great experience. I asked our driver to check the official situation before we got out of the car. He took us to a desk where we paid…
Sacred: I'm not an animal person, I don't mind the zoo, but I felt uneasy here. The handlers and the space are wonderful, but having the monkeys run about is not really my jam. But if you like animals and seeing them live and up close. Keep your belongings to a minimum and have a great…
Kuta: Loved the sunset here! The surf is good also. Cold beers from the local vendors are the perfect compliment
Mount: Never bored to hiking this Volcano Rock and sandy trekking path  But its stunning view from the top you can see Mt. Abang, Mt. Agung , Mt. Rinjani also Batur Lake
Aling: We arrived about 10.45am.  There are many different options for tours but each of them require you to take a guide.  We chose the 4 waterfalls which cost IDR 375 000 for 3 of us.  We had a short walk to the falls from the reception area.  Quite steep going down which means quite…
Grandmas: After our very long flight <U+2708><U+FE0F> we came to this hotel. The service was very friendly and courteous and was always available to answer questions <U+0001F44D>.   Unfortunately the first few days were pretty hard (I was sick) and I was very happy to be in this charming hotel. The view from the third floor into the open courtyard with the plants climbing down from the ceiling is simply magical. Also the small birds that come to visit during the day can be admired from the bed.   The breakfast was very tasty and I was glad that there was tea and fresh fruit.Here I think everyone gets his money's worth in the early morning.   The Spar is very well known and you should make a reservation in advance, otherwise you'll miss something good!   I would like to thank the team again very much. I felt very…
Amnaya: I highly recommend the hotel. The hotel has opened recently and it looks very beautiful. The room was spacious having a great Balinese design. It was very clean. During a day, the hotel staff would come to bring water, fruits, coffee, tea and clean up the room. The pool was very beautiful. The hotel staff provided us with towels and drinks. The food was super delicious!!!! Even those foodies who love to eat a lot, would be happy. Congrats to the chef! Unlike many hotels I stayed at, Amnaya has an exceptional service like nowhere else. We were welcomed by Ms. Iluh who made our stay very pleasant. She was there for whatever we needed. When Iluh was not working, there was Ms. Ceri who responded to all our requests. She was also very polite and happy to help. Ms. Wilda was also very…
Radisson: I can’t say enough good things! The service was on point, the resort was absolutely breathtaking and peaceful, the rooms were clean, large, and modern, and the breakfast buffet is what breakfast dreams are made of. The location is perfect for uluwatu, and they have shuttles that go to the beach or the temple which was nice even though we didn’t get to use it. The only thing that I was a bit dissapointed with was the lack of food choices at the pool. The pizza we got only had sparse toppings making it only a cheese pizza really, and the hummus was only 2 pieces of pita with a smidge of hummus. I thought it was odd because our food at filini’s was so good! Other than that little note, we enjoyed our ultra relaxing stay and appreciate the little things they did to our room for my…

Besakih: We went to visit the Besakih temple, expecting to find a beautiful, peaceful temple, instead we were surrounded by locals trying to get money from us. We bought our tickets at the entrance, where the problems started. Our driver had already put some sarongs around us so we…
Sacred: Fun for all the family walking around the money sanctuary. As you walk into the centre ponds full of amazing koi carp great you then a gentle walk down to the monkeys. Lots of gently sloping steps not hard to do as you can rest all along and well sheltered areas so not stuck in…
Kuta: Pros:  The Kuta beach was conveniently located.  Cons:  The beach was dirty and contaminated.  We were bombarded by walking vendors all over.  Impossible to sit down and relax.
Mount: Beautiful early morning walk for sunrise delight. A challenging few hours but perfectly achievable if taken at the right pace. Always satisfying at the top! We hired a guide but this was not necessary as we took a packed breakfast with us.
Aling: We had a ball and it was definitely an experience that we qill remember. It is a tourist trap in that it is overpriced but that is Bali. Cheaper that waterbom and my boys and hubby enjoyed it much more
Grandmas: Everything about this hotel is GREAT. The perfect location, only 10 minutes from the beach & the staff made my holiday special. I got quiet room & the breakfast it's delicious. Thank you to Ardita for always bring any of my request to my rooms. Thank you to Bawa, Bayu, Martin,  Arta, Wisnu & all the staff for a wonderful service. Definitely will come back to stay here.
Amnaya: My family and i thoroughly our stayed in high part due to the extremely efficient staffs who were not only sincere but also deligent in aiding our needs. Particularly, shoutout to Ms Sihati such as providing a room tour to ensure we know all the great available for use. She also took the initiative to check with us if we require any extra blankets etc. All in all, the  suite was fantastic, and my family is looking forward to having another weekend getaway in Amnaya
Radisson: Radisson Blu in Uluwatu was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was really good, and the room was amazing. We had a view of the swimming pool and could even see out to the ocean. They also provide a free bus ride to Padang Padang beach and to the Uluwatu Temple every day. We only stayed there for 2 nights but I definitely wish we would have stayed there longer. 10/10.

Besakih: It was nice sunny morning when we came to Besakih Temple. Sky was almost clear so the volcano was perfectly visible (I can’t remember the name) Temple is huge. Not everything is accessible to ordinary people, only to thise who pray. It is really very big temple. When you think…
Sacred: There is entrance fee. You will get park map and do and don't instructions. You follow the path. You will come across lots of monekys. Caution is required, do not display any water bottle or food bag. They are very aggressive and will snatch it from you. Park rangers provides…
Kuta: We walked onto the beach. Walked for about 5 minutes and then turned around. The beach is disgusting.   The sea and beach are full or plastic and rubbish.    You have the urge to start collecting all the crap, but its an impossible task for one person.   Its a very sad sight.
Mount: After a few late nights with the crew.  We were up at 2am to make the trek up Mt Batur in Bali. This was so inspirational.  Our guide was great and spoke good English.  We weren’t under pressure by other climbers. The sunrise view was amazing.  This was worth every cent I paid. …
Aling: On arrival, you stop to pay and have a tour guide.  I felt that it was important so that we knew where it was okay to jump.  Our guide was very helpful and took many pictures for us with our phones.  The walk down is not really precarious, but the steps are rocks of all…
Grandmas: I have traveling for many time and Grandmas Legian was really awesome, all staff very helpful and always do their best to ensure our stay running well. Location was in centre of legian, so close to the beach, shop and restaurant. The most important is all the staff treat me like their family, yoga the hotel manager was nice, yulius, grace in reception was very helpful until the technician bayu was good and fixed my safety deposit box in the room. Really recommended hotel and I would back again.
Amnaya: Just opened this week, the Amnaya Resort has a beautiful Balinese feel to it.....the architecture and decor is a touch of modern plus classic Bali. We had dinner there....a smallish menu of Balinese plus western foods....presentation 10/10, platter of tapas offered for free before our meal....they were delicious, and drinks/cocktails excellent. Karayawan (Komang) gave us a quick tour of the spa area, very impressive indeed, and we were looked after by Piki at our table.  Excellent service. Maybe could add a small lamp or torch for each table so the menu is easy to read. We had a very pleasant experience..we will return again .....thankyou Staff !
Radisson: This is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. From the first day until when we left the staff made us feel like we belonged (Widya and Harry from pool and restaurant service were excellent and the highlight of our trip!). Just the minor touches and service to the rooms make you feel like your in another world. Heaps of couples and families and no overlapping, amenities and restaurants will make you not want to leave the hotel. Highly recommend especially for surfers wanting some luxury!!!!

Besakih: The temple itself is worth the journey but DO NOT PAY THE SCAMMERS, they are all over this place trying to scam you into buying very expensive offerings. Totally ruined our morning.
Sacred: A great place to spend a couple of hours. The surroundings are beautiful with some really old temples and lots of history. Good facilities but could do with a cafe ( maybe we missed it!). It’s the monkeys that make the most fun though- clearly very well cared for and both…
Kuta: Know that this is a common beach but i always enjoy the waiting for sunset time here. It's always magical and unforgettable.
Mount: We left the hotel 1 clock we been there 2 clock me and my wife we was thinking easy to go up there when we start to walking oh my god never ands walking walking break 10 times never ands so if you like to walking on the mounting get sport shoes comfortable bring water next to…
Aling: Taken to this great nature activity by a great driver and great guide. The water falls are magnificent and the swimming refreshing. They also have natural water slides down some of the smaller waterfalls and cliff face jumps of 2,3,5,10 and 15m. Good walk paths and finished with…
Grandmas: first impressions for grandmas hotel legian is tropical hotel, the staff welcomed us with cheerful and served sweet ice tea for us. and the room is quite small but clean and complete facilities. special thanks for anom who cleaning our room and the reception staff grace and yulius always tried to help us  recommended hotel if you need to spend your day in kuta area, close to beach and many art shop around hotel, easy to hire cab or scooter.  hotel was noise cause side of main street but they has provided earplugs in room, so noise is not a big problems
Amnaya: I hadn’t heard from this Balinese hotel chain before. I wasn’t sure what to expect but the pictures online were amazing and the price as well. I was delighted to receive such an exceptional warm welcome, care and professionalism from all the staff, in particular from manager Mr Kariyana, receptionist Mrs Iluh and Mr Ratmasa. Attentive Abdhy made sure I enjoyed an abundant and delicious breakfast which I selected ‘a la carte’. The chef came personally to greet me and made sure I enjoyed the meals and the special freshly squeezed smoothie of the day. Ceri introduced me at her hotel workshop to the Balinese hindu flower offerings and cheerfully explained me the background.
