The room comes not only with a rich breakfast but also afternoon high tea and Balinese delicious desserts. The…
Radisson: Where do I start I have stayed in many many beautiful places in Bali and this by far would have to be the worst from the minute we arrived the service was shocking not friendly not accomodating and definitely not family friendly the general manager bjorn is arrogant and rude he would see us at breakfast and not even greet us but would be greeting other guests he clearly knew our concerns as we spoke to him about our complaints and concerns the night before....also there was a hazard in the bathroom the water would leak out into the corridor and my little baby slipped and smashed his head my conclusion is if you have children or are of Muslim faith do not stay here and we are so glad we cut our trip short.

Besakih: Of all the major temples on the Bali tourist map I feel that Besakih has been changed the least by development and commercialism.  Other than the shop-lined approach to the entrance, and some tastefully done enhancements to the walk up from the ticket office, it feels much the…
Sacred: My boyfriend and I came here on a rainy day but still has fun. It is a beautiful maintained sanctuary with lots of energetic monkeys. We were able to capture some food photos of the monkeys and enjoyed watching them.
Kuta: Clean and calm, Not much populated nice to walk through. Please negotiate with street vendors.   Yeeeppee
Mount: Moved at 1:30 am from our hotel in Nusa Dua and reached to car parking of mount Batur tracking point. Gang of local guides insisted us to hire a guide to climb up. We were not willing to hire a guide as they are asking 100 US Dollars. After negotiations we were agreed at 50 US…
Aling: We went for option to take picture only for 20k, but you have another 2 options with slide and jump, or jump only. First jump is about 5m, second about 8-10m and third I would say 15-17m, you need guide for this as they won't let you jump without :) But without jumping is it a…
Grandmas: We stayed for 2 nights when we first time arrived in Bali, the hotel location in the center of Legian, close to the shops and walking distance to Legian beach. All the staff very friendly and helpful, Yoga the manager always asking our stay to make sure everything fine, Arta,Ita,Dedi,Grace and Yulius very nice with their service and they always smile to the guest. We willl back again for sure and we love Grandmas.
Amnaya: We loved our stay here so much. Its fantastic balinese hotel. The staff very helpful in all ways and told us about local area. The room itself was really nicely designed. It was good size with comfortable seatings and comfortable bathroom. The bed was comfy and we slept well on each of the 3 nights we were here. Its about 25 minutes from airports, great views hight ways. We will definitely stay here again.
Radisson: Stayed for 5 nights. The staff were friendly and effeccient, could not complain about one thing. The pool was great, it has palm trees in it, which mean syou can always find some shade in the pool and they keep the pool cooler than most in Bali. The restaurants were lovely at night, in the open and the the view of the palm trees lit up in the pool made for wonderful ambience. The breakfast was great and they made eggs your way and brought them to the table for you, the juice was fresh, so much better than most resorts. The bathroom was lovely and big as well as glamorous with a great showere and water pressure. Internet was also good, streamed Netflix without a problem, just took less than a minute to connect, but then ran smoothly, so just be patient at first.   The only reason…

Besakih: Yup there are people trying to earn money and sell you stuff or guide you..just say no and smile! You park up and then pay for a motor bike lift to the entrance(it is uphill!) and the entrance fee and a guide. It's not much and yes they would like a tip at the end too. Just tip…
Sacred: We loved hanging around with the monkeys. They weren’t dangerous and tried to steal from us. They were well taught and quite friendly.  It is a beautiful and calm place.
Kuta: Although I have been travelling to Bali for more than half a lifetime, I have never grown tired of watching the sun set over Kuta Beach. I have often pondered, why is this so? Is there some magic in the air at the end of the day that intoxicates the mind. Is it that sudden…
Mount: We took a tour on klook for a tour in a 4WD. They picked us up around 4am from ubud hotel and then we started our journey in a normal car. We stopped at the bottom of the mountain for a coffee and then we switched to a 4WD. Super monster vehicle. They took us up Mount Batur to a…
Aling: Whether you want to swim, a jump, or just to view the waterfalls, I highly recommend this. You’ll get a personal guide who is patient and skilled in the art of slow mo videos to take pictures of you. There’s no pressure to do the high jumps ( even though I highly recommend it )…
Grandmas: What a little gem, in the heart of Legian, walking distance to everything, the front staff can’t do enough for you, the breakfast only $6 and boy does it fill you up. Rooms are small, but very clean and tidy, you get bang for your buck and then some, totally enjoyable.  Thanks for the lovely stay.
Amnaya: This resort Just opening on this november, located at Nusa dua area, great design resort combine balinese with modern touch. The rate is very competitive, enjoy the Junior suite room with great balcony with Day bed,room amenities very complete, living room with big television can rotate 360°. Great Breakfast experience, taken signature menu "soft shell crab" very tasty and great presentation at sukun restaurant. I with my wife had spa experience at bhava spa "full moon purification " treatment for 2 hours,combine with foot ritual, massage, body scrub and closing with flower bath, really amazing, the Best spa  ever, very professional and excellent service by all staff. Will be back for sure and highly recommended. Thank you
Radisson: We stayed at Radisson Blu for our honeymoon (beginning of December 2019). The hotel grounds and our room was lovely. They had decorated our bed because it was our honeymoon. All the restaurants at the hotel are amazing! Good service and the food is Devine!! We only ate outside the restaurant once. The breakfast buffet is the best I have experienced in Bali. The staff are very friendly. The spa offers excellent quality massages, facials etc. My husband and I will definitely stay at Radisson Blu next time we return to Bali.

Besakih: There are some bad reviews on this temple. We did not have more than a 1 minute walk to the ticket office, but were grabbed straight away as we opened the door. We got a guide who was very good and enjoyed what he had to tell us about the site. The guide did ask for a tip at the…
Sacred: Becareful in there. Do not bring a knapsack or backpack or any food unless you want a monkey to jump down on you for out of no where and start to unzip your back. I witness it. It is not pretty. Remember you are not at the ZOO. You are in their environment. You are a visitor in…
Kuta: Kuta Beach is a beautiful place. The beach stretches from near the airport through Legian down to Seminac.  The sand is soft and shelves into the Indian Ocean. The beach is cleaned every morning removing most of the waste that has been dumped into the ocean! There’s a Myriad of…
Mount: Our 6 friends decided to try and go see the sunrise but when we arrived there on our bikes a group of “guides” who are nothing more than rude pushers charged us 40usd per person for a guide that is not even needed. We founded a bit pricey for a walk of 2 hours and decided to…
Aling: Aling aling is one of the most famous waterfall in Bali so obviously, I was sooo excited to get there !  What a disappointment when we arrived : you gotta pay if you want to swim ! They make you pay for a guide and water activities even if you just want to hang around and maybe…
Grandmas: My trip end with beautiful stay at central of legian, everythink was perfect thank you bayu, bawa and wisnu  who always standby to fulfill everything that i need, and thank you to all the friendly staff there..
Amnaya: One of the best hotel i have stayed at, amazing location, spotless clean, very efficient and happy staff starting with the porters ending with superb house keeping staff, reception very helpful amd profesional. I would recommend the pool bar and amazing freshly cooked breakfast.
Radisson: The hotel staff were very kind and courteous throughout our stay. The property was incredible and the ambience was great.   Few things that were very frustrating while staying the most premium rooms were: 1. Flies and ants were found on the food that we were about to consume 2. We were a family of 3 members and the toiletries supply was limited to just 1 person 3. WC flush in one of the restrooms did not function for 2 consecutive days  All the above were brought to the attention of duty manager First 2 points were take care but the last point (regarding flush), the problem continued to persist till the last day of our stay, this was very annoying  Staying in a premium room and experiencing such unpleasant things was terrible.  Hence I've rated the overall rating as a "4 Star"

Besakih: Interesting only if you are an admirer of the art and architecture. The 1.5 hr ride we had was fun but once you reach there, u'll have to buy a ticket in which a local guide is included and yes along with a scooter ride to take you to the entrance of the temple. The scooter…
Sacred: Amazing monkey park located in a forest nearby Ubud. You can get there using their free transfer. Be careful with your camera and other properties because monkeys go crazy with sparkling things. If you are lucky you will be able to shoot a great photo with these funny animals.…
Kuta: If you want to hit the reset button in life, best be in Kuta, Denpasar, Bali.  Specifically Kuta beach. Meditate, Surf, Swim, Eat & Drink.  If you're into the nightlife, Kuta has a number of clubs that play good music and a variety of drinks (my personal favourite, Bintang). …
Mount: Mount Batur is a beginner friendly hike. There are occasional motorbikes offering their service to take you to the top if you're feeling tired.  Otherwise, it's a short and easy hike for regular hikers.  The view from the top is great. I won't say it's super amazing like Rinjani…
Aling: This was one of my stops while I was riding around on my scooter , chasing all the waterfalls in Bali.   If you simply want to look around and see the waterfalls it’s 20,000 IDR , if you want to go swimming and cliff jumping, it’s 150,000IDR and you go with a guide. They give…
Grandmas: hotel with good location and near beach the room was clean and comfy, there were mineral water, air conditioner, hot water, ear plug and free shuttle to the airport. Staff were friendly and really helpful, especially in the reception grace, always smiling and willing to help. the breakfast was nice. Will come back and very recommend hotel.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: We stayed here for 2 nights. Very clean, modern, and relaxing. The food at the restaurant on the hotel grounds were good. We also ventured over to the strip near the hotel and there were some nice cafes. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a small issue with our room, the staff immediately rectified it and it felt like it never happened. The hotel grounds were well kept and very beautiful. The overall ambiance was very calming and relaxing.   Thank you for a great stay!

Besakih: Spent about 2 hours walking around this temple and it was well worth the trip out to it. We have been to Bali many times but have not seen this temple till now. It was a great morning and a truly beautiful temple. So glad we went.
Sacred: The place was so nice because the monkeys are free to wander around so they are not wild or they dont hurt the people around the place. It was so nice to have a walk there
Kuta: We stayed at the Grand Inna Kuta Hotel (loved it!), only just few steps away from the beach. At the beach there were very nice and polite locals to sell all kinds of products and services to tourists. If they didn't have the item/service you were looking for, they went to find…
Mount: You are attracted there by the valley, the volcano and the lake, plus the balinese people that all together make you feel in the real nature, where local life combines with the environment.
Aling: This was our first trip out of Ubud. Their price to get in is steep - 250,000 for one person if you take a guided tour of 3-4 hours. Nice young guide. The views from the rice files are stunning  - you can see sangaraja area and the ocean too.   Actually the Kroya waterfall is…
Grandmas: Very well located with well appointed rooms. Receptionists, Wifi, bed, aircon, breakfast, cleanliness 10 out of 10. Ari and Tina at reception were welcoming and very helpful. Room size is good for the price. Some rooms are a little noisy as it is located at an intersection.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: A decent place only if you wish to stay within the resort. Commute to most place that you may want to visit in Bali would be long and difficult and take the 'relax' out of your holiday.  If you are with your family and teenagers, be ready for challenges

Besakih: I was kinda worried and skeptical about visiting this place because of all the bad reviews I’ve read here. However, our driver assured us that the local government reformed their policies to address the general uproar of tourists on social media and review sites like TA.  So…
Sacred: The monkey sanctuary was very interesting. The monkeys were just roaming around and no matter how close they got as long as you didn’t mess with them they didn’t mess with you. Please follow all the rules. These monkeys are smart. If you have food they will find it...even if you…
Kuta: Very dirty and contaminated.   I didn't want to swin because I saw death fish and that is not good.   Even went to Nusa Dua and Seminyak and were also very dirty.
Mount: Wonderful views, good experience, kind honest people. Weather is excellent in November. Food is always fresh and save to eat on the street. Fish is excellent and so testy.
Aling: If you are traveling from the Seminyak area, then it’s about a 3-hour drive through the mountains which have great views if it is clear, you will even see monkeys by the side of the road. There is also a Temple by the lakes (Ulun Danu Beratan Temple) which is worth a stop…
Grandmas: Great little hotel, right next to Italian restaurant was hard to find hotel as not much signage. Staff where lovely. Breakfast was ok. Nice area not loud at night. No room service. Staff girl Yudi was so nice and sweet and did a lot for us . Would stay again
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Radisson blu is a beautiful place for family, beautiful room, ocean view, friendly staff, we can see the ocean clearly from our room which is so nice, the cleanliness was excellent but they should upgrade the breakfast menu..

Besakih: Really grand and impressive temple. Knowledgeable guide in Bali Hinduism. Saw so many devotees praying and making offerings.
Sacred: Another great way to spend the day with the family, be careful with the monkeys and remember to make sure you remove watches, sunglasses and anything else the little monkeys can take as they can be a bit intimidating but in a nice way, again very clean and well run.
Kuta: Surfing lessons..  Lounging on the beach.. And miles and miles of ocean and beach.. Glorious. Downfalls: If you don't like aircraft noise.. The airport runway is visible and so are arriving and departing flights.. Thankfully droned out by the waves of the ocean.. Bali is under…
Mount: At first we were staying in Kuta and Mount Batur was far from there like 60 kms and on top of that you got to leave the hotel at 2 am in the morning to reach there by 3:30 am. The trekking starts as soon as you reach there. We hired a personal guide. The complete cost with…
Aling: Raw power at the high point of the beutiful waterfall chain consisting a few drops from 15 to 10 meter (jumping possible) delights.
Grandmas: This hotel not only clean, comfortable, staff friendly they also offer outstanding service. I got really upset when I lost my snorkelling after checked into my room. I couldn’t not recall where I left it. I thought I left in the Bella Italia restaurant which is attached to the hotel. After spoken to Wisnu at the reception, he and Ayu (the supervisor at Bella Italia) helped to identify where I may have left my snorkelling set. After viewing CCTV, I realised I forgot it in the taxi. I finally got my snorkelling set back with the help of Wisnu and Ayu.   I am so grateful for your help and what an outstanding level of service. I am so sorry about the trouble I  gave to you. I would recommend this place without any hesitation. 10 star service.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Really good stay. Pool was amazing, buffet breakfast was amazing. Cheap drinks at happy hour. We did have issues with the air con unit making a noise and also we could hear the people in the room upstairs walking and stomping around at all hours of the day. It was also really hard to get any help from the service desk, they didn’t really speak English and would ask me to spell everything every time and even then had no idea what I was talking about

Besakih: I must admit that after reading the reviews on the TripAdvisor, I nearly decided to skip this stunning temple but I am so glad we eventually decided to give it a shot.  My husband and I were driving a rented car over the 16 days we had in Bali and that made our life a lot easier…
Sacred: This was my second visit to the sacred monkey forest and it will not be my last. I could spend all day watching the monkeys go about their business. Beautiful scenery all over the sanctuary and its all nice and shaded.
Kuta: I can only imagine that a few decades ago this beach was an absoultely stunning place that would have been peaceful, full of great surf, friendly locals and a beautiful natural environment. However, times have certainly changed and now this "paradise" is littered with filth of…
Mount: There were four in my party, all of us over 60 yo . We had two guides with us. Our climb started at the foot of Mt Batur at about 4.00am, it was pitch black, each step we took was by torch light and the path wad literally a goat track. Nevertheless we plodded on and reached the…
Aling: Beautiful waterfall and surroundings. We did the Sambangan medium tour and it was an experience of a lifetime for us
Grandmas: Originally booked for 4 nights and ended up stay 9. From the minute if arrival it's clear that the staff really make you feel welcome and go out of their way to assist, in particular maria from housekeeping and arta at the breakfast station, always with a smile and curious about your day. When you travel solo the small interactions always help.  The hotel itself is great value for what you get, the rooms are great, good shower, ac works perfectly, obviously close to the busy street so a bit of noise but even the hotel leaves you with earplugs should you need them. Most likely the words I would choose to describe the hotel would be comfortable and considerate.  Would reccomend !
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Great experience,great food ,great service,well behaved,ameni amen are so good,we will find each and every thing what we have imagined,specially in the night pool side area is looking like man made Heaven,very romantic for couple.

Besakih: The people around the temple are con artists and appear to have nothing but money on their minds. Beware of all the little tricks and lies to get your money, including the guides that are supposed to be free once you purchase the entry ticket. Couldn't even go into any of the…
Sacred: It was great fun to walk and observe monkeys. It is safe just don't disturb animals and everything will be fine.
Kuta: We love to watch sunsets (who not:) and Kuta beach is right place for that. Our hotel was in few steps away and we was there every day :)
Mount: First off, if you are at all into any physical activity on holiday please do this. Secondly, if not for our fantastic guide Ari, i might maybe have died(JK) but this is really not an easy trek. And lastly this is absolutely incredible, a great feeling of accomplishment and a few…
Aling: It is a crap !! You must pay 125000rps to go there with a guide and you can swim and jump (not very interesting) or you can just pay 20000rps to go there by your own (5min walking easily) BUT they won’t let you swim or jump !!!  You can do it if you pay but if you don’t ... be…
Grandmas: Stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. Staff are friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good and you could also order a meal off of a menu.  The restaurant next to the hotel called Bella Italia is very good. The food is great.  There is no pool but you can use the hotel next door for £3 which includes a meal and drink.  Rooms were comfortable and housekeeping were so friendly and even left animals out of towels.  Hotel is close to lots of shops and restaurants and is a 5 min walk to the beach.  Would definitely stay here again and would recommend.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Be careful if your flights get cancelled or delayed the hotel will not give you an extra night or refund you or anything it’s just bad luck you will lose the money you spent. Pretty poor policy considering they charge a fortune to stay there. Overall the place is amazing few thing they need to fix though. Don’t get a hotel taxi as they are a rip off ask them to order you a blue bird you will save hundreds

Besakih: I went to visit the temple without reading the reviews first. That was a mistake. The ticket was I think 80000rp or 100000rp I can’t remember. It includes a scooter trip from the ticket office to the temple ( up the hill, about maybe 1.5km. A guide is also included in the visit.…
Sacred: A good place to unwind and take photos, but be careful not to tease them. Easy to find at the end of Monkey Forest Road.
Kuta: Pleasant surprise! Golden sand, very clean, the waves are not too high, so you can actually swim in between the big waves, but also high enough for beginners in surfing. Sunbeds are available, but you need to pay by hour (unlike Canggu, where the same amount of money would…
Mount: Well second day of our Trip in Bali and met beautiful group of 3 people and a nice guide..Started from base camp at midnight..Its highly risky if you are not used to trekking as there are so many pebbles loose rocks and ashes so could get scratches too but whats the fun without…
Aling: We had an amazing time here. The scenery is beautiful,the water is fresh and cold and you should defenitly pay extra for the all included ticket with wateractivities, let me tell you the 15m jump will give you a rush.And we got this really cool guide named Kadek,wich made the…
Grandmas: I love the  ambience in this hotel, the located in central of legian so many things that you can find here. Night market, local resto, bar and many more. There's no pool in hotel but they offers you to buy idr 50k for pool voucher that located at next door and this voucher inclusive meal and drink. It was  amazing pool. Their room not too wide but very clean, I have some favourite staff here,  I will say thank to Odi who keept clean my room during stay, Ari at receptionist that make me feel like I am talking with old friend, Bawa who help me to  booked a transportation to airport also Wisnu who checked me in and I am not forget with manager Yoga. He make sure everything in hotel that make me satisfying. And all the breakfast staff I just remember Deddi. Thank you, I will back…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The staff is helpful. The room is spacious. The bathroom is great. The Hotel located near the access to go down the cliff to see beach. We are very happy during our stay there. The only thing that need improvement is the kids club.

Besakih: Pura Besakih (Bali) was by far the most disappointing attraction I have ever visited in my life. After paying a 3 pounds ticket that includes transportation, entrance fee and local guide, some women were waiting for us to offer a "free" offering for the gods that we refused, but…
Sacred: A lovely shady walk through the forest with monkeys endlessly entertaining the visitors - a few Indiana Jones Instagram spots!
Kuta: A beautiful beach that is sadly littered with all types of garbage that does not seem to be cleaned up at anytime. There are large numbers of hawkers selling goods, renting recliners and selling drinks and although this is their livelihood they hassle visitors continuously. This…
Mount: Great climb.  Over crowded though.  Took us around 1.5 hours to get to the top.  Breathtaking views.   Make sure you wear proper hiking boots.  Not cold.  Take snacks as they don’t offer any meals.
Aling: Pay the extra and get the guide. Comes with insurance, water, snack and the confidence you need to do the 16m jump! So fun thank you!!
Grandmas: Great stuff and perfect location just in the middle of Legian very near to Kuta as well also to Seminyak  If you looking for some thing cheap and really clean that’s your destination  What make me try this hotel for four years now it was there spa ... as they happy best spa in Bali  Before after massage at there spa I will be tired to go my hotel I just want some thing near by  I give try for 2 days in the beginning  And here are we !  My favorite hotel in Bali
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Nice resort with great customer service experience. far from the city area, however its a great place to escape from all the hustle and bustle. definitely recommended for anyone that need relaxig place to get away

Besakih: From my side, the "mother temple" is one of the real highlight on Bali. It is a very huge and you will have dozens of possibilities to take unique pictures. YOU MUST GO THERE!!!
Sacred: We arrived around 3 pm and we were the only ones there! So we get the whole place to our selves.  A lovely guide showed us around in a calm, relaxing pace and she told us all the stories about the monkyes.   If you follow the rules you will have a great experience!  The monkeys…
Kuta: The sunset here is fantastic. There are many stalls and bars around offering ice cold beer. It can be crowded but this beach is definitely a must visit.
Mount: Too crowded and risky trekking. You can't back out in between. Path is extremely narrow and completely filled with ash and pebbles which makes it very difficult to climb. Good part is our guides were there with us for the whole trip and supported whenever required. Yes, it is a…
Aling: I visited the Aling Aling waterfall with 2 friends as part of an organised tour booked via our hostel in Lovina and we were all very very pleased we decided to visit this particular waterfall.   The best way to get there is by taxi or scooter I would say, we got a car from our…
Grandmas: The staff was amazing, they always seemed genuinely happy and friendly with no request being too much for them. The young guy at the bar was amazing and the lady at the restaurant. She was there during dinner and came so early to work to serve breakfast! Upon checked out, they even gave you a 'blessing' bracelet! I hang it inside my car :) Thank you! Would love to be back here.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Clean facilities, great design and atmosphere, kind and friendly staffs. It was an amazing stay in Uluwatu thanks to this resort. However, it would have been better experience if they at least  noticed us about fixing work going on right next to our room or even suggested to move to different room due to noise even though it was around 4-5pm and also if they were more clear about which rooms are occupied so that cleaner staffs weren’t be making loud noise from cleaning job in front of our room at 6:00am. However, they offered 2 hours late check out in free of charge to compensate that. All the staffs were truly kind and helped us a lot to make our stay great.

Besakih: The Besakih Temple is at the base of the towering Mount Agung, an active and sacred volcano to the Balinese people. Unfortunately, the day we visited the mountain was mostly obscured by cloud.  The temple is also the most important and sacred temple to the Balinese Hindu people.…
Sacred: It’s safe and fun if you are obeying the rules listed in the entrance area. Do not bother monkeys and they can be very cute. Do not bring any food while visiting!!! They are going to take it anyway so to be safe it’s better not to have any food in your bag.
Kuta: So much garbage everywhere and very populated beach.  While swimming in the sea, I kept finding plastic items in the water. At this point there is not much the management can do but at least they should clean up the sand. Probably the beach is ruined as there were so many people…
Mount: The hike itself is pretty challenging as the path is very sandy and your grip on the ground always looses. The altitude itself isn't a problem but be prepared that it's quite a continuous slope all the way up (and that is being the easy path already - there is a harder path up…
Aling: The waterfalls are beautiful, and the water is not too cold, if you want to go for a swim. However, you are only allowed to go in the water if you pay for a guide. It's IDR 125.000 per person but it's all a scam! The 'guide' won't tell you anything interesting. They will just…
Grandmas: I have just stayed at grandma's hotel legion. It was a great location. Not far from the beach. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. On the front desk Grace. Always remembered our names and asked if everything was good. Many times. In the breakfast area Ita. Always remembered our order and room number. The other people Dedi. Arta. Nanda. Adi and tudi. Were also very helpful and keep it very clean.the beds comfortable and clean .odi our room cleaner made towel animals. <U+0001F60A>The only negative for hotel was it was a bit noisy. But they did have earplugs in the room.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Beautiful hotel with huge rooms and bathroom with bath. Huge swimming pool  Short walk down to the beach  3 restaurants in hotel so no need to leave  Beautiful grounds with green grass and franjipani trees

Besakih: Its located in the Besakih Area in highland, 1hour driving from Denpasar. Besakih Temple is the largest temple in bali, with a Agung Mountain view, if you had a luck you can see the  Agung Mountain from this temple, and take a picture with the Mountain as a background. You need…
Sacred: A must do when you’re in Ubud! The monkeys are a bit intense and if you bring a backpack or bag of any kind, be prepared to have the monkeys jump on you. We saw a number of people had their belongings stolen by the monkeys including phones, chargers, water bottles, etc...…
Kuta: We enjoyed the sunset so much and the shops around. But what ruined our experience the most were the super pushy walking vendors that are total RIP-offs. The beach is swarmed with them. I understand they are just trying to make a living but they are ruining something in the…
Mount: It was a challenging climb and I may have been a bit hungover from my birthday - probably not the best combination. The couple we climbed with and our guide were very tolerant of my slow and not so gracious climb to the top. It is fairly steep with not many places to rest.…
Aling: We just have trip here for the first time! And we so amazed with the waterfall. I love how people can jump safely and slide safely in the waterfall. And the local guide so helpful we pay like $10 for the help of local guide! Everyone should go to here! Easy access to waterfall
Grandmas: Tiny room but fine for one person for one night. Staff really helpful.  Central to restaurants etc but lots of noise in the night from people banging doors and talking loudly in hallway. I don't think there is any sound proofing.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: This was our last stop of our stay in Bali and couldn't have ended our trip on a better note. From check-in to check-out, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Staff were super helpful and very friendly. The facilities were amazing and our room was very spacious. The breakfast was superb with a wide variety of foods including local cuisines. Close to shops and loved how they had shuttles to Padang Padang beach and the Uluwatu temple. Loved our stay here and we will definitely be back!  One minor feedback is to have the pool opened during the night because it's still hot and people would enjoy going for a swim during the late hours of the night :-)

Besakih: Besakih is about 2 hrs drive from Kuta. Besides being the 1st temple in Bali, the architecture is OK, not too impressed.  It is too much hassle since People there try to find any opportunity they have to rip us off.  Be careful at the Entrance fee booth, count your change after…
Sacred: Great place to visit take note of the signs informing you of the do's and don't's. Monkeys are cheeky, setting is beautiful , I recommend the south end entrance as its not as busy
Kuta: Beach area is clean. Its a crowded one - tourists throng on to the beach especially in the morning and evening. Parking for 4W is a problem, as such visitor should opt for a cab which will drop you &/pic-up once you leave.
Mount: I was exhausted when i hiked up to the mount. I was gonna give up but i didnt and it pay up. The view was perfect.
Aling: 125k IDR per person for the short tour (1.5-2 hours) — totally worth the guide if it’s your first time there. We had Ketut and he was lovely. Provided us with water and went out of his way to ensure we had a good experience.   Make sure you try the slide and jump! I’m terrified…
Grandmas: For a one night's stay, this hotel ticked the boxes - clean, good location - there is an Italian restaurant just next to it and there are shops just outside the hotel.  It is good value for money. The breakfast was so-so, but still edible. The room was clean and the AC was strong and powerful.  We didn't like the noise though. When we saw that ear plugs were provided, that raised eyebrows. Our room was not facing the main road either, so I can't imagine those who are staying by the road. I think this hotel is great for those who want to party and come back tired and crash in their beds. We were there with our 10 year old son. We arrived in Bali, at night and would be checking out the following day. With that, I honestly cannot fault the hotel, but I would like to add a word of…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We were so excited coming back to this wonderful property once again after a year have past! Things were bit different compare to 1 year ago that there are more trees and the property is still maintain well, however some of the paint in the room and the terrace is getting old and does not have its original color anymore . Nevertheless, it is still one of the best Hotels we've been by far in Bali . The price is very good , the room is spacious and the service is excellent! . The breakfast is fantastic one of the best in Bali .The facilities such as Spa, pool and the gym is superb!  We would definately come back here again someday and for sure Radisson Blu is one of our top 3 hotels in Bali to visit!

Besakih: The Besakih temple, the mother of all temples of Bali, is huge and serene. The beauty of the mount agung and the architectural beauty of the temple are matchless. I am worried about the commercialisation of the temple- the entrance fee is IDR 100000, that includes a sarong,…
Sacred: This is about a 15-25 minute walk downhill from Ubud. There is 3 entrances around the sanctuary. You can't miss it. When you see high tree like fences then you're there. Or sometimes there is monkeys outside of the park at the car parks. Entry and payment was very easy. There is…
Kuta: There are many coaches at Kuta Beach that teaches surfing.  Can see a lot of tourist learn surfing at Kuta Beach.
Mount: So, I like to think of myself as relatively fit as I am a weekly power walker, have climbed Wayna Picchu in Peru, etc. but this volcano got me. I have a hard time hiking uphill and no one told me that this hike was straight uphill, with no break. About 1/3 of the way up, while I…
Aling: Usually I’m very sceptical about paying for a waterfall, even more so when they say you need a ‘guide’. On this occasion however I’d 100% recommend going and paying the 125k for entry as this gets you access to the most exiting waterfall in Bali by a long way. More of an…
Grandmas: Well located, excellent price, staff very kind, spacious and well-equipped room and bathroom, clean, buffet breakfast included (and every day you can choose a different main dish form a menu), free shuttle bus to some places (like Seminyak and the airport), not far from the beach and good warungs and bars... Only problem: it may be a little bit noisy...
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: From the time we arrived at the resort, the staff have been very friendly and welcoming to us. Done our check-in instantaneously and went to our room accompanied by the bell boy even though we didn't have any baggage on us. He was very friendly. Once we entered the room, we were amazed by how big and spacious it is. Everything was well decorated and modern. The amenities provided was gracious as well. They provided us with 2 bottles of water bigger than usual hotels, our own coffee machine, and many more. The breakfast was very delicious even though there weren't much options. Such a memorable stay we had and we'll surely come back for another getaway.

Besakih: The oldest and probably the largest temple on Bali, Pura Besakih covers all bases. However, TripAdvisor is al about personal experiences and while I rate the temple 'excellent', there are many things I'd rate 'poor' or just 'plainly annoying'. You buy a ticket, put on your…
Sacred: This is one of a must visit tourist attractions in Ubud. We had so much fun there.  Friendly staff look after every visitors, pleasing view of temple and funny monkeys. Worth a visit when you are in the area. Wide parking area.
Kuta: It's a nice beach  but to crowd . Too many  people and some time  the local  are a bit pushy  to offer  something to buy or to try....  That's was a good experience aswell. Finally  we moved to another beach was a bit better.   That's experienced beach in Bali.
Mount: Beautiful views of the mountain. Really enjoyed the lunch at the restaurant over looking the mountain. It was  a delicious buffet meal.
Aling: Very active, slide down a bug waterfall, jump from 5,10 and 15 meters. Real beautiful surroundings. The price is 125.000 which is good value. The guides that accompany you are very friendly, enthusiastic and safe. Had a really super fun time
Grandmas: Located in the heart of Legian, this hotel offers great value and is exceptionally clean and modern. Has all you need except for a pool but u r able to use the hotels next door and it’s a stroll to beach.The outer rooms may get a bit of traffic noise.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: this hotel blew our minds! the room was amaaazing, very spacious, clean, hi tech , the service impeccable ! the food sooo tasty with a huge variety especially the breakfast buffet. so yummi  a real luxury escape

Besakih: Besakih gave us the best experience of our spiritual tour in Bali. One day we will comeback to this beautiful place.
Sacred: A nice walk in full immersion in a real forest can give some emotional feeling to the big city person . The smell of the nature will accompany the visitors for all the walking time . The only concern is to don’t expose certain objects like sunglasses , earrings , camera , mobile…
Kuta: So this is definitely the busiest part of Bali we experienced. Lots of large malls and big restaurants but the beach was still VERY nice and worth a visit.  We only spent about 2 hours in the area but i can see why people love/ hate this place. It's a little too busy for my…
Mount: fantastic hike, not too hard, beautiful views and great to relax in the hot pools after. our driver Widi was fantastic, very friendly and knowledgeable.
Aling: This is a place that was nice but only as a side thing for Sekumpul waterfall which u have to see. We paid 20 000 rph per person for entry and they didnt let us jump from the cliffs. You have to pay extra for a "guide" which u wont need, but worth it if you want to use the cliff…
Grandmas: the rooms are small but clean and tidy, the breakfast is delicious and plenty, the staffs are very friendly especially Arta, Ita, Dedi and Yudiari, they serve us like babies thank you for your service guys see you next time.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Stayed at this beautiful resort with another couple on a Luxury Escapes package in November.  The package was very generous, included breakfast each day and two meals for the duration of our stay as well as a massage each.  The resort is quiet and beautifully appointed.  The pool area is expansive and not difficult to get a cabana or lounge.  Our rooms were spacious, clean and modern.  My personal view is the restaurants on site were a little lacking to come up to 5 star level.  The breakfast offerings are vast but could do with some extra attention to detail.  The staff were all friendly at the Radisson Blu and the spa area is lovely.  A 15 minute walk will take you into Uluwatu if you don't want to wait for the shuttle bus.

Besakih: Sitting at the footstep of almighty Mount Agung, visit to this ancient temple let’s you feel the power of faith and presence of divine powers on this island of Gods!  Tips: Do check the latest status of volcano and seismic activity in the area before heading up. Depending on…
Sacred: Monkeys are Mischievious.  Keep everything on lockdown and don't forget monkeys have thumbs.  Great ambling afternoons.     <U+0001F64F><U+0001F44D><U+0001F609>
Kuta: the greatest sunset i have see So wonderful very very wonderful Really recommend when you in bali <U+0001F60D><U+0001F60D><U+0001F60D>
Mount: My husband and I went on honeymoon to Bali and being keen sunrise enthusiasts, booked the above tour online with 'Get Your Guide' ahead of our travels. Paying £60 EACH was our first mistake, as we came to learn that this was a heavily inflated package spruced up to sound a lot…
Aling: This was a wonderful experience, we arrived at 10 am which is a great time before all the young people arrive. It is important to have the guide with you as it is relatively difficult to know where to go and jump etc. We did the 5 metre jump and slip down the water fall which…
Grandmas: I stay here regularly and have always found Grandmas Legian a great hotel. This is my go to hotel in Bali.  The rooms are small but always clean & comfortable. , with TV & chanels, hot water with good shower, comfortable bed. & everything you need.   But this review is more about thier staff.  I have always found thier staff friendly, easy going & happy to help with anything from extra water to help with cars.   but this is about the service that the staff give in perticular Yoga, Agus, Grace, Yulius, Resa & Sanjaya. after checking out and accidently leaving aud$2500,00 in the room these staff found it and arranged with the manager Yoga to contact me and arrange its return.  The money was complete & in full. I have thanked the staff and left a reward which i was told was…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Beautiful hotel in a great location!  Rooms were clean, spacious, and luxurious.  The service was impeccable.  Great breakfast buffet and lovely pool.  If you are visiting Uluwatu I would highly recommend you stay here!

Besakih: The confusing reviews on TripAdvisor had me worried. Was I making a good decision by going to Besakih Temple, the mother of all Hindu temples in Bali.  One of the oldest and most important on Bali. A pilgrimage for all Hindu people.  I was there at 7am and was a witness to a…
Sacred: Worth the visit.  Nice sanctuary.  Of course there are monkeys all over the place.  We were worried about the monkeys aggressiveness from reading on internet but in reality monkeys live their lives and leave you alone if you don’t bother them and don’t have food. We had no issue…
Kuta: We enjoyed the beach a lot,even though it's really hot and you get tanned or sun-burnt even under an umbrella. The ocean is amazing and the water is almost hot at shore. The sunset is like an amazing painting and would definitely recommend catching one.
Mount: We went today to Mt. Batung sunrise, along with perhaps other ca 3.500 tourists. The sun rise is beautiful, which is why I am giving 2 stars and not 0. The impression is totally destroyed by way too many people going one by one on the narrow path in dust (dust mask would have…
Aling: Spectacular waterfalls and great fun jumping in and sliding down the smaller falls. Managed the 10m jump but didn’t have the guts for 15! Water activities cost extra but include a guide. Ours was very friendly and encouraging but even if you don’t fancy getting wet, worth a…
Grandmas: Was there for my second stay. Still superb as before. The service and staff are the best especially yoga the manager as well as Yulius at the front desk. Unfortunately I haven't tried their spa, maybe on my next visit to Bali.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: I first of all want to say a huge thank you to Nando as he is the reason our trip here was so incredible. I booked this hotel for one night as my boyfriend and I were traveling around Bali and it was my boyfriends birthday so I wanted to treat him to a nice resort (it was all a surprise). I had previously booked a pretty standard room but added on a few extras such as a birthday cake, wine and rose petals etc. Upon arrival Nando checked us in and noticed from scanning my boyfriends passport that it was his birthday. I briefly explained why we were visiting and our travel plans etc. Nando was so kind and sweet and offered to upgrade us to the best room for an affordable additional cost. Of course I said yes and we went to the bar to have a drink whilst the room was prepared (we…

Besakih: The Besakih temple is quite far away from everything but still worth seeing as it’s the largest, and there are lovely views from the top (and also the drive there!). As tourists you can get hassled quite a bit- the ticket price of 60k idr pp includes entry, sarong, and a guide.…
Sacred: My husband and I had a lovely afternoon walking around the Monkey Forest.   As soon as you walk through the gates there are monkeys sitting, running, playing, fighting and swinging in the trees. It was relaxing, and engaging, from the start.   The trees have developed…
Kuta: I have lost count of the number of times I have been to Kuta beach and this trip was one of the best. The locals have worked really hard to clean the beach up. Hardly any rubbish on the sand and the water.
Mount: The hiking trip itself wasn’t hard at all. Anyone can do the trip. We had to walk in line. Too crowded for my taste. We had to go so slow that we couldn’t loose a sweat if we wanted to.   It’s possible to run up the mountain in 40 minutes, no problem. Starting height is about…
Aling: What a shame: no group discount! We arrived there with 14 people. The waterfall itself is beautiful! The group did in fact enjoy the 3 jumps. The guides were really nice! It's better with guide. They encourage you to jump! On our own, nobody would have jumped! :-) 4 of us did…
Grandmas: This is my first time stay in Grandmas Legian but previously I have been in another Grandmas nearby airport. The location in the middle of Legian are, only 10 minutes by walking to the beach, nice breakfast with buffet menu and additional alacarte menu. The most important is the service really good, from the cleaner until the manager. they always do their best to make sure everything is good during our stay. Yoga the hotel manager really nice and always asking our stay and give us information about Bali and some places should be visit, Grace, Resa and Yulius also nice and very helpful. our room cleaner, Sanjaya also good and give us animal folding towel in the room. we would comeback again for sure, thank you Grandmas Legian.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: This was the first hotel we arrived at to kick off our Honeymoon! After 20 hours of travel it was extremely impressive to turn up to this hotel with their amazing location and views from reception and each room. The rooms are huge and are very well set out and presented. Breakfast here is also incredible with a great variety and egg station.  This hotel is in a perfect location to get around Uluwatu – you can walk from the hotel for 10 minutes to hit the strip where there are nice restaurants and bars close by. If you hire a scooter from the hotel you can also get around to all the close beaches and restaurants as well.  Recommendations  Go to hatch for tacos Visit Sundays beach club Scooter over to Jimbaran for seafood one night – we went to Menega Café which is good Spend a…

Besakih: This is the most ancient of Balinese temples, the "Mother Temple". Set on the slopes of Mt Agung, it contains many small temple areas. The devotion of Balinese culture is deeply present here. Tourists need to wear a traditional sarong in order to enter.
Sacred: The monkeys are very passive if you don’t look them in the eyes or show your teeth they are very funny animals and can try and get in your bag do not clap because I watched someone get Biden by one
Kuta: Difficult to relax here because so many people asking you to buy stuff and expensive short Sandy massages. Other than that, it is a cool beach and can make friends
Mount: It's a still active volcano in kintamani  We saw it from the village bridge and not that much visible
Aling: We had a really good times during our visit. We were with a group of 8 and got 3 guides which we at first thought was a bit too much. But they really took good care of us and were really focused on us having a good time but also looked after our safety. There are different…
Grandmas: Grandmas plus hotel located in very strategic area near legian and kuta beach. The hotel services are very excellent. The hotel servants serviced visitors kindly. They also suggested visitors some destination in Bali that visitors can visit.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The property:   We booked a room at this beautiful, luxury hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor facing the ocean and the pool and it came with a balcony where we enjoyed drinking coffee at sunrise. The hotel has a fully-equipped gym that is well maintained. The pool area is huge and there are various lounge chairs and cabanas, as well as a bar,  surrounding the pool. The pool is well lit at night giving the property a romantic feel at night time. However, the pool closes rather early. The pool also seems very shallow, so not really great for guests that like hanging out in the pool as it barely comes up to one's thighs.   The hotel has two restaurants on the property, which I think are the highlight and benefit of staying at this hotel. Unfortunately for me, check-in staff…

Besakih: It is a very beautiful temple on the hill. You have to climb quite a few steps to reach it.  We paid RS 60,000 admission fee which included admission, one-way ride to the temple, a sarong and a guide. we decided not to take a guide. At the bottom of the temple some sales Girls…
Sacred: fantastic mix of nature and culture, with the temples in amongst the forest, the vegetation and setting is breathtaking, and then you have the monkeys too, a truly wonderful experience
Kuta: Lovely beach to watch the sunset ! Lovely in the evening to go for ba walk if you are looking for some peace from the main road.
Mount: Hard trek for the sunrise but well worth it at the end. highly recommend doing this to all bali visitors
Aling: I like this waterfall, because 1 place has 3 until 4 waterfall in this place, that amazing. Recomended for traveller when find beautiful waterfall for take a picture.  You can see my picture in my instagram at nicosetiawan_ dont forget to follow me and you will see more kind of…
Grandmas: Booked here at last minute after travelling around Bali prior to airport. Wished we’d found it sooner and stayed for longer. Location, staff, breakfast, complimentary tea/coffee in the afternoon and free shuttle to airport if needed. Rooms clean and well equipped though twitch small but have all you need and very comfortable. Would highly recommend and will be back next time we come both from and before the airport and will extend for a day or so too.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Definitely a first class hotel. The attention to design and sustainable principles is excellent. It really is an oasis. The pool and gym wonderfull. The staff very good and the restaurants and breakfast also top notch. Yes there’s a shuttle but go for Blue Bird taxis. Very cheap, better than fixed price ‘local’ taxi. Ideal for two or three nights. We chose being close to pool and breakfast - good choice. Nice walk to nearby beach from back of hotel. Have dinner at the cliff top Temple restaurant, spectacular sunset and great food. We highly recommend this hotel and we are fussy!

Besakih: The temple was beautiful but a bit overcrowded because of new years eve celebration. The guide should be included in entrance fee and not request tips.
Sacred: A great place to visit. Very well laid out with great clean facilities. Staff are extremely helpful. The monkeys are really something to see and experience.
Kuta: Usually in rainy season (Dec/Jan/Feb) I would tell you to skip kuta/legian/seminyak beach. With the rains and the currents all sorts of rubbish is pushed from the sea and farther inland to the beachfronts and despite all of the local efforts it is not enough to clean the…
Mount: DO NOT SUPPORT THE MOUNTAIN MAFIA.   We decided as a group to take a taxi to the volcano and do the easy trekking by ourselves. As previous comments reveal - not possible due to the mountain mafia.  We got harrased, verbally and physially abused by the ignorant inbreed mountain…
Aling: Totally awesome afternoon of jumping off waterfalls 5,10 & 15 m our two guides were great and helped keep us safe and even helped my mum climbing up to the waterfalls. My 13 yr old nephew thought it was totally cool and even jumped the 15 m jump. Great afternoon spent and in a…
Grandmas: I stayed here for three nights and paid $130AUD.  The hotel is on the Main Street so expect loud traffic noises all through the day and into the late hours of the night. The hotel does provide ear plugs. However I would definitely recommend writing to the hotel requesting a room away from the traffic when you book here.  I enjoyed staying here as it was convenient. The beach is only 10mins walk away. There’s a commonwealth bank across the street with a security guard outside their ATM booths. There’s so many shops and restaurants right on your door step. The hotel is on the same rd where all the main clubs are located.   The rooms are small but since I’m a solo traveler it didn’t bother me. Most of the guests here were mostly couples and small families of four. The breakfast was…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: What a fab time we had Staff very helpful with Gitta in Guest Services offering service fit for royalty  Food outstanding and staff super friendly  We loved looking out for the hotel Dog which was super cute  Wanted to tske it back to oz with me  We will Be back fir sure

Besakih: We have come here several times now. We always enjoy the long drive from Kuta and get to take in the surroundings. Please be advised that when you pay for admission, you do not have to use a guide. It is optional despite their insistence that you pay one to take you around the…
Sacred: we all enjoyed the monkey forest but make sure all your belongings are secure! We lost some bushmans insect repellent and think the monkeys are all mozzie free now <U+0001F601>
Kuta: This is a great beach and goes for miles. Many spots to hire a chair 3 for 100 and drink a beer. Keen ones can also learn to surf. Great spot to sit on a beanbag and watch sunset.
Mount: we started our hight with a tour guide leaving our hotel at 2 am and starting the hike at around 4 am. we reached the top around 6 am and had the most amazing view of the sunrise. myself and my partner are quite fit and didn't have any problems hiking. however there were many…
Aling: You driven to this part of Bal so go and view it. Not the best attraction in the world to be honest and a few photos. Plenty of bikini clad young girls obviously not aware of how short some can be and kept the guides busy ogling ... It’s a buzz for some jumping and sliding down…
Grandmas: Staff super friendly, rooms were super cool and fun. Clean with good showers and great breakfast. Would recommend grandma's to any traveller. Opposite a Commonwealth ATM and centred well, close to everything you need.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Nice hotel, friendly staff, and what I love the most in this hotel is The Breakfast! The breakfast is so delicious. Room was clean. Overall this hotel is recommended for family, friends or honeymooner

Besakih: Took 2hrs+ to reach here from Kuta. Lots of roadside stalls selling food & souvenirs lined all the way till entrance gate. Tourist ticket cost IDR60K. They provide a sarong for you to wear and you will be accompanied by a guide. As there was an ongoing special ceremony that…
Sacred: We hired a taxi and visited the monkey sanctuary. The ethos of the place is good and the monkeys seem well cared for. We were able to walk around freely and weren't troubled by the monkeys at all, but there were always plenty of staff on hand if there had been a problem.  There…
Kuta: Yes nice now the Balinese are making the effort to clean the beaches. Beautiful sunsets in Bali.  Plus very friendly people.
Mount: The night hike up mount batur to watch the sunrise from the top has been my favorite adventure on this trip thus far! We hired a driver and specialist to be sure we did not have to worry about getting ripped off by one of the “guides” and he gave us an amazing adventure. His…
Aling: We hired scooters and zipped up to the Aling Aling Falls from Lovina. The entry price to the Secret Garden for 'short trekking with water activities' was 125k. Seems expensive but we were sent onto the trek with two guides for the four of us and they took great care of us as we…
Grandmas: room, facilities, and etc.. The staff was very helpful and friendly, i have stayed for 3 days, the first day Lita handling when i check in, she is very attentive, and Anggie, she help me to take my luggage in the last stay, she also give me tea, thanks also for Sanjaya the room cleaner, i promise will be back again next month.....
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Beautiful hotel which is set far off the main pathway. The hotel is very scenic, and all the rooms appear to have great views. Rooms are spacious and have lovely bathrooms (shower and bathtub) and nice balconies. The swimming pool is wonderful, with plenty of loungers and shade spots. The pool is warm too!  Breakfast is served in their artichoke restaurant, with a wide variety of options including both local and western hot stations.   Service was OK. They offer a shuttle to the beach and to Uluwatu temple. We had asked if we could get the shuttle just to the outside of property (about 10minute walk in the heat), but for some reason they wouldn't do this, even through the shuttle would be going in that very direction to the beach. They offered us an umbrella for the heat…

Besakih: The ancient temple has wonderful architecture and fascinating history which you learn with your guide (Which they say is paid for but who will ask for a tip anyway) if you go at the right time you can see some Balinese dance for the temple which is a special sight (Full moons…
Sacred: We visited the sanctuary in the afternoon as we read the monkeys are less aggressive after they’ve been fed at 2pm.  The monkeys were great and so were the staff who work in the park. You’re not allowed to touch the monkeys however they one did climb on my boyfriend and wasn’t…
Kuta: Living in Vietnam I feel the beaches are more beautiful. I was told there are many more beaches around the  Bali  area that are very pretty and more relaxing and enjoyable   I made one trip to Kuta beach and stayed about 10 minutes and walked back to my hotel.
Mount: Climb to the top was not the easiest but with the right sports shoes and mindset, it’s well worth the exercise and challenge.   Getting to the summit with unobstructed views of the sunrise while having warm hot chocolate in the chilly temperatures was one of the finest feelings…
Aling: We all loved Aling Aling but especially my teenagers. They loved the thrill of the natural water slides.   When we first arrived I was a bit shocked by the price of entry. I am not sure if you have to pay that and take the guides but in hindsight I am so glad we did. We had 4…
Grandmas: I met Anggi during her off hours at a fruit salad shop and I was blown away by her radiance, enthusiasm and willingness to help. She gave me tips on what to order, translated my order to the local vendor and told me when how to say it in Bahasa for the next time I order.  We went on chatting about things to go to, and see in Kuta and how life was going for the both of us.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: As mentioned on other reviews, the rooms and pool are exceptional but the staff truly make the visit memorable. They’re extremely helpful, pleasant, and genuinely seem to enjoy their job. I spoke with a few of the employees that have been working there since the hotel opened a couple years ago so it’s nice to support a business that apparently treats it’s staff well.   The hotel is also with a few minutes walk to Bingin and Impossibles beaches, and a 20 minute walk to Padang Padang beach, which allows you to explore the area without the hassle of using taxis or driving.   Another wonderful second stay at Radisson Blu and I plan on returning in the near future.

Besakih: Bali's most revered temple, climbs up the southern city of Mount Agung.The entire temple complex has 23 separate temple that visiting pilgrims must visit on their to the top, with around 1000m from first to last temple.  Entrance fee for Foreigners is IDR60K
Sacred: Great day  but be careful of your belongings.  Jeep things in bags and zipped up.  They are very clever
Kuta: Full of garbage and people trying to sell you things that you don't want. Bali has a lot of nice places to see and spend time. Go see it so you can experience it and then go somewhere exciting. Piles of garbage on the back and the water is dirty.
Mount: Sunday 8th September and we visited Kintamani, where both Mount Batur and Lake Batur are situated.  We were here as one of the stops on our Great Bali Introduction Tour which we booked through the Tui Rep in our hotel. It was a cultural tour including places of interest.  We got…
Aling: There are 8 waterfalls within Sambangan Area. Aling-Aling Waterfall is one of them.   Within Aling-Aling Waterfall You Can Find Kroya waterfall, which is fun for water activities as you can jump from 5 or 10 or 15m Cliff. We also can do water slide from the waterfall.   You have…
Grandmas: It was a pleasant stay for a couple of weeks . I would personally like to thank the staff for being so supportive especially Ms. ANGII INDRIYANI PUTRI for her heartily and generous service she is always ready to support you in best possible manner with beautiful smile on her face. She even helps you to to visit the best places within short time by providing best itineraries.  I would personally recommend this hotel for comfortable stay food was great and the ambiance was perfect
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
