Radisson: We went on a luxury escape package, this was very reasonable considering all the vouchers given for massage, meals and cocktails. Staff were very friendly and accommodating . Special mention must be made to the efforts of Yoga, Krishna, Naya and the two masseuse. Breakfasts were excellent..

Besakih: This place is magnificent, holy and brath taking! I was lucky to go just before nyepi so I saw the ceremonies. Yes, there are money seekers but I just said no to everyone (after buying my ticket) and I was fine. I did tip thr guide 100.000 rp which he didn't like but I said it's…
Sacred: Lovely sanctuary and great to see the monkeys living as they should. Great walks and marvelous photo opportunities without disturbing the monkeys
Kuta: The beach has a lot of independents surfing school. It is a good place to pick up surfing at a reasonable rate. Overcrowded with tourist, a norm for a popular tourist area but dislike a lot of sellers keep pestering you to buy souvenirs, massage, pedi and manicure.
Mount: We are average hikers and the hike was definetely not worth paying fir a guide.  The trip was beatiful and at times a bit challenging, but as long as you pay attention there is no danger at all.  Lights are though needed.  The trip around the crater top is a must.
Aling: A very nice place to visit while in Bali. Admission price is quite expensive, but very worthy with a pleasant experience here. A place to visit and guaranteed you will love it.
Grandmas: My friend and I stayed there for 4 nights. Although it was a basic hotel with minimal amenities, but the service and staff was like a 4-star hotel. Just to have an idea of my trip- it was my first time in Bali and I picked Grandmas Plus in Legian because of it was really affordable, 10 minutes walk to the beach, walking distance to the nightlife and it had amazing reviews. So, now, to explain how the staff there deserve a bonus or a raise or at least praised for their hard work, helpfulness and kindness.  1. Their super quick response when we rang to ask for something for our room.  2. Their helpfulness (even at odd hours) when it came to places to go, travelling tips, drivers to hire, how to not get cheated, where to buy cheaper souvenirs, and so much more. 3. Last but not…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Could not fault this place, such a beautiful resort! The grounds are beautiful, rooms great, restaurants AMAZING & the facilities spa, pool, service is 10/10 It is very reasonable priced for Uluwatu!!

Besakih: If you want to feel the calmness and the spiritual aura of Balinese you should visit this place. Just make sure you follow the rule to visit this, in order to keep its holiness.
Sacred: Nice place. I hate zoos but this is such a lovely place where the monkeys run freely and they can come and sit on you if they want. Super nice and really worth a little fee paid.
Kuta: Regularly walk along Kuta Beach front and the locals work hard to keep it clean.It is well patronised by surfers and swimmers. You can relax at a beach bar and have a quiet drink especially at Sam’s near the Turtle recovery section
Mount: Amazing  sunset worth the hike choose the difficult  path if you want a good hike do not book with bali sunrise  treaking as you can get much better deal else where as they are over priced. The views are fantastic  and you definitely worth the trek .
Aling: While driving from Lovina to Munduk, we stopped at Aling-Aling Waterfall and spent about 1 hour there. First, we have to buy ticket. As we just wanted to see the place without any water sports, we were charged 10000 per person. Otherwise, the charges are 225000 per person which…
Grandmas: Thank you for your great response. Will consider for coming back to this hotel. Walking distance to Kuta beach. Enough space and clean room with cozy bed. They provide free shuttle to airport and nearby place.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed for three nights and the Hotel is excellent, rooms are huges king size beds means really king size. furniture and design is very tastfull bathroom leaves nothing to wish for (or maybe that high end toilet) Swimming pool is never too crowded, lawns and grounds are very well kept, the pool bar even services an oven baked pizza. Restaurants and breakfast are very good, oriental european amarican, it is all there.

Besakih: There are a lot of negative reviews about the aggressive vendors.  Yes, i did run into them.  My included tour guide did ask for tip.  Would i do it again? The answer is yes.  The tour guide was able to answer my questions and take me through the routes that i would have missed…
Sacred: We visited some days ago and the forest had so many monkeys. Some aggressive, fighting eachother and stole a water bottle from a woman. The surrounding was great, a nice forest. We were a bit uncomfortable being so close to the monkeys but we knew what we got into <U+0001F605> if you like…
Kuta: Kuta Beach was one of the nicest beaches in the past, but anno 2020 it is really not more than an average beach. Where the sunset is beautiful to watch here, the beach is packed with plastic, every 2 minutes or so you will get bothered by a salesman, which can be really…
Mount: I didnt climb the mountain but I spent all morning looking at it from different places and it is breathtaking
Aling: This place is amazing. You can do waterfall sliding and jumping. Its worth visiting. Our local guide was very helpfull. GEDE was his name .
Grandmas: Excellent staffs and always willing to help with a smile. Love the ambience with great location as well. Right on the main street where all the action are and suprisingly quiet. Would definitely come back for more.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Excellent stay here! The staff are all very friendly, helpful and polite; the room was fantastic, great view and very spacious and very clean also; the breakfast buffet was amazing, very wide selection! The gym is quite small, but the facilities are good. We had a slight issue with the bathroom door, within 15 minutes of reporting it to reception, someone had been and fixed it! The location is a little far out but therefore it is quite peaceful and they do regular (free) shuttle bus into Uluwatu and to the temple in the evening. Only negative was when we dined at Filini, the Italian restaurant there; the food was great but service was quite poor, took a lot to get anyone’s attention, which was quite a contrast from the otherwise excellent service at the hotel. Would definitely…

Besakih: We’d read the reviews and decided to go anyway  Firstly, the parts you can go in are worth seeing. That said, there’s a lot you can’t go in Early morning seems to be a good time to arrive, we got there at 10:30  The price includes a sarong, ride to the entrance and a guide:- The…
Sacred: Went there with my wifei and had a lof of fun for a couple of hours. You get to be surrounded by monkeys from everywhere and if you are "lucky" you get to be touched by the monkeys, yes, they touch you and not viceseversa. While taking pictures there a few times monkey jumped…
Kuta: Kuta is a famous beach, so you should go at least once.  Sure, there are plenty of vendors trying to sell you all kinds of stuff, but if you can haggle effectively you can rent boogie boards or surf boards for cheap.  We didn't stay in Kuta, just came to visit the beach for a…
Mount: A +-7km long hike (but with 1km height difference) takes you up to the caldera of one of the high mountains on Bali. Around halfway up you get the choice for an easy or a hard trail. The easy trail was challenging at times for us, as untrained hikers, but doable. On the easy…
Aling: Came here as part of a private tour and we paid 125k for the short trek, which included tour guide and jumping at two or three of the waterfalls. We didn’t do the jumping parts, but the tour guide we hadwas very friendly and helpful. He helped us take lots of photos. Best to…
Grandmas: Comfy room, friendly n helpful hotel staffs, good breakfast. I love the giant ants decorations, it's very unique. The room is minimalis but very comfy for me. The wifi is fast. I would love to comeback
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The Radisson Blu Uluwatu is perfect for honeymooners or just simply to relax after a hectic week. My wife enjoyed the spa and the fresh coconut! Although far from other places of interest, this is a highly recommended place.

Besakih: It's very important temple like head temple for Balinese.  It's worth to pray there so you will feel some mysterious atmosphere.  But to go on the top there are many steps so with baby or small kids, you need more energy  and better have water, some hats, suns cream to avoid…
Sacred: Lovely setting. Be prepared to be surrounded by monkeys.  Cover up because the mosquitoes are about. Loads of fun and close to the Ubud markets.
Kuta: Beach is not clean. Full of garbage and smells bad also too crowded. We could just enjoy beautiful sunset view from our hotel rooftop otherwise beach was not usable at all.
Mount: This morning my husband and me took on the trek to watch the glorious sunrise from the top of Mount Batur.  We booked through Get My Guide and our guide, Ari, was amazing.  It is a challenging hike and neither of us are what you would call regular hiking fans at home ....... but…
Aling: I recommend this place to eveyrone who likes little bit of adrenaline pumped to their blood. I had great guide, atmosphere was really good, I was in May and it wasnt crowded at all. When I come back to Bali I ll go there again.
Grandmas: The hotel place was excellent,  All staff was friendly and so kindly Cleaning very good,  I suggest to you all because in bali you dont need a luxury hotel,  Price of this hotel was ecxcellent thank you grand mass
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Only AC has a paroblem, very noise to us and for the way in, must be adding lightning.. for anything else, is a good hotel and comfort and also a good service. For a breakfast i think maybe must be have more variant

Besakih: its a lil far from ubud but if you have the time its a must visit. the temple looks extremely beautiful and its a big area. we visited this place on our second visit to Bali. but unfortunately since it was raining and cloudy that day we couldnt experience the agung volcano in…
Sacred: Beautiful scenery and lots of monkeys just chilling! Be warned there are lots of steps and thus this us not for the seriously unfit or those with limited mobility! It is a lovely place to be and worth every pesky step
Kuta: Was staying at a hotel on this beach over New Year’s Eve. Omg. The place was jam packed. We could walk up or down the beach or the road. The beach side road was also closed causing huge traffic jams.
Mount: Thats the higher mountain in Bali island, and we lucky to get open sky day. That atraction is a sightsee and can be combine with many others tours since he is the biggest montain and can be seen from diferent areas when the skyes are blue. Very nostalgic scenary, with many fruit…
Aling: We went today and there were only 10 other tourists. I don't know where people saw this place overcrowded.  Yes, it's better to buy the 125.000 Rp package as you get a guide and he helps all the time, he explains how to jump, he takes pictures, he takes care of your stuff,…
Grandmas: Nice Hotel - great location, rooms are clean and staff are attentive. The beds are comfy with good pillows. The breakfast was also nice and staff helped to arrange transport when required. Will stay here again.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Located in uluwatu, next to anantara hotel, away from main road ab 5-10 minute walk. If you walk to the top of the road many restaurants and shops are there. It’s 1hour away from kuta, 30 minutes from jimbaran, 1.30 hours from Ubud. There are many beaches nearby the hotel like impossibles beach, binging beach, Padang Padang beach, and many more.   Impossibles is a walk down a stair case ab 10 minutes. Not too difficult for a person like me who doesn’t like to walk much. I have attached some pics of impossibles beach here. Hotel provides shuttle service to Padang Padang beach from morning till afternoon everyday. Also provides to uluwatu temple at 4.30pm and pickup at 7.15pm after Kecak fire dance. We used these services was very helpful. Both Padang Padang, uluwatu temple and…

Besakih: Very tourist centered, and the ticket gets you everything you need including sarong, entrance, guided tour and motor bike ride to Temple entrance.
Sacred: Was a great visit and the monkeys are fun to watch play, eat, cuddle and fight. But please obey the warnings and you’ll be sure to have a wonderful visit.
Kuta: It's full of garbage on the whole line of shores, even dead blowfish with a lot of flies left there and noone seemed to care to clean it up. I took pictures of some only.
Mount: We woke up at 1am to get on a bus from our villa and started climbing at 3:30am but it was one of the most amazing things I’ve ever done!  We had a local guide (not a tour) who took us up a back way. More of a direct climb but much steeper, rockier and challenging. It was a…
Aling: Not worth the detour if you have seen waterfalls before. Entrance fee is expensive (for Bali). You will be assigned a guide that follows your every step. Don’t think about having a quiet time, he will be there all the time telling you where to go. Very crowded. Not worth the…
Grandmas: My family and I arrived in Bali late in the evening around 11pm. The staff were very welcoming and patient with us after our long flight. Each morning at their breakfast buffet, Saputra always checked in on us making sure everything about our stay was okay.   Additionally, Saputra gave us advice on what places we should check out, restaurants we should try and even accommodated us on our last day by allowing us to have our luggages stay in their locked room after check out as we explored the city before our flight. He was a great resource!   The hotel itself was in a great location! Just outside the hotel were cute shops, restaurants, massage parlors and groceries. It was also a short walk to the beach too!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The location of the hotel is amazing. In the countryside by the ocean. Extremely clean and cozy. Perfect place for a getaway rest. rooms and bathrooms were nice and kept very clean daily. The staff at the front dest and every where are so polite and respectful. Very nice individuals. We had a blast. I will stay there anytime

Besakih: Spent around 1.5 hours wandering around. Even though you are not allowed to step into the prayer areas, you can get pretty good visual from all angles as the 'alleys' circle the areas. Sad to see kids selling post cards. Be prepared for the multiple vendors also on the streets…
Sacred: A great spot for a couple of hours. Really interesting to see all the monkeys and it is a nice place to walk through. Word of warning - one jumped on my back and opened my backpack - luckily all he got was a bottle of nasal spray - must have been very disappointed when he tasted…
Kuta: Great place to chill out. Not crowded on weekend. Enjoyed a peaceful moment taking a slow stroll down the long stretch of sandy beach. Eateries are just nearby if you're hungry. There're also shops at the art market beside the beach if you need to shop for souvenirs. Recommended.
Mount: You should get at the Batur's area at 3-3:30 at the morning to get a chance to see sunset from the top of the Batur Volcano. If you are not ready to cardio you can rent the bike to get at the top (almost). View from the top is AWESOME!
Aling: An amazing experience of beauty with an adrenaline rush! Waterfalls are beautiful and the jungle stunning! Easy trek to navigate with local guide which is included in entry fee. Don’t be tight... just pay the small entrance fee to support the local community. Worth every cent!
Grandmas: Very cheap and effordable price... Very clean room and comfortable bed. Staffs were also very cooperative. Had a plan 2 night stay but later on extended for more 2 days. Every penny paid was worthy <U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D>
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Food excellent - breakfast buffet, all day restaurant and more fine dining restaurant for the evening.. Service friendly. Rooms spacious modern and clean. Quiet at night = no loud bar noise. Gym small but clean with equipment well-kept.

Besakih: We were a bit uncertain whether we should go at all after reading all the bad reviews about the Besakih temple experience. We went anyway and said NO to the sarong vendors, NO to the offering vendors, NO to the guides/guardians and NO to the postcard kids. So we had NO trouble,…
Sacred: Kids loved the monkeys. Ages 1,10,11,18. No issues with the monkeys at all. The youngest thought it was amazing!! Just don't put your drink down ha ha. Looks like they enjoyed it though.
Kuta: Perhaps we’ve been too spoilt by our beautiful, clean beaches in Australia and our recent stay in Nusa Dua, but our experience of Kuta was awful. It’s really smelly, overcrowded, and both the beach and the water were filthy.  We literally had rubbish clinging to our legs when we…
Mount: Despite it was a bit overcrowded during the trek, like people had to queue for climbing up, you would find it worth after you have reached the top and enjoyed watching the sunrise. Make sure you wear a proper shoes as it was a bit slippery while climbing out there.
Aling: The place is really dreamy and worth the visit (and the dizzy ride to get there). Do the waterfall by yourself and don’t let the people of the entrance scam you! To be honest I don’t even think you need a ticket to enter! Anyway as soon as you arrive to the parking lot, they…
Grandmas: I always stay at Grandmas every time I visit Legian.  The room is simple and very cozy. Staff are very friendly and attentive.  Yudi at reception desk is very helpful and kind.  Breakfast is good with some options for buffet and a la carte as well. Overall I have  a good stay here.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: This hotel is very beautiful. The service and friendliness of the staff is fantastic. I would return anyday. One of the most calming and restful places I have been to. The food in all the restaurants is delicious and fresh. Bali as a whole was okay but this hotel made the difference for me.

Besakih: I can't fully appreciate this experience because of my feeling of being robbed. The people there are professionals and have many tricks to fleece your money.  1. At the car park, there is no sign anywhere that the entrance ticket is inclusive of the sarong rental. There are many…
Sacred: The monkeys here are well looked after, there are alot of staff around feeding and cleaning. The monkeys seem happy enough doing their thing and the forrest really is beautiful its just a shame that some tourist don't do the right thing!! Don't touch the monkeys!! don't pull…
Kuta: Clean beach... Very relaxing and people are quite nice.  Do don't hassle you so you can have a good time with friends and family
Mount: My dad, me and a friend booked a private guide who brought us to the top. In the beginning you have a normal road (in my opinion) but our friend was unfit and found it really hard. Then there was a meeting point (after 30min) where you have to chose between the easy road and the…
Aling: We went there by motorbike from tulamben, 125k entrance @each person for short track (15 min walk to waterfall, 30min - 2h activity in the waterfall) The activity that you choose might be vary, for short track you have cliff jump 5,10,15m  The tour guide was so friendly,and…
Grandmas: Very nice place for stay a long time in Bali, just minutes walk to legian beach, shoping and hangout place. The room is quite small but always make up everyday...so our rooms are always clean and tidy. Breakfast is excellent with many variety menu and always get new menu everyday...so we are not boring to have our breakfast, although we were staying for a week. Mr. Saputra as a supervisor is very nice and kind man. He is always come to every table and asking people about breakfast menu in everyday and we always meet him everyday at breakfast time 07.00 - 11.00 am for a week we stayed at Grandmas Legian. He is wonderfull, thank you very much for your hospitality Mr. Saputra<U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F> and will see you again for next trip.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: What a great pleasure to stay in this hotel. It’s just made to relax and chill. The breakfast buffet is excellent, and offers whatever you like. The fire place at night is cozy, and gives a warm feeling when having a drink or a night snack. The pool area is quiet, well decorated with many comfy sun-beds. What we liked most about the room were the ultra soft linen and the comfortable bed. Even tho it might look big, it feels like a boutique resort. Highly recommended and also close to cool beach clubs such as Omnia, El Kabron and Ulu Cliffclub.

Besakih: That is the mother temple. But there are tour guides who ask for more money, for more tip. You pay a ticket for entrance and in this price is sarong and tour guide. Usually people leave 2$ but our guide wanted more and more. And he wasn't happy with rupies, he would like tip in…
Sacred: Nice way to spend the morning walking amongst nature and seeing the cheeky monkeys doing their thing. Advise to go in the morning as the natural canopies in the sanctuary trap in the heat making it hotter and steamier than it already is. Also avoid wearing backpacks as the…
Kuta: Definitely one of the best beaches on pop circuit. Soft sand, very gentle gradient, safe surfing for most levels, not overcrowded. Kept clean, and cleaning activities need to be kept up. Not immune from global plastic pollution unfortunately.
Mount: Was a solo traveller and was assigned 1 guide (1:1 ratio) from my accommodation (triangle house at the base of Mount Batur). The view at the summit was breathtaking and amazing. The beautiful view of the sunrise is dependent on the weather. During my hike, the sky was clear blue…
Aling: Fantastic experience. Jumping off waterfalls from 2m, 5m, 10m and the big 15m. 1 gentle water slide down a small waterfall and 1 larger rougher slide plunging you into a deep pool. The walk through the trees to get there was pleasant. 2,500,000 IDR for 2 people (roughly £12.50).…
Grandmas: Situated in a very good location in Legian , this hotel offers nice (small) comfortable rooms . Breakfast is very good , and the free shuttle back to the airport is very convenient ! Staff are very friendly and welcoming  : special thanks to Mister Saputra , and Miss Ana (Juliana) who did a fabulous job ! And thanks also to all the rest of the staff - from reception to housekeeping and breakfast room ! I will come back with pleasure !
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Stayed here in July (not school holidays) for my 40th birthday and also our 1st wedding anniversary. Travelled with our 10 month old boy, my parents (in their 60s) and my brother and his partner.    The hotel is beautiful and spacious. The rooms are huge (we had a ocean view studio) and we had a lovely wrap around balcony. Like others have mentioned the rooms could be better sound proofed but we were lucky and didn't have noisy neighbours. The hotel never felt crowded and you could always find a deck chair or cabana. The staff were super friendly and helpful throughout. Special shout out to Nova from F&B! All the staff LOVED our baby! The food at the Italian restaurant is fantastic. The buffet breakfast had a wide variety but I didn't think the quality was as good as it could…

Besakih: Managed to at last make a visit to the Mother Temple after countless visits to Bali. It was a huge complex which houses different temples. There were shops selling souvenirs and foodstalls dotting the road from the ticket booth up to the temple.  Contrary to the many bad…
Sacred: This was part of our sight seeing tour and was definitely worth the visit. Definitely fun and something out of the norm
Kuta: Walked the 1.6km along the beach from our hotel to Ku De Ta for New Year and back again at night.  Beach has a nice atmosphere, lots of places to stoo and some powerful waves.  Yes it's not the cleanest but it's in a very busy city!! If you want a completely clean beach then go…
Mount: There are multiple tour stands around Ubud. We payed a decent amount and from the time we were picked up to the time we were dropped off there was little to no direction. We were in an over crowded van and our group was pretty cranky. Maybe because it was so early in the…
Aling: Bali is known for its waterfalls and Aling aling is one of the best. watch out for the cliff jumpers.
Grandmas: The location is great - nearby to shops, eateries and beach is about 15 minutes walk.   Pros: Clean sheets, clean bathroom, good breakfast, you can choose a hot meal aside from all the other usual items - cereal, juice, coffee, eggs, 1 or 2 fried dishes.   Cons: Rooms smell musty even after opening the windows. Some improvement on the ventilation definately required here.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Everything is perfect except the view over ocean, which is very limited. Very friendly staff. Perfectly clean. Breakfast should be improved with additional choice of fruits. Access to the beach is a challenge!

Besakih: we had so much fun shooting and exploring this place! it was worth every penny and we learned alot from our tour guide as well
Sacred: Absolutely loved the Monkey Forest! Had read a ton of reviews saying it was a scam and it was pretty lame but I literally had the time of my life! So so so many monkeys of all sizes everywhere, some friendly and some scary! We walked around for about 4 hours without getting…
Kuta: The beach and water is very dirty. There are many surfing boards for rent where you can also leave your belongings. It's a nice place for your first surfing in terms of the waves and sand.
Mount: Do not be put off by some of the reviews!  My partner and I did the sunrise trek to the top with a pre-booked guide from our villa. We are in our early twenties, with a pretty good level of fitness. We didn't find it a hard trek fitness-wise but a more technical trek where you…
Aling: If you like to push you adrenaline, this is the best place to visit, a beautiful view make a good vibe
Grandmas: clean ,, near  the  shops  beach ,restaurants  ,.  the  staff  the  best  the  room  is  small  but  perfect  hot water  good  wifi    the  breakfest  its  like  a  lunch  , no  smoking  rooms    and  the environment is quiet  if  a  want  a  room   cheap  this  is  a choice  teramakasi      suputra, wiohi,ita, komang, yoshi,lita, meika,yudi,dedi maria , yudiari,surya, lesmana
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: The hotel location is peaceful and quiet unlike the busy road and noises along Kuta area. The scenery is simply amazing and breathtaking with the view of the Indian Ocean. The room is very spacious and comfortable. Highly recommended to stay at this hotel.

Besakih: We buy our ticket that cost 60.000rupias and it’s says that includes the sarom and the local guided, but don’t believe this because after they will charge you for the guide !!! The temple wasn’t that great, we had visit nicer ones in Bali, and the people inside the temple like…
Sacred: A very pleasant few hours spent here. Beware though, these monkeys will steal anything, they can unzip backpacks, will take glasses, hats etc. Don't make yourself a target. Saying that, most will leave you alone, especially if you have nothing worth taking.
Kuta: kuta beach is one of the best beach for surfing or just walking along  ,has   one of the best places to see the sunset also .u want to just sit and have a beer on the beach or just relax  and have a beach massage  is also great to have ..nice beach area to have lunch or dinner…
Mount: Too many people and at times very dangerous. Very difficult climb, in the dark. People slipping and you're climbing one after the next in a crazy long crowd.
Aling: Almost secretly located in the forest. Decending with our guide down the steep stairs you could hear the water from the waterfall pounding down. It was fun jumping in the water and going from the slides. For us it was enough just the first two jumps. Real adrenaline junkies can…
Grandmas: I enjoyd my stay at grandsmas alot, polite staff with big smiles, artistic paintings and beutiful plants all over hotel made the feeling very plesent.  Special thanks to: Hendy, Ara, Meilca, Lita and Ngurah Putra!  <U+0001F64F>  Suksma
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Very good hotel to relax, need shuttle to go to better beaches, some nice restaurants nearby, Very quit in the evening, not much to do in the hotel, good for family & children, very good and healthy breakfast

Besakih: I have visited the Besakih temple again after 40 (!) years and still find it amazing. Peace, harmony and spirits are unchanged. Temples well maintained from the money we tourist pay. I love how people redo multilayer roofs. I listen to my guide and buy postcards from the…
Sacred: The monkey forrest was walking distance to our hotel so we decided to give it a go. The entrance fee is quite reasonable. The nature in the forrest is beautiful, and it was fun to see the monkeys doing their tricks. I did not enjoy some tourists clearly breaking the rules and…
Kuta: I had been to Fiji, Cook Island, Vanuatu and Phuket in recent year, finally we will take a holiday in Bali, which is very famous, it was turn out our worst holiday ever, because Xmas is a high season, after landed in Bali airport, usually time to travel is about 30 mins from…
Mount: We woke up at 1.30 in the morning and arrived there at about 3.30 . It is about 2,5 hours to get on the top, there are many people and it gets overcrowded . It is not the easiest trek mainly due to the fact that are many people going up at this particular time for the sunrise…
Aling: If you catch up with the Darwis trekking guide community in upper Sambangan village, they can give you ootions of ahort, medium or long trekking.   The whole area lends itself to walking and exploring. Terraced ricefields are just up the hill and make a great start point for an…
Grandmas: Got this incredible offer from booking.com and chose to Stay for 1 night before moving to a private villa. The staff are very friendly, Strategic location, comfortable room and a cheap buffet!What more can you ask for!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We came over from Nusa Dua to the radisson blue at ulluwatu its been nice but little things that other hotels do they don't for instance down at the pool for a swim one towel is aloud no cushions on chairs very uncomfortable couldn't get napkins at the restaurant just little things that were wrong ate at the Italian restaurant very nice food would go back there Look its an ok place but stayed at better ones

Besakih: Besakih Temple or the Mother Temple is the biggest Hindu temple in Bali. It is located at the foot of Mount Agung.  I visited during the Bali Galungan, the period celebrating the victory of dharma over adharma.  The site is a sacred place hence wearing the sarong is a…
Sacred: Fun to check out the monkeys who were cute, as long as you left them on their own. Great to have been there to experience it. Awesome family activity!
Kuta: Well, the ocean is the ocean but when ther is to much garbage, not so well. Also, allot of ambulant sellers that anoing you every 2min!  Surf is ok for beginners and the prices are decent.
Mount: Very crowded and a challenging trek! We started off meeting our tour guide. She was lovely and helped us all the way through. When you get to the top, the views are amazing. There are hundreds of people trying to get to the top. It's chaos & pitch black at the beginning with…
Aling: Yes, it is real fun and the surrounding is beautiful as pretty much all jungles and waterfalls across the entire island. You can go there just to visit the place, admire the beauty of the nature, take some pictures and go, no one can and should force you to do anything extreme.…
Grandmas: With such centrally located position in Legian and cheap prices, I don't expect much from this hotel. But Grandmas turned out to be beating my expectation. The room is just wide enough, it has nice garden set-up, the shower is working well, amenities are adequate, bed is clean and comfortable with four pillows, the staffs are very helpful, and each room has a refrigerator in it. The downside is probably it has limited space so that it has no swimming pool nor car-park.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: The radisson Blu is a vey nice hotel with very spacious rooms, that feel new/refurbished. The pool area is het excellent with many options in terms of beds. gym is well equipped with new fitness equipment.  The breakfast buffet is a bit of a let down. While there are quite some options available at first sight, there is not that many options of you don’t prefer warm/cooked breakfast. Buffet is the same all days. Restaurants on site are okay but not really great. Room for improvement.

Besakih: We had a great day when visiting besakih temple, it so amazing temple architecture complex, and majestic pagoda of the temple, and we also can be show others part of island with green side and show of active volcano in back of temple
Sacred: A 20min walk from Ubud centre. Wonderful experience, so glad I went. Obey the rules and you will be just fine.  Highly recommend you don't wear sunnys, hat etc. I watched 2 pairs of sunnys get taken, a bottle of orange juice from  lady's open bag and a cliff bar from bag. Was …
Kuta: Nice sunset beach when clouds allow...  lots of people, mostly fully clothed, but still interesting people watching
Mount: We booked the trip as a group of 4 who all have a high fitness level, we managed it but there was no advice on the physical demands that are expected and the route down was quite challenging.  We also thought it would be a handful of groups going up the mountain at 3am instead…
Aling: Visited this waterfall yesterday with my husband. We opted to not swim for two reasons: it cost more to swim rather than just visit, and second reason was we had a very busy day the day before our visit and were a little tired.  Getting down to the waterfall was fairly easy, as…
Grandmas: The location is really nice in the centre of Legian and beach also walking distance. The staff very friendly and treat us like a family. Yoga the hotel manager always ask our stay to make sure everything is fine, Hendy, Ana, Mirah also nice and very helpfull. Very recommended hotel and we would back again.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The most wonderful place to relax with a stunning pool, excellent spa, beautiful food at two restaurants and a relaxed, quiet ambience. The luxury escapes offer made our stay incredible value for money.

Besakih: Your grab car pulls in after a 3 hour ride..immediately "sarong-woman" springs into action ready and willing to sell you a sarong for 500 rp !!! Then, fully saronged you head up to the temple only to find a mob blocking your way and guiding you back to the ticket office.…
Sacred: It was nice to observe the monkeys in their natural habitat, at the same time rather sad that most of the forest around them has disappeared,
Kuta: Beach is clean, comfortable and safe.. we have wider options of relaxing with drinks and music with great options of food. You can chill out for full day. Beautiful location and nice view. It's must try at anytime during day or evening.
Mount: Pros: if you make it for the sunrise, it is truly spectacular. The views are amazing if you are lucky enough to get a cloudless day.  Cons: this is not a "trek". The first half of the walk is up a road that cars can drive up. The second half is actually up the mountain. It is…
Aling: Your own guide included to the price, letting you swim, jump from cliffs (5, 10, 15 meters), feel the paradise of the nature. There is a natural waterfall slide - Incredible time.  Probably the best attraction from all!
Grandmas: i love to stay here. the location is close to everything. Rooms are clean and big enough. you get everything you need in here. but the thing i love the most is the staff. So polite, so friendly, so helpful. Especially miss Anggi, we like her very much. hopefully we will come back again one day.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: I was Very satisfied with my experience here. It was clean, comfortable, and very accessible to everything in Uluwattu. I would say I chose the right place for my trip in Uluwattu. The pool was also very relaxing and beautiful.

Besakih: Beautiful Area.  Very expensive ticket that includes sarong, ride to the temple by motor bike.  We used bike but no one came to get us back, so we walked.  It is not that far to walk, maybe good for older people.  We had to go with a guide and he wanted 10 US$ tip!!  We gave 5. …
Sacred: The statues are amazing. The monkey's are a unique experience. Remember these are wild animals, respect their space. Ask questions and keep an open mind.
Kuta: Unfortunately, the beach that was once beautiful is now ruined by copious amounts of rubbish.  There is sometimes people cleaning the beach but unfortunately not often enough. It ruins an otherwise picturesque place.
Mount: There are literally hundred of people "climbing" the mountain. It's ridiculous that you need a guide to go up there. It's very very easy. Mass tourism and mafia. Definitely a one time experience for me.
Aling: Visiting the Aling Aling Waterfalls was a highlight for me as I enjoy a lot jumping from cliffs. The water temperature was very pleasant and the scenery one of a kind. The 3 different waterfalls of different heights (around 5, 10 & 16 meters) allowed me to jump straight into the…
Grandmas: ok, the room is a bit small, but this hotel is a nice place to stay. The price is very affordable and they offer great service. The room and shower/toilet room are really clean. The mattress, pillow, and blanket are comfortable. Though the room is small but it has everything we need. Minibar, kettle, good wifi, plenty of tv channel options. Aircon works perfectly. Buffet breakfast is very nice. All of the staff are so helpful and friendly. Once we left our rented car to be picked up by the owner who came late ( we had to leave to catch the plane), the security man called us just to let us know that the car had been collected so we didn’t need to worry. The location is great too, walk distance to Legian Beach, ATMs only two doors down, 24 hours Coco express across the road, nice…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Nicest hotel I have ever had the chance to stay in. Staff were amazing and went above and beyond for every guest. The rooms were spacious and modern. The breakfast buffet was incredible - there was even a donut wall!! I will definitely be returning on my next trip to Bali. Thanks for a great stay!

Besakih: In all my years of going to bali this was the first time I had ever been to Besakih Temple. We were lucky enough to go with my Balinese family to the temple so we got to go into their family temple to lay offerings and pray which was very special then afterwards we walked…
Sacred: I wasn't at all interested in visiting the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary, but I sure am glad I did. We spent a delightful few hours wandering among the beautifully maintained shady trees and temple buildings, watching the monkeys' antics. Not one bit of bad or aggressive…
Kuta: I must admit I was a bit disappointed. The beach was very dirty. The traders along the beach were friendly and not pushy at all. Was nice for a walk but not a swim
Mount: Quite daring  at first level but once you reach on the top all tiredness change to happiness . Its that Ahaa!!! moment
Aling: The waterfall was so high and the water very cold, but don't ask about the view because it's very beautiful.
Grandmas: I have been travelling to Bali many times in the past 5 years and have stayed at many places. Last month I discovered Grandma's Legian and have been back for 3 stays since then!   The location is close to everything -- restaurants, shopping, the beach. Rooms are clean. Wifi is fast and works all over the hotel. Showers are hot with great water pressure. A/C works perfectly - whether you want it super cold or not at all, it's easty to control. Beds are comfortable and the pillows.....amazing!! I wish i could stuff one in my bag to take to other hotels!   But best of all is the staff. So friendly, so polite, so helpful and very attentive! You will immediately feel welcome by the front desk staff and they are there to answer questions or give advice throughout your stay. (Special…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: I extended my trip after attending a conference nearby. Travelling solo can sometimes be intimidating however I felt right at home at the Radisson Blu. A beautiful setting, peaceful location. Great pool area with ample shade and lounges.  Lovely poolside juice bar and an all day dining restaurant on the other side of the pool. 3-4 dining options within the resort providing you choice. Good food! The breakfast buffet is ample.  Lovely day spa with hospitable staff. Reasonable prices. I opted for the 2.5hr escape which cost about AUD170. Not cheap by Bali standards but good value.  Extremely spacious rooms. Beautiful walk in shower with rain head, separate bathtub. Night lighting to find your way to the bathroom during the night. Comfortable beds and pillows. Effective air…

Besakih: Having been in Bali for 10 days, I traveled a lot of different places, met a lot of nice people, I got a very positive impression on this land and people.Since the Besakih Temple is the main and most important temple of Bali, I really wanted to visit it. My guide tried to…
Sacred: It’s been always great to visit this special place! The guest should however remember that this is not a Nat Geo and respect the nature and monkeys (unless one is looking for troubles).
Kuta: It is quite a challenge to get to Kuta beach ... which is reasonably clean due to donated beach cleaning equipment.  The trick is to walk through the Central Mall.  Worth finding fir a cooling dip
Mount: Hot springs in crater worth visiting. Entry to area 30,000 when you come from rice terraces. Mountain can be climbed with guide or in trip for sunrise views
Aling: this is awesome place, location is so sacred and far from the local house, the water is very clean, here you can see 4 waterfall (Aling-alling waterfall, kroya waterfall, Kembar/twin Waterfall, Pucuk waterfall) in one place and only one in Bali, beside see waterfall here you can…
Grandmas: The  hotel was amazing all staff were very friendly and I would definitely recommend  this place to any of my friends. The breakfast was amazing and the manager  saputra even took time out of his day to talk to us and see how we were doing!  Overall a great recommendation for anyone backpacking Bali!
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I would definitely return to this hotel. It was clean, great pool and good food. I visited the spa with my wife to get a couples massage and enjoyed it. Great location with free shuttle to near by beach but also close enough to walk to nearby food and shopping.

Besakih: Maybe we were lucky. I read many reviews on here and most of them seemed to have a lot of trouble with being ripped off. We went there by car. The driver payed 5000 IDR for parking and told us in the car that we need to buy tickets at the office right outside the parking lot.…
Sacred: if you have spare time visit this place otherwise here are more other better places to visit. the park is large with full of mischievous monkeys.
Kuta: Don’t brother coming to Kuta. Bali is a wonderful  place, enriched with genuine culture and traditions but it’s very disappointing that overrated tourist areas such as Kuta tarnish their cultural integrity. Kuta is a dangerous place, riddled with sleazy night clubs and crawling…
Mount: Waking up in the morning, 2 hours drive from Sanur, and then 1,5hrs hike up to the top of the active volcano to watch sunrise was all worth it. It is a advance hike as surface is partly sand, stones and ashes, however tour guides are amazing and many people (even bit older) made…
Aling: We had a guide who took us on the walk to the waterfalls. You need sturdy shoes as a bit slippery and you need to take your time. The waterfalls are absolutely beautiful and on one ledge you can take the leap of faith and jump in.
Grandmas: This is an awesome place to stay. Friendly staff and great service. There breakfast is fantastic you pick from a menu and they also have a Bali buffet. Fresh juice and fruits. My favorites were the Indonesian snacks. My girlfriend loved it and she’s a foodie. Great times. We will back.   Michael and June
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Great place and great location  Good o oi rice comparing with others but there is not view from the cliff what makes it not that special but overall it’s a great hotel I would strongly recommend this hotel

Besakih: Besakih is the biggest temple in Bali so, in my opinion, a must see. On the way to the temple, my guide told me not to pay for anything offered outside the temple because the local people only do it, to take advantage from the tourists. So a few tips: if you get a ride by…
Sacred: A lovely place to walk round and see monkeys hanging about and playing in teh park. They are free to roam around and are very interested in people and inquisitive of your belongings , so be careful. The park keepers ensure that the monkeys are well fed which keeps them attached…
Kuta: Beach is not clean but it's flat and long. Traffic is a nightmare, traffic jam starts in the afternoon and stays till night. People are very helpful and friendly tough. There is lot of bargaining of price, as a rule start with 50%less and stop at 10%more.
Mount: Paid IDR 350k per person, took us 1.5hour up, then 1 hour to hang around the breakfast place, another 1.5hour down. The view is nice enough but IDR 350k is quite expensive and since the peak was so congested we couldn't hang around as long as I would have liked.
Aling: Incredible views and a lot of fun. This experience allows you to see 4 waterfalls! You can even jump off the first 3 and slide down one of them. It was sooo much fun. The actual Aling-Aling waterfall is breath-taking. That is the last one you’ll see on your short walk but you…
Grandmas: We stayed in grandmas legian for 3 days and on first day we had little bit complain because we want to have double bed but on that time they only have two single beds. The day after the hotel manager Yoga meet us in restaurant and he arrange to move us to double bed, it's really great. All the staff was really nice and friendly, they always ask us about out stay that they want to make sure everything is fine. Hendy and Dicky also nice and our room cleaner sanjaya and windu made surprised with towel decoration. They also put apology letter with green small teddy bear, it was amazing that they are really care with their guest. We will comeback for sure.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Had a wonderful time. Kind staff clean room big spacious room w balcony. Restaurants were great. Beyond what we expected in Bali.  Would return again. Spa treatments were amazing and the space was lovely and relaxing.

Besakih: Our driver dropped us in the parking lot.  Tickets 60,000 rupiah each.  You will be told you need to have a sarong (~70,000 rupiah, subject to your negotiation skills).  You can either take the "scooter shuttle" to the gate, or walk up the fairly steep paved drive (1 mile?)…
Sacred: Back to nature woow it really beautiful place I see. Interested temple and surrounding. Lov it so much
Kuta: Nice swimming but the water was a little dirty and the beach was filthy - lots of rubbish along waterline <U+2639><U+FE0F> Sunset across the water was spectacular !
Mount: If you are nature lover and love to see natural beauty from the peak of the mountain surrounded by clouds has unbelievable view. But for that you have to trek so hard if you are weak at there than it cant be in your list.
Aling: If you visit the nearest temple Pura Ulun Danu Batur, you must definitely visit aling aling waterfall, one of the most amazing experience! It has a fee of 125k but include, the entrance, local guide and water! The tour begin with a 10min walk to reach the first waterfall 5m. (3…
Grandmas: Breakfast was decently over my expectations as not only was I offered the buffet breakfast, but also get to choose from the menu! Very aesthetic presentation of the food, and the nasi goreng was delicious. Service from the staff was wonderful, they were polite, patient to answer all enquiries, and very sincere. The room is rather small, but it doesnt matter as the bed is soft and comfy. There were many TV channels to watch as well, wifi was very fast. Facilities were all clean and of pleasing standards. Room service was very clean and thorough as well, and I would like to commend Maria for a wonderful job with tidying our room, even leaving a pleasant surprise for us haha! Grandmas plus Legian is located nearer to Garlic lane shopping street. We didn't really enjoy the shopping…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: What a stunning resort. So new and spotlessly clean. Food was delicious. Restaurants were lovely to dine in and the food was spot on. Staff were exceptional. Very smooth check in and check out. Prompt taxi requests. Pool area was beautiful. So big and spacious. Cocktails were divine. If you get the chance to stay here do it. I'll be back.

Besakih: Besakih Temple, rightly known as the Mother Temple, is one of the most important temples of Bali. It is revered heavily by the locals.  There is an entrance fee of Rp. 60000 per person which includes the rental of a Sarong. As in most of the Balinese temples, entry to the core…
Sacred: I would say its the best place in bali I had fun there The monkeys are funny very funny 10/10 you would enjoy
Kuta: Not the best beach in the world by any means but a nice place to relax and unwind.  We saw lots of surfers in the ocean and they looked to be enjoying themselves
Mount: Bucket list experience decided that day I would fly to Bali, booked flight organized driver and tour guide 3am at base of mountain climbing.
Aling: Once we made it clear that we weren't interested in a guide or jumping in, we were offered entry of 10,000 each. We were told to get back on the scooter and drive a little way up the hill. The nice man charged us 2000 more to park the scooter. Once down at the waterfalls there…
Grandmas: Excellent location and only a short walk to Legian beach. Staffs were great and acceded to my requests whenever possible. Everything was splendid! Great value for money and will definitely stay again. :)
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: A friend and I stayed here for 5 days after a yoga retreat in the jungle and it was really a lovely hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff, very clean, beautiful pool and the breakfast was delicious!  I would definately recommend this hotel.

Besakih: Arrived at the temple complex at 10:30 am on a Wednesday morning.  Experienced no issues/hassles with any pushy tour guides (fake or otherwise).  I spent almost two hours at the complex (there are actually MANY temples, and I explored a couple up the road in the nearby Besakih…
Sacred: Great place to visit - lovely to see the monkeys being so well looked after - easy to get to - takes about 1 hour to wizz around.
Kuta: Well beach was very dirty!  we were approached every minute to buy etc but stayed polite. Approached by a lady to have a lemonade and seat seemed harmless ( 3 of us) felt bad so said why not. She started cleaning sand off our feet called 2 other ladies to do my husband &…
Mount: Me and 3 other women from my yoga and meditation programme in Lovina got picked up at 1am and our driver took us to the base to meet our guides. Our two guides were amazing, very calm, attentive and both held my hand up and down the mountain. It was a pretty hard climb,…
Aling: Aling Aling is so underrated! I found out about this place looking into other reviews and I'm so glad we came here, our tour guide who came with us hadn't even been here! Aling Aling did feel like a pretty long drive, but I think it's worth it. There are several different…
Grandmas: Nice place, well appointed room, very comfortable, friendly staff, airport shuttle pickup went fine, good pre-arrival communication.  Would stay here again.  Plenty of restaurants, etc. nearby.  Only downside was that nearby traffic was audible sometimes in my room #319.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Nestled into the side of a clifftop, the Radisson Blu aim to deliver excellence in hospitality service & achieve in spades. From the aesthetics to catering to every whim, there is something for everyone.

Besakih: I was disheartened when I read some reviews about this place before. Some of the reviewers commented that although the temple is beautiful and pretty much essential for the Balinese in their daily lives, especially the spiritual one, one could think twice to go there knowing he…
Sacred: The park is nice, lots of monkey which will steal your stuff of you do not pay attention. Some can be aggresive if you try to touch them or if you look straight into their eyes. I wanted to take a picture, sitting near one and probably I have looked into her eyes, as she grabed…
Kuta: A good place to relax. Superb sunset. Good service by the ladies doing your hair, nails and massage. Awesome
Mount: My friend was visiting me from Australia and since we were staying in ubud and had both heard the trek was great we decided to go last minute.   I had my motorbike so we figured we would just head up there for 4am. I had heard that you HAVE to hire a local guide at the bottom so…
Aling: This waterfall is amazing - it's like a natural water park with the natural waterfall slide (and a smaller one too) and jumps into the waterfall pools. We paid 125 for entry & a guide. It's so worth having the guide. They say you have to if you want to go swimming. Gede was our…
Grandmas: Absolutely loved staying at this spot! Booked for two nights and ended up staying for four. The location was great (central and not far from the beach), the room was perfect with shower pressure to die for & the breakfast buffet was PHENOMENAL.  The staff were what made it for me! Particularly being a solo traveller, it was so lovely to be welcomed with a smile. Shout out to Yoshi, Lermana, Sanjaya & Darmawan who went above and beyond to make Grandmas feel like home, the nicest guys ever with such kind hearts. Appreciate you <U+2764><U+FE0F>
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We ended our trip here for 2 nights after spending 8 nights in other parts of Bali (Nusa Lembongan and Keremas).  The hotel is relatively new and the rooms very well designed. The staff are wonderful and very well trained. The free sunrise yoga is great. Free shuttles run to Padang-Padang and Uluwatu.  The breakfast buffet was really good. The food at the pool was good too - great woodfired pizza and salads. Plenty of sun beds surrounding the huge pool.  The location is fairly remote and you need to use Taxis to go anywhere or hire a scooter. There are some surf shops and a restaurant/bar about 10 minute walk up the driveway. Impossibles surf beach is a 10minute walk away down a very steep path and from there you can walk over the rocks to Bingin at low tide.  The spa was lovely…

Besakih: The Temple so nice there have so many kind different Temple,and from besakih temple you can see mount agung so wonderful view!
Sacred: Great place to take pictures. If you are alert and follow the rules... you will be fine and having a great time.
Kuta: I found this beach to be the best beach to pull up and have a bintang while you're watching the sun go down.
Mount: Anyone  out there  keen to summit mt batur with me. Without  a guide?? Wanting to go but not into the usual tourist group thing. I'm in ubud at present.
Aling: This was our experience at Aling Aling Falls and the people we have met. I have researched and read most reviews prior to hauling the whole family there. My primary concern was the safety of everyone especially so when there are kids with us. We were accompanied by our driver…
Grandmas: Room is modest but everything what you need is there, comfortable and perfectly cleaned every day by Maria! Great breakfast for what it costs. A bit noisy in the evening, but after one day got used to that
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Bali has always been one of my favorite vacation destination. My husband and I always visit Bali 2-3x a year; whether it is for a short getaway, wedding, or golf event. We have stayed in so many hotels and we can say that Radisson Blu is in the top 3 of our most favorite hotels in Bali. First of all, we love the location. The hotel is situated on top of a hill, overlooking the ocean. It is not as crowded as Seminyak and Nusa Dua but there are still a lot of things to do in the area. Lots of good restaurants on the main street and beautiful beaches within 10-15 minutes driving. The hotel itself is fairly new and well-maintained. We love the modern and open-air lobby and we can’t get enough of the pool. There are plenty of lounge chairs and cabanas and lots of trees to give some…

Besakih: Hands down better than any other temples,  this mother temple is magnificent.  The new system is they charge a bit more but includes sarong and tour guide, local one, so your tour guide can’t come in with you,   Impressive.
Sacred: As long as they are fed,  and you follow rules...the forest is worth it alone.  Cool and graceful.  Overgrown roots,  mossy strobe,  chuckling river.
Kuta: Kuta beach by Beach Mall. Very busy beach . Advise to go off season if you can. Beach mall is a great place for food
Mount: Yes it is a spectacular view if you can get to see it with all the aggressive sellers/hawkers up there. It cost to get there, then it cost to go up the volcano and it just keeps on costing.  If you are on a budget be careful.  The drive around the volcano and lake was well worth…
Aling: Had an amazing time with my guide jumping from cliffs ranging from 5 meters to 15 meters and ofcourse the Aling Aling waterslide of 12meters.  The surroundings are pure nature and the adrenaline rush you get from jumping is great!   A must do if you're in Bali
Grandmas: Very nice stay in this place, rooms are cosy and neat. The staff is very helpful and make you feel special (welcome drink). Rooms have air con, television, mini fridge, safe and everything we need. They offer breakfast for 60 000, their salty options are way better than the sweets one. They also try to control their impact on environment and it is much appreciated!
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: This place is unreal! The rooms are amazing the pool is stunning the staff can't do enough for you! It's just brilliant! Highly recommend to everyone really enjoyed my stay here will definitely come back <U+0001F60A>

Besakih: Beautiful place and glad I visited but all they care about is money and for me that ruined the experience, the Balinese people believe in karma and the way they handle such a place will bring nothing but bad karma.  It's expensive (not really but in comparison to other places)…
Sacred: Look, I love this place. It’s forest, there’s a temple and lots of sculptures, but how many stupid tourists did I see touching baby monkeys then getting more than they bargained for? LOTS! There are signs everywhere saying don’t touch the young monkeys, watch your belongings…
Kuta: Full of hawkers and the beach is actually very dirty. Wouldn't recommend visiting this particular beach. Try padam padam instead. (they do charge and entrance fee for padam padam beach)
Mount: 1.  Introduction Mt. Batur is an active volcano located near Lake Batur, about a two hour drive north of Kuta.  It is a very popular climb due to the magnificent sunrise views from its three summits (Congratulations Point, Western Summit, Main Summit 5,630 ft.).  2.  Trailhead…
Aling: Its public land which understandably local communities want to make a little profit from. 10k IDR entry is fair price. But for local guide we tried negotiating a price for our 6pax budget traveling young people group and they would not change their 125k overpriced IDR pp price.…
Grandmas: That is what Ana said and it’s true. Rooms are small and there is an open closet above the desk. However, the place is clean, beds are comfy with firm and soft pillows, breakfast is great. All staff called me by name. The restaurant manager - Saputra- came every morning to my table to chat and make sure everything was ok. In addition to the buffet there is a choice of main course. The reception staff are super friendly and helpful and every day ask if everything is ok. Meika arranged my tours and a driver, Ana showed me how to repare the canang Sari and pray.
