When I arrived since they did not send the driver they gave me a voucher for a one hour massage at Rehat spa. The manager Yoga , the manager gave me complimentary transfer to the airport and thanked me for my feedback about…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The Radisson Blu Uluwatu is a true gem. It is a rather new hotel on the Uluwatu peninsula, which is a beautiful and not so crowded part of Bali (relative to the Seminyak or Ubud areas). The hotel is close to a laid back surfer village with nice stores, restaurants and bars. The hotel offers a free shuttle to different beaches close by as well as to the Uluwatu Temple (schedule available at reception).   Upon arrival we were assigned to room 615, the room itself was beautiful (as all rooms in the hotel), but lacked a view. We asked reception whether they could relocate us to a room with a nicer view, which they kindly agreed to: we were assigned room 727 (in a different building and higher up, which has a fantastic view).  The rooms itself are very spacious, have very comfortable…

Besakih: The backdrop of Mt. Agung makes it a beautiful place to go to. There are a large number of temples in this complex. With temples which are over 1000 overs old, you get a sense of awe.   There are a few downsides though, 1. they dont let you enter the temple complex if you are a…
Sacred: Great experience, monkeys are free to go where ever they like. Well looked after and fed by the locals every morning. Keep everything in a bag zipped up and close to you, because the cute monkeys will take it. They love water bottles <U+0001F602>
Kuta: Very crowded beach, not so clean either. Shacks on this beach do not offer much for vegetarians. If u like calm and quiet beaches to enjoy, Double Six beach is a great option nearby.
Mount: I climbed Mount Batur today from 9:30 am with my boyfriend and a guide. The guide costed 350k rupies each after negotiation, it was recommemded by our driver. I would not recommend to climb the volcano because you are obliged to climb with a guide that you have to pay a lot and…
Aling: Wow, this place is awesome, you can go from a natural waterfall slide thats around 10m high, jump from a 5m cliff a 10m waterfall and even a 16m waterfall... Felt like a hidden playground in the jungle! Awesome guides too!   Had a blast!
Grandmas: I love this hotel and have been here many times. I give It a 10 out of 10.   It is close to shops and restaurants.   It is clean.  Crisp white sheets and towels. The staff are amazing ...so friendly and kind .   I would like to thank the staff at the front desk for being such beautiful people and making me feel so welcome.   Thank you Anna, Hendy.Julia, Dicky, Melka, Aging, Faisal ,Yuri, Manik, Yoshi, Mirah.  Thank you to the cleaning staff who kept my room and bathroom spotless Arya, Ardana, and Budiata.  For the yummy breakfast and service in the dining room Hq, Deai, Kamang, Famang,Widhi, Suparma,Def Uni, Devi, Teja, Emi, Saputra, Yudiari.  Thank you to Aging and the rest if the security guards who always made sure I crossed the road safely and I was always greeted with a…

I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: The most beautiful place in the world. The hotel was exceptional, staff brilliant and food awesome. The cocktails were delicious and the bintang beers extra cold. The pool was well located and warn. Really beautiful hotel

Besakih: It's nice to visit this temple complex with a guide he can explane the who's and why's. You besure that your clothing is a propriet: trouses with long legs alsof for the ladies or you have to ware a sarong.
Sacred: The monkey forest is a MUST SEE in Bali! The park is a really cool place to visit with so many monkeys walking all throughout the park.  Its centrally located with several shops and restaurants around too!
Kuta: I was staying right opposite to this beach for 3 days and the beach looks very busy all through the day but it's neatly maintained.. there will be a garbage truck which stands in the beach every morning which collects waste from the beach and on the beach.. a group of workers…

Aling: Nice waterfall with fresh water. There are also local guides who can take you around this waterfall. Average the waterfall is good may only need to be careful to access the center of the waterfall.
Grandmas: Breakfast awesome Good clean room  Very friendly staff  Exzellent place near from the Beach  I will come Back @ this hotel;-) Shops and Cafes and Restaurants and Clubs near the hotel.my daughter missed only a swimmingpool.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Had a fantastic stay! Rooms are spacious, ours was on the ground level which had a pool view and a lovely terrace with deck chairs to chill out. The pool is incredible, massive and well designed with plenty of trees for shade, numerous deck chairs, day beds and cabanas and easy access to the bar for drinks or snacks.   Special mention to the incredible breakfast buffet with an eggs station, fresh tropical fruits, amazing pastries, a large hot food selection and even a donut wall. The 2 restaurants are not bad, but the pizzas are pretty average.  All the staff from reception to the waiters to the grounds staff are friendly and always smiling, the hotel is immaculately clean and room/turn down service with a chocolate on the pillow each night.   There's a free shuttle service to…

Besakih: Definitely a place worth to visit because it's a more than 1000 years old. Fascinating views and buildings and everything covered in mystery. However beware that a one way transportation and a guide is included in the price of the  ticket because they still Try to convince you…
Sacred: It was neat to see all of the monkeys interacting in a natural environment as opposed to something like a zoo.   We had a guide with us; he gave a great background on behavior, history, and warnings.   The monkeys, much like all the roaming Balinese dogs, are free to be…
Kuta: You can maximize sunlight in Kuta Beach. The most famous beach in Bali, as if you haven't in Bali if you're not visit this beach. Laying in lazy chair for IDR 50.000,- enjoying drinking coconut from it's shell. And surfing for sure
Mount: We took a day trip up to Mount Batur to catch the sunrise. Unfortunately it was too foggy... and a freezing 15-17 deg C!! Something I never expected!  Nevertheless it wasn’t a trip wasted. We explored Penulisan Temple - saw some carvings from 300 BC there too!!    If you want…
Aling: The Aling-Aling waterfall is worth a trip, even though it already lost some of its magic due to the many tourists going there. Currently they are trying to build some new big sightseeing spot directly and therefore destroyed a lot of nature at the waterfall. However worth going.…
Grandmas: Thank you Saputra, Ana, Hendy, Yudi, Ita, Widhi, Komang and the team, thank you for your hospitality, Thank you for the amazing birthday surprise, I will return to stay at Grandmas. God bless you all.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We spent 3 weeks in various parts of Bali and chose Radisson Blu for final destination. What a great decision and a great place to end a most memorable holiday! Hugh thanks to every single employee! Big thanks to everyone!

Besakih: I read a lot of negative reviews and was in two minds about visiting Besakih as there is no shortage of temples in Bali. However I did visit this temple and I thought it was the most beautiful and majestic one of all so I would definitely say it is worth visiting for that reason…
Sacred: This is a s park-like sanctuary where macaque monkeys roam freely. They are also free to leave the sanctuary, and you will see them on the power lines down the street. There is about a $8 USD sanctuary entrance fee. If a monkey sees you have something and wants it, they will…
Kuta: A very clean beach with everyone doing their part to keep it this way. In the 3 days there, I saw all the market owners and locals raking the sand to collect rubbish dropped by the tourists.   You can sit on the beach with beers sold by the locals, very cheap, and even go…
Mount: Batur is miracle of nature. We decided to go there for the sunset and go back after it is dark. This was great decision as we were only three people up there. Batur was mysterious, misty and seemed dangerous. It also offered great views, steam coming out from ground and deep…
Aling: Better you have a guide here! They have some price list.  Guide, totally welcome, helpful, funny, everything is good! And I got a super guide who can took a picture really good!  Don't forget to bring your gopro! <U+270C><U+0001F3FB>
Grandmas: Very affordable price... Excellent hospitality...very near with Kuta... excellent service by staff especially cafe team and receptionist... Clean room... Will repeat stay to this hotel... Food very very delish and they provide so many choices of foods...

Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: This hotel is amazing from food, service and hospitality to facilities and staff. Stayed 4 nights on my own and had a great time, quiet and relaxing. Rooms are spacious and very clean and the restaurants serve great quality food for good prices. The pool was fantastic with lots of lounges and cabanas for use. Spa and gym is great to escape for some relaxation, would definitely recommend a massage, Unik was great! Staff are more than happy to accomodate you with anything you made need, including luggage storage use of facilities and a shower after check out if flying out late. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Besakih: I checked other reviews before our visit, and I have to tell we didn't see any problem here. Entrance fee is 60k, and it includes the guiding and the sarong as well. The people didn't want to sell us anything more forced than any other places in Bali. Temple is nice, worth to…
Sacred: Lovely settings but a bit nerv wrecking when the monkeys are getting a bit to close or visitors stir them up with their shouting and screaming. Abolutely a must while in Ubud but don't forget to follow the rules while in the forrest
Kuta: Love this place. Changes year after year. It's a shame they seem to be getting greedy. Great to see some places are going no plastic..
Mount: It’s was amazing like to be on the top of the mountain like that and see the volcano and having the best view ever and to see the origin village for the Balinese and the big lake was wow like something you need to do must to see that and have the best picture ever
Aling: It was a toss up between this waterfall and Gitgit. Having spoken to a few people we are confident we made the right choice choosing Aling Aling. Gitgit sounded a little too touristy and dull in comparison.  We paid an entrance fee of 125,000IDR (set price) per person for 2 to…
Grandmas: Thanks for the hospitality that I've got from here. Thank you Saputra and Team. Thanks for your help & cooperation Saputra. Thank you also to Sanjaya, Windu, and Ardana for the surprise of Towel Art. Its helps me to refresh myself while I'm entering the room after work. Loveable...<U+0001F60D><U+0001F60E><U+0001F44D>
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The situation of the brand new hotel on the cliff in Uluwatu between Bingin and Padang Padang beaches, far from the crowd, is excellent. A direct view on the ocean, however, is made impossible by trees and walls surrounding the premises. This is frustrating and mitigates the interest for a superior room said to offer ocean view.  Only a micro-boutique is available at the spa, which is practically useless. As the hotel is quite remote from the civilisation, availability of a small store and an automatic teller machine would be a big plus. The room and balcony were very nice as well as the services and restaurants. The big asset of the hotel is its fantastic swimming pool and the very large, well maintained area surrounding it.

Besakih: The mother temple is the most expensive temple in Bali (60k/person, not even toilet included) and not really impressive. All temples inside are closed for visitors so you are just walking around. Guides are really pushy and don't want to leave you alone. They just want to rip…
Sacred: I was staying nearby the monkey forest and decided to walk through the forest on my way to the central Ubud .  I arrived first thing in the morning and page and insert the monkey forest and 8:30 am. I followed all the instructions regarding safety and security inside the monkey…
Kuta: There are beautiful sunsets here. This wouldn't be my choice for relaxing on the beach. There is too much commercial business, hawkers, motorcycles, trash, concrete walls, restaurants, hotels...you get the idea. Not my kind of place
Mount: At first we thought, it should be a nice trekking tour to the Vulkane batur, but it wasn’t. When you decide to make the tour, you need a dust mask it was so dusty! More than 200 people’s goes the small path up to the mountain, so you stand, walk, stand, walk and also motor cross…
Aling: Beautiful hike! See several waterfalls, put on the lifejacket and ride down a 10 meter fall. Exhilarating! The guide was incredible carried and played with my son the whole time while ensuring he was safe. We hired a driver for the day amd payed to have a guide when we got…
Grandmas: We found the hotel to be very professional in everything they did and the staff were always helpful with everything within the hotel whether it was room cleanliness or running the breakfast in the dining room. Saputra the supervisor was especially helpful with any aspect of the hotel asking us daily if we were comfortable or could help us in any way to make our stay more enjoyable or if we had any problems that he could help with or just give feedback to him. Was a pleasure to stay at Grandmas Legian Bali for our wedding anniversary.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Your facilities where a great set up, the spa was so relaxing and super clean. As  as soon as we have arrived it was all fantastic. restful and a lot of fun. Thank you to the staff.  Edie & Allan  Melbourne - Australia

Besakih: We arrived the site with our rental motorbikes, then walked a little to the main site of temple. The site is wide open with nice panorama. We had a guide for the tour. He told us the historic beautiful stories. We also happened to see newly wed brides dressing traditional…
Sacred: We got a driver for the day out to ubud. Great trip out. The forest is surrounded by roads but the entrance and walk in is beautiful. Most accessible place I have seen in Bali for pushchairs or wheelchairs,  wear shoes that can get muck on them.  We didn’t take anything in as…
Kuta: Its one thing to ban plastic shopping  bags but what about all the other plastics and rubbish that ends up in the sea. The surf at Kuta is so thick with unspeakable plastic and fishing rubbish, you must push your way through it. Residents throughout Bali and elsewhere need to be…
Mount: Walking Batur for sunrise was the highlight of our holiday. The walk was enjoyable (despite the scrambler bikes everywhere) and the views were incredible. It’s cold up there so take a jacket (even if you’re Welsh) but really recommend this!
Aling: We took the entire family to the Aling-Aling Waterfall and had an amazing experience. We booked our trip through the hotel and glad we did, our driver and two guides were very helpful. I looked on TripAdvisor before hand to get as much information as I could because along with…
Grandmas: Kuta, well known with the crowded and busy place, but still want to visit and spend my day to see the Kuta Beach. But when I arrived at this Hotel, I feel like a quiet and fresh place in the middle of the city. I still can enjoy the greenery of the hanging plan (idk what it's called ) but looks amazing.  Another thing, when I arrived, Yoshi the bellboy gave me his warm smile and just helped me to carry my luggage even it's not too heavy. It's so nice.. and in thr morning during breakfast, Anna the GRO always doing courtesy about my stay, and she's so kind, to all the guests. The breakfast so delicious, many options. And the last, for Hendy, my favorite FO Supervisor (coz there is only one they said) He was so kind, and helped me to arrange my activities during stay. All the…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed for 5 nights at the new Radisson blu at Uluwatu. Great location at this 18 month old resort, courtesy of luxury escapes. We had breakfast and 2 evening meals,as   well as a nightly cocktail and 2 massages for the good lady wife.  We upgraded to the corner balcony suite, which offered sunset and ocean views. The room was nice and the balcony very good, although the ocean views were poor and we were on the wrong wing for a full sunset. Breakfast was your typical buffet, but plentiful and fresh. The 2 dinners were good, but there is no free water and had to buy water which was more expensive than beer. There is a plentiful supply of water to your room however. The swimming pool is huge, and the hotel provides a shuttle service to the padang padang surf beach, and to the…

Besakih: We read a lot of negative reviews. However we still wanted to give it a try. It was a great experience and we didnt feel cheated at all. For 60k IDR / person, it already covered entrance fee, sarong rental and local guide. People weren’t pushy in selling things and we had a…
Sacred: Place worth to visit for everyone, from kids to adults. Big forest with a lots of funny creatures. Hide your sunglasses, water, jewelry in your bag or don't wear it at all, as monkeys might still it from you. Keep your bag closed and by your side.  Overall we enjoyed watching…
Kuta: If you are a surfer, even a beginner, this is a good place. Swimming possibilities are limited (at least if you want to do it according the rules). It is instructed to swim only between red/yellow marked flags. Pitty was that over a length of the whole beach there was only 1…
Mount: Had the complete sunrise trekking tour in mid-August 2019 with my family. This is hell on Earth, or something that closely resembles it.... No need to describe what the tour is about, because this is widely dealt with in any travel guide, and there are countless feeds on…
Aling: I have seen pictures of other waterfalls that maybe are more beautiful, however, the adventure that Aling-Aling offers is wonderful.  First of all, we had hired a local driver for a tour of the area and we only paid 150,000 rupiah to have a guide for the entire time.  Our guide…
Grandmas: We were styed in Grandmas Legian for two days and we were really enjoyed. The staff very friendly and always courtesy about our stay. Yoga the hotel manager was great, he always make sure that our stay and the others guest nothing problem. The room cleaner Sanjaya also good, he putted quotation card with animal towel decoration on our bed. Mirah in front desk also did her job with great service, she always smile and very helpfull. Hotel location was in center of heart Legian, so easy for us to find shops and restaurants. Thank you Grandmas Legian.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Beautiful resort, quiet and very relaxing. We spent a total of 3 nights at Radisson Blu.   The massive pool was a nice temperature with plenty of day beds and lounge chairs situated around. Good waiter service around the pool. Happy hour is from 4pm till 6pm. There are games available for use by the pool like jenga etc.   Our room - we stayed in a deluxe room. Room was spacious with large bathroom with a separate bath and shower. Comfortable king sized bed. Room has all the amenities you need like beach bag, slippers etc.   Good buffet breakfast with lots of cuisines available to cater for all. There are 2 restaurants onsite artichoke and Filini (Italian). Filini was the stand out for us.   The hotel staff always go above and beyond to make your stay very welcome. Resort is…

Besakih: We visited Besakih Temple during a day trip with Eco Bali Tours. The temples and grounds themselves were beautiful and very well maintained over the years, however we were taken aback by the pushy tour guides.  Our driver for the day said that we did not have to pay any entry…
Sacred: We were picked up at the hotel and our first stop was the Sacred Monkey Forest in Ubud. Of course there are many monkeys, but as well a lot of nice spots to take photos. Even though it is a park where you have to pay an entrance fee, it is pure nature and you feel like you are…
Kuta: Ideal for learners. Pay for an instructor for an hour, it makes a difference. Watch out for all the ladies who never leave you alone wanting to give you a massage, etc. Recommend Mochtar near the turtle release by the red flag. My son enjoyed the experience and i got all my…
Mount: we were really looking forward to this hike, as we love spending time in nature and we frequently do sunrise hikes back home, too. so we thought okay, why not in bali? might be a bit crowded, but we are only here once so lets do this. well, we should have thought twice and read…
Aling: There r 4 waterfalls at this place. If you go there early u can jump without paying 250k. The aling aling is 4m deep. There is an other one where u can jump that is 10m deep. Fantastic. Tell them u dont need a guide. Entrence fee is 10k IDR (less than $1)
Grandmas: Hotel very near to anything... Easy to go Kuta or Seminyak or beach.. The staff very friendly The breakfast very nice and delicious... I love yogurt oat and fruit.. Staff service very friendly (saputra) very nice attend and ask about food... The hotel have  free service go to airport (time table)  Very easy to get transport in here My first time at bali... I love bali
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! Radisson: The hotel room is bigger than average. Really enjoy the pool, gym, yoga and pilates classes, good food, friendly and helpful staff. The only thing that I wish the hotel management would improve is the bed. Way to soft for someone with back pain.

Besakih: The entrance fee is IDR60k/person, including 1 tourguide and 1 way of fetching you to the temple by motorbike.  It is a very large area with a clear view of the mountain. It takes us 1 hour to visit this place.  After the tour, the tourguide will ask you for the tips. So it is…
Sacred: Fun day out with friends - totally recommend for families. Don’t be afraid, they will only come to you if you are poking for it.. otherwise they mind their own business.  The Monkey Forest is a walk, you can probably finish it in about 2.5 hours depends on how busy and how long…
Kuta: Understand that they are just making a living but it just too much of persistent hassle. The beach is dirty and cant swim, too many ppl trying to learn how to surf. Dangerous to swim. In fact, they put red flags asking ppl dont swim there.
Mount: The whole experience of Mount Batur was brilliant! We received a surprise banana pancake at base camp and then had a follow up breakfast up the top of the mountain- which we did know about.    The climb itself is quite tough, we do a lot of walking and scaled Ben Nevis a few…
Aling: Aling aling waterfall itself is nice but other waterfalls in Bali can compete with it. However the best part is a little more down with a natural slide. A bit stressful in the beginning but so much fun. I did it with and without life jacket. It is very safe as far as I can say.…
Grandmas: It's a walk away from Kuta beach, also to Legian night clubs, so fun is everywhere. Hotel staffs also helpful. They even can help with transportation, from renting motorcycle to car. Room is notbig but bed is so comfy
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Clean and spacious rooms, excellent food and friendly and efficient staff made our holiday in Bali was memorable.  The luxury escapes deal was an added bonus. Extremely good value    We enjoyed the massage too.  Only thing missing is beach access.

Besakih: We visited the temple around 4 or 5 pm, we paid the entrance fees of 60k idr then we rode scooters behind some guys to reach the mother temple. There will be people trying to sell you some offerings for 10k I think, if you're not covered till the knees you should rent a sarong.…
Sacred: This is a really beautiful place with loads of great photo and video opportunities.  Between watching the Macaque monkeys and traversing the many beautiful trails, we had a lovely time.  Because it's such a jungle and there's a lot of flowing water, it was a cooling environment…
Kuta: Great for people watching and surfing. Lots going on all the time, lots of touters trying to sell you stuff.  Good sunset too!
Mount: Mount Batur is an active volcano in Kintamani District, Bangli Regency, Bali, Indonesia. Wikipedia. please take care of your cleanliness when climbing, do not litter, do not speak harshly, think dirty, and behave badly. for women do not climb during menstruation.
Aling: Aling-aling waterfalls is one good waterfalls in bali, the located buleleng regency. you can jumping and swimm in the river.
Grandmas: I had a one month stay here, just amazing!! Staffs are friendly, rooms are clean. The cheapest hotel around the area. Near to shops and restaurants and almost anything you can find in walking distance. Definitely coming back!!!

Radisson: The perfect spot for a relaxing holiday. Rooms were spacious and new. The pool is one of the best I've been to with endless lounge options for those that want sun and those that prefer shade. The buffet breakfast selection was impressive. All hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a pleasant stay.

Besakih: This temple is the most expensive temple in Bali (60k/person, not even toilet included) and not worth it at all. All temples inside are closed for visitors so you are just walking around. Guides are really pushy and don't want to leave you alone. Stuff is unpleasant and not…
Sacred: This is more like a nice park with some abandoned/closed temples and monkeys mostly keeping to themselves.   The place is an easy 20 minute walk from the ubud palace on a road lined with shops and eateries.  Go when the weather is good.
Kuta: The beach is well maintained. God for surfer's , even for beginners. They offer primary training to new surfers.  Water is warm and clean. A lot of westerns swim freely wearing bikini.
Mount: We had booked our trip online with Bali Volcano Trekking and felt this was a great trip.  It had started raining heavily where we were staying and the driver was nearly an hour  late in picking us up.  The tour operator offered a refund or rescheduling if we wanted due to the…
Aling: Its abt 3.5hrs drive frm Kuta and if u have motion sickness, i suggest u take e pill but its def worth it.  Took e package wit e least amt of trekking but it ended up quite tiring too. I tink its abt IDR125000 per pax and it comes wit guide. As there abt 8 of us, there were 4…
Grandmas: I have been staying in this hotel since its opened because of the strategic location. However, other additional tumbs up for the bed and the pillows which are really comfortable, the room is clean & smells nice, the shower got the perfect pressure, the hotel staffs are amazingly friendly and helpful..not mentioning it's considered as so much affordable price. Bli Saputra, personally, I would like to say thank you for whom assist me & a friend kindly when we would like to go to travel and when I left the handphone charger at the hotel, he's willing to ship it to Jakarta at the same day. Really appreciate it.  Maria, thank you for taking care of our room and keep it neat.  Ibu Komang in Rehat whom I heard one of the best therapist in town.. Always full booked, but definetely one…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Amazing hotel with the kindest, most attentive staff! We stayed for 2 nights and were very impressed. The pool area is not overly crowded and very peaceful. The room was perfect and a great oasis. We loved the staff- they were all so kind and helpful. We had a great stay!

Besakih: This is a real tourist trap!!! After a long drive, I was very annoyed to find out that after you pay an entry fee you are then forced to pay approx $15 AUD to have a local guide take you in. You are not allowed to enter without a guide and wearing a wrap...even though I was…
Sacred: My husband and I really enjoyed thew Sacred Monkey Forest. The monkeys were amazing to watch. We saw them in all sorts of activities including eating, sleeping, climbing. We especially enjoyed one monkey cradling a cuddling a baby as it slept and a mischievous monkey who managed…
Kuta: This place is the busier section of the beach stretch Kuta- Legian, as most reviewers stated.  Along the beach, surfers, hawkers, lounge chairs.  Still an ideal place to watch the sun set, watch the rolling waters come in bringing surfers in.   Take a break and walk along the…
Mount: I didn’t go sunrise trekking that’s why it’s just average for me. I stayed in accomodation just across toya devasya. Cheaper option for accomodation with hot spring. Its only 350k per night. Walk 2 minutes across the accomodation you’ll see Batur Lake, they also have a tent…
Aling: The waterfalls are locates near to Lovina in the north but you need a car, to drive there. During driving we saw a lot of rice fields and charming local villages.  It is good to have a local guide, on my own I couldn't have found the attractions because the way is not marked.…
Grandmas: It was the best hotel , that i was reside, the staff very frindly , and kindly , all of them were polite, and comfortable room , yummy break fast , i want say thank you to all of them <U+2764><U+FE0F>Specially maria and saputra

Radisson: nice place to stay if you want to relax, artichoke restaurant for lunch taste is good but too expensive and restaurant consider Caesar salad as main course. The spa is very good. The staff name Budi, she is very good. The hotel is not on the beach. The pool is good.

Besakih: We went here as a part of our Ubud-Kintamani tour. Our tour guide warned us about the hawker local guide included in the ticket price and told us not to get one. However after getting the sarong one local tried to come with us and with the greatest difficulty we said no to him,…
Sacred: You'll see monkeys at play, gathering as families, and generally getting on with their lives, in a natural, beautiful habitat.  Abide by the rules, I didn't on my previous visit and got a bite on the backside, but this time was stress free.   There are plenty of officials…
Kuta: Well People when changing money only go to places like supermarkets or banks which offer the lower rate Eg Changing AUS Dollar is 9400 a number of street and small booths over 9800 to 10000. Sadly many of these are not authorised and they are quite magical in how they can Rip…
Mount: The view of Mount Batur rising from the Batur lake makes you feels as  you are in a postcard world. One can trek to see the lower crater (not to the highest point). It will be cold up there so better get some warm clothes.The sunrise was just awesome.
Aling: Exploring the waterfalls was so much fun! They were beautiful and it was fun to get to swim and be in nature like that. The slides were fun, the jumps were crazy but also fun, I'm just feeling it today from that 15 meter jump, ouch, I need to work on my form! Overall a great…
Grandmas: I truly felt I was home. It felt like in a family: their kind staff and details makes Grandmas one of the best hotels in Bali. They make the difference. I am sure I’ll repeat!   Thank you very much, it was a real pleasure!

Radisson: There was a lot to like about this resort Overall we found our package incredible with the spa massages and included food Loved Fellini  Breakfast was ok nothing special The pool was beautiful However the staff must instigate a policy where they monitor people leaving towels reserving chairs for long periods We had an issue with the noise level coming from other rooms which we as avid travellers have never experienced  The resort is remote and getting taxis is difficult however we don’t mind walking and as such it doesn’t bother us The gym was user friendly  Special thanks to agung, yoga , adi and Nando

Besakih: This place is a joke. You will be extorted for money the second you walk in. After you buy tickets and are pretty much forced to use a guide you have to walk through endless people aggressively trying to sell you things. They do not give up and will resort to shoving things in…
Sacred: Well worth the visit. Its a magical forest area with really entertaining monkeys to keep you company.
Kuta: God Beach but alot of people. Got good bike parking. Good place for jogging. Nice place to learn surfing. There are people will teach surfing but need to pay for it. Overall good
Mount: This excursion is offered by many tour operators and hundreds take it every day. The mountain is lovely and the views are breathtaking. But the excursion quality is very iffy and the way the unregulated mt Batur guides/tour operators behave like a mafia can make this a horrible…
Aling: If you are in the Singaraja area there is a complex of waterfalls which are worth a look at. I set off from Singaraja to look at the falls at Gitgit. Long before i reached it i saw a sign for waterfalls and forked right in the road to follow the instructions. Along the way were…
Grandmas: I had great stay from 18/4 till 24/4. Honestly the most relaxing holiday I had so far. A very clean and comfortable room. 5 min walk to the Kuta Beach and many restaurants, massage pallor, bar and shopping outlets nearby.Delicious breakfast buffet with various kind of food. And most importantly very friendly and helpful staff. Full smile that makes you warm and feel so welcome. The housekeeping staff is so great. Our room was very dirty as we was having many activity but it will always be top class clean when are back. Special saying to staff Saputra who is very helpful and friendly. And housekeeping staff Sanjay Windhu for your beautiful notes on my bed! Will definitely be back! Highly recommended.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: What a beautiful hotel. The rooms and facilities are absolutely stunning. The location in Uluwatu is great too. Far enough off the main road to be quiet but also close enough to walk or just a 2 min scooter ride to some great cafe's and shops. The massage in the spa treatment are was wonderful and very luxurious. A great pool with lovely surrounds. Both restaurants in the hotel were sensational. The only thing we were slightly disappointed in was the buffet breakfast. It was still very good but it just wasn't quite as good as we were expecting given how incredible everything else was in the hotel. Overall: Highly recommend

Besakih: We read all the reviews and thought maybe best to stay away.  But we were already in Ubud and may not get the chance again so we arranged our very reputable and knowledgeable local tour guide/driver to pick us up from our hotel at 7am.  Our driver took us in via the Eastern…
Sacred: It’s a great place to get close to The monkey true environment. Fully recommend. The monkeys are used to visitors so they are not violent with people. Also it’s full of guards in case of any attack.
Kuta: Kuta beach is always busy, from trinket vendors, hair braiding, surfing, massage girls/women to cold drinks/ice creams you can have it all on Kuta beach. Close to shopping centres, bars, all different food outlets, clothing, watch sellers and anything else you can think of its…
Mount: Out hotel Kamojang Jimbaran arranged this trip for us. We paid USD 50 for our trip (transport, guide, breakfast). We stayed in Jimbaran and we were picked up at 1am (the driver was almost half hour late). Only then were we told that we were picking up 4 other passengers before…
Aling: I planned to come here without local guide, but as im not a Balinese and I don't want to miss the best things here I decided to hire local guide. It's worth the money you spent on them as they will show you the do's and don'ts. they will provide life vest for waterfall sliding…
Grandmas: Everything here was great, staffs are approachable and kind <U+0001F44D><U+0001F3FD> Room is clean and comfortable. The foods are tasty. Specially dedicated to Sanjayh Windu who made a crab and left a sweet note for us after tidying up the room. Will definitely come back here for the stay if I ever come to Bali again.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: A clean and sharp lace to stay on the Buki.  My wife and I came to celebrate a anniversary and were very happy with the hotel and team running it. We had an amazing low tide walk from the easy accessible stairs leading to Impossibles beach all the way to Dreamland (New Kuta Beach) this was one of the highlights of our holiday...Don't try it on High Tide! As a keen surfer I found it to be excellent as Impossibles is close using the stairs down the cliff and also Bingin is only about another 10 minutes south. If you want to surf Ulu's and Padang Padang hire a bike with a rack as its only 5 to 10 minutes away. The food was of a very high standard and good value for money. I would go back no problems at all.

Besakih: The mother temple in Bali,all Hindu religion come to this temple for pray,not just local people but so lot of tourist also come here for the best destination in Bali,for all my friends come to Bali and visit to this temple for your remember on your life.
Sacred: I like this place:) so many monkey<U+0001F412>, beautiful forest, entry was 80.000 RP :) it was rainning,but we saw monkey-so dont eorry,if it is rainning<U+0001F4A7><U+0001F4A6>
Kuta: A beautiful picturesque beach with some of the world's best surf. There are many places to get surf lessons or just enjoy a cool Bintang on the beach.
Mount: Beautiful trip, we walk fast so 1,5 hour top, 1 hour back. Its cold on top so bring a jacket, some warm clothes, sunrise about 0630 AM , and it was jus amazing. The guide with small breakfast about 500 000 local currency.
Aling: When we went to started to our with rain being end of wet season, wow did it rain. I had a small umbrella but others just got totally soaked. Very steep steps to the waterfall, quite tricky for anyone especially older people or young children. You don't need a guide really, its…
Grandmas: Really good place for someone who is looking for balanced place between pri e and conditions. If you come for few weeks and don't expect extra ordinary standard is really perfect. Service is amazing! I was sometimes overwhelmed by kindness, delicacy, friendliness and descretion of crew. Meika on reception very kind always smiled.  Breakfast is hudge. Choices are good. Manager Saputra very attentive and professional. Been there for two weeks and definitely will come back whenever visit Bali.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Had the best holiday at Radison Blu Uluwatu Beautiful new hotel with nice large rooms, friendly staff , great restaurants and exceptional pool area.  We loved the open areas that wwere very large and lots of nice lounges to relax in. Food and drinks were very reasonably priced. Overall great value for money.

Besakih: Its amazing how the villagers organize the place now. So there is no chasing over tourist anymore. Instead they give an entrance ticket included with sarong, local guide and one way transport up to the main gate. Well done!
Sacred: The best place to meet monkeys. Also the forest is nice in hot weather because of the shadow. A lot of monkeys, they are not aggresive if you are not an idiot. We met group of russian young men which yelled at monkeys and behave like total idiots, really disappointing, poor…
Kuta: The beach itself was decent, but I couldnt imagine being here in their busy season as I thought it was already quite busy! The vendors can get a bit pushy - I get it, it's their livelihood; however, it does get a bit frustrating being asked the same thing over and over and over…
Mount: My husband and I went on this trek which was stated as slightly challenging but since we are ok in terms of fitness, we booked it. We were also going to the hot springs afterwards.  We booked it with GYG and when we got there it was pitch black and we were given torches. There…
Aling: Special note: “Aling-Aling Waterfall” is really the name of a waterfall that is actually part of a network of 7 falls.  There are certain falls you can slide off of and hike.  My review (sadly) only includes one waterfall that is rather small, but empties into a large pool.  I…
Grandmas: Nice hotel close to the beach. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful and well trained.  The room and the bathroom are small and simple, but clean. Good breakfast buffet and wonderful Italian restaurant downstairs.  Great value for money.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu located on the cliff. It's certainly makes your stay here got extra view and experience. Woke up in the morning, make sure to go at the back door to get down the cliff to see the Sun to rise. Makes sure got your water, gonna quite long stairs there. And seeing the virgin area of the Impossible beach and Bingin Beach. Making through back to the hotel, you will see the local people and the village. You will get the experience blending for a little bit, at the village while you walk. Then get the breakfast, was amazing. The foods no complain. The room amazing, 58 m2. The biggest I've ever slept. Even it's for the cheapest one. The view to the pool from the bedroom. Only, they use dry toilet. I am prefer use douche.

Besakih: Worth getting a guide if you don't have your own. Our guide was great, he told us a wealth of information and also went into parts of the temple and took photos with my camera where we were not allowed to go. There was a cremation ceremony at the time we were there, which was…
Sacred: Probably the best thing to do in Ubud. It's quite a large circuit so can take awhile. The monkeys are very cool. A little scary lol but very cool. You can just stand and watch a group for ages. Quite entertaining. Some parts are stinky and it's quite hot but that's to be…
Kuta: If anyone thinks this is a great beach needs to get their head read and see more if the world.  Let's be honest it is the water temp and thexweathervin general as to why people come to bali.  There is no conceivable way you can relax on this god forsaken piece of coastline.
Mount: A active volcano and chance for telling to same. Get up early and enjoy this opportunity of lifetime.
Aling: I really like to support local communities and their work. However, this location is just a rip off to get money from tourists. I went there with friends because we saw it on google and didn't expect much, just a waterfall to cool off. When we arrived, they stopped us at a…
Grandmas: Buffet breakfast is awesome. They have different menus everyday.its just a few minutes to go to Ground Zero you can even walk if u want to.ts a few minutes by taxi too to go to Kuta beach and experience Surfing. Staff  are friendly and amazing. I would really recommend this to my friends and to people out there.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: We came to spend a week here, and ended up staying here for our entire holiday - it's a superb hotel, well run, very helpful and accommodating staff, nothing is too much trouble.  The breakfast is excellent - such a wide variety of choice and cooking to demand as well.  Beautiful surroundings, and very spacious and comfortable rooms.  We will be back!

Besakih: Be prepared. It'll cost you 60,000pp to get in. Plus they'll try to scam another 100k off you with the excuse that 'there's a ceremony going on'...... well there's pretty much ALWAYS a ceremony going on at this place.   Lucky we brought sarongs you can't go in without one and…
Sacred: This was a very cool experience. We were told to hide anything the monkeys might want to grab and we kept the toddler in a baby backpack. No monkey’s bothered us or jumped on him. We did see them chase a boy and pull a few ladies skirts. I’d recommend not wearing a skirt if you…
Kuta: Kuta Beach the famous beach in Bali Indonesia. Kuta Beach : Visitors those comes to Bali is a must go place. Well organized beach for everything you need while you are there . Locals are very friendly & helpful . But yet you have to be cautious from touts. There is a strong wave…
Mount: The sunrise was fantastic over Lake Batur with Mount Agung in the background. It did feel like queuing up the mountain however as it really is that popular. Whilst guides are all extremely friendly and helpful and the path not too challenging it didn't quite feel like a 'trek'…
Aling: You won'tjust see one waterfall.but there other waterfalls afteraling aling. Dont miss it. Just ask peoole around or take a local guide for safer exploration
Grandmas: The hotels is good staffs are fantastic ,about 15 min to legian beach, i wonna come back there, rooms are nice and clean  well trained  and english speaking staff,cant forget a nice buffet  breakfast   ,healthy eating
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Our stay was amazing. Lovely employees and good food. We have really enjoy the breakfast, you can find all type of food. Unfortunately there is no beach directly to the hotel. We will come back soon. Thanks

Besakih: It's on the slopes of mount Agung , the largest temple in Bali . It's a Hindu temple .  Everyone visit here .
Sacred: An awesome spot to come and get up close to the local monkeys. They are very curious and will have no hesitation at getting up close to you. Even with the knowledge of trying to keep you property close so they can’t grab it they were able to still steal my water bottle.
Kuta: Kuta beach is a beach with a huge rock & blackish sand. A lot different than the other beaches & nice to watch the sunset. I liked the vast stretches of Seminyak beach with white sand much better.
Mount: Highly recommend. We climbed with 3 children one is a 5 years old.  We love everything about it. Such a wonderful view from the top and such a magical space to enjoy and share with family <U+2764><U+FE0F>
Aling: You can pay for a local guide and after you can enjoy swimming, jumping from the cliff, sliding.. There are more waterfalls near Aling-Aling. We didn't pay this extra fee so we coud only watch and take pictures, but we've enjoyed the area as well.
Grandmas: The Hotel is amazing, I will coming back here. The Location is great near the beach and 10-15 minutes from airport by taxi, the staff is really amazing and friendly especially miss Anggi ! The rooms are very clean and you got all you need! Thank you for everything
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: After 23 hours of traveling, not finding our driver at the airport and an crazy drive to the hotel, we needed something good and the Radisson Blu delivered.  Arrival was very welcoming and peaceful. The room was large with a nice balcony. Very clean and the bathroom was beautiful. Bed was comfortable. We pretty much showered and went straight to bed.  In the morning, we hiked down the stairs just off the property to Impossible Beach, which offered a gorgeous view as well as a nice morning workout.  The included breakfast was wonderful. An omelette station, lots of fresh fruits and pastries as well as local foods of fried rice and noodles. The pineapple juice was awesome.  We spent a little time by the beautiful pool, then sadly, had to pack up and leave. We wish we could have…

Besakih: Too many people trying tor make money of you but still worth a visit if you have interest in Hindu traditions and Bali culture. This is a very special temple in Bali. Even though I am not religious, we even performed a Hindu puja there just to have an experience!!  Our guide…
Sacred: I want to say in just 21 words about my first experience in Bali with Wayan , an excellent guide : Past, present, prosperity, Love, labour,landmarks, Temples, talent, traditions, History,harmony,heavenly, Sea, sunshine,sand, Feeling, flowers,fantastic Beautiful, Blessed Bali... …
Kuta: Peddlers galore. Every 5 minutes someone comes around and offers you something. Also, smokers here are inconsiderate.   Everyone seems to be smoking and they just throw the cigarette butts anywhere.   It's just a beach. Nothing fantastic. The beach is Seminyak is better,…
Mount: We were picked up at our hotel at 2 am by our private driver. We arrived at abt. 4 am at the foot of Mount Batur, where we were already expected by our private guide especially for the Mount Batur. The climb is quite heavy, certainly not for beginners. Not only up but descend is…
Aling: Despite the difficult access to the waterfall it is worth to visit. Here you can swim, jump, slide (all for extra fee), simply have fun!
Grandmas: Centrally located Walk to beach Cozy Small room Friendly staff Walk to beach No pool Has a good spa  Can arrange tour and transport Close to airport and kuta Has a computer for hotel guest in lobby  Many taxi around hotel 15 minutes from airport
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: I only stayed here for one night but enjoyed the experience very much! Don't recall seeing the spa listed on the website, but they *do* have one.   Very well maintained grounds and rooms.  The bathrooms are enormous. Reasonable prices at pan-asian on-site restaurant, and the free breakfast had a huge variety of foods, best breakfast I can remember seeing. Walkable to Uluwatu shops and beaches and temple (though not always a sidewalk). Definitely recommend checking this place out.   Luxurious but comfy and worth the money.

Besakih: Large and impressive at the foot of Mount Agung, especially if there is a ceremony going on.  Just amazing to see all the participants dressed in ceremony attire, sitting on the ground with their offerings.    Will only mention that the “guides” here are not trustworthy.  They…
Sacred: This is a fabulously well set-up area but despite being “off-season” here, the tourists flicking through (ovs including ourselves) way exceeded monkeys. Every photo opportunity has numerous people boggling for prime position.  Despite warnings and others experiences, there was…
Kuta: Despite the horror stories about the garbage, the beach was surprisingly relatively clean. But man, we went during low season and it was already crowded each day with tourists, and with it the cheap commercialism of which there seems no escape. Though this is an understandable…
Mount: We did not opt for trekking Mount Batur, but instead decided to get our driver to drive us up to Kintamani to watch the sunrise from there.  We started at 2:30 am. It took a good 2.5 hours to get there along a narrow winding road. We reached around 5 am. We waited until 5:45 am…
Aling: A stunning retreat from the heat. The trek out is not for the feint hearted. Multiple falls, great high jumps for the adrenaline junkie teen. I personally preferred the natural slide and swimming in the waterhole.  Highlight of my trip. Can not wait to return this year
Grandmas: Hi my readers,  After 1 year I havent post anything because of i almost even havent time to eat, now i want to review about Grandmas Plus Hotel Legian, Bali. You guys know that there are so many hotels in Bali. Last week, my friend and I chose Grandmas Plus Hotel Legian, Bali. What is our expectation is we only need to sleep. No need too good hotel. But after we check in.. oh woww.. we got King Bed. The hotel is very nice and comfortable. What we are impressed is the staffs there are so kind. At that time we are so thristy. The complimentary water are only 2 bottles, rite? But, we ask more and they give us more. This is the simple thing that touch our heart. Second, the Breakfast... Oh wowww.. we are firstly thinking that the breakfast is standart buffet breakfast as usual in…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: After a hectic drive to get here we got out the car to the WOW factor- absolutely beautiful! The staff couldn’t be nicer and they all spoke English well. Our huge room had the best view overlooking the spacious grounds, across the bay and straight out to Mt Agung. The pool area is well set up for lots of people to enjoy the area with having their own personal space. The 2 restaurants were impressive with Artivhoke a standout. The area around here is well suited for the surfy/hippie/healthy type of crowd. Love love love this place! Terima Kasih xx

Besakih: Thank you for  the chance  given to me for visit this temple. Very peacefull place. Place for hinduism people for praying. Very religious and thank you for the experince that i used the traditional custom.
Sacred: This is nice and many monkeys here. They are friendly to us. And the little monkeys so cute. This is a highly of Ubud.
Kuta: Jimmys bar in front of Bali Sea Turtle offers cold Bintang with great service. Be careful the boys have lots of humour and play tricks on unsuspecting guests who they know. We see them every year now 15 times and have watched them grow their business.
Mount: This is a huge tourist trap. We went on a tour as it seems to be impossible without one due to the mafia. The walk up was not too hard, it is a straight forward path. However a few generally unfit/smokers did struggle. The walk however was hugely ruined by the amount of people.…
Aling: I had such a Great Time , I Love adrenalin so Jumping off the cliff was amazing but my friend didn't jump but she went swimming anyway so its good for non Adrenalin Junkies too!!
Grandmas: Hotel staff are extremely friendly especially Ngurah - sorry if mispelt (security), he's always soo welcoming when you come back from a day of exploring always ask how your day was and greets you every morning and night. Sometimes you get these little ant bug things but staff are always happy to help get rid of them. Just don't leave unwrapped food or empty drink bottles or containers around.  Hotel is clean and the buffet breakfast is ok, that's the one thing I think can improve. Food taste amazing and staff are great. Just need more variety and maybe some western breakfast options in the buffet section. Most times…

Radisson: This hotel was amazing!  Literally ask the front desk for whatever you need and they can help.  The view was amazing, every room seems to have some sort of an ocean view.  The morning breakfast is something to look forward too.  Would recommend this resort to any and all!

Besakih: This temple complex consists of a number of small family temples as well as temples dedicated to the Trinity Indian gods. You can take a guide here or walk around the place by yourself. It offers a beautiful view overlooking the complx & serene greenery around. You can witness…

Kuta: The beach itself is nice, but you don't really get a chance to relax as you always got someone trying to sell u something.

Aling: Warning: these waterfalls do not have an easy access, like the more popular Gitgit and Tegenungan for example. Also no shops, restaurants or toilets anywhere - so this hike really is more for exercising, and less for flip-flopping to an attraction to take selfies. Wear good…
Grandmas: would like to share my experience in stay with Grand Mas legian which summarized in below   excellent location wonderful staff best service ( helpings,  advices , directions) great cleaning and house keeping- Odi Martin <U+0001F929><U+2698><U+0001F337> nice prices tasty food
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The hotel is quite new and well maintained. The rooms and bathroom were clean. The pool is large with plenty of seating. The buffet breakfast was exceptional with a large range of food and drink. The staff were very attentive. The check in and check out process was smooth and no issues with the airport transfers. Overall a great stay with no complaints. Also we stayed one of their most basic room but it did have a small beach view which was a nice surprise.

Besakih: This is a big temple in Bali. Wonderful environment. The ticket includes sarong and one way transfer. The guides will try to get money out of you, better to avoid them.
Sacred: I enjoyed the natural environment of being in the monkeys habitat even though the monkeys have a bad habit of being sneaky and naughty... I was fortunate to see a monitor lizard big one at least 1 meter long... Definitely recommend visiting the forest...
Kuta: Kuta beach is a city beach close to many hotels, bars and restaurants. Not a special beach but pleasant to take a few photos, take a walk and enjoy sunset. Not the beach I would choose to enjoy the day in Bali
Mount: The view from the top as the sun was rising was breathtaking, definitely worth the intensive climb to the top. You can see how the sun rises and shines over the ocean. Be advise to that is not an easy climb, could get very challenging to reach the top. The path gets very steep…

Whenever I come to Bali, I would stay in this hotel again  Richard

Rehat Spa in the hotel is great so you will get your money's worth.
