The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Have stayed here twice now and is a great place to stay and relax, if that's what you want to do on holiday. Beautiful pool, nice rooms. Typical buffet breakfast and restaurants are both good. Great gym!

Besakih: The Temple is quite nice, but the people ‘helping’ you are very annoying! The Temple is not that nice to forget about the people at the entry. We paid for parking, but we had to pay again to someone else, because we seemed to have parked on a private parking. No ticket of…
Sacred: Didn't need too long to look around but well worth stopping off at. Respect the monkeys and I think they will leave you alone, we were initially nervous about visiting but there were so many staff about we felt quite at ease. We followed the rules and there were no issues at…
Kuta: Didn’t think it was going to be so clean! Was great for boogie boarding and surfing. Was good temp. Great seats for sunset too!
Mount: Be prepared for an extremely early alarm call/no sleep if you want to witness the sunrise from the top of Mount Batur.  Depending on your tour operator and location, you are likely to be picked up from your accommodation at 2:30 am before being driven to the foot of the 1,700…
Aling: Aling aling waterfall the location is west bali, this have hight more than less 25 meter so verry nice please,have junggle nice view in buleleng village me so verry fun visited this please with my freand
Grandmas: If you plan to go to Legian area, this hotel is the best place to stay. You won't regret it :) Mr Ngurah and all the staff are so friendly and help us a lot. Thank you :) Definitely going to stay in this place again if we are coming back to Bali
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: The location is quite remote in Uluwatu. However they have shuttles and fairly cheap taxis to take you everywhere. If you are looking for a quiet family our couples hotel this is great. If you like to swim at the beach its difficult because of the rocks and the tide. However they have nice waves if you like surfing.

Besakih: It was foggy when we visited Besakih Temple. We could not see Mount Agung. It is the biggest and most important temple for the Balinese people. For us it was just another temple. Our teenage boys didn´t share our enthusiasm. If you are near visit, but Tanah Lot is more…
Sacred: The monkey’s are cute but quite vicious. Be very careful and they will warn you. We were out side the place and my wife had just purchased a dress that she was carrying in a bag. A monkey came over and took a swipe at the bah wth his sharp claws and tore the bottom of the bag…
Kuta: The beach is not the cleanest however we enjoyed walking the beach at low tide.  Enjoyed watching the surfers, newbies and pros.  We stayed away when it became busy with the locals trying to sell stuff. We stayed at the Sheraton kuta across the street from the beach so it was…
Mount: I looked at the clock and it was 11.30pm. I had my alarm set on my phone for 1.30am with our driver picking us up at 2.00am. We were setting off from our Hotel on the North East Coast of Bali to climb Mount Batur. The alarm went off and after what seemed like a very a brief…
Aling: nothing to say but perfect day-trip gateaway. yes, it's over 2 hrs drive from denpasar, but short-medium-long trek, 7 waterfalls, secluded natural pool will pay it off.
Grandmas: Having a comfort stay in GrandMas Legian for 2 nights during Nyepi period in Bali. We have a good and decent breakfast here. All of the staffs are friendly and full of attention. The manager on duty, Mr. Ngurah called us to ask whether we need any assistance and showing careness about our stay. We love it and really apreciate their attention. Keep up the great work!
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: This hotel is lovely, brand new and very smart but my goodness it is a bit clinical!   They have the opportunity to incorporate some stunning Bali influences throughout the hotel but there is nothing apart from one wooden candle stick in the bedroom! It is a blank canvas asking to be made more exciting, more individual and more Balinese but it looks like it has been designed and made for some European city.   Breakfast was great, the bedrooms very comfy.

Besakih: The temple is quite beautiful. We actually planned to go to Lempuyang Temple but mistaken it with Besakih. When we were there, we paid the entrance fee. When we entered the temple, someone trying to approach us and being our guide. We didn’t have any idea that we could go inside…
Sacred: The idea of the whole area is to preserve the animals and temples as well. Beautiful place and nice tour. The only issue I saw was that some monkeys were either eating or playing with plastics and other items left by visitors or stolen from them (saw one monkey stealing a hand…
Kuta: I love it! I spent some greats moments there! You can find some great surfs schools there like omg surf school that is right in front of the sheraton. There is bars on the beach too with colds beers to relax and chill
Mount: We climbed Mount Batur this morning and we have a very divided opinion about this experience.  Already at home I read on the internet that it is practically impossible to climb the volcano without a guide, because there is a kind of a "guide mafia". Since we didn't want any…
Aling: Beautiful and impressive cascades. Steep climbes..   Because we are twice the age of people who like to jump and slide from great heights we did not. However it did look spectacular and the people seemed to have great fun. We just enjoyed a refreshing swim and the natural…
Grandmas: My friend and I was supposed to stay here for 2 nights but we ended up extending our stay at Grandma's.  I have no complains about this hotel. The location was great, the breakfast was very delicious and there was something for everybody, the room and bathroom were nice and clean. It's easy to tell that the hotel is quite new.  But what's most important? Definitely the staff! They were always ready to help you no matter which question or what size of problem you may have. To me epecially Diki stands out. He's such a kind and helpful guy. He was always up for chatting and he made our stay at Grandma's even more special!  I will definitly stay at Grandma's when I'll be in Legian again.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Amazing place to stay,the rooms and bathroom are big and clean. Lovely balcony with private sun loungers. The pool area is great. We went to Filini the Italian restaurant, it was the best meal we had so far in Bali as well as the in-room dining, they got the best satays. The staff were friendly.  Definitely we will be back...

Besakih: Besakih temple was wonderful to walk through and see the sites/architecture. However, at the top of Besakih temple there is an artist that claims to have painstakingly made all of the drawings . . . . this is SO NOT true! We almost got conned into buying one for over 1 million…
Sacred: Walking around the sanctuary takes more or less half an hour with monkeys everywhere. There is the staff who would help you take photos with the monkeys as well!
Kuta: Visited kuta beach couple of time but find it's not clean enough and very smelly, i could not have courage to swim due to safety issue because it's so isolated.enjoyed sunset though.
Mount: The beauty of the volcano has been spoilt by the littering and dirtiness at the top.  The walk up is not enjoyable due to the constant stream of motorbikes going up and down pestering walkers to jump on for a ride - at a cost of course!  The dust they kicked up is hard on the…
Aling: We are group of 6 people visiting Lovina for the dolphin, but we end up with this activity.. canceled dolphin tour ( we don't want to chase the poor thing with fisherman boat )  Amazing waterfalls, at the begining we would like to do by our self..ticket fee is Rp 10.000,- /…
Grandmas: From the reception to staffs everything was perfect. Budget friendly hotel and provides airport shuttle too! Has good range of buffet breakfast and also you can select one item from a-la-carte menu.  Location is great!
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Excellent resort with exceptional staff, amazing views. This resort is ideally suited to those wanting relaxing accommodation in a 5 star facility. A little off the beaten track and away from the rowdy beach and bar scene but close enough to commute.

Besakih: Also known as the Mother Temple. Went there in 2014 and want to go again. It's such a mesmerising place that you can't resist yourself. The Besakih temple is the biggest temple of Bali and really majestic in architecture. Make sure you wear long clothes as shorts are not…
Sacred: This was such a fun stop! There are monkeys EVERYWHERE.  We got some great pictures.  The only downside is that you can't take water in with you and it is so so so so hot in Bali! :)
Kuta: We stayed on Bali over a week for a holiday and visiting our backpacking eldest who was there at the time. We like to country specially the outer places very much. But... We stayed near Kuta beach and regretted this. It has lost everything it once was as told. Everything is…
Mount: Like many people, we did the sunrise hike.  We got picked up at our hotel at 2 am and hiked for 2.5 miles up a steep, rocky, slippery trail.  The trail was crowded and people were loud.  But when the sun started to rise, it was all completely worth it!  Great experience!
Aling: Aling-Aling waterfalls area is one of the coolest places I've visited in Bali. For two people the driver cost IDR 600k and that includes from Lovina Beach, to Aling-Aling, to Sekumpul and back to Lovina Beach. Aling-Aling costs IDR 125k each for a guide and "insurance". I…
Grandmas: We stayed here for four nights when we first arrived in Bali. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room is great and extremely clean. The bed and pillows were probably the comfiest we have had so far. Will definitely stay again. Can’t beat the price.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We had a lovely stay at the Radisson, it’s a very good located hotel if you use the scooter to move around. By waling distance you can reach the Impossibile and Bingin beach. Breakfast is one of the best had during my last month of trip between China and Bali. Prices are a bit high so I would improve this and the prices of extra services provided like spa and restaurants. Staff is friendly and helpful, resort well equipped, just missing the view of ocean and sunset to make it perfect. I would suggest it to friends and family altough.

Besakih: Besakih temple is one of the most beautiful temple in Bali, along with Tanah Lot, Uluwatu and Ulun Danu Beratan temple.  Reading the TA reviews, I was quite apprehensive to visit this temple, but glad that I did.  As mentioned in the reviews, the entrance ticket includes sarong,…
Sacred: In Asia, Indonesia is a  beautiful country 3 rd large population in the world. for the nature lover, this is one of the best locations.
Kuta: If you guys thinking of relaxing and chilling at the beach. This is not the one because it's so crowded in the day time but it's nice by the evening time.
Mount: We headed up at 4 AM. We did not encounter the harassing locals that others have mentioned. However we did use a local guide (Jordan) who we got through Good Bali Driver. We had been hearing from locals how cold it is on that way up. For perspective we are from Chicago and they…
Aling: You're in for a treat If you like jumping off or sliding down waterfalls.  There are 7 in total. 1 larger one you can slide down and then a tiny one that you skim over. Then there are 3 you can actually jump off of if you're crazy. I wasn't but my boyfriend was crazy enough to. …
Grandmas: We stayed 4 nights in Grandmas Plus Legian and we really like the hotel. Very friendly staff with smile whenever we see them, breakfast in semi-buffet style- you can order your preferred mains while you can take some other food. Fried rice and fried chicken are very delicious. The location is very good, ~10 mins walk to Legian beach. There are some restaurants and convenience stall around the area. And most importantly, there is a massage shop just next door which is very convenient. Must stay again if we come to Bali!
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: This hotel is truly spectacular. The entire property, from the moment you walk in is breathtaking. Everything is immaculate, very Serene and beautifully designed. Everybody who works here is extremely friendly, attentive and welcoming. Rooms have fantastic balconies and beautiful views.   the food is excellent everything is reasonably priced. It truly is an amazing value for what you get.   Also, the gym and spa are also top notch.   Im looking forward to coming back and definitely recommend to anybody looking for a luxury resort in Uluwatu

Besakih: I was here in a dense fog day.It was really amazing atmospher indeed.Unfortunately I couldn't access to some places in this premise but I was very impressed by this temple.
Sacred: Loved it. These monkey are well fed so don’t jump all over you and steal belongings. Lovely walk through the jungle, we really enjoyed it. Great for kids as well
Kuta: Its typical Sandy beach, during day its full of people and at night the nearby restaurants will blast music; singing or recorded. Safe and with all the facilities you need
Mount: Beautiful mountain, this place make you feel free, and the weather very cold, if the night i suggest you stay in your hotel/guest house wkwkwk
Aling: Aling-Aling Waterfall can be visited by all, but young children and the elderly are advised against participating in the water activities and cliff jumping for their own safety. Those intending to participate in the water activities should bring a change of attire and/or…
Grandmas: Booked double room last minute late at night. Arrived to be told only a twin left- that was fine no big deal. When arrived they seen hubby’s new tattoo- Upon checking out they make you wait to check room (fair enough) got the all clear. Then when driving off in taxi chase taxi down- towel had a few small marks from tattoo (would easily wash out)- didn’t have time to wait for supervisor so paid $10 to go and cover cost. Honestly a bit over the top if you ask me. Would not recommend.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Very nice place to stay,the rooms are big and super clean. Lovely balcony too. The pool area is great, lots of sun loungers, never an issue getting one. Very friendly staff.   Only negative is that its not on the beach.

Besakih: The entrance ticket of IDR60k per pax to this mother temple of Bali is inclusive of the sarong, motorbike ride to the temple entrance, and a tour guide.  No discount for bringing your own sarong.  The motorbike is only one-way up to the entrance.  You have to pay separately…
Sacred: Had an amazing time at the monkey forest. Becareful of the monkeys and look after your stuff. Staff are so kind and friendly and you could get some good pictures with the help of the staff
Kuta: Always a pleasure to chill on this beach.  Soak up the sun and down a beer or two. Beach sellers can be a bit of a pain but just a polite no thanks is all it takes.   A great bar to visit on the beach would be pande n lily. They make you feel welcome.
Mount: Amazing experience to climb to see the sunrise but like every other review says, it's standstill traffic for literally hours. Incredible view, but you'll be sharing it with hundreds of others.  I'd read heaps of reviews and thought I'd be prepared, not so much.   Highlights:  -…
Aling: Great half day out. 3 cliffs to jump off along with a 10m waterfall to slide down. We didn't book in advance but just showed up at the reception and were introduced to our own personal guide who was fantastic (he was still smiling even when I was repeatedly too scared to jump!).…
Grandmas: The hotel is in a good area with lots of restaurants and just a short walk to the beach.  Decent breakfast.  The room is tiny, I would not want to,be there more than overnight.  The staff are all friendly, the room is clean with pleasant decor.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Radisson Blu Uluwatu is amazing from the minute you approach the lobby, the staff are all very welcoming and so helpful with any questions or requests.  Our room was the best room we've ever stayed in, we upgraded to the suite and there was plenty of room for 3 of us, the view was fantastic and the cleanliness second to none!!  We truly can't fault anything and only have wonderful things to say about our whole experience - it was hard to leave...we will most definitely return and recommend to everyone!!!

Besakih: My husband and I visited the temple last month and their tour guide was very informative when it came to telling us about the history of the temple. It is definitively worth the visit if you want to take in some history and culture.
Sacred: The site is not well maintained and the monkeys are not particularly well behaved. I would suggest simply encountering monkeys in the street in Ubud near the forest.
Kuta: We went to Kuta beach during sunset. I was totally amazed with the sights I saw even though it was a little cloudy. I think this place is a must go during sunset. Attaching some pictures of the same.
Mount: This is a fairly easy climb but there are SO many people doing it there can be traffic (people) jams going up and down. The views of the sunrise and surrounding area are amazing and make it worth the early start and the number of people. There are other hikes on the island that…
Aling: Adventure, fun, nature, bali, island life you will get it all here... get your family and pre teen kids here. Escape from the city, put away your gadgets and give your camera to the guide to capture your moments. Jump, slide, swim or just sit and enjoying the nature. IDR 200 per…
Grandmas: Just stayed three nights here. Located on a busy intersection I thought it would be noisy but was amazed how quiet it was . About a one kilometre from the main club precinct of skygarden etc but there are countless bars and restaurants (better I reckon) in between. Also about 800 metres to Kuta beach. Rooms are small but very clean and great service and it only cost us about $29 Aud for a room. Only downside is no pool.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Had the most wonderful relaxing holiday at The Raddison Uluwatu. The hotel is beautifully designed from large comfortable bedrooms to huge swimming pool and an abundance of beds and cabanas to choose  from.Breakfast was fresh and delicious with a large selection to suit all tastes. Location is a 7 minute walk to Main Street which has many restaurants to choose from but honestly we were happy eating lunch round pool and dinner at both restaurants was good and price comparable to the street restaurants.Happy hour was great value and we made use of it every day enjoying lovely cocktails between 4 till 6 .What really made this hotel 5 star was the excellent customer service displayed by all the staff but a huge thank you has to go to the following :- Gitta on reception was excellent…

Besakih: We had a bad luck with the weather (raining) and therefore we weren’t able to see the beautiful surrounding of this temple. But that’s not the temples fault. It is very nice place with great atmosphere. The bad thing is that the locals are spoiling this beautiful atmosphere by…
Sacred: This was so much better than I expected, the entrance fee is worth it just for the beautiful grounds but the monkeys really make this extra special.   This was so good I am going back again, definitely my highlight of Ubud so far !!
Kuta: Really nice and clean beach. My friends took surfing lessons and I had nice time in the sun. There are some nice bars along the beach too.
Mount: Great views and good food.love it!If u ride down from the village u can visit the hotsprings aswell.
Aling: Awesome slide in natural waterfalls. The first waterfall is the most beautiful but the others are more fun. The local guide spoke good English and was very helpful. We paid 250k for 2 people, but we should've bargained. I am not sure if this place is safe so be careful.
Grandmas: Good hotel, good price and good location. This is my second time stay at this hotel. Overall, i am satisfied staying in this hotel. The breakfast is very limited selections and very limited parking space
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: My best hotel experience! No words can exactly explain the grateness of this experience. When we arrived they served us a welcome drink, and they took care of us for all the stay. At check out they were so kind with us for everything we needed. Really superior!

Besakih: We have been travelling for 10 months already in Asia and this temple is among the ones that we liked the most. We didn't need to face any of these scams as we didn't go through the main road but through the eastern one. We just parked the motorbike and went walking 5 minutes to…
Sacred: Great day out. Beautiful sacred forest where the animals run freely.  After going to Bali for a yoga retreat, we took a day out to do some fun activities.  A trip to the sacred forest in Ubud was a highlight of our day.  Not a lot of places offer seeing animals in their natural…
Kuta: Busy bustling beach. The sunset is epic and definitely worth visiting. Affordable beach chairs available all along the beach, as well as some higher priced beach clubs. Food is everywhere!!!
Mount: I did a less common trip, which was the combined Sunset and Sunrise tour on AirB&B.  The trek up was done at the much more respectable time of 2.30pm in daylight.  It is not an easy trek, but even though I'm not exactly the fittest person around, I made it in about 3 hours. …
Aling: Aling Aling waterfall is quite high and impresssive, although not as big as other waterfalls that adventurous people will do during their travels. As it's not allowed to swim in the natural pool (we haven't been able to find out why, but possibly due to safety concerns), you can…
Grandmas: I stayed at Grandmars Plus Hotel for 2 weeks. I originally was only staying for a few days but rebooked for my entire holiday.  Ok love this place .  It is spotlessly clean..The room is not large but adequate   the breakfast was great and the staff are fantastic Especially the following staff Front office: Ana,anggi,Henry Security:Ngurah,sumertha,Susana Housekeeping: Agung indra,darmawan. All the dining staff especially Pande I will always stay here when I am in Bali
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Absolutely loved our stay at this resort. The pool area is perfect and there are so many different seating areas and sunbeds that are all super comfortable. All the food from the restaurants were delicious and the staff were second to none. Could not recommend more.

Besakih: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the temple complex. There are lots of stairs and I recommend taking a casual stroll right around the complex to enjoy the pagodas from a variety of different angles. Make sure you bring your sarong and comfortable shoes. There is the usual…
Sacred: This place gets 10/10 from all my children. We are generally avoiding places with animals after being horrified in Vietnam and reading mixed reviews for most places here. For every person writing enthusiastically about birds flying round freely in Bali Bird Park there is another…
Kuta: This has to be one of the most amazing beaches I've ever seen in Bali!  The white sand that makes up the beach with the beautiful colors of the water made me feel like I was in paradise. Yet as I walked closer to the water and got into the ocean I noticed that the sand was black…
Mount: We booked a private hiking tour from Klook at Mount Batur.  The hike was very tough for us as we are not sporty people. Started our hike from around 4am and reached at the peak at close to 6am.  First of all the weather is pretty chilly at the mountain so cover up, it’s around…
Aling: You pay a cheap entrance fee (less than 10$) and you get a guide, lifejackets and water. The cliffs are amazing and perfect for everyone, from beginners to edvanced divers. you can jump from 5, 10 and 15m. There is also a natural slide carved in the rocks by the water which is…
Grandmas: I went to Denpasar on the beginning of January 2019 on a business trip. The branch staff booked for me and I stayed there for 5 days 4 nights. Overall it's nice & comfy, but there are some points need to be improve: 1. the breakfast place has a no moking sign but still there are some visitor smoked there. There are no separator for smoking & non smoking at the breakfast place. 2. I used the hotel laundry service and my clothes has no fragrance, very different if you use laundry service outside the hotel. 3. Less coordination between the Reservation & FO. My branch staff already paid for the room and inform it to the RS but it doesn't show on their data (FO) so I had to confirm again with the FO - show them the proof transfer at check out.  well that's it, hope they will improve…

Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Had an amazing time at Radisson Blu Uluwatu.  Our panoramic room was huge and had fantastic view over the ocean.  I cant express enough how nice and relaxing this hotel was and how friendly and helpful all the staff where.

Besakih: Amazing views from this large temple. There is a lot to see and do. But beware, women as soon as you enter will harass you to buy things (do not touch or they will make you buy). The guide we had asked for more than the top we gave and was very pushy so if you feel comfortable…
Sacred: I was anxious about visiting here but many of my friends had been and recommended this. Its great to see the monkeys in their natural environment. They will not come near you unless you have a water bottle. Please do not take this in with you or hide it from the monkeys as they…
Kuta: Lots of people and lots of vendors constantly on you to buy beer or tacky tourist stuff that you have to haggle for. Lots of fun if you like some chaos
Mount: Succumbed to the hype surrounding sunrise hike of Mount Batur and I'm glad we did. Our kids age 15 & 12 had a great time hiking this volcanic mountain as well. I'd rate the hike moderate one. We finished it in about 2.5 hrs. We started at 3.00am from our hotel in Ubud and…
Aling: We heard about Aling Aling through a tour guide, he said it was better than the other touristic waterfalls so we decided to give it a go and so glad that we did! Our driver had no idea where it was so it took us awhile to figure it out. After hours of driving we reached a…
Grandmas: This is my first time come to Bali to meet my boy friends and choose Grandmas hotel for my stay, I realy enjoy it due the bedding is comfort ,the breakfast delicious, great job for chef team Pak Suparma, Yuni and Devi, big smile every morning from the waitress Ita, Yudiari and Dedi, I feel safe with security guard Ngurah,Agung, Ketut and Hamdan, they are very helpful, thank you for reception team Hendy,Faisal,Agung,Dayu,Yoshi,Diki,Yudi,Julia help me for everything I need during stay, and every morning you will meet Ana at lobby area, she is attentive guest relation at Grandmas Legian, I will stay here again
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Usually not a big fan of the brand itself, so was a bit sceptical at first, but the reviews and the photos on TA really convinced my husband and I to choose this property for our final 3 nights of our Bali trip. And we are so happy we did! The property is very nice, modern, new and clean! The lobby has a very pleasant view when you first walk in, one of the best we saw in Bali! The room was very spacious, immaculately clean and very tastefully decorated + had very nice views (Ocean Deluxe Room). The pool was really nice with plenty of sun loungers and space to move around. Breakfast was also surprisingly good (compared to other 5* resorts in Bali where we stayed before), with good variety and quality. So were lunch and dinner, although the service was a bit on the slow side, but…

Besakih: This is the largest and mother temple in Bali dating back more than 1000 years. Located within 3km from Mount Agung and on its foot hill. The temple got its name from the village called Besakih where it is located. There are also two sub-temples - one for royalty family and the…
Sacred: Nice place to walk around if you get there early, it's peaceful and nice and the monkeys are generally pretty well behaved. However, while we were there a big group of school students came on busses and were really loud which changed the whole vibe of the place, and also got the…
Kuta: Beach is a bit dirty and always crowded so definitely not a place to relax. Good at sunset to have a Bintang but otherwise stick with your hotel pool.
Mount: From reading the reviews it’s obvious that the two different routes up the volcano illicit v different reactions so pick when booking your trip, find out which route your guide intends to take.  I took the route up without motorbikes, but I descended using this route so I know…
Aling: Had heard about "The Secret Garden" before, but a lot of Drivers are unaware where it is. Decided to go after we were told it was an easy walk. Well we would not call it an easy walk, lots of natural steps, but not too difficult. The first waterfall you see is Aling Aling a…
Grandmas: I just concern about the shower glass door seems dont cleaned properly, and bathroom floor is so slippery. But overall, for the price i paid. Its worth more than other 3* hotel. I hope u dont increse the rate ..lol..been check in with this hotel everytime i go to bali. But always has problem everytime i book from traveloka.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: We really enjoyed our stay, the hotel is very clean and well maintained. The rooms are huge with a bath and the pool is huge with lots of sun loungers, cabanas and day beds. Great variety and quantity of food for breakfast. There is a free shuttle service to Uluwatu Temple and Padang Padang beach which is great. The hotel did seem a little isolated so it would improve the overall stay experience if there was a free shuttle to/from main shopping/restaurant areas.

Besakih: All temples in Bali are unique .. Besakih is different because of it sheer size and area and number of temple structures within the complex. The environment surrounding the temple complex is cool and the views are fantastic. They also have good souvenir shops on one side of the…
Sacred: Great place to visit. Effortless walking and nicely paved pathways. Much of the sculptures are in mosaic and a few covered with green moss. An abundance of trees that provide great shade. One is not allowed to carry food r feed the monkeys. Only when you inside you will…
Kuta: Dont hesitate - pay around 100k for 2 sunbeds and 30k for a cold beer served on the Beach. Just go go <U+0001F44D><U+0001F3FC><U+0001F60E>
Mount: We are a couple in our late twenties who are currently doing a backpacking trip around the world so as you can imagine we’re on a tight budget.  As a result the cost per person we were quoted for a guided tour of the volcano was extortionate to us so we decided to do it…
Aling: We truly had agreat Experience at these falls! Aling aling is a great waterfall in itself but what we enjo yed most was jumping off and sliding down the surrounding falls. They have 5m, 10m and 15m jumps gauranteed to give you a real adreniline rush! We loved it.  We went early…
Grandmas: Will stay here whenever go to Bali,great location,staff is very nice and helpful,specially their guest relation Ana,i book directly from her,give best price,also very quick respon and handle whenever i need some help
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The Radisson Blu Uluwatu was exceptional. It had such a relaxed fee because of the spacious grounds and pool area that were fantastic. Our room was plenty big enough, we enjoyed sitting on the balcony many times

Besakih: The place itself is wonderful and has a breathtaking view. The entrance fee includes free saroong, guide and one way up to the temple. But you canbring your own saroong for the sake of good pics. <U+0001F60A> After arrive, some women will sell you flower for praying and kids for postcard,…
Sacred: This forest looks like the Lord of the rings, beautiful and very well take care, the monkeys is the best and they well taken care and free to move around
Kuta: I am Yoga Efendi, a traveler from Yogyakarta, Java Island - Indonesia. I've been here many times and yes! This is the best beach for waiting sunset in Bali Island!   The beach is more clean now, less plastics, and very amazing jogging track! Kuddos for local government!
Mount: It's quite hard for solo traveler like me to book from online tour. So here is the tip for anyone who did a solo trip and want to join other group (sharing tour). Like what it has been said in the forumn, you can book the trip the day before on a tour booth at ubud street. Just…
Aling: We take guests to Sambangan waterfalls every week.Last week we were very lucky not to have been swept away. We had crossed the bridge walked over the rocks down to the 8 metre jump, we walked down to the pool of the 8 metre. Within a few minutes the conditions had changed…
Grandmas: I have just returned home after a 6 night stay at Grandmas Legian Hotel. (return visit to this hotel)  Location suits my needs.  Good price, small but we'll equiped rooms. Food standard at breakfast seems to have improved from my last stay, pretty nice breakfast now, although the area is a little awkward, with a big empty void in middle of room. They have also started a free shuttle bus service (I didn't use it).  Could be useful for some. All the staff were great, they are happy and extremely accommodating. But the young lady Anggi, who worked reception in the mornings, deserves special attention.  She brightens the day with her beautiful smile & warm greeting of guests as they arrive for breakfast.  She even remembered my name and would greet me each day. Not so easy in a…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Stayed 5 nights through Luxury Escapes. Hotel was excellent - nice and new and one of those that doesn’t feel busy or crowded despite being full. Breakfast was excellent as was the pool. We enjoyed our free massages in the SPA. Our room was huge with a very comfortable bed. Food and drink was priced reasonably and of good quality. We will come back! Two minor suggestions for improvement would be 1) try make the pool a bit warmer (not sure that’s possible but other Bali pools were not as cold!) and 2) do not let guests play their own music and speakers at the pool - on one morning a family turned up playing loud club music at 10am which really disturbed other guests. It should not be guests job to ask them to turn off,hotel staff should deal with this. Overall though an excellent…

Besakih: the temple itself is beautiful and the place could be special but we as a tourists were there just to give as much money we could, on every step you were pushed to buy something even small kids were selling postcards and crying so you would give them money, the guide was…
Sacred: For only 70k IDR per person you cannot go wrong spending a couple of hours walking around these beautiful grounds. Preserved for the monkeys and local wildlife. It is so nice to see animals in their natural jungle habitat instead of in cages. I have been twice and both times got…
Kuta: This beach is not really what I expected from Bali, it’s beautiful don’t get me wrong, as are most beaches however we were hassled constantly by people selling things. It’s impossible to lie and sunbathe in peace without being bartered every few minutes and they don’t give up. A…
Mount: This place is around a 1hr + drive to Kintamani  from say the down town Kuta . On the way you can visit factories making Stone Statutes & Silver Jewellery which they say is more important in their social being than Gold. Also Painting Factories etc and then proceed to the Mount.…
Aling: I found this on Trip Advisor and after much research told my driver about it. He had never been which was even better so we found it together and he was able to experience something new on his Island.  There is an entrance fee of 100,000 IDR for a guide and I will be honest, I…
Grandmas: We stayed here as a stopover. We arrived late at night and was leaving for the island early in the morning. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is super clean and nice. The beds were comfortable and breakfast was perfect. The employees were super friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel which is close to the airport.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The pictures don't lie .. the resort and hotel is beautiful, the pool amazing and the rooms large, clean and tastefully furnished .(although the acoustics and noise transfer between rooms is terrible) .. but this place just lacks the personal touch .. maybe I have become more of a 'Boutique Hotel' kind of person but I just found this place toooooooo big.  They have this kind of 'keep you in the resort' attitude with lots of 'offers' of free drinks, meals and massages .. which inevitably ends in you spending more money somehow .. with a ++ (plus service tax plus govt. tax) on everything .. it really all adds up.  My suggestion if you stay here is have a great b'fast, enjoy the pool for awhile (lots of sunbeds and cabanas available and the pool really is gorgeous) then head down…

Besakih: This is a very beautiful Temple. Take your time walking round experiencing the peace and calm,. We have learnt over the years that by using a good tour guide you learn so much more about attractions and we were not disappointed this time we took a tour with Suweca Bali Tour,…
Sacred: Well worth the price!  Beautiful statues and jungle vegetation!  The monkeys were a lot of fun.  They did an amazing job developing this place
Kuta: nice clean beach and it has a good shopping market outside the beach with reasonable prices for getting the local stuff
Mount: Through a friend, we learned of a  large Bali tour company called Suta Tours that can customize tours to fit your needs. Having read of persons who had combined sunrise trekking of Batur with rafting and coffee plantation visit for a looooooong day, our group of 4 felt up to the…
Aling: This place is extraordinary. It may be difficult to get there because most drivers don't know where it is. We used google maps to guide our driver, who was not the most helpful by any means. The driver charged us 70 dollars from Ubud. There is a small kiosk where you pay a…
Grandmas: Staff from the concierge, dinning crew to the security are friendly. The beds are clean and comfortable. However the room is dim and bathroom sliding door is heavy and noisy. They do not provide tissue in the room so please bring your own if you need. Overall still value for money.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: An incredible customer mer experience from A-Z! Extremely friendly staff, no matter if reception, cleaning or restaurant. Exceptional rooms, great food with breakfast and 2 restaurants. We loved it and will definitely come back! Thanks a million for a wonderful vacation with a great value for miney  <U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F><U+0001F64F><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D>

Besakih: This place has magical effect of calming the mind. The serene environment is a pleasure to see. Preferably go in the morning.
Sacred: Awesome Hold on to your stuff, some tribes of monkeys steal a lot. And read the safety instructions..
Kuta: It was a beach that was a surprise, we loved the little time we spent there. Like all beaches there are always a lot of people who are always trying to sell something but this is anywhere in Bali. A surf beach but it is also great for those who want to get some sun and relax.…
Mount: The sunrise is incredible, so do that. But make sure you get a tour of the other craters too. The trekking is a little more challenging, but the views and the experience are worth it.
Aling: This place is amazing! It's actually 4 waterfalls that are close together, Aling-Aling being the biggest.  On the other falls, you can jump off cliffs, rappel down rocks, swim, and there's one where you can even slide down the falls whose bed has been smoothed over by water for…
Grandmas: Front Desk, Dining Room and Housekeeping staff was friendly. Got a room on second floor, no need to take an elevator. Room was nice but I could not rest well as other guests were just too loud even after midnight. There was quite a queue for breakfast. Dining Room's seating capacity was limited.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Hotel is new and modern, like a total different world from other part of Bali. The location is a bit far from Kuta and Seminyak where people usually do shopping. Staff is friendy and attentive. Room is huge as well as the bathroom. Breakfast is great but I wish it could extend to 11:00 am.

Besakih: A place where you can visit with kids, and family. For me it was a memorable place I have witnessed a wonderful temple with ancient history, cultural and architecture. We can see the beauty of nature. I would recommend to take out some time to understand the different culture…
Sacred: The serenity and nature is absolutely beautiful. Unfortunately they have now put in new rules where you are not allowed to touch or feed the monkeys. Due to this there are far less monkeys that are out and about to see :( still a lovely place to visit however :)
Kuta: This beach is close to restaurants and shops. Used by surfers. Not the best beach for swimming but nice for a stroll at sunset.
Mount: I finally did the Mt. Batur Sunrise Hike and it was SPECTACULAR!!! So glad I did it and would recommend it for anyone with moderate level of fitness. It was definitely a steady steep, but luckily was not wet or slippery when we did it, which worked to our advantage. The path was…
Aling: This place is amazing, the whole complex is a garden, you can swim, you can have waterfall shower, while enjoying the fresh air. Not so far from the parking lot, so there's not much sweat you will expend. Entrance fee IDR 10,000, Parking IDR 2,000 Was a happy day!
Grandmas: The hotel staffs are all so kind and polite! They all deserved to be recognized! I will always book again! The hotel might be only 3 star but I definitely felt like I booked a 4 or 5 star hotel with the quality of service I experienced in this hotel! Thank you sooo much Grandmas Plus Legian! <U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F>
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Good environment.  Room is spacious with balcony.  Nice and beautiful pool.  Restaurants provide good food and good services.  Buffet breakfast has lots of choices.  Staff can speak good English and are polite and friendly.  A good hotel to be commended.

Besakih: Visit early to avoid the masses.  An early visit revealed Mount Agung - not erupting.  It sits as the backdrop to this Balinese mother temple complex.  It is large and sprawling surrounded by various family temples.  A small hike up to the very last temple is worthwhile and…
Sacred: I was a little put off after reading others reviews saying the monkeys were very aggressive however we had the best time at the monkey forest. Both me and my boyfriend made sure we didn’t bring any bags or things on us to attract the monkeys and yet they still managed to climb…
Kuta: Its a must to see the sunset at Kuta beach. Its the best place to experience it. Loads of what sport available. A great place to walk and clear your mind....please do not litter!!!! It can get crowded at the beach depends on what time you are there.
Mount: Not a good area to be visited, as we have to pay to cross the road to get to Batur, then we have to pay again to trek the mountain. Too much tourist and rubbish, with the collection of money from the tourist, the organizer doesnt pay attention to it.
Aling: Aling aling waterfaals have wonderfull scenery. you must trekking along the forest to get there. There are a small and big waterfall in it. You can swim at the stream and jump from the hills. but you must have local guide if you want to do it. There is entrance fee that include…
Grandmas: As supervisor mas Handy  As reception mbk Dayu and mbk Anggi also as a house keeping bli Agung Indra all of them are so helpful and give me such a good servies while i stay in Grandmas Legian and makes me wanna come and stay over and over again ....thanks all
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Wow. Words cannot express how incredible this hotel is and how amazing our experience was. Wow. Wow. Wow. Plus, we got engaged!!! Which added to the magic. Beautiful experience. Will recommend to all our friends and family.

Besakih: Driver cum guide told us that we have to rent or buy a sarong before going to the ticketing booth.  Walked to booth to find that entrance fee of Rp 60k includes sarong, motorbike ride up to the entrance of temple.  Upon reaching there, ladies shoved offerings Rp20k each,  rental…
Sacred: So great to see the monkeys in their own free space, albeit the odd knob of a tourist who can't follow rules. We left back packs at the hotel, took only our phones to avoid tempting the little cheeky monkeys to search us for food. Wasted a good half an hour watching them play in…
Kuta: I love this beach, really deserves the fame it has. The prettiest beach especially during sunset. I wanted to learn how to surf so maybe I will return
Mount: We had heard lots of different things about Mount Batur and wether we should do it alone or with a guide. In the end we found Bazir was the man to use (+62 877-6038-1082). He was lovely, patient and took us a different route which avoided all the other guides. The climb was a…
Aling: Scenic and enjoyable. The hike was not too tough but not easy either as the ground was slippery. Might not be suitable for older folks or children. We were able to slide down the waterfall and also jumped down one. Life jackets are provided. Pretty much a brand new experience.…
Grandmas: I stayed for 1 night at Grandmas Plus at Legian.   Location Very central - it's right smack the shopping street, so I was shopping until 10 pm for souvenirs. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants that you can choose from budget to fancy, so you satisfy any sort of craving you might have.  Convenience FREE shuttle service to specific points from Seminyak to the airport  Breakfast Buffet is a good sizeable spread especially for the price you are paying  Facilities A lot of instagrammable spots in the hotel so be prepared to take a lot of photos! I did the complimentary painting class and I had so much fun  Service Service staff was at top notch - Ana (Guest relations), Concierge, reception et al
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. Radisson: Everything was fantastic. Stayed in panoramic view room which was nice and had a great view of pool and ocean. Great pool area with day beds and lounges. Breakfast ok. Dinner at Felini was excellent. Friendly service across the whole resort.

Besakih: The temple is just about ok. Entry inside is not free. You need to carry those Pooja plates from below to gain entry into the main part. It is only worth going for the drive there. Lush green forests on both sides , super clean mountain roads, beautiful clear skies all…
Sacred: Loved the excitement of seeing the monkeys. We used the Airbnb instagram tour services and this was one of the places listed as a must visit so, it had to be done!  You pay to get in to the park and from the entrance gate on you will come across a number of monkeys running,…
Kuta: For a surfing novice, my friend Mellissa was treated well by Greg @smilesurfbali and I will recommend any surfers and surfers wannabe to visit Greg at Kuta Beach. He was professional and patient. He also stayed with her in the ocean to make sure she doesn't get hurt while…
Mount: It was an early 4am hike from the bottom to catch the sunrise.  The hike was not enjoyable as you have to share the difficult trail with tons of motorbikes spewing pollution in the thin air while you needed fresh oxygen. Sunrise at the top was breathtaking but it was also very…
Aling: Nice place. Beautiful nature. In rain periode you can't swim in de bowl beneath the waterfall. Too much current!   BE CAREFUL. last year 3 people died . Don't swim under ,  rubbish from forest fells also of the waterfall..  But beautyful place to see and to swim. Parking place.…
Grandmas: Arriving in Bali close to midnight we had the hotel shuttle.  While it seemed expensive running around Bali at 12 o'clock was not on the agenda.  Arriving at the hotel after midnight we were greeted with a lemon drink. Reception was expecting us and had the room ready. The staff promptly took the bags to the room and showed us around. The room was narrow but adequate. Kettle, tea coffee, fridge. Bathroom was clean and all worked. Breakfast in the morning was a little confusing but I put that down to language. Excellent value, Staff were very polite and attentive at all times. Check out was just as simple as checking in, just as it should be. We will defiantly be using grandmas on the way out.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The hotel is good for the price point - it has nice rooms and nice pool, the breakfast is ok and lunch is much better.  Service was good once you got past front desk and reservations.  However, reservations and the whole checkin process ruined the trip for us.  This is the worst reservations manager I have ever come across in 20 years travel and an awful checkin process (involving atleast 6 people)!  After a long journey we arrive to the hotel and are kept waiting for an approx an hour to checkin, when I query this they finally say that we only have a reservation for 2 adults - I show them the reservation that clearly states it's for for 2 adults and a child and they take a picture of this, then go back and fourth with reservations and waste more time.  Eventually I speak to the…

Besakih: I was blessed to have visited it during one of the Balinese Holy Days and offer my prayers there. The atmosphere is spiritually uplifting. A wonderful sight to see all the pilgrims dressed in traditional Balinese style and offering prayers, waiting for their turn in patience.
Sacred: So many cheeky monkeys in a lovely sanctuary. Easy to spend time watching the monkeys playing, eating & just being cheeky, also amusing to see different reactions from other  visitors. Our 2nd visit in 2 years on a day trip to Ubud we wouldnt have missed seeing the monkeys…
Kuta: I took some surfing lessons, the waves are perfect for beginners. The sunset was also very beautiful.
Mount: The trek is easy and the view from the top is amazing… therefore there are hundreds of tourists going up at 4 am to see the Sunrise at 6 am… that's good  for tourism business, but it is a pity for the site. The top of the volcano has been equipped with benches, like in a cinema……
Aling: Beauty has sanctification, this is exactly the case with this waterfall. You have to walk down the path to get this waterfall. Aling-Aling actually is not that difficult to reach, but there are also 3 small waterfalls below Aling-Aling's main stream, reaching those three might…
Grandmas: Great location in the Main Street of Legian. The Grandmas hotel is surprisingly quiet, the rooms are small but very well laid out with comfortable beds, good air conditioning, a clean and functional bathroom. It also has a small fridge and coffee making facilities. The breakfast was very good quality with several different selections to cater for most tastes. There is valet parking available for those with cars. You can also get some relaxing treatment in the spa on the premises and the massage I had was excellent. This will be my new hotel when staying in Legian, very good value for money.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Fantastic hotel and service, food is amazing in all the restaurants and around the pool.  I would highly recommend this however to a couple or a family with older kids.  As amazing as it was, I don’t think it’s ideal for a family with small children because the hotel is extremely quiet.  The kids play room is nothing special and there’s nothing for kids to do besides swim in the pool.  I would stay there again if it was just my husband and I.

Besakih: As we read the review about besakih...there are so many scam... yes its true! But they will leave us if we reject them. The ojek (motorcycle with friver) to go to besakih temple from ticketibg counter is include in ticket prices. Dont pay more... better you take saroong by our…
Sacred: Pros:  The forest was clean and the staffs were helpful when a monkey snatched our belongings.  Cons:  Inconveniently located.  No food available nearby.  Nobody was allowed to go into the temples (correct me if I am wrong).  Overall, it was not worth the long car ride from DPS…
Kuta: Crowded place. Ok to hangout if u like hustle and bustle. You can swim in the beach. Event to take Umbrella and chair and sit u have to pay ab 50k IDR. There beer n food stalls throughout. It’s a big stretch, u can walk and find Lucy ur spot. There are a lot of shops and hotels…
Mount: Having read online that you do not need a guide to trek up to mount batur I decided save some cash and drive & walk up it myself. However when I arrived at the trail entrance (around 11.30) I was immediately stopped by a group of locals posing as guides at a gate and told I…
Aling: This was such an amazing experience! there was many different waterfalls to go into. The first one is the 10meter slide (to afraid to do that one) then second one was a 5 meter jump which technically what you do first to get the hang of it, the third one was a little 5 meter…
Grandmas: Room is cozy, clean, and provide our basic necessities. Affordable and located in the center of legian. Staffs are kind and helpful. I didnt try the foods bcs i have to catch the plane. Definitely will come back here again when i come to bali in the future
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: As a Travel Agent I've stayed in so many lovely hotels and resorts. The Radisson Blu Uluwatu was the best experience I've ever had, truly wonderful in every aspect.  The big difference I think was that every single staff member made us feel special, with genuine smiles and helpfulness.

Besakih: This temple complex is amazing, a huge amount of steps so do be aware. Getting to the temple is very difficult thru some very pushy vendors.  You do not need a sari, or an offering,  the money you paid to get in covers everything.  Do not get pushed by the vendors.  They spoilt…
Sacred: I have been to all kinds of nature parks, including Night Jungle etc in Singapore. Never have we experienced such a fabulous environment for animals as this forest, had to be over 1000 monkeys of all ages, in a huge undated free roaming environment, with streams , waterfalls,…
Kuta: This is my second favourite place in the world & I have visited a number of times now. Most of the locals are extremely friendly & respect when you want to be left alone. The beach & streets were the cleanest I have ever seen.  We miss it already & cant wait to visit again soon
Mount: You need to hire a guide to ascend the volcano. Best done for sunrise over Bali. Woke up at 1am, it’s a 1.5hr drive from Denpasar. Started hiking around 3am to catch the sunrise.  Wear proper hiking shoes, the terrain gets rough on the way up, especially the 2nd half. I…
Aling: Actually there's another waterfall near this area, the name is Aling2 too, but for me the waterfall is not as beautiful as this waterfall, it's crowded because tourist come to take a bath in the pool....  If you like go to this waterfall then you must set your map to Sambangan…
Grandmas: The staff at the restaurant were so helpful and wheeled me to our table. Food was great, overall I would recommend this place to anyone. I'm booked to go there again soon. Loved it. Having my daughters birthday there in February next year as we are flying to Australia to visit family. So close to the airport.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: service is great! front desk, f & b and housekeeping... the size of our room is good! tasty breakfast! nice little walk to a secret beach and uluwatu temple shuttle are very nice. Will be back next trip to Bali for sure.

Besakih: We were a bit in doubt about going to the besakih temple, because of the shocking reviews.  Thankfully we had an amazing day. You need to pay 60.000k per person for entree fee and that’s about it. I recommened you NOT to take a guide, you will pay a lot of extra money. You can…
Sacred: The monkey forest is always one of our highlights of our Bali trips. Not only are the monkeys adorable, the forest itself is a beautiful area to spend a couple of hours strolling through. Whenever we are in Bali we always plan at least one trip to Ubud just so we can include a…
Kuta: Rarely crowded, not pristine but fairly clean, drinks & food at reasonable prices close at hand. The locals friendly & helpful & you’re not pestered by people trying to sell you souvenirs. As for the weather, glorious but don’t forget your sunscreen!
Mount: We drove there by ourselves in the middle of the night. Its a mountain on no mans land so no trekking guide should be permitted.   We were followed,traced and forced by a lot of locals who were trying to sell their trekking guide tours to us. Not interested, then they told us…
Aling: Tip 1: Hire a personal driver (exc. petrol). I had unfortunately tried to use Uber, and it costs 335,000 IDR for a one-way trip. The going rate of my driver was 375,000 IDR / 10 hours. This is definitely able to be negotiated, but I don't know how much lower we can go. The 375…
Grandmas: I was woken by cleaning staff vacuuming at 1am. This went on for over half an hour until I called Reception who basically told me they were trying to get ahead for the following day.  I've never heard of a Hotel cleaning rooms in the middle of the night - cut my stay short and booked elsewhere.  Their response to my complaint is attached, giving the impression that noise should be expected at all hours.  Avoid.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Good commerical hotel, great braekfast and hotel facilities. The pool was large and had good accedd and beds. The kids used the gym and the concierge were helpful when asked. Did the job for 4 days in Ullluwatu,

Besakih: We booked to come here before reading trip advisor, and feared coming on finding awful reviews! Nevertheless we attended with a private driver, we weren’t forced to buy a sari, nor were we forced to pay extra for a guide. We opted to walk to the temple from the ticketing office…
Sacred: We had a nice trip to the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary. Not to expensive, and you can walk around in the forest for hours if you want. Monkeys everywhere.
Kuta: Good fun beach, Take up the offer to get served with drinks while the sun sets. Waves are generally good for body surfing & not overcrowded.
Mount: The volcano is truly a sight to behold. It looks so magnificent far away, you can only imagine how it looks like up close. A mind-smacking experience, honestly.
Aling: My partner and I visited Aling - Aling with a guide. This waterfall is one of a group of falls near each other along a short trail. A lot of steps going down and coming back out, some in poor condition, so do be careful and take your time. I am glad we got a guide as he helped…
Grandmas: we are enjoyed to stay in grandmas, that make me feel like home because the staff are really helpful.  The breakfast was delicious ! The location is perfect.    big thanks to Anggie! we will always remember you because she's good worker !  Thanks again!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Very pleasant stay. Rooms are incredible : we had a room with a terrace and sunbeds. Big size, very comfy bed, huge bathrooms. Very nice pool area, sunbeds could be a little more comfy though... Nice breakfast and food at the restaurant is very good indeed. Very good vibes during our 4 nights stay.

Besakih: the fantastic charming of the Mother temple among the other temple in Bali, and considered as the most sacred temple significantly pilgrimage.  there has no doubt, no objection for the temple remarkable Balinese traditional structure itself, this is the absolutely wonderful…
Sacred: wandering through this forest jngle is lovely especially if you can time it early enough before the buses come in with groups. but hold on to your hat, bag, glasses, camera and everything. The monkeys are more than curious!
Kuta: Legendary beach in bali. One of the oldest and most visited beach in bali. Full of activities and sun through the year. Near to many known hotel such as hardrock hotel and Kuta Paradiso. Just enjoy the sun and sunset as u laydown on the day bed and sip your coconut water
Mount: If you're in Bali, this is a must-do, especially if you love hiking. It's a tad far away from everything and requires waking up early but it'll be so damn worth it.  Honestly you don't really NEED a guide to navigate for this because the trails so popular you just need to follow…
Aling: We went by ourselves to the park with a lot of different waterfalls and natural pools and slides. Aling-Aling is just the biggest of those. They are offering guides and tours but I don't think you need that.   We drove with our scooter, it's maybe a bit hard to find but you can…
Grandmas: Near beach and nightlife , brilliant breakfast , price without rival , so clean . polite and helpful stuf.  Can't find any other hotel with this price and this level . recommended 100%. Special thanks to stuff team  Anggi ,meika , yudi<U+0001F60A><U+0001F44D> ,dayu ,faisal ,agung. <U+0001F339><U+0001F339><U+0001F339><U+0001F339><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D> Will comeback again
