The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I stayed here for an Active Escapes retreat and honestly it was such a treat! Room service is fantastic! Everything is squeaky clean. The rooms are spacious. I walked around barefoot most of the time. There was a pretty wide selection of food but I'm not sure if that was the usual hotel selection or if it was because of the retreat. Staff members were amazing and incredibly helpful!! Would definitely love to stay here again in the future.

Besakih: Beautiful temple BUT ... prepare to be scammed the whole way - from a way overpriced "compulsory" sarong (bring your own - get a cheap one somewhere else first), to the guide, bike ride, tourist shops, "must have" offerings kit, "orphans" selling postcards ... beautiful sights…
Sacred: Took a bag in but no food was very enjoyable experience.  Keepers feed monkeys and if you follow advice no issues.
Kuta: Watching the sunset from this beach was on my list of must-dos. I'd been hoping to be able to enjoy the moment and perhaps break away from all the hustle and bustle of the city, even if just for an hour. We'd intended to bring some cash to rent some chairs, but forgotten, so we…
Mount: Every climb is different, every sunrise is different but still absolutely beautiful! Definitely worth the climb!
Aling: The initial asking price was IDR 100k per person. We negotiated it down a little, but reading the other reviews it does seem that the lowest price was IDR 50K per person. Do take swimsuit and towels. Bring your slippers with you, the trail up and down the waterfall is rocky and…
Grandmas: Located in a prime location (legian street) which great for shopping and everything is near by, right from airport to famous restaurants. Only drawback is the size of the room. Toiletry and water cans will be replaced daily which I personally liked.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: for this period i stay here are too short . So for sure i will come back soon and stay here again .  If my friend want to visit Bali , I will recommend them to stay here.  So thank you to all staff in Radisson blu Uluwatu. To make my holiday to be a wonderful Holiday.  Thank you see you again

Besakih: Very beautiful temple and lots of amazing structures. You can experience the cultutand rituals of Balinese people. The temple is called mother temple as it is the biggest of the temples. The entry includes a guide and a motor bike one way drop also you need to wear Sarong to go…
Sacred: A keen stop off for hired drivers. 20 minutes is plenty, no matter how much you like monkeys, as they are all the same just different ages.
Kuta: Kuta beach was absolutely stunning. We rented a sun bed so we could relax on the beach. These women approached us, online I seen they get referred to as ‘aunties’. They offered us a massage at 50,000 IDR each which seemed reasonable for half an hours work. Then before we knew it…
Mount: Our driver picked us up at 1am from Seminyak to arrive to the place by 3am. We only had a demin jacket and shorts on this hike and it was FREEZING, we did not get warned about the temperature of this hike.. i highly recommend pants, jumper, long socks and good running shoes. The…
Aling: That place was just AMAZING! My boyfriend had bday that day, so our guide called them before. When we arrived we were splited. Me and my boyfriend went to see Aling Aling waterfall and then Went to try 10 m natural waterfall slide. It was a bit confusing for us why we were…
Grandmas: very clean, and very friendly. very helpful.  I reallay want to visit bali again. this hotel very reccoomed . thanks bali an dtahnak indonesia. thanks grandmas Plus Hotel lEGIAN. i HOPE ONEDAY i CAN VISIT  BALI AGAIN
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Radisson Blu. We spent 5 nights here & it was very relaxing . Our suite was spacious with a large deck , great views over the pool & sea . It was lovely sitting on the deck in the evening , enjoying the sunsets , watching all the wee boats come in & counting the continual stream of planes !  The staff were lovely & helpful ( Thanks Pika for so quickly sorting the overpayment ! ) , the pool was large with plenty of cabanas  & loungers to sit on . The staff came around frequently to take drink & food orders - the Iced Mint Lassi was so refreshing .  Large , varied breakfast buffets & great coffee . Dinner at night most enjoyable too in a lovely setting especially outside .  My only minor issue would be the relatively limited range of cocktails…

Besakih: I just spent 5 weeks here exploring beautiful Bali (coming from Portland, OR) and the so-called official workers at this holy temple are absolutely horrible, corrupt and antithetical to the temple experience and they should be dismantled from the tourism industry and barred from…
Sacred: Great experience!  If a guide helps you with the monkeys, takes pictures for you, and lets you feed them peanuts, show your gratitude and purchase the photos he offers. The price is nominal and the service he provides absolutely enriches your experience.
Kuta: This very crowded and difficult to relaxing but it was  awesome beach in the heart of Kuta. The waves were great and the location.
Mount: So I was totally unfit and under-dressed for this adventure... I walk regularly, do my steps... this is uphill climb for 3 hours (at my pace) be advised. On my defense: I have a bad knee but love to adventure!! So ...halfway up: I gave up. I was just gonna sit in the forest…
Aling: Hire a personal driver and went there by myself. Firstly i would like to say that, for first timers like me it was easy to locate and there is a foot path for u to follow without getting lost. It was raining today when i got there which was even better cos it wasnt that hot and…
Grandmas: The hotel was in the centre if Legian, within the walking distance of the bars, restaurant & clubs of the area.  The beach with walking distance, the hotel itself is 3 Star hotel, which should be given 5 star rating, service is superb, you when stay there, make sure you always get the breakfast, buffet breakfast is served with signature menu, selection of fours mains to choose for breakfast.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Radisson: We stayed here for our honeymoon and got the deluxe room. The room was on the ground floor and had a patio but didnt have a view. The room was spacious and had an epic bathroom. The pool and hotel was great. The Hotel breakfast and pool bar was amazing however the food at the Filini restaurant was terrible, both meals had a bucket of salt on each meal and we both got a little sick from it. You can walk out to the road and get great food for half the price. It was nice and quiet for a honeymoon.  Great place to stay for few days.

Besakih: the temple complex is so huge when we entered we were greeted by a person who introduced me to be the part of temple trust  and he informed he take us around and we obliged to it, He took us around the temple complex explaining the legend behind the temple, cultures and the…
Sacred: The monkeys and temples are a must see! Peaceful rainforest setting, monkeys everywhere! Some ornery, but most don’t care you’re there. Great stop!!
Kuta: We saw the sunset three days in a row and each time it was magical. Cold beers are available everywhere and the sand is clean
Mount: Just being here I could have just stayed here all day. Total bliss. The air up there and the view surrounding us, was all I needed.  I think I was almost the highest point and from where I sat, looking out at the volcano it was just breath taking. The feeling I got being there…
Aling: There are total 7 different waterfall in this area, and have different "level" of jumper :). You'll get addict to jump as you'll offered a 7 different level . Adventurer ? Jumper ? A Height Challenger ? You definitely need to come ! This place managed a local organization, and…
Grandmas: I am not a "city hotel" type of traveler so at first, I was a bit sceptical about grandmas. However due to its previous reviews, and location, I booked it anyway. Left all expectations at the door, turns out it more than just another hotel. Room is clean, hospitality is there, and the breakfast is to die for. Large selection buffet with free beautiful presentation of main course of your choice. I was surprised, literally. The best breakfast during my Bali roundtrip, even compared to the more expensive hotels I've stayed before here.  The other aspect is the staff. So friendly, communicative and attentive yet professional from the frontdesk, restaurant, to the housekeeping. Although I'd love to mention everyone but that man, Atmaja, whom I met during breakfast is the one who gave…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Loving this place, we are here 2 times in 6 months and will definitely be back soon! We love the architecture and the atmosphere of this hotel. It's a well maintained and modern hotel with a tinge of local culture.   As Architects, we enjoy our stay here very much, learning from the amazing detailing of this development.  Thank you Radisson Blu, Diego and team for making our stay here so memorable.

Besakih: We hired a private car with a driver/guide, thus able to avoid the negative experiences expressed by some of the TA members.  Foreign visitors pay a higher admission ticket than locals. This is not uncommon in developing countries. The admission ticket includes a 1 way ride to…
Sacred: The entrance fee is reasonably priced and the experience is wonderful. There are so many monkeys and seeing them just live in their natural habitat is so interesting and fun. The natural landscape is quite breathtaking as well, and there are many temples along the path.…
Kuta: We heard about how unclean this beach is but we found otherwise. Really nice atmosphere and also pretty sunset.
Mount: Watch out for locals trying to scam your money. We went for a late morning trek to avoid the sunrise crowd. Got stopped along the way by a local with an expired (2015) tour guide license claiming that we had to pay 600K idr to go up the mountain. Outrageous to try and scam…
Aling: bali traveling from the south end to the north .... can imagine? and after that I have to go down a path that is steep and still very natural. But all tired paid by the incredible beauty. Very fresh air, quiet atmosphere, a stretch of green forest, the water is cold and clear.…
Grandmas: Its a beautiful hotel located in a busy area. All areas of interest are closeby. Excellent connectivity to any part of Bali. The room is small but has all conveniences. Delicious breakfast is served with a large variety of Indonesian cuisine kudos to chef Suparma,Yuni and Devi. The stewards who served us were Ita,Atmaja,Yudiari and Dedi. Housekeeping staff who were ever willing to serve us happily were Agung and Pande. The engineering staff were quick to attend to any issues in our room. Check in/out was a breeze with Agung and Diki. Excellent guest relations executive in Yuliana, she organised for us to attend traditional balinese prayer offerings in traditional ethnic wear. Our kudos to her. Excellent spa exists at the hotel.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I love this resort. The staff are very friendly and super helpful. From the minute we walked in we felt like we were home. All the amenities are amazing. We booked with luxury escapes and we received all these complementary dinners, massages and cocktails. Well worth the money we paid. The food they serve at this resort is just faultless. The ocean view rooms are huge and the bathrooms are huge too. I would definitely stay here again. Excellent hotel. Love this resort.

Besakih: This is the largest temple in Bali, known as the mother temple. Some of the structures are made from lava rock and some from concrete. We had our own driver/guide who explained the culture and religious ceremonies to us.A lot of wild dogs roaming around looking for food. We had…
Sacred: Beautiful forest. There is not much to walk inside, a small temple. The monkeys come when the employee calls them. Not to be touched, they jump on you when the employee gives the monkeys snacks.
Kuta: We enjoyed the sunset and also the surfing lessons. our kids played in the sand and it was overal a very nice beach

Aling: i came to lovina on the 10th october and the local guides locals say it was closed due to a few death incidents happened lately...need people to verify on the closure matter...but the death incidents did happen on september...not recommending kids..
Grandmas: The rooms are lovely and clean and cleaned daily. A little on the small side but do have everything you need. The staff are super lovely and very helpful. Be aware that the hotel is on one of the busiest corners in Legian and gets quite noisy from about 5am Bali time, so sleeping in doesn’t really work.

I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Absolutely disappointed by this chain! Booked a room via booking.com for my honeymoon and a night before I was flying to Bali, I found out that my room was cancelled without even explaining the reason or sending an email about this. I entered my booking.com to check the address of the hotel and realized that the room was cancelled. When I called the hotel, the guy from the staff told me that they didn’t exchange the information about available rooms with booking.com properly and it was outdated, that’s why my reservation got cancelled.  I was totally shocked since nobody even sent me an email about this.   This is a shame for such a famous chain! Very disappointed. They just damaged my honeymoon.  Do not recommend to anyone.

Besakih: This was just one of many temples we visited in Bali, but the only one where we left feeling most defintely taken advantage of.   You park down the hill and the 'ticket' includes a short ride up the hill on the back of a motorbike  (that or walk!).  This was fine and even though…
Sacred: Up close with the monkeys worthwile attraction kids love it , Good value for money take plenty of photos
Kuta: At Kuta beach you can do everything: surf, body massage, back massage, rastas, tattoo, cut hear hair and so on. Lots of restaurants and drink services. Beach cleaning is not strong. One is been hassled by vendors.

Aling: Have visited here a few times with friends and the waterfall is always a magical sight, especially in the morning light. If there has been rain the expect to see it truly pumping.  Beware that it can rain upstream which can create flash flooding. Before descending from the…
Grandmas: Room is quite small but it is comfortable and clean, perfect services from all the staff, best location in center of Legian street, affordable price, free bicycle, only 100 m from Legian beach.  Cons : No balcony and swimming pool
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Radisson Blu in Uluwatu is a must experience. Located in remote quiet area. Very pristine hotel with amazing respectful staff. We stayed 4 days and were very impressed with this resort. Dinining here was similar to fine dining in 5 star restaurants. The pool and service around outdoor area was above expectations. Room service was outstanding with nightly turndown service which included pillow essential oil mist. Wonderful experience, thank you.

Besakih: We were with a private guide and driver from Destination Asia travelling from a hotel in the North to one in the South of Bali.  He was able to tell us all about the temple complex of 23 temples and the significance of all the colours.  It was a festival time when we visited so…
Sacred: Read visiting rules: hide all bottles, toys, glasses, food and watch your kids. Nice but small park. Take a map at the entrance to find a way
Kuta: Loved the waves and the sunset in Kuta was something to remember! Enjoyed every moment staying there... Surfing is one of the must-try things.
Mount: Mount batur sunrise hiking tour starts at 1-2am in midnight depending upon your hotel location from where driver pickups you and you reach at zero point around 3.30am. You should book a local guide a day before. Tracking starts at 3.30-4am. Total 5 km up and 5 km down. It takes…
Aling: Leave your health and safety hat at home for this one. It is spectacular scenery and the guide we had, Michael, was brilliant. It is a bit of a walk to get to the falls, but it is cool and there is soo much to see.  You can swim but those looking for more adventure can slide…
Grandmas: this place is absolutely fantastic, price, location and the staff are the most professionalism and genuinely compassionate that I've ever encountered. The rooms are very nice and the cleaning staff is absolutely the best I've ever encountered.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: My fiancé and I stayed at the Radisson just last week for 2 nights to prepare for our Bali wedding and we were truly impressed with the property itself, the architecture, service, the best Italian restaurant ever (Arya should get the best service award) and how value for money it was. Nothing to fault them for especially with the amount you pay, we are Radisson Blu gold members so you have perks like late checkout, free breakfast for 2, 15% off F&B etc which made our stay really value for money. Only issue was the rooms were pretty close to one another most with connecting rooms so it's easy to hear your neighbors.  Steven & Alison from Singapore

Besakih: We come here pretty late just after 4 so this place was not crowed at all.  Since we left the car locals wanted to sell us something. Reading lots of reviews I knew did not have to buy anything unless I want too.  They were really convinced and my friend nearly got the offering…
Sacred: If you are in Ubud, this is a must see. Very beautiful. Not big of a forest. It took us about half an hour to walk the whole forest. The monkeys are very cute but be careful with your belongings. We heard multiple stories that the monkeys can and will sniff out any food. So we…
Kuta: Spent a few hours here and the beach was fun other than all the trash on the beach. Hope they can start to clean it up soon!
Mount: Not a trek for the faint hearted. The views are spectacular and were a highlight of our Bali trip. The path to the top, especially the last third, is often difficult to climb. Scree underfoot makes walking treacherous - just as much so on the way down. Be sure to wear good…
Aling: This waterfall is so much fun! There is a natural waterslide and loads of places to jump off into the water (5m, 10m and 16m!). We were the only English people there, everyone else in our group was Balinese which was nice, not overrun by too many tourists taking selfies (lol).  …
Grandmas: This Hotel is located in an ideal spot, close to the beach, shopping and a variety of restaurants. Very clean accommodation and good sleep quality.  Rooms not very large, but adequate and very comfortable. Good WIFI reception.  Excellent breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Amazing resort,staff were fantastic,pool area great and rooms were huge! Good selection from restaurants and we loved the happy hour at all the bars! Massive king size bed which was the most comfortable bed we have slept in!

Besakih: I been there a few years ago  And now came back to show this  Beautiful temple to my Japanese friend. They ask us at the ticket counter where we are from... they expected my Japanese friend to pay for a guide even though no Japanese speaking guide was available and my Japanese…
Sacred: Ubud Monkey Forest (Mandala Suci Wenara Wana) is a reserve located at Padangtegal Ubud, Bali. There are hundreds of long-tailed Balinese macaques living in the forest. Here, you can observe the monkeys in their natural habitat and click many amazing photos. There are also three…
Kuta: amazing place, the waves are perfect for surfing and the people there are nice , many tourists and salesmen
Mount: Many companies organize a sunrise trekking with Breakfast to Mount Batur. The trek is moderately difficult, but the sunrise and views are simply amazing, which I think is the best part of Bali for me. You can see forests, lake, greenery, clouds, two active volcanoes from here.…
Aling: Aling Aling is a beautiful natural adventure for the whole family. it is only a 40 minute drive from our place Kubu Kusuma B&B Lovina.There is a entry fee of rp 100,000 this covers the cost of a private guide which you need to direct you  in the safest places to slide and jump…
Grandmas: I love the services provided by the staff at the hotel. The staff are so lovely and warm. Love the ambiance and the coziness of the hotel. Even though the room is quite small but it is comfortable and most importantly the staff make up the room everyday and always keep it clean. The hotel also has a great location which located only 5-10 minute away from the beach and nearby with convenient shops.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu, very nice quiet location, staff are excellent and facilities are fantastic. Rooms are spacious and spotless, with the pool and leisure / lounging areas well set out and wonderful. Staff are attentive but not over the top. We highly recommend this property.

Besakih: When we reached the entrance we paid 60,000 per person for the entrance fee which include renting the sarong and a tour guide. Our tour guide by the name Putu (which means the eldest child of the family) showed us around the temple giving us great explanation of how the temple…
Sacred: So worth the relatively low admittance price, cannot recommend enough. The monkeys are very interactive so keep your things close!
Kuta: Awesome beach in the heart of Kuta. The kids loved in here. The waves were great and the location awesome!
Mount: It can be a little tough because of the loose rocks, but the view is stunning! Expect loads of people climbing up with you (all the travel agencies offer the same tour at the same time), but once you get to the top, there's plenty of space to everyone to sit and contemplate the…
Aling: This is by far the best waterfall/pools in Bali. It is so beautiful and peaceful here. Aling Aling falls aren't actually that great but just walk a bit upstream from them and there is a small place called secret garden. It is truly amazing here. You can jump from 10m into the…
Grandmas: Firstly the staff at reception were super impressive !!! Such great customer service so welcoming which was lovely and they should be commended for this !!!!  The room is very basic which is to be expected for the price .. we didn’t stay the night as we had a late flight and only needed a pl w for the day for our bags and a shower but laid on the beds and they were super comfy !!!!  Shower good pressure and body wash and shampoo in a dispenser.  No pool or balcony but great location .. “YES SPA” a few doors down great for hair wash and mani/ pedi before flying home.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: If you want luxury and seclusion then this is it. We stayed in a suite and had the most amazing ocean view. The pool is great and there is a gym as well as free yoga classes. There is nothing to fault at this hotel and we will definitely return.

Besakih: We visited these temples as suggested by our resort on a trip to the volcanos.  However you do feel that you are getting ripped off from every angle. Even visiting the grotty toilets will cost you.  The temples are very much the same and it's a bit of a concrete jungle.  There…
Sacred: Very nice and big place. We stayed there few hours watching the monkeys, taking photos and walking around. Friendly customer service.
Kuta: If you enjoy being harassed then Kuta beach is the place for you! Literally every second person will yell out to you offering braiding, massages surfing or ice cold beers. This is definitely not a relaxing beach vibe. Even after dark, you cannot enjoy an evening stroll. This is…
Mount: When we landed we then realised we have to pay kind of tax to be on that road as well as we have to eat in the resturant to see the peak and take pics else the ladies would surround you till you order. However nice place to spend on.
Aling: I went several time with different friends and I never got bored with it. The view is amazing, the water is so fresh and clean, and Panca, our local guide, is also a really nice boy from the village. I to go there again in near future. Love.
Grandmas: Breakfast is chancing every day. Place is central for beach and shopping. A lot of restaurants in 5 minutes walk. Small rooms but very practical. Elivator to the floors. Still wonder why there is no 4th floor.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Check-in proofed to be rather complicated as the employee wasn’t able to articulate that 1) paying a deposit is optional and 2) that is more a credit than a deposit which you get to use throughout the hotel for drinks, food etc.   Rooms are spacious, pool area is generous and rarely crowded (even on busy days it wasn’t noisy due to the layout) and spa is nicely set out. Breakfast was disappointing as well as the quality of the rest of the food. Felt like the hotel was saving on good chef and quality ingredients.  Also due to local taxi companies owning certain areas in Uluwatu it was difficult to leave as well as get back to the hotel without being totally ripped off.  We expected an international hotel to follow international processes which it didn’t seem to. In addition we…

Besakih: From the minute you arrive expect to shell out IDR .... parking moped, hiring a wrap, entrance ticket, entrance guide, offering to the Hindu gods, postcards from the little girls !!!!!!  It felt endless.   The temple itself is a large complex and you do need a guide to…
Sacred: We visited here as part of the full day Baki Tour. The monkeys are in the wild, sort of.  They are fed by humans and they are totally use to being around humans. That said, they may take your glasses or anything else they’re interested in. We watched attendants retrieve a pair…
Kuta: Coincidentally were there when there was a traditional kite festival taking place, good fun to watch whilst enjoying the sunny Kuta beach!
Mount: Tip: use a guide (we fully recommend Bazir +62 877 60381082 - available on WhatsApp)   After a painful 1am alarm, with a few beers the night before and half way up the Volcano, I questioned whether it was all worth it. Even at 5am when we’d reached the summit I was concerned…
Aling: If you're planning to take the dolphin tour in Lovina Bali, and still don't know what to visit afterwards, go to Aling-Aling Waterfall. It's located in Desa Sambangan, Buleleng, so it would not take you more than an hour to get there from Lovina. But if you're going from…
Grandmas: First of all, i would like to commend the staffs at Grandmas Plus Legian. They are the true gems of this property. Before I even booked this hotel, i knew that the rooms are not that huge but suprisingly it was not that bad. Considering the price of around USD 45 for 2 nights including daily breakfast.  You can always say that the room is small and windows doesnt look existent but hey, this hotel is clean and comfy. It is also located near everything. Restaurants, shops, beach mall, money exchange, a good 5 to 10 minutes walk from the beach. The best part is the breakfast...not too fancy and not a buffet. But the selection of set menus are more than enough to satisfy your morning cravings.  Upon check in, they gave us complimentary welcome juice which is very refreshing.…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Our family of four (including 2 children aged 10 and 11) had a Luxury Escapes package. We found our stay at Radisson Blue to be excellent. Everything about our experience was 5 star - the rooms, the service, the pool, the food and drink offerings and the architecture of the resort were all lovely. The location is also excellent, with plenty of shops, cafes and beaches at your doorstep. Although the resort is very up market and modern, it somehow still seems to retain the charm of Bali, largely thanks to the friendly and attentive staff. I would love to come back.

Besakih: This is not photoshot  place!!!! This is not for your fake super model selfies point.if you are into all those things dont go there. If you are into history if you like Balinese  culture gods religion history yes this is the place. Biggest temple in bali with for all their God…
Sacred: Can’t visit Bali without this experience! The monkeys were very friendly and loved seeing them in their natural (as can be) state. Very shocked at their level of intelligence.
Kuta: Love the atmosphere here. The surf is good, the sand is clean and there are vendors selling cold beers, no complaints!
Mount: If you choose to treck-up in the morning for surrise it is worth it, every bit. Word of caution: Unless you are used to trecking not advisable to the sunrise treck. The darkness and the terrain makes it tough. There are motorbikes available on demand enroute if you cannot…
Grandmas: Stayed a couple of nights here for a quick stop off. The rooms are clean and functional. The beds are comfortable. The location is at a busy road junction and so it is quite noisy in the room we had. The air con is not really powerful enough for the room so it was a little too warm. If it's value for money you want then this hotel is ok
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: What an amazing resort! Everyone was so friendly and was an amazing getaway to just do absolutely nothing. The resort had everything I needed and was amazed by everything the resort had to offer. Would 110% go back over when I get the opportunity.

Besakih: This temple is totally ruined by the local mafia. The government has changed things in the past but the people are still aggressive and very unfriendly. The temple is only used to pull money out of your pocket.   I advise you not to go to this temple. This temple is ruined by…
Sacred: Based on reviews, we opted to arrive right at 8:30, and were so glad we did for a few reasons. It was easy to purchase tickets (no line, credit cards accepted). We were the first ones in, and therefore we had an unfettered view of the sanctuary and monkeys. We were there alone…
Kuta: one can enjoy the beach with morning to evening. try to get the hotel near beach so that  you can move everywhere easily.
Mount: We didn't take the sunrise trek so we somehow managed to miss the "mafia" in the morning (8:30 ish AM) They managed to get us on the way back though, we were shouted at and threatened, he even suggested that we should go back to the top and spend the week there as a punishment<U+0001F602>…
Grandmas: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is clean, and the staffs are very friendly. The location also quite good, surrounded by local shop or resto. Just one minus, the road near that area is one way, so if you miss the lobby, then you have to turn again. But overall this hotel is value for money , especially for short visit
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I truly enjoyed my 4 nights stay. The room was very spacious and clean. I stayed in ocean view room  which had tiny ocean view but it was still great. The swimming pool is huge and I think it will great for family. The gym was great with great atmosphere. I will love to come back stay here next time.

Besakih: It is  far from touristic centers like Ubud, Kuta but if you have time and like temples it is good for you.The biggest temple in Bali and ancient one.There were many temples (seven terraces the guide told us) that beautiful, clean and with flowers. Actually I liked it a lot…
Sacred: Have been here 5 times Love the scenery  So much to look at & experience   If you’re scared of the monkeys go in the afternoon when they’ve been fed all day & just stay away from them  Don’t put your hands in your pockets or carry bags as they think you have food   I’m not…
Kuta: There are many other beaches in Bali that are much better than here. But this is one of, if not the most, the easiest to reach for tourists. Surrounded by restaurants, malls, hotels, may get overcrowded at times. Still  beautiful but I prefer other more quiet beaches in southern…
Mount: Mount Batur is a renowned hiking place and is popular for sunrise. This is by far the biggest tourist trap and the price range for hiking is as low as 100 000 Ruppiah to as high as 1500 000 Ruppiah depending on how would like to get cheated. A local person briefed me about this…
Grandmas: Stayed for 2 Nights (05-OCTOBER). The staff were very hospitable. Greeted us with a smile to make you feel comfortable. I like the ambiance of the Hotel as its modern with the touch of nature. Location is very good. A lot of restaurants and 5 Minute walk to the beach.   Breakfast - they have a separate menu that they change everyday. This is good as you won't get bored on the food. They will serve you local cuisine. Kindly note that Indonesian wants heavy breakfast. Asian People love this as we are used in eating rice at morning.   We requested for a Quiet Room- they gave it to us. I only noticed that rooms aren't sound proof. You can hear the noise from outside. If they can  improve this one, it will be very helpful.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Great - beds, breakfast, dinner options, tanning place, and really great service. There isn’t really much I can say that hasn’t been said, I’ll be definitely be come back here again..they treat you like royalty! :-)

Besakih: This is a site we planned to visit in Bali because it was the biggest in Bali.    They should regulate the guides with the price of admission.   After purchasing the ticket, I was approached by a girl with a basket handing me the offering in a yellow bag.  She was telling me…
Sacred: It is bit expensive in comparison to other attractions here but fully recommend it. Monkeys seem to be happy as well ;)
Kuta: Beach is OK, nice to watch the sunset and the waves here are epic I can see why this is perfect for surfers! The beach itself isn't the best! Not as bad as other reviews I have seen, I would say need actual beach beds/chairs and shade umbrellas for the public, also the constant…
Mount: Mount Batur was on my “to do” list in Bali and I managed to get it from our hotel paying only 350k. I was first told 1500k by a private driver, then 800k from the same company. Our hotel had a good deal with them so it was not a bad price. The driver was on time, got there at 3…
Grandmas: I lost my handbag beside the hotel (parkingplace for motorbikes) and two guests who was living in this hotel found my bag (open) outside by a motorbike, who was parking beside the sidewalk. They took care of my bag, wrote a letter to me and put it in the "box" of this motorbike. They thoght it was my bike. The nice Staff on the reception and the nice  Manager helped me as much as they could. I went out again to the parkingplace and there stood a man with my letter in his hand. Went back with the letter to the reception and one of the staff called the guests in the room. They came down and gave me my bag back. Such lovley people we need more of - thank you so much dear Louisa and Ashot. And again thank you Grandmas Plus Hotel Legian. :-) I will recommend this hotel to my friends…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Amazing staff, very friendly and extremely helpful. Beautiful big rooms, with huge bath and rain head showers. We had a room with a view of the ocean and a balcony. The food was very good, especially the breakfast. Excellent location

Besakih: We visited in April 2018 towards the end of a period of ceremonies and it was very interesting to see all the worshippers attending and making offerings. At this time the temple complex was very busy. The location is quite impressive with Mt Agung in the background still gently…
Sacred: This is a fantastic experience to walk amongst the monkeys and watch them interact and go about their day.
Kuta: there’s too many vendors who will keep asking you to buy from them etc. we just wanted to walk by the beach and we couldn’t enjoy it because they keep walking beside us and keep offering braids, dress, drinks etc. maybe if you want to learn how to surf, this is your area. now if…
Mount: The view points offer great views of both the volcano and the lake. There are several hawkers around selling souvenirs and clothes at really cheap prices.
Grandmas: this hotel is located in the center of legian. The front desk employees are very well spoken and cooperative.   The best thing about this budget hotel is the breakfast because their breakfast is worth every penny as they have the option for both English and Balinese breakast.  rooms are quite small but this hotel won't dissapoint you if you are planning stay spend most of your time outside the hotel and you just need a clean room to sleep in after a tiring day.  I would definitely visit grandma's in my next visit to bali.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: I stayed at Radisson Blu with a friend for my second trip to Bali and it was one of the best resorts I've ever visited. The staff were amazing, both friendly and helpful. The service was top notch and the breakfast buffet was delicious! I was also very impressed with the on-site bars and restaurants which all catered for my dietary requirements. I would recommend the Radisson to anyone travelling to Bali and am already looking forward to my next visit.

Besakih: We were very fortunate to discover the Pura Agung Besakih has reopened after the November 2017 eruption of Mount Aguing. This Hindu temple is one of the most impressive temples in Bali. It should not be missed. To do all 9 levels of the temple you may need a entire day to do it.…
Sacred: The Sacred Monkey Forest was so much fun!  I had no idea we would be in such close proximity to the monkeys but we had no issues with aggressive or violent primates.  A monkey did jump on my husband’s back (he was wearing a backpack) and managed to steal our bug lotion out of a…
Kuta: Surprisingly, We went to the beach most days during our holiday. It was fantastic! Very clean, great places to sit. Some chairs were also areas supporting sellers who offered cold drinks! Of course, there are sellers that approach, but they were friendly. Loved it!
Mount: An early start! 1am pick up but the views were worth it. The guides are brilliant they are full of information about the area plus they get you up and down safely. You will be picked up from your hotel in an air conditioned car and driven to the base for coffee and pancakes.…
Grandmas: We stayed at Grandmas Legian for 5 nights recently and the staff made our experience a dream. The cheap price meant the room was a bit smaller than other hotels, but when you’re on holiday you want to get out of the hotel and explore Bali anyway! The location was central and convenient, close to the beach and shops, easy to get to from the airport and with a lot of taxis passing through. Kuta Beach is just a 5 minute walk down the road and Beachwalk Shopping Centre is a 20 minute walk with many stalls to haggle with on the way.   Just next door are Bella Italia and Rehat Spa, a great Italian restaurant and the #1 ranked spa in Legian on TripAdvisor. The hotel also felt very safe and all the amenities worked perfectly, with the cool air con a blessing after a hot day and awesome…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Nice new hotel settled in a good location with great facilities, competent staff, service and delicious food. All the restaurants from breakfast to dinner are highly recommended. Good value for money. All the family love it.

Besakih: Besakih (Baisakhi in Sanskrit) Temple, probably the biggest in Bali is an interesting place to visit. The traditional Balinese architecture coupled with the traditional Balinese way of Hindu worship has an aura, reminding the knowledgeable visitors of the great good old times of…
Sacred: We were advised to take a visit and we did we were dropped there by our hotel and walked back. Definitely worth a visit.
Kuta: Kuta beach is very good place for relaxing.not a very big beach and not very crowded.nice view.location is very good.
Mount: Our family of 4 did an exhilarating trek up Mt Batur to see the sunrise. We woke up @ 2 am to drive 2 hrs to the bottom of the trek. We started the trek @ 4am & reached the summit @ 6am, well in time to see an awesome sunrise. The trek itself is difficult & one has to be…
Grandmas: I had a pleasant stay here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They responded to our requests professionally. The location was also real awesome, only five minutes walk to the beach!!! And the most important thing, the price was very reasonable with super amazing service. Def. will stay here again
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Great value for your money, i do not have one negative thing to say about this hotel. Great facilities, good gym, hairdresser, spa etc. Very clean and new looking with large rooms and beautiful interior. Great service and very good breakfast. Also located well in Uluwatu, quite close to restaurants and beach clubs etc. I want to go back as soon as i can. Also we had a late flight home, but no problem cause we got to borrow the spa bathroom to shower and change etc. Very clean and comfortable. Hope to be back soon.

Besakih: We hired a driver through Balicab and he was great. On the approach to the temple, he told us we had to pay  IDR60,000 for entry which included a sarong. We will be hassled by others selling sarongs, offerings, guides etc but to ignore them all. Boy, was he right, but we did…
Sacred: Well signposted route around the sanctuary. The monkeys were being fed at sites all around the park. Impressive river valley. One of our members was bitten by a monkey , probably better not to hang around in crowds of human visitors.
Kuta: One of the most convenient place to watch sunset on a beach. It’s super crowded. Great place for beers, picnic and especially people who wants to learn surfing since the waves are still not as scary compare to others. It comes with many restaurants and little shops for shopping…
Mount: Great and impressive view of the volcano with the volcano. We went where based on the guides recommendation on a trip to Ubud. We arrived with a perfect sky free view and 10 minutes later the Volcano was covered.
Grandmas: The location is central to everything, the room although small was clean &  maintained well by Sanjaya who made towel animals to greet us when we returned. From the moment we arrived at the Grandmas we were greeted by the smiling and friendly staff and got to know them over the 19 days we stayed there. The reception staff were amazing and helpful - to be greeted by lovely smiles every day made my day. Thank you Ana and your team Agung, Yulia, Aris, Diki and Faisal(such a character). Breakfast was great made even better by the friendly happy staff Atmaja,Yudi(your wonderful),Ita, Dedi, I have not listed all names but you all made us feel very special and part of your family. We look forward to returning to stay with you.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: This is my favourite hotel in the world and I try to visit it whenever I visit Southeast Asia. The staff are all fantastic from the moment you arrive on the property: concierge, reception, housekeeping, restaurant staff and therefore clearly the combination of the management and the Indonesian culture sets an example that's difficult to beat.

Besakih: The "Mother" Temple(s) are located on the slopes of Mount Agung, Bali`s highest volcano (active). The temples are up to/over 800 years old and the architecture is amazingly precise and enduring. A significant religious site, be sure to bring clothing to cover your legs (this…
Sacred: This is the place you must visit while you arround in Ubud. Recommended this place but please makesure your important thing  is not show while you take picture with the monkey. Heheh
Kuta: Spent two weeks with friends in kuta and spent a number of days walking along the beach and swimming. The beach is not a smooth sandy beach but more of a rough grain sand with lots of washed up broken coral.   If you walk down to Legion and Seminyak the sand is finer and easier…
Mount: We (2 girlfriends and I) did the climbing in April. We get up at 2am and  started at 3 am, in the midst of the night. It was heavy stuff but some guides helped us. It was really breathtaking the moment the sun came up at 6am and the moon still at the other side.
Grandmas: Stayed there for 4 nights, the hotel location is very good which makes everything you want such as restaurants, cafes, shops, bars and the beach are nearby. The staff are very friendly and helpful as well.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Spent the majority of our Honeymoon at the Radisson Blu, after getting a luxury escapes package deal. We had the best time ever, with lovely staff, rooms, food and exceptional views. The variety of food and beverage options (2 restaurants and 3 bars) meant that sitting by the pool all day was a delight. The on site spa was fantastic (very professional day spa therapists). Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for relaxation and luxury at an affordable price.

Besakih: An underwhelming “temple” that isn’t worth a 2+ hour drive from Seminyaki. The architecture can perhaps be considered somewhat inspiring but this takes second-fiddle to the swathes of locals ripping you off at EVERY opportunity imaginable!   Never have I been to a place…
Sacred: Amazing place with amazing energy! Definitelly going back! Had a lot of fun with the mokeys and took amazing photos!
Kuta: Kuta Beach has most things to make a Beach great. Very Long walks in the sand where you have wiew to many things. Good watersports and surfing if you want to try learning. You have little waves and Bigger if you want. Many places to chill out and get a drinken the Sun
Mount: Beautiful views and location. We couldn't do tracking due to leg problem but gorgeous area of into that. We sat at top and was amazed. Only downside like kuta beach, you get swarmed by sellers which didn't take no for answer.
Grandmas: We're back! We stayed here 6 months ago & just chose Grandmas again for our recent holiday (from 10 - 18 Sep 2018). Price was affordable, room was a bit small but comfy. The staffs have a very good attitude & fast response. Free valet parking for car for any room types & hair dryer was given by request. The location is very strategic. It is near ATM, minimarkets, cafes, restaurants, massage place, laundry (if you don't want to do it at the hotel), etc. Wifi is good. For breakfast, they will give you choices of menu & you will wait for them to serve it at the table. Well, they also serve the buffet, usually it consists of salad, cereal, breads & jam, porridge, fried rice, potato wedges. But it may change depends on the hotel management I think. We wanted to try other hotel, but…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Sophisticated. Large rooms. Magnificent friendly professional staff. Excellent location  Fresh treats delivered daily to the room. Great water pressure for showers. Nothing was lack lustre. Very polished.

Besakih: Temple with 50 temples inside compex...shiva temple, vishna temple and brama temple is main temple. This is on 1000 metar abive the sea, under mountain volcano Agung. Very piecefull place, place with some good energy. You must see!
Sacred: There are Monkeys all around...They sometimes like to play with you...safe though. Dont feed the monkeys and dont disturb them they are used to human beings and are curious like small children..may like to check out your bags and carry on for eatables or something to play with.…
Kuta: Kuta Beach is on the western side of the island's narrow isthmus. It's considered Bali's most famous beach. Good to see and relax
Mount: You will ideally climb it to enjoy the sunrise. Depends from where you  are starting but it should take you 1.5 to 2 hours.  Once you reach the summit usually your guide will give you breakfast while waiting for the show to start.  If you intend to climb a few more volcanoes in…
Grandmas: Worth every penny to stay here..location is very good..super duper friendly staff...breakfast is normal...room is very big..my aircorn broke down(cannot be help n u know what? They come in less than 1 min..n keep apologies..which i feel superb workers with superb attitude of them to assist..awesome !!!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: First time staying in Uluwatu, Radisson Blu did not disappoint!  Before arriving they confirmed our reservation and airport pick up.Hotel beautiful every thing clean and new.  Rooms amazing, clean and spacious with a large balcony with a lounge, bathroom huge with seperate shower, toilet and full size bath.  Staff professional and friendly.  Stayed with Luxury escapes, massages easy to book in on day and fabulous, food amazing catered for gluten and dairy free even had a seperate gluten free corner at breakfast.  Loved Indonesian food at Artichoke restaurant ended up eating there every night! Even arrange transportation to our next destination at reasonable price. Very relaxing stay, would definitely revisit and recommend

Besakih: Besakih is known as the Mother Temple of Bali and is simply the most important temple for the whole of the island. It's actually more like a complex of temples in one very large compound and its known and loved for is its dramatic location on the southern slopes of Sacred Mount…
Sacred: Pretty average, give it a miss unless u have nothing to do. But typical Bali tourist stuff, so this review is probably meaningless
Kuta: We had great time at the Kuta beach first day we witness the release of the water turtles into the ocean was amazing   The the next day after a long day in Bali we went to the beach and enjoy an amazing sunset swim most beautiful sunset ever
Mount: We booked private tour with bazir, it was worth it.  The view is amazing, we could see the moon on the other side as the sun rise. And Mt agung and rinjani are really really beautiful..  After mt batur we went to the hot springs (its not that hot though, i'd say lukewarm…
Grandmas: The rooms were small but comfortable. Breakfast is good and the person Yudi was very helpful. The front desk folks were very pleasant and always ready to help. Close to the beach and to the restaurants.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: we stayed here for 4 nights in June. staff were so helpful and friendly, everyone always saying hello and wanting to help. felt very comfortable here, so happy. great restaurants, loved the food by the pool as well and cocktails, always amazing. gym was pretty good as well, was nice. room was great, loved the bathroom and shower, the lighting was great. balcony was great view of the cliffs, loved the chocolates everyday. thanks so much, we will definitely come back!

Besakih: If you are exhausted of all overcrowded temples in Bali, go to Pura Besakih and go there now. As people are afraid of Agung volcano after it spewed out some ashes in November 2017, you should enjoy being one of just few human beings there. That makes such difference!..
Sacred: Brilliant trip to the Monkey Forest. It was lovely to see them all running around in their natural habitat. There were staff on hand to capture amazing photos too. There was also a blind monkey, and one who had an injury, which were housed separately to keep them safe and given…
Kuta: One of the closest beach to Kuta , surrounded with shopping places. And its clean . You can enjoy sunset here ,If you reside in Kuta
Mount: Awesome views from viewing point and some restaurants. You will be harrassed by local people selling their goods though - harrassed might be a mild word. You can get Bali souvenirs very cheaply here. Awesome place to visit, a must see in Bali.
Grandmas: The rooms were little small but comfortable. the breakfast was good and the person Yudi would go out of the way to help. The front desk always eager to help the guests and the whole experience was very pleasent.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed in June 2019 for 5 nights in a suite upgrade.  This Luxury Escapes package was excellent. The breakfasts were sumptuous, the cocktails and happy hours inviting and the spa was excellent (but expensive like most 5 star resorts). The suite with large balcony was outstanding - spacious, light & airy with a great view. The staff were also happy, professional & friendly.  Special thanks to Diego (the Food & Beverages Manager) and his excellent staff, particularly Olla, Arya, Widi and Adit.  Obviously many more could be mentioned but it is hard to keep track of all the names when so many were excellent.  The bathroom amenities were high quality. The restaurants offered good menus at reasonable prices.  We particularly liked the Filini menu.  We would happily recommend this…

Besakih: We hired a driver to take us from Benoa to various locations in Bali for the day, the locations included Kerta Gosa pavilion, Pura Besakih Temple, and the Ubud monkey sanctuary.  We cautioned our driver that we only wanted to go to Besakih if it was safe; he assured that it was.…
Sacred: Warm greetings and smiles as I walked up.. Even the security in the parking area greeted and smiled..  A very clean and modern venue.. Combined with the forest.. A family outing for sure.. And several areas where tourists could watch and observe the monkeys doing their thing.. A…
Kuta: A nice end to the day and some very entertaining ‘people watching’. Fend off the hawkers and enjoy the sunset with a Bintang and some bbq sweet corn.
Mount: Great! If you have time to hike mountaint, please visit mount batur at kintamani bali ! This is an active volcanos in bali.. very very adrenaline fight
Grandmas: It was small room but very reccomended hotel for me. If you want to stay just for sleepand explore more in Bali, this hotel is very good choice. The breakfast was so good and the cleanness is good. I'm very enjo my self to stay here and i woul love to stay in here again if i back to Bali.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: A beautiful resort located close to Uluwatu with excellent facilities. Spacious room with large balcony, views to the ocean, beautiful linen and towels. Good choice of restaurants.  The Italian restaurant Filini offered great food and service -  highly recommend. Beautiful swimming pool. Friendly and helpful staff.

Besakih: You can’t not come here. It’s the biggest, oldest and grandest of Bali’s temples. We were fortunate enough to visit during the month-long ceremony in April, with the complex awash in gold, white, red and black parasols and flags. To see and hear thousands of people worshipping…
Sacred: What can I say...this place is brilliant and the other reviews say it all really. Top tip...go early to avoid the crowds.
Kuta: We went here and took some surfing lesson which was super fun and also a great experience. The sunset was a bit covered by clouds but still nice
Mount: My partner and myself booked a private tour with Bazir following reviews we had seen on trip advisor. We paid 1,500,000 IDR for the both of us. Bazir’s father picked us up from our hotel bang on time at 2.30am. We drove for around 1 hour to the meeting point. Bazir actually goes…
Grandmas: It’s a cheap hotel, but very clean , great friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds and   Efficient air conditioning. The rooms are small, but you are in Bali and won’t be spending much time here. If you are on a tight budget , this is the place to stay. We only stayed the night for a stopover before heading to the islands , but would definitely stay here again . Was a bit concerned by the price when we booked , much better than some other places we have stayed , but this was so cheap . Was given a lovely drink on arrival
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Immaculate and gorgeous property with beautiful and attentive staff - testament to the incredibly warm and gracious nature of the Balinese people.   Contradictory to negative opinions about cleanness in this resort -  it is a spotless clean everywhere. Food good but not exceptional.  Never problem of finding table at breakfast. Whole complex well designed with excellent craftsmanship, good materials and finishes.  Rooms clean, modern, good sized and well equipped but unfortunately with paper thin walls so earplugs could be very handy.  Being only 4 stories high rooms are easily accessed by elevators (in every corner of the complex) plus wide stairways.   Beautiful swimming pool surrounded by white stone steps which complementing the looks giving it a character of Roman…

Besakih: pictureperfect for the selfie loving people. nice well maintaned gardens and clean grounds. try to go early to avoid the crowds
Sacred: Really enjoyed our visit - the monkeys were very cute and fun to watch - just do t look them in the eye!!! The surrounds are beautiful.  We went about 11am and it was busy with tourists.
Kuta: The place is crazy in terms of crowds and traffic! Even when you are on way , near kuta the traffic turns wierd, people breaking traffic laws and driving crazy, parking for cars is a task . Taxis are numerous and fake blue taxis are too much be careful! I literally saw two fake…
Mount: We booked the trek through our villa and I am glad we did. Talking to a few people at the top, it sounded like they took the cheap option and that is exactly what they got! Our guide picked us up from the villa and then we drove to the base of the volcano. It was early in the…
Grandmas: Dear Grandmas Plus Legian Hotel - Bali,  Good day from Jakarta! Well, First of all.. I booked Grandmas Plus Legian from end of March 2018, and I stayed there last week for 4 days and 3 night. Below is my Score to Grandmas Plus Legian :  - Hotel Grandmas Plus: The hotel is very clean, and very comfortable. feels like I always in the room. My favorite one was my bed covers and my towels are always change with new ones everyday. Score : 9/10  - Staffs: Really Friendly Staffs, always on-time once I need something. Also, the security guard was very polite and friendly. Their English Language really good! So for everyone, especially foreigner who want to stay in this Hotel, you'll not have a problem with Language. Thank you to mba Julia who always answer my questions regarding the…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Radisson uluwatu was a awesome place to stay, either for business and leisure. Large pool, big and nice room, awesome service from all staff member, the food was great personaly i like the mie laksa from aristocrat resto. everything was awesome, great job team!!

Besakih: This is a very impressive complex but you have to be determined not to be ripped off by someone during your visit.  You will have to bring your own sarong or buy one we didn't see any free ones.  Your entry fee includes a guide and a free scooter transfer up to the temple -…
Sacred: Great outing to see the Monkeys and the Temple. Be sure not to wear anything that stands out or carry any food, as the monkeys are very good at grabbing items from you.  Forest is well kept and there are hundreds of Monkeys.
Kuta: I really loooove this beach with its nice clean sand and friendly local vendors. The sunset here is magical
Mount: Don't bother if not going to be a clear at the top. Got with a tour agency, get picked up early (2am) at hotel and drive to nearby mt batur and have breakfast and given water then drive on to the start point (Have to pay a little to use the gross toilets). Have a guide up the…
Grandmas: This is the perfect place for a 1 or 2 night stop over between other places. Very small one bedroom but the bed was sooo comfy. The bathroom was very small too with no ventilation. The free breakfast choices were not great either I definitely think that can be improved. Staff all very lovely though :)
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Most of the guests seem to be on a Luxury Escape break which is really good value and seems a regular on the site.  As the hotel is very new everything is in good condition and there are plenty of sun beds and cabanas around the pool.  The staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful although housekeeping could be improved (times are inconsistent and bits are missed).    The hotel isn’t very near any shops or restaurants so unless you’re prepared to get taxis everywhere you’re stuck with what’s on offer at the hotel.  The food isn’t fantastic and there’s room for improvement but the staff more than make up for it.  There’s only a few items there’s a surcharge for with the Luxury Escapes vouchers.  The hotel is also quite remote for other attractions in Bali so it’s much more…

Besakih: We hired a private driver for the day that took us to the temple. He first took us to a shop that wanted 1,000,000IDR for us to buy 2 sarongs! We said no and the lady was very aggressive and we ended up hiring them for 500,000IDR!  We got to the ticket office and paid 60,000IDR…
