Sacred: This is not like a typical zoo in the US.  This is truly a monkey sanctuary where you are walking in their domain.  They are free to run and jump everywhere around you and run along with you as you stroll through the beautiful grounds.  Luckily none of the monkeys climbed on us,…
Kuta: The beach has been cleaned up very well. We had a good day out and enjoyed the romantic sunset. Many bars also serve cold beers. Definitely a good place to visit when in Bali
Mount: Fantastic scenery and serene atmosphere.  Great people and lots to see. The weather changes very quickly as you ascend towards the mountain region and sudden rain showers can be expected.  There are lots of stalls on the street selling fruits and souvenirs as well as clothes and…
Grandmas: This place was very clean and comfy, rooms are small but have everything you need in them. Shower was very good also. The staff were extremely efficient and welcoming.   Only thing I’d say is that it wasn’t made clear that this hotel is in Kuta and not Seminyak. However it turned out we preferred the beach in Kuta anyway.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed as part of a Luxury Escapes 5-night package & chose the Suite upgrade.  This was well worth the extra money for the bigger room with balconies. The resort was excellent & ranked up with the best - we have been to many Bali resorts and would definitely return to this one. Like most Bali resorts, the staff were the standout experience.  The restaurants both provided excellent food at a reasonable price and the staff always provided excellent service. Special thanks to Diego the Food & Beverages Manager and his staff, especially Widi, Arya, Adit & Olla. We used the spa twice but found it to be expensive (but provided a good service). We would highly recommend this package.

Besakih: I would recommend this to anyone. It is an amazingly beautiful temple field with some of the kindest people. Some friends I met their brought me into their homes, fed me and clothed me. Their kindess is something i will never forget, my one friend even directed me back to my…
Sacred: I enjoyed visiting the sanctuary and learning more about the Balinese culture and history of the sanctuary.  We visited around 1pm and had no issues with the animals.  The monkeys did not pose any trouble and mainly stayed away unless you broke the rules, for example chasing…
Kuta: Our kids loved playing here and we also enjoyed walking on the beach. We saw the beautiful sunset and we will return for sure.
Mount: The driver was at our lobby 15 mins before schedule , we were staying in Ubud only so we started at 2.30 am. The driver was extremely courteous who drove us safely.  Keep some change handy using the bathroom costs : IDR 5000, you can rent a jacket for IDR 50000. Incase you need…
Grandmas: Been there even 2 years ago same period. The Hotel is very well located right between Legian and Semiyak, just minutes away from Legian Beach and also from the disco and pubs area. Staff very gentle and caring, everything very clean, breakfast a little poor but at a very reasonable price. Rooms a bit small, mine this time had no wardrobe, but okay if for a short stay. It also has a very good Spa connected called Rehat, right next door. I think the rooms are too small for a long stay and I didn’t like the totally opened common areas in every floor.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: It was peaceful, beautiful with attentive staff and great meals. For some quiet relaxing island life....without all the hub bub of the beach, surfers etc. the room and amenities were great and would stay again

Besakih: Our private taxi and driver was a little reluctant to take us to this temple, as the drive is not easy and it's a little out of the way. But this was the highlight of my visit to Bali.These are a beautiful cluster of temples, with a beautiful setting. Don't miss it!
Sacred: Loved it here, there are litterally monkeys everywhere. I was a bit nervous about them jumping all over me but think if you follow the rules you will be fine. Did see a few dive on people but from what I saw it was the tourists own fault.
Kuta: The beach was the best we have seen it in many years a lot of effort has gone into cleaning it up. You are still pestered by the hawkers offering a range of products .
Mount: We didnt want to get up for the morning trek with kids so we visited from Seminyak on a day trip. The resturant was very nice and traditional Indonesian with Western options. Views of the Volcano were great. Make sure you go before 2pm as the cloud sets in and hides the volcano.
Grandmas: Very good hotel, value to money is excellent. I loved the Interior Design, Location, Cleanliness, Scooter Parking, Spa, Italian restaurant, nice staff. The location was amazing, in the middle of everywhere. very clean & nice basic breakfast.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The pool area was fantastic for kids with a great shallow area for them to play on. Ate several times at the hotel, food was good, breakfast was great and worth including when you book accommodation. All staff were very friendly and tried to make you feel welcome.

Besakih: Beautiful temple set in stunning surroundings, but be aware that everyone there is going to try to rip you off. The entrance fee of 60k pp supposedly includes a local tour guide and sarong if you need one. However, I was unaware of this as we were dropped off in the parking lot…
Sacred: The Monkey forest is “a must” if you go to Ubud, and I don’t see why it is. Yeah, it’s fun for maybe half an hour to see all of the monkey playing around and everything, but you can even see that from outside without even paying the entrence fee. Also, we thought that it would…
Kuta: Nice to frolic in Kuta Beach specially during sunset and sit down on the sand while sipping juice or drinking beer as you watch the sun does down along the scenic horizon.  Kuta Beach also has excellent waves, thus it is frequented by surfers particularly those coming from…
Mount: If you can handle the early morning and the physicality of climbing up (and down) then this is a must do when in Bali.   Do your research and book with a good guide to avoid all the busy routes and crowds. We organised via our hotel (Capella Ubud) and luxed our with the five…
Grandmas: I stayed for 3 nights, the service was excellent, The staff & security are very friendly and kind, breakfast was great, you can have buffet and another menus, you can also take away for the food which is very good, The breakfast area is very scenic & lovely, the semi-outdoor dining space is very nice and beautiful, the room is the same as photos, very clean room, neat, clean bathroom. The hotel is close to the airport, near the kuta beach, markets, souvenirs. Best Hotel ever!!!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Wow this is a place u will really enjoy spending time. Staff friendly, helpfull and allways smiling. Rooms and hotel over all are kept very clean. WiFi works very well even at the pool. Would stay again if visiting Bali.

Besakih: i was a bad experience. The tample was beautiful. The first time i came. I just arrived at parking lot then some woman come to us and offering some sarong and put them on me. And I Have to pay 25k for each, 25k for some like scarfs to tie sarong up, and some Sesajen (offerings)…
Sacred: We visited the sacred monkey forest sanctuary and enjoyed every bit of it. If you like nature, forest and these naughty little creature, you will really enjoy the visit. The way it’s built is very interesting, pretty amazing hidden pockets within the sanctuary with great natural…
Kuta: When you are in Kuta, its a must visit beach. It is quite clean and has many water sports activities. Nearby / on the beach bars is an advantage
Mount: Lovely sight from Kintamani. A must visit. Climb up Mt Batur to see the sun rise behind Mt Agung. Well worth it.
Grandmas: I recently stayed just one night at the hotel and can't fault it. The rooms are compact but clean, comfy and have everything I needed. Breakfast was really tasty and the staff were all incredibly friendly. I Also had a massage at the Rehat spa there which was fantastic. I mostly stayed here as I wanted to be closer to the airport so I didn't have to worry about catching my flight and it was perfect for that. Great all round affordable hotel.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: The Radisson Blu in Uluwatu was simply perfect. Their staff were so friendly and accommodating, they couldn't do enough to make our stay perfect,  The actual resort was breath taking, the beds and pillows were so comfortable.  Food was really good at all venues.

Besakih: Although, it is “officially” closed due to the recent volcano eruption, we had no problems getting in. This was the same for many other visitors. We were on a tour so our guide took care of entrance fees. You definitely need to wear a sarong even if you are wearing long pants or…
Sacred: A wonderful walk through a well kept park that afforded all of us to learn how to respect the monkey families.
Kuta: Our hotel was in Kuta, but since we wanted to see everything that we can we went to other beaches in the begining of our trip, on our 4th day we were tired and dicided to go on Kuta beach because it was nearest... We didn't regred it!!! First off all the wather is very cold, but…
Mount: Well organised trip up Mount Batur. We were actually the only people on this trek and the only people walking up the mountain that evening which definitely improved the experience. We are two relatively fit people and honestly found the trek quite hard work, but our guide was…
Grandmas: I really liked this hotel. The staff are really friendly and hard working they are an asset to the hotel. The room was really nice and was cleaned daily. Breakfast was served 0600-1100hrs. You were able to chose from a selection of 4 items such as eggs Benedict/ waffles/ pancakes/ chicken satay etc and these items changed daily. And in addition there was a buffet to choose from and juices and hot drinks. Really enjoyable. I ate at the Bella Italian restaurant on site and had a really nice meal.  This hotel is situated perfectly for evening entertainment. It’s at the end of a street packed with shops and stalls, bars and restaurants and the further you got down the strip the more lively it got. This hotel is at the quiet end. There are some lovely restaurants nearby and the beach…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights in June. We were immediately impressed by the breezy open aired lobby and modern styling.of the hotel which given it was so new meant that pretty much everything was immaculate. We stayed in the 1 bedroom ocean suite which was massive and very comfortable. We had a spacious wrap around balcony with a great view of the ocean and pool. The bed was comfortable and our daughter loved her pink cot. The breakfast buffet was of a good quality although could have had a bit more variety. The pool area which is the main area of the hotel was fantastic. Lots of shallow areas for little kids to play around and it never felt crowded. The service from all staff was great. Always a smile and they were always willing to go above and beyond. I had 2 spa…

Besakih: The temple itself is a marvel, having been built in the 8th century (and rebuilt and maintained a fair bit since then) but, honestly, the 2 minute motorbike ride for the ticket stall to the temple was worth the trip.  Approaching the temple with the view of Mt Agung in the…
Sacred: Beautiful landscape with monkeys free to roam at will. Some up and down stairs but mostly easy and can go at your own pace and is very shaded. It is worth the visit but be sure to watch your things. One monkey climbed on my husband's leg and tried to chew his way through the bad…
Kuta: The beach is clean, although there's still some rubbish. The community/people is doing a great job. *Next to beachwalk shopping mall *Lots of surfing, we went there the day after full moon.
Mount: This requires a lot of effort but you will be rewarded once you get to the top and see the views.... they are amazing!  Really early start is a must for this, I wouldn’t want to do it in the heat of daytime and sunrise is perfect when you’re up there!  We started trekking about…
Grandmas: Only a few issues.  Shower was Luke warm and bathroom really needs update..Not fresh looking.   The restaurant has great service and lovely setting.  Downside  ... limited menus and very small portions.  Otherwise great stay at Hotel. Would recommend it  4/5.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: I did a review rarely. But since this is a perfect place to stay. Excellent service (thanks to Saka and Doel). We were well treated, they are so kind and patient. The food is also good especially their Cafe near the pool called Coka (not sure if the spell is right), you should try the burger. Nice Weather and view. I'll come back for sure. This place makes my trip memorable.

Besakih: Mean people only trying to rip you off. Avoid it if you can. It's not worth time or money, you'll only have a bad experience.
Sacred: I could spend all day watching the monkeys do their thing in this place. Well kept, clean with some quiet spots to get away from the rest of the noisy tourists to observe the monkeys in peace.
Kuta: I went with friends to this well known beach and we enjoyed the sunset after a nice long stroll while watching some surfers catch nice waves
Mount: We read some reviews on trip advisor and a number of people suggested Bazir as a guide. We contacted him via WhatsApp (+62 877 60381082) and he replied very quickly and was helpful over WhatsApp. On the morning of the climb he was there waiting for us right on time. My…
Grandmas: This hotel is a good place to stay if you are thinking to explore Legian area, many shops and restaurants within walking distance. It is value for money and they have a great breakfast (combination of Buffet plus you can order one type from the ala carte menu). For whom are travelling with very tight budget, you have to try this hotel
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Beautifully designed hotel with amazing staff. Stayed for 1 night initially and plan to return after a week for a few more days. There's no direct beach access from the hotel but it has a beautiful pool.

Besakih: Our driver and friend Cito was telling us on the way to Basakih Temple that he knew of some friends that had gone with a driver who had shown them around instead of the local tour guides and when he got back to his car he found his windscreen had been smashed I could tell you…
Sacred: Very reasonable price to get in. The monkeys are free to roam and are actually outside on the street too. It’s a lovely shaded walk around with a few temples to see too. The monkeys are fed and looked after well and are completely free to run around and even leave the area if…
Kuta: Went there to learn how to surf and we also enjoyed the sunset with cold beers and old ladies offering cheap massage :D
Mount: DO NOT GO if you want to go without a guide. We, a group of three, wanted to go up Mt Batur. We went there on our own and tried to go up the mountain. However as soon as we tried, we were blocked in doing so by 10 men surrounding us. They said that we had to pay 700.000 (400 for…
Grandmas: We spend a great time in Grandmas Legian while we stayed in Kuta. Is veey well located and near to the beach and shops. The staff is very kind and always try to help as much as they can. The room is perfect, very clean and comfortable and the breakfast is just amazing, we couldn't finish everything <U+0001F602> We will return there the next time we go to Kuta, great place to stay at a good price.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We stayed here for 5 nights on a Luxury Escapes package and what a wonderful surprise it was. A boutique feel even though occupancy was at 80% we never felt crowded. The architecture is superb: modern, dark and moody and the rooms are incredibly spacious. Staff were a delight. Nothing was too much trouble. Thanks to Diego and his team food and beverages at this resort are excellent. We particularly enjoyed Filini. What a magical ambience. Thanks Radisson Blu. You are a class act.

Besakih: Perhaps this is the widest temple I have ever visited. Local guides and sarongs come with entry fees. The temple with beautiful scenery around it.
Sacred: It is a great attraction for these that want to spend a nice time on an easy going walk. It is indeed a lot of monkeys and they are not shy at all. Actually, they are carefully checking if you only have something that they could steal. There are also guardians that make sure…
Kuta: Beautiful beach with light gray/tan coloured sand...wide and long and great for walking ...calm when we were there
Mount: He told us alot about the history of the mountains and had alot information. Some Friends were a bit slower but Bazir took great care of them
Grandmas: Stayed in Triple room for 3 nights from previously 1 night due to closed airport.   My reviews : 1/ Affordable cheap hotel with At 2nd night they gave me cheaper rate due volcanic eruption.  2/ complete amenities in room. Tea coffee making, bathroom amenities, safe deposit box, 3 bottled water.  3/ Friendly Professional attentive staffs that greet u anytime  4/ Nice breakfast with ala carte 4 choice every day. The food taste good . Extra breakfast for extra people cost IDR 30K - 50K  5/ clean room. For triple room can accommodate 2 adults 2 kids which is 1 queen bed and 1 single bed.  6/ Location is 20 mins from airport but if traffic can be 30 mins.   From Legian beach is 10-15 min walking.  7/ Has Italian restaurant open 24 hours. For Indonesian restaurant closed after lunch…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Came here for a couple of nights for a wedding at another hotel. Very good location, but not a beach front hotel. Garden rooms overlooking the central pool area was great. I wouldn't bother with an ocean view room as the hotel is set back from the ocean.  Staff excellent

Besakih: The temple was our second stop of a three-stop tour on Bali island.   Cascading temples on Agung mountain with breathtaking views.   Recommended!
Sacred: They feed the monkeys and keep them somewhat contained in this sanctuary so the monkeys are really all over the place. The employees are great with the monkeys. Monkeys are so so cute!
Kuta: I heard good things about Kuta beach, saw beautiful photos of the sunsets and I booked a week in Kuta purely for that reason. I wish I didn't. The beach isn't easy to get to, it's dirty and as soon as I stepped foot on the sand I was harassed by people left, right and centre. I…
Mount: We went there with my husband this morning. We arrived around 7am and decided to hike by ourselves as it is an easy trek. As we were almost at the top of the volcano, a guide with a motorbike asked us if we had a guide, we answered no and told him that it is ok we do not need…
Grandmas: Nice, cozy, clean rooms. Good location and great staff especially Ngurah Putra!! On the down side rooms are a little small and there is not much living space inside. Therefore this hotel is recommended for a short period of stay without much luggages. But still highly recommended. Thanks guys!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Overall I love this place. Hospitality and the facility is great with the private beach access makes everything even better. Definitely will be back to this place. If Radisson can add more variety on the breakfast it will be perfect.

Besakih: Reading through recent reviews, I realise how lucky we were to have our own driver and guide for a complete day, as our tour also included cycling in Sideman, lunch and a visit to Klungkung Temple earlier that morning.  We therefore avoided the unnecessary unpleasantness of…
Sacred: This was included in a day tour. Be careful of the monkeys. While I was there one girl got bitten as she tried to feed one. Plenty of signs around saying don’t feed them. Another monkey stole a woman’s earring. Just be very wary of the monkeys as some of them are very cheeky.…
Kuta: Was there fast, waves are large, good for surfing, wouldn’t recommend this if you wanted to bathe. Water was fine
Mount: As with most if not all tours you leave your Ubud accommodation at around 2-2:30am. Our driver was late but this seems to be a common occurrence and there is plenty of time to get to the mountain.  We had a stop off at a tea/coffee house for complimentary tea and coffee and a…
Grandmas: It’s nice tiny hotel located very centrally easily accessible to Legian beach and nearby ATM  Rooms are cleaned daily and they are giving nice breakfast in the morning especially the staff very much helpful with smiling faces
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We recently stayed at Radisson Blu resort in Uluwatu and were blown away by how incredible it was. We went up on a luxury escapes deal and it was amazing value for money. The staff were outstanding and nothing was ever an issue. We would highly recommend this hotel for a family and we look forward to coming back again in the near future. Thank you to the staff for making this a memorable experience.

Besakih: This place is worth to visit because it is one of the oldest temple in Bali with breathtaking view to mount Agung. If you do not want to spend more money, just say No to all sellers, no matter what they say. You only have to pay for the ticket 60k IDR for adult. The ticket you…
Sacred: The monkeys don't bother you, there are plenty of workers feeding them corn so lots of photo opportunities, good walks a few stairs, very well maintained and definitely in our opinion worth a visit, we would visit again when back in Ubud
Kuta: Kuta beach is still favorite beach for tourists local and non local. Enjoying sunset with low budget. You can sit on the beach and enjoy sunset moments with family or friends without you have to consume something!
Mount: Have to admit I wasn’t sure about how much I would like going to look at the volcano Mt. Batur.  We didn’t hike the volcano but were able to enjoy viewing from a restaurant with a beautiful view overlooking the lava field below Mt. Batur.  There is a peaceful serenity…
Grandmas: Great staff who go an extra mile to make you feel comfortable. Rooms are extremely clean and well maintained.Truly a gem centrally located in the heart of street which is a shopper’s paradise. The service was great and the breakfast buffet was awesome. “I would very much like to stay once again at Hotel Grandmass plus . Excellent hotel!”
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: I stayed at the Radisson during the Active Escapes festival and had an amazing time! This was the first time a group rented out the entire resort and the staff did a wonderful job catering to us all. The bar service was a little slow, but we were a much larger group than they were used to. The facilities were impeccable! The pool area was perfect for relaxing, with two bars to choose from. They also have a spa and a gym for you to use and are a short walk to a hidden beach.  The rooms are fantastic and jihad a great view of the resort and the ocean.  My stay was so great I even extended it!

Besakih: Well worth the trip for the fantastic temple regardless of local guide. Offerings/donation are not mandatory and totally up to you. Bring your own sarong so you don’t need to rent it
Sacred: Get there early when there are fewer people. Shady area and plenty of relaxed monkeys around doing there own thing. Nice coffee shop just outside exit 3.
Kuta: HIGHLY RECOMMEND JOESPH’s Surfing down on beach in Legian he’s awesome my son has n never surfed wanted to try Joesphs was great taught him on dry first then went out to sea stayed with him until he had the confidence to do solo., then let him go Joseph stay in front of him the…
Mount: Batur trekking was the mostly planned and awaited program of our Bali tour.To our great  delight,the weather was fine.We were picked up from Kuta at 1.00 am on 18th February and the trekking started around 3.00 am.It was not as much difficult as expected but the final part was…
Grandmas: I enjoyed staying for 3 nights in Grandmas Plus Hotel Legian last month, May 2018, for a short assessment and enjoy with the cleanliness of my room and within a distance of the hotel with my destination spots. The staffs are great!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Really great all round accomodation. Lovely room, pool and facilities, service and food. Had a fabulous stay here and will definitely come back. Was more like a resort than a hotel which was great. The bed was so comfortable tha we didnt want to get out of it and we are usually early risers.

Besakih: Enjoy a tour around the oldest highest temple in Bali. With the entry ticket you get a tour guide. Though you are expected to tip him at the end. The place itself majestic and mystical. Downside is that it is quite a hike so it is not accessible to everyone.
Sacred: The Monkeys are somewhat agressive and don't hesitate to steal You things they want ! If you try to retreive it they show their teeths and You better let it go !!!
Kuta: To lounge on the daybeds with the big umbrellas, you have to pay around $10 CAD to the people who own the restaurant stands at the back of the beach. We bargained and got it down to $8 but you can always sit at the back for free or bring your own towel to sit on the ground.   We…
Mount: It is a gorgeous mountain! The views are very nice. It is like 1h from Ubud so not too bad. Also ask your driver to stop at a decent lunch place there are a few there that offer amazing views of the mountain! It can be a romantic trip. Also the volcanic rock is fascinating!
Grandmas: The hotel is small but cozy. The room is petite but clean. The staffs are helpful & friendly. The buffet breakfast is great. We get to choose other food from the menu too. Will surely go back to this hotel
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: We stayed at Radisson Blu for 5 nights in a Luxury Escape deal. What an experience. The staff were so friendly but professional. The suite was huge with a large terrace located on top floor with views of the ocean. The pool was always just the correct temperature with lots of access points and lots of loungers cabanas and sofas. There is nothing that did not meet our expectations and go beyond. We have been on 17 LE deals and this ranks as one of the best. Thank you to all the staff and to the GM who we met several times. To our new friends to name a few, Rena Adi Agus Wili Nova Windhu and Ika and the lovely Cecilia on reception we cant wait to return.

Besakih: Go at your own risk.If you want peace stay away. If you still decided to go make sure you carry pocket full of cash to dump on the tour guides head
Sacred: It feels scary, but i really think it's just of human nature to get scared of unknown things. Otherwise it's nice to see much monkeys at one place. Although if you take a road which is monkey crossing, you can easily save some 80k of IDR, cause there are a lot of monkeys too.
Kuta: Sunsets in Kuta are just amazing. Walk along the sand, pick a bar (sometimes they choose you), sit back in your plastic chair, have that wonderful bar owner bring you a Smirnoff, and enjoy the views. I was taken back on how lucky I was to be able to witness it. They work so hard…
Mount: My experience at Mount Batur was great. There was a beautiful sunrise, not too many people, and friendly guides. The hike wasn't too hard and I enjoyed it. We woke up at around 4 to 5 am and drove there with a trip agency (I can't remember its name). Later we stopped at a hot…
Grandmas: Friendly staffs and nice services. great facilities and cleanliness, and also great location (near to the shops and beach). The price are great. Definitely will come back again for the next visit to Bali.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: I stayed in this hotel in April 2019 with two of my friends to finish off our 2 week trip of Bali. This hotel was absolutely stunning, only problem was we only booked 1 night here! We should have booked longer!!

Besakih: While the temple itself is beautiful, it is the most cynical place I have visited in Bali. You are led to believe that your entrance ticket covers everything- but don't be fooled: once you purchase your ticket, you will be directed to a tour guide who will ensure that your…
Sacred: Really good monkey forest located in Ubud. There much more friendly monkey. Make sure you read the guidelines before you enter the forest. The entrance tickets not so expensive IDR 80k per person. For you like to see monkey, We recommend to visit this park.
Kuta: Pros. 1.Best for surfing.  2.Good for watching sunset. 3.Good restaurants and cafes are situated in the opposite side of the exit points of the beach. 4. Movie theater and Beach Walk shopping center are next to the beach. Cons. 1. No in build sitting area in the beach meaning if…
Mount: We went to Mount Batur by lunch time. So directly went to the restaurant Amora where you get an excellent view of the volcano. Not only the volcano you can see the Batur Lake also from there. From the roof top of the restaurant you can get a great view.
Grandmas: The best aspect of this hotel is its staff.They provided the best service i have experienced in my travels.As we were vegetarians, they prepared a separate meal for us when informed.They are a real asset to the management.Few of these staff members are  Ana,Hendy,yulia,Dayu,Aris,Agung,Faisal,Diki,Agus palgunadi, Lesmana and Wisnu.These are the names i remember but all of them are very good in their service.Check in and check out was done easily and in no time.Stay was very pleasant. The hotel is in a prime location with easy access to all the places.The beach, restaurants and travel agencies are all at a walk able distance.The hotel is maintained well in terms of cleanliness too. Special thanks to ANA there, whose name i will always remember for she has given us the best service…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Stunning grounds and great location, extremely friendly staff. Pool is so nice and a great way to spend the day relaxing. Breakfast is the best of the best. Would highly recommend and hopefully will come back again!

Besakih: The temple is amazing and the guide was not friendly for visitor. There are some charges even they charged sarong although we had bought the ticket. You can carry your own sarong.
Sacred: Definitely worth a visit, the entry fee is pretty reasonable and it’s generally cooler than elsewhere due to being in basically jungle climate! You really are up close to the monkeys which in reality we found a bit intimidating but it was still a good trip
Kuta: it nice with the sunset, but so many people . to many people specially the student . i think they have study tour or something. but beach is not to bad also
Mount: This was the highlight of our trip to Bali.  We had wrestled with the cost and it did end up being fairly expensive, even after negotiations.  In the end we did it all, and were very happy.  From Seminyak our driver was waiting in the lobby well before we arrived, was very…
Grandmas: Staff friendly & ready to help you when check in. They gave you nice welcome drink, w/ lemongrass. The taste of breakfast was average. But i prefer ala carte (like i had at Grandmas seminyak). The room was clean, and as expected. Would love to comeback.  And if you go north / west (i can't tell) or just, along legian street you can found Ground Zero Monumen. with many Night CLub ex. sky garden, Paddys, and so many other
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Beautiful new rooms large and modern decor with great restaurants offering lots of options beautiful pool large balcony extremely friendly staff who pay attention to every detail rooms cleaning twice a day slippers put out next to my bed such a nice little touch. Staff at reception are amazing and knowledgeable. If your looking for a relaxing get away from the hustle and bustle this is the place

Besakih: Totally 4 hours cars ride to get harassad by local guides and different sale people. They tell you to give donation to the temple and also tell you that you give to little allthough you allready paid entrance where in wasnt mentioned that you have to pay extra for local guide…
Sacred: Went to monkey forest as my friend wanted to go there . The monkey seem happy enough and are feed often . It seemed odd to me a little like a Disney theme park .Lots of photo opportunities most of the monkeys seem friendly and some were shaking hands with people and climbing on…
Kuta: Best for sunsets and surfing. Lots of restaurants and a huge shopping mall called the Beach walk shopping center.
Mount: Strongly recommend to get a guide for the trip. We engaged BaliTrekkingTrips and have one of the best experience.  First of all, Thank you driver Adi for being on time and await us at the wee hours at 2am. I have heard many tours which came late and such wasted the resting time…
Grandmas: Beautiful breakfast and dining area. Staff was great and welcoming and made me feel comforable. Room was very clean and the cleaning services were excellent. Would definitely recommend and stay here in the future.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: I came with a large group of people (the whole hotel) and had an amazing time! My only complaint was a misunderstanding with a drink charge but reception kindly solved the problem without any drama. I also wish the pillows weren't so big. They need to invest in thinner pillows as it made it difficult to sleep (but that's a privileged problem to have really!). Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay here for everything from the amazing bedroom to the wonderful spa they have.

Besakih: We stopped here as part of a full day tour. We had a guide with us that told us a lot about the history and significance of the Temple. You could spend a lot of time here because it’s so big. We really enjoyed how peaceful and beautiful it was. We went mid-day and it wasn’t that…
Sacred: A beautiful Walk into the Woods with plenty of Monkeys in their natural habitat. The sculptures are marvelous. Entry Fees per adult is 80k. Chill place to relax and spend some time with nature.
Kuta: Great to sit and watch the sunset.  Talk and have a bit of fun with the locals.  Little bars to get a drink.
Mount: Myself and 2 friends went to the mountain with a hired driver. Left at 2am to get there from Seminyak and planned to hike without a guide.  When we arrived at the village road we got pulled over by "Security" to pay a ticket entry which was 330,000 IDR each which we had no idea…
Grandmas: I write this review knowing I only paid not much more than a six pack of beer per night. I expect a bit better though.  We chose this hotel for somewhere to hang out for about 8 hours before our red eye flight home.  It took 15 minutes at check in before we were even acknowledged. The room was tiny with an air con that only operated when you were in the room. It was very hot in the room and I couldn’t imagine how you would sleep in the room. Even after the air com was running for 90 minutes you were still hot and stuffy sitting in the room.  The room had windows going out to the corridor. If you wanted natural light then everyone could see in your room as they walked by.  The room was very noisy. Lots of traffic noise and whistles. It was like I was at a sports match with how…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: So happy when i boked this hotel, the view was fantastic, pool bar amazing and restaurant as well. Everyone very kind with all guest, also with me, especially Angga, his make our holiday perfect in here. Thanks to all staff. See you in next holiday

Besakih: I ignored the many negative reviews on TripAdvisor because I wanted to make it a positive experience and I also disregarded the warnings on Lonely Planet guidebook. So I have no one to blame but myself.  I am a light skinned, female, solo traveler. I wanted to see the temple at…
Sacred: Really not expensive. It's clear the monkeys are well cared for.  From the moment you arrive you can't walk 2 minutes without seeing some monkeys. They will get close to you. Many staff on hand to help if you need it.  Out of respect please just obey the local rules.
Kuta: Kuta beach has the most amazing sunsets, especially when there is a bit of cloud on the horizon.  We come from a coastal town in Western Australia and we have stunning sunsets, but I think Kuta Beach out does it.
Mount: This was one of the best experience I had in Bali. Our driver came to fetch us at 130am. It is a 2 hour journey to Mt Batur. Reached the destination at 330am. A guide by the name of Ketut was there to bring us up the mountain.   We started our trek in the dark using torch…
Grandmas: For the price it is an ok place we rented there because our flight was late and it is not far from the airport..but it is very noisy you can hear everything..cars beeping and buses...but close to beach 15-20 min walk...and many restaurants and you can get a 1 hour massage in the area for $7.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Very good service from all the departments. Stayed 8 days at the hotel with my wife for relaxing from busy days at work (hospitality as well) the rooms were very good we got a pool view 712. Swimming pool were great and relaxing. Good location for surf at impossible beach so avoided Padang. A place to return for sure Special thank you to all staff. Alan at FO and Rosita from Housekeeping.

Besakih: The temple is really amazing but unfortunately we have to argue with the guys there. Guide are not worth actually. You will witness a cluster of temples and shrines, each having their own story and uniqueness.
Sacred: Love the monkeys <U+0001F412> We got there early in the morning while the monkeys were eating, so we did experience any animal bad intentions because we had heard they would try to take things from you. Had a great time taking pictures.
Kuta: Went to Ubud today and wanted to relax so I came to Kuta beach. However it was impossible to relax there.. The people are trying to sell you things even If you make then very clear you don’t want to buy. I even left because I couldnt chill at all.
Mount: As I have been saying in all my posts that Bali was a total surprise. Completely different from what I have heard from people. It is beyond beaches and pubs.  One such place I visited was Kintamani Volcano. For people who want to explore and adventure early morning trekking…
Grandmas: Very close to the seminyak beach. Service, restaurant and room was amazing. Staff was very nice, they shifted me to a different quieter room because I wanted to catch up on my sleep, without me even asking.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Laid back and attentive. Friendly and fun staff, good food, good drinks and of course "impossible beach ! The dollar goes far in Bali and for this high end resort this is one of the best values I've found.

Besakih: Pura Besakih is regraded as Mother temple of Bali.  The Temple complex is spread across a large area and looks beautiful. Mount Agung creates a stunning backdrop for the temple.  One thing we didn't like about the whole experience is that the guide and so called temple priests…
Sacred: The park is a self walking tour through a nice little park. Entrance fee was about 6-7 usd a person. Apparently the monkeys here aren't as friendly as other Monkeys around the island. you can't touch and do much with the monkeys and we were done with it in about an hour.  I was…
Kuta: Traveled with kids.. They loved the big big waves. And I loved the fun filled surroundings with lots of people watching to do.
Mount: early start and some hard stoney trails to navigate but well worth the journey, fantastic views at daybreak, a real bonding moment for family and friends. if youre worried about fitness levels, take your time, plenty of people going at an easy pace. i bombed up with my son, much…
Grandmas: I chose this hotel because it was only me this time trip to bali, so it wasnt need to be very good.  First of all, no one cared I was standing in front of the front desk after they finished another guest. Also first night towels were very smelly but I acceptednit because room was cheap and I thought this happening is normal in Bali. However next day it was not stinky at all and completely dried. On the picture you can see the window but no sunlight coming inside of the room and noises of people and plates wakes me up in the morning for the breakfast. Staffs were good and outside of the room is normally very clean and nice. But the reason I wont go here again is also staff. They get deposit for the room keys, but when I check out they didnt give me back the deposit. I called them…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: I was filming in Bali for a week and needed place to relax and work on the evenings. The staff were all very welcoming, the rooms were simple and clean. The bar is a great place to watch the sunset, although if you’re a wine lover, it seemed that every time I’d ask for a glass or red this would turn into a huge complicated procedure. There was never a bottle behind the bar and they’d have to go off and find the only bottle in the hotel it seemed. Really have to get the drinks selection organised as this happened every night without fail. All said and done though, I’d definitely recommend this place for both work and a relaxing holiday

Besakih: This temple is located on the slopes of Mount Agung. The recent eruptions of the volcano have had a dramatic impact on tourism. People that are making their living of the visitors are trying the best they can to receive money. This leads to annoying and not enjoyable moments and…
Sacred: U can see these many monkey at any odd place at delhi, agra l, shimla and other monkey menace places.. Beware of them.. They can snatch anything.. Keep tight
Kuta: It’s a fabulous beach, the surf is good for beginners, the sand is hot, the people watching is fun  Just be prepared to get swamped by hawkers. They have excellent memories and know new faces when they see them. If you don’t want to buy just smile and say “thank you, no thank…
Mount: You need a low level of fitness to get up to the view of the whole country side. You can walk the ridge of the volcano to see all the different perspectives. It was amazing. The warmth from the gases comes out in some small pockets. Our guide was good but you don’t need one.…
Grandmas: Just stayed here for 12 nights, family of four.  We booked two rooms (double and twin) close together.  We arrived at 12:30pm to check in but couldn't because the room wasn't ready.  That wasn't a problem because check in is 2pm.  We went and had lunch and came back at 3pm.  Room still not ready.  We were not given a welcome drink like other travellers received.  Finally our rooms are ready.  We go to the fifth floor and find we have be given two double rooms.  We have two teenage daughters who cannot share a bed without fighting so we go back to reception and ask for a twin room as booked.  The girls get put on the second floor as there is no twin rooms on the same floor as double rooms.  We stayed like that for one night but it was a pain going up and down to each room if the…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Resort was only 9 months old so everything was huge, brand new and modern. Pool area was massive and very comfy with cabanas and day beds. Staff were attentive but did have to call them over a few times to order drinks as no 'service button' beside you. Rooms were again comfy, but walls paper thin! Could hear the people next door talking clearly. Had a beautiful room with corner balcony, nice view. Resort provided complimemtary yoga at 4pm each day but wasn't promoted within. I only knew via Instagram. We joined in and loved it. Restaurants were ok, food average, only ate there twice out of 4 nights though. Great location for a peaceful, quiet stay away from the hussle and bustle. Unable to walk anywhere so rely on the free shuttle, taxis or a driver. I think this resort will…

Besakih: Run by the local Mafia unbelievable how they can get away with I paid 5000 for a parking then be purchased or entity good 120,000 then after that they blackmail us to pay another 200,000 if we want to see the temple or else we can go  very aggressive woman selling offering we…
Sacred: I have been to s monkey forrest in England, this one is a different league.   There are lots of monkeys that just ignore you but watch out for monkeys stealing food and bags.  My wife had two monkeys climbing over her trying to steal her glasses and hat.  I  thought it was funny…
Kuta: Excellent stay in Kuta the people are very friendly and cant do enough for you. FABULOUS place to visit.
Mount: Our Mt Batur experience was victory saved from the jaws of defeat. Based on recommendations we went to Mt Batur as a day excursion from Ubud. This mountain is famous for its sunrises but our crew of five was never going to get up at 2am so we decided to go mid-day to get out of…
Grandmas: We stayed here for 4 nights & have nothing to complain about. The aircon was taking a bit slow to get cold but when we told the staff, they immediately checked & everything went fine. Hot water was working well. Bed was comfy, I love their pillows. So fluffy my bf & I had troubles waking early and leave the bed. Lol. Staffs were really nice, informative & helpful. If you rent a car, worry not about the parking lot because they offer you free valet parking for all types of room. This one really make my bf & I will consider this hotel as the 1st choice for our next trip to Bali. Strategic location, close to the beach, cafes, restaurants, malls, atm, minimarts & nightclubs. We even took a morning walk to Legian beach from the hotel. Oh, they do offer you a free bike rent too.…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Raddison blu Uluwatu was amazing beautiful clean. They said they had full capacity and it was still not busy and very relaxing. Rooms were clean and very well appointed. Staff fantastic. Breakfast options could be better on a healthy alternative. Cocktails very good and bar food great. Location is quiet relaxing and good for couples. Far away from the hustle n bustle of busy Kuta, Seminyak, Legian.  There’s some really cute cafes too just outside of the hotel

Besakih: If you have an interest in local Balinese culture this i a place to visit. Admission ticket includes a guide and a motorcycle ride up to the temple gate, it is a bit of a walk to get there and you’ll walk plenty once inside.   The guide is a good idea since it is a place of…
Sacred: The park was a lot smaller than I expected, especially knowing it was in a jungle, however the trip was still enjoyed and we did have encounters with some beautiful, placid monkeys.
Kuta: The beach was near my hotel, but that was the only good quality. I understand the locals there have to make a living, but they are aggressive with trying to sell to you. It’s hard to enjoy the beach itself because they push so hard to sell you their items and services. The water…
Mount: We hired a tour to go to the mountain and it was expensive. The only thing the tour does is picks you up. They promise breakfast but it is a joke, white bread and boiled eggs. Horrible. You have to wear comfortable clothing to hike and climb and warm clothing because it is…
Grandmas: Small piece dragon fruit fall in sheets,Im sure its easy to clean and when check out the receptionists charge us more than 500 k but u can not take the sheets with u<U+0001F602><U+0001F602>. They keep us and after arguments the staff said .just give us how much u want mam ! Also there was no hot water. Been staying here for the past three years. Be aware of scams from hotel.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The most beautiful pool and outdoor relaxing area.  This hotel was very quiet and tranquil allowing us to totally relax and unwind by the poolside.  Good food choice and drink options within the hotel grounds.  I will 100% stay here for our next trip to Bali.

Besakih: Once we parked the car near the Temple, we got surrounded by the ladies selling sarongs and offering us umbrellas. A man promptly showed up offering his services as a tour guide, saying that 'under new regulations' it's only allowed to visit the temple with a guide, for 100K per…
Sacred: Gorgeous place, was a bit taken back by all the monkeys. My bag was grabbed and took a few pulls to get it back.
Kuta: People often make the mistake of expecting Kuta beach to be like Nusa Dua, Blue point or Padang Padang beach. Well folks, each beach has its own unique character which provides tourists with a different experience. Kuta beach is great, sunsets are awesome, busy beach yeah, but…
Mount: We've seen so many sunsets in Bali we knew we had to catch a good sunrise and what could be better than seeing the sun rise up from the mountains early in the morning.  A no brainer when we decided that it had to be Mt Batur.   We lived in Seminyak, a good 2 hours away from…
Grandmas: We stayed at Grandma's Plus Hotel Legian for only 1 night, before our flight back, and it was the perfect location, only 20 min to the airport by car, and also walking distance (20min) to Beachwalk Shopping Center (with several stores and restaurants, near the beach). The staff was great and helped us find a cab to the airport, as our flight was early in the morning (we leave the hotel at 4am!). The hotel is clean and very comfortable. We did a massage at the hotel's spa and it was amazing! We had a great and relaxing last day in Bali. Definitely recommend the place and wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy it better. Maybe next time..
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We two Adults, a six year old child, and a 75 year old senior arrived to find the hotel had cancelled our reservations.  After booking directly with the hotel and paying half cost of the deposit up front we were given a confirmation number. So far so good...  When we arrive the day before Easter at around 6 at night, we are told our books where given away and they had no rooms available for us.  They then told us they had send an email a few day before to let us know we had to pay 100% of the booking before even arriving somthing in 40 years of travel I have never heard of.   I explained we had just been on an island without internet and being on holidays wasn't checking emails. But did have a confirmation number and made payment.  After hours in the lobby with a small child…

Besakih: Out of the 20 countries I have visited, I’ve never experienced anything like what I saw in this temple. I never thought I would say this about a temple but this place NEEDS TO BE REGULATED. Our driver warned me about this place, but we were not prepared mentally for what happens…
Sacred: First time to this Monkey Forest, had a good day. The walk through the forest is mostly in the shade and is an easy walk. Will you see monkeys? They are all over and are very active. Strolling through the grounds you hear the chatter and squealing of the groups and individuals.…
Kuta: It's a nice enough beach   Sand isn't fantastic but nice chilled surf beach. Full of tourists loads of bars nearby Not my kind of vibe of beach .
Mount: Mount Batur is an active volcano in north-eastern Bali and is a popular attraction. There are plenty of lookouts in and around the town of Kintamani and the views are spectacular on a clear day. Accommodation is readily available in the area to enhance your enjoyment. There is…
Grandmas: My friends and I stayed here for 6 days and we all had a great time here. The hotel's best asset besides its fantastic location is their staff. All were so friendly and helpful. They made an impact with us. When we arrived we did not want double bedded rooms and they obliged by changing to twin bedded rooms.  The location is so good we could walk around to most places like the shops, restaurants, clubs and massage / nail salons.  The hotel was generally very clean. The rooms were rather small so with two persons and our two bags, it was rather tight. Being at a busy traffic intersection, the noise level was a bit high sometimes. Maybe with better sound proofing, it would get better. The bathroom was modern but the shower area needs to be cleaned often. It was very slippery and…
