Radisson: The food (Breakfast, lunch & Dinner) are very good, quality and generous portions and very reasonably priced for a resort of this quality. There are plenty of happy hours available at the various bars therefore easy to access 50% discount on cocktails, beers etc.  Gym is fantastic as is the large spacious pool, no negatives all positives.

Besakih: From the time we entered, we were in awe of this spiritual place. It was teeming with tourists and there was this buzz of eagerness. We each received a beautifully made and colourful sarong (not for keeping) to be worn over our clothing. We walked around looking for the holy…
Sacred: Very nice place...the staff are friendly you must be careful from the monkeys don’t look them in eyes.
Kuta: Long clean beach with good waves. Beer and seating is available. Many good restaurants close-by. Always happy to go there.
Mount: I always think the best way to experience a place is through it's sunrises, and Batur never fails you with stunning views. Whenever I'm in bali, I'll try to plan in a hike (although it is getting more and more expensive to do the trip through tours and guide- don't think they…
Grandmas: Stayed for few nights here   For a budget hotel this place is clean,comfortable,easy to find and close to most shopping places.  Nice ambiance.   Provides good sleep and nice shower.   Also they have bikes for hire and the spa is brilliant.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Lovely stay in this quite new resort, great rooms, very spacious, awesome beds and bathroom was really nice. pool area is superb. Super friendly staff, nothing was a problem for them. The resort feels small and exclusive, nice and quiet. food quality in the restaurant was above what you would expect in a hotel of this rating. Breakfast were awesome. Happy hour is from 5:00 to 10:00pm so win win. Walk to other restaurants outside of the hotel, not far to go for something different, about 5 min walk. Free shuttle to uluwatu temple. All in all, a great place to have an inexpensive holiday. I would return.

Besakih: Pura Besakih is the most important, the largest and holiest temple of Hindu religion in Bali, and one of a series of Balinese temples, on the slopes of Mount Agung in eastern Bali. If you wanna visit Besakih Temple make sure bring your sarong, will not allow you to enter if not…
Sacred: Seems to be well run, advise not to feed the monkeys and a pleasant place to take a walk around. Hard to find information on the shuttle bus.
Kuta: Kuta Beach is a great place to visit, especially at Sunset when many people gather to watch the sunsets. The beach front is packed with people the length of the beach. Many of the locals come down and play soccer.  Well worth it, grab a drink from one of the many beach bars that…
Mount: its harsh and slippery so be careful. Its steep and full of people but its fun. When we went there it was cloudy so no sun rise but coming down was worth it. The views are beautiful.
Grandmas: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we chose it because of the location. We received a great service from the hotel. And, also the breakfast was delicious. We would love to visit this hotel again.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Radisson Blu Uluwatu is a new resort.  It is tucked away with views over the ocean.  If you want somewhere quiet to sit, relax and read this could be the resort for you.  There are two options for dining in the evening, if you want to eat outside the resort you would need to arrange transport.   Beautiful large pool and great staff.

Besakih: It has just opened after the volcano alert, so it was basically empty .we were with our guide from the hotel and from the parking we took motorbike drivers to get us by the feet of the temple and for 40 thousand they waited for us to take us back down.This is the mother temple,…
Sacred: I love these kind of places to be able to watch the animals up close and personal. Some of the monkeys can get a little too close and try to take whatever you have that they seem to like. Just be aware of your surroundings. When you walk around you will be able to see how the…
Kuta: The beach was very clean (much cleaner than previous years) and the boardwalk was nice for a stroll. There are hotels and clubs with music where you can buy a drink/food and have a swim in the pool. We enjoyed eating dinner at the authentic home cooking tables by the water as…
Mount: View of this volcano was awesome though we just drove past on the way to the hotspring. We were informed it erupted way back in 1917. So there's plenty of history in this area. We were informed that a regular hike up the slopes would take around 2 hours. Perhaps an adventure for…
Grandmas: I love staying at grandmas hotel. The staff are super friendly and the food is amazing. My favourite thing to do on my stay there is swim in the pool. Also they have the best spas in Bali. I really enjoyed the massages. I believe it’s such a good deal for the price you pay and I will definitely be back.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Very new/modern facility with excellent amenities. Superb staff with fantastic food options. The breakfast had an awesome varied selection and was delicious. Nice shuttle to uluwatu temple as well as one of the local beaches. Very convenient and easy access to local attractions.

Besakih: It is the oldest temple in Bali (from VIII century) and also the biggest one. It is nice, but not the most beautiful. Ticket entrance is 60k rupias per person, and includes a guide and go up in a motorbike (for go down you can pay or walk, it is not too far)
Sacred: Didn’t know what to expect as visits to the temples has been a bit of a let down.  Pleasantly surprised,  great guides to help scattered throughout the sanctuary
Kuta: Nice place for a few drinks and see the sunset. Casual seating areas with lots of small bars.    Be ready to be hassled to buy from people selling their goods.
Mount: I climbed Mount Batur, with my family, the scenery was incredible and I was very grateful, the guide gave me the best service, and my family, I was very happy to meet a very friendly, polite guide, for my next visitcontact Kris Bali trekking again. thank you for the good service…
Grandmas: My colleague booked for me a twin room on the first floor where I stayed alone, because when checking in the receptionist told us that we got a free for each twin room that were booked. I have no idea about how much the exact price of the room was.  My own room is clean. The towels that were hung by the shower room has brown marks on them, as if there was a tiny dose of coffee were spilled.  They put a new testament bible inside the table's drawer.  Both the appetizer before the breakfast and the breakfast itself was great.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: I stayed at this hotel on a Luxury Escapes booking and it was a fantastic deal. We enjoyed the large pool, the restaurants and the spa.  All the staff provided excellent service and the room was spacious and very clean.   The hotel location is a bit far from shops and other restaurants although we did walk to Bingin one day (about 15 minutes walk...then down 188 steps, then back up 188 steps) but the food options at the hotel are very good. We were there after the Australian school holidays so it didn't feel crowded and there weren't really any kids around (there is a kids club) so it felt like quite a grown up, sophisticated resort.   Location wise it's not really ideal as a hub for daytrips to the south western beaches (Seminyak is about 90 minutes by car) although some people…

Besakih: This should really be a must visit place. Bali's most important temple perched high on its highest volcano.  However any visit is completely ruined by the extortion from the guides who don't want to take no for an answer. I can speak Indonesian and have lived in Bali for ten…
Sacred: Like going for a pleasant walk in a park. Don’t bring food or drinks and you’ll be ok. Not stroller friendly. There are ground staff around for helpful info. Signboards provide adequate information. Would probably it go again.
Kuta: this golden sand beach is in the touristy part of bali. medium coarse golden sands with surfable waves makes this ideal for water sports and people watching. the local vendors here can be a little overbearing. we've found, "no thank you, maybe later", repeated 5x works, fairly…
Mount: It's pitch black, you're surrounded by jungle, and you can vaguely make out lights moving up the slope of an unseen giant mountain far, far, far above you... if it wasn't for our guide I'm sure we would have got lost or lost the urge because this is a tough walk at freakin' 4am.…
Grandmas: Nice location, close proximity to the beach. Great if you are just looking for a comfortable room and not intending on spending much time in it. Friendly staff, decent aircon, good restaraunt, wifi is a bit slow. All in all a good value for what you're paying.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Fantastic resort  with a huge pool. Food is fantastic and staff were friendly accommodating and amazing. Great views from our suite, comfy bed and loved the liitle touches such as the changing snacks you got in your room everyday. As well as all the environmental touches.

Besakih: Besakih Temple, known as Bali’s ‘Mother Temple’ for over 1,000 years, sits 1,000 metres high on the southwestern slopes of Mount Agung.  Besakih is the biggest and holiest of the island's temples and is surrounded by breathtaking and scenic rice paddies, hills, mountains,…
Sacred: Nice view on the natural surrounding. Big trees, monkeys, and trees again. Make you think hiw many wonderful trees are there in the island and how would have been the area before cutting most of them for rice fields...
Kuta: I love this kuta beach so every time I going to bali I will be always give sometimes to see it and I believed everybody does... But right now what a pitty this gorgeous beach seem likes lil a bit dirt place to visit and so many garbage should be clean on certain area.... But I…
Mount: Whilst it's been a long time since this volcano erupted, you can still see the blackened areas - with nearby homes. The view from the bridge is good - but like with most areas in Bali, every tourist spot is commercialised and everyone trying to sell you things.
Grandmas: Location of hotel is very good. Beach is at a walkable distance. Local market, money changer is just across the street. Wifi is good,rooms and bathrooms are very clean with proper house cleaning done everyday. Breakfast is also good and there is a spa and italian restaurant attached to the hotel. Staff can speak english and is very helpful. There is a lift too. I stayed here twice and was never disappointed. Only one suggestion dont take rooms much in the interior because wifi can be slow. Please check the AC is working properly or not.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Stayed for 5 nights using the LE package. Our room was upgraded to a panoramic view on arrival (thank you!!)  Beautiful big room, made to feel even more due to the high ceilings. Fresh cut flowers each day was a nice touch aswell.  Great spot to just stop & unwind.... possibly a little secluded if you have a young family (like us) with no kids pool & the playroom was just a bare room with few tables & a TV. But this was the only downfall we had. Great breakfast options, very fresh & tasty! The walk down the steps to the small beach is worth the walk. Great spot to sit & watch the surfers.

Besakih: Must visit Place when u are in Bali  ( Nice Temple ) Best for clicking Pics  Beware of guide in Besakih Temple
Sacred: this was my second visit to the forest, and first since the upgrades. It seems much more 'monkey friendly' now with rules and guidelines for keeping the monkeys in a more natural habitat (considering it's a park of sorts). It's much safer for the humans now too. I only saw one…
Kuta: Very popular to sit and watch the waves whilst enjoying a bintang or two. Hair braiding and shopping along the beach also.
Mount: Hey!  First thing I'd like to say is that if you want to do a special tour like their sunrise trek then having a guide is much more important. That being said, climbing the mountain in the middle of the day DOES NOT REQUIRE A GUIDE. The locals are pretty much all in on a scam,…
Grandmas: the hotel is modern. Clean rooms, decent wifi, very comfy beds, great location, and good tv movie channels.  We stayed only for a quick one night to keep going to another area of Bali. So this place did the job. No pool area, but it was ok for us, as we were for a short day.  Close to banks, exchange places, shops, restaurants and all.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: The Radisson Blu is high on our list for favorite hotels in Bali. It is very new and beautifully built. Gorgeous during the day and nothing short of enchanting during the night when illuminated by lights. If you are traveling with a significant other this is the hotel for you. It is a very romantic hotel overall. If you want to have an amazing candle lit dinner by the pool with a bottle of wine… this is the spot. Also the breakfast buffet is by far one of the best we experienced on the island. The swimming pool is iconic and there is plenty of places to lounge around. Also if you are looking for an adventure one of of the prettiest beaches is just a short hike down the cliff from the Radisson. If you want to see more of Uluwatu the best sightseeing is also just a short taxi…

Besakih: As usual all the temples in bali are really beautiful. Remember to take a sarong while going inside. This place is dedicated to all the major gods of hindu mythology.
Sacred: One of the main attractions of Bali. A very beautiful place to walk, a large area, and the monkeys will not let you get bored. Entrance 80k IDR per person. I definitely recommend.
Kuta: Bit on the crowded side but a beautiful beach. Sea is not rough so possible for sea bath. Lot of surfing facilities providing shops can be found however waves are not the best for pros.
Mount: We climbed Mount Batur to see the sunrise and it was well worth the climb. We started in darkness with lights attached to our heads and took about 2 hours to reach the top. Fantastic experience!
Grandmas: Good hotel for family and bisnis because the place is quiet startegic and also is not far from kuta beach. And there is many store surrounding this area. Also my son is happy with the bycycle compliment
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Stayed for 5 nights and it was a very quiet and relaxing time together, the property is lovely and our suite was big and well equipped, but the view let it down unfortunately.  The breakfast was delicious with a huge variety and the staff are very friendly and very helpful. The hotel is very isolated and going back to the airport took over one hour and forty minutes.

Besakih: The temple is huge and breathtaking to explore. Very picturesque. There are dress restrictions when visiting the temple. Cons are there are a lot of stray dogs. Amazing.
Sacred: A few nasty and aggressive monkeys. Don’t take water bottles as they seem to like bottles. Babies are cute!
Kuta: A nice clean beach with life guards, just on the city side. For 3000 Rupees (20 cent) you have showers. And people selling drinks. You can take surfing classes.
Mount: We'd heard so much about how great Batur was, so we were willing to do the 2AM start. The experience was a total let down though, and we regretted going.  Issues: -Start time: After being picked up at 2AM, we stopped on the way to Batur for "breakfast", which was a kind of…
Grandmas: I’ve been traveling to Bali for 10 years for very much needed vacation time from a hectic work life.  I’ve never stayed at budget hotels.  However this time, I’m in a professional break and had decided to spend 2 months in Bali.  My budget meant, I needed a budget hotel.  What a great gem. Staff are wonderful (even bought me a birthday cake, and had the staff play musical instruments while singing Happy Birthday (in my room, I’d be way too embarrassed if this was in the restaurant).  Clean, tidy, good atmosphere, safe, quiet.. as I said, just missing a gym with some weights.  Highly recommend for solo travellers like me.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: This is a lovely place.  It’s not on the beach nor does it have a good view of the ocean.  However, the rooms and pool are nice and the food is good even if the restaurants are let down by subpar service.  There are many steps around the pool area.  Be careful navigating this area at night as the inadequate lighting can make the steps a bit treacherous.

Besakih: When in Bali, do yourself a favour and fully explore this magnificent Temple. Make sure you pay one of the local guides to be able to explore the whole Temple, right to the very top level. The views from the top are truly breathtaking.
Sacred: Visited this place with an 11 and 4 year old.. none of them were impressed and wanted to leave quite fast. Yes, there are several monkeys, but watching this in a decent zoo is just as fine.
Kuta: Kuta beach - the iconic location that is a must visit ,  Any time of the day of night the beach is the place to be !  For families, singles, surf lessons or simply just relaxing .
Mount: We booked the sunrise tour with a guide through a tour company. The guide is a must! The track is challenging and I’m glad we did it in the dark. The views and sense of accomplishment once at the top was awesome. We were a group of four of varied fitness and we all got to the…
Grandmas: I stayed in this hotel for one night for a weekend getaway. The reception was great, the check-in process was quick and efficient in time, good. My first impression when I got into the room that it's kinda small, but as I stayed in there for a few hours, it's not that small. It's enough room for 2 people to move around and I think it will not be a problem for people who will just use this room for sleeping at night. The bathroom was clean and everything there work perfectly. They serve a la carte breakfast, to me it tasted so so. But I have some concern about the breakfast area, I noticed that the chairs were stained by bird poop as there were some wild birds that flying around the roof. So I couldn't help to feel uneasy when I was eating, worrying that something might drop from…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Great staff and quality of the facilities . The whole experience was great from start to finish. Breakfast was to an amazing standard,gym good and o lovely pool.Food around the pool was good quality and value.

Besakih: Well it’s the Mother temple of Bali and true to the word it’s humongous. Tourists are not allowed to enter the temple. You can only walk past the walls of the temple. There is a guide allotted to you when you purchase the tickets at the entrance. The guide will accompany you…
Sacred: This was a very cool place until a monkey attacked me. The monkeys can be very aggressive so stay to the main trail areas!
Kuta: Beach is clean/ long and water is refreshing. Nice to sit under the trees in shade after sunning. The vendors are very aggressive and saying no to them does not deter them. This makes it less peaceful so keep moving and walk the beach to avoid them.
Mount: Amazing view up there. You should be with ok condition physically to do this hike. But it so worth it. Trip starts about 2am at your hotel and you are back about 9am.
Grandmas: The hotel is really good: Simple, small and functional room to serve every needs, open corridor to make me refreshed, good cleaning service, excellent staffers, and amazing breakfast. Plus, it has a good location: From the hotel, it takes ten minutes to walk to Legian beach looking like Ipanema beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. You can get to night-life venue on foot. There’s a lot of excellent restaurants nearby. I prefer staying in Bali to staying in noisy beach cities in Thailand. Definitely, I’m coming back to Grandmas hotel Bali Legian.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We stayed here on the last leg of our Bali tour and weren’t disappointed. The staff are wonderful and the property is beautiful. Price was very good for what you get. The only improvement I could suggest is maybe the speed of the poolside service. At times our frozen concoctions were not so frozen by the time they made it to us. The other thing is the Artichoke restaurant for evening dining. The food was average. The Italian restaurant was much better.

Besakih: We visited this temple as it was one of the "must see" temples. It is very pretty, but there is so much rubbish, plastic, etc. lying around it is disgusting!! They really need to clean this place up. Also, if this is more than 30min drive - it's not worth it at all!!
Sacred: Great to see free ranging monkeys. Very safe, just give them space and don’t stick camera in their faces. Don’t tease them with food.  Clean, well-kept park with waterfalls and pools that the monkeys jump into. Don’t miss it
Kuta: So Kuta beach is long and looks great but it’s actually really filthy. There is rubbish everywhere. Although lots of people were surfing and swimming I decided not to risk it. You can’t sit and relax because your constantly being approached by sellers, they can be quite…
Mount: Mount Batur is so beautiful even when it's raining it's still stunning. This time we ventured down the bottom and you can see where the lava has been when the volcano erupted. The soil at the bottom is so rich the age grows so many crops in ransom spots
Grandmas: For the money you pay what you get here is absolutely phenomenal. Free breakfast buffet every day including a main meal chosen from a menu, excellent service and very helpful English-speaking staff. Rooms are very clean and come with all the amenities you need including two free bottles of water every day which is great since you can't drink water in Bali.   I really enjoyed everything until the last day, which really soured our experience unfortunately. Me and my Indonesian girlfriend returned to the hotel at night as we had for the last 6 days before, and the doorman profiled her and assumed that she was a prostitute I was bringing back, just because I'm a foreigner and she's Indonesian, asking her for ID without asking me for any. Previously we had never been asked for ID…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: This property is severely under priced. Total value for money and an amazing experience. The rooms, staff, breakfast, check in, check out, beds, views and service are 5 star all the way. Would highly recommend this resort and the Uluwatu area for all those seeking peace, quite and tranquility.

Besakih: The Temple is ok and reasonably pretty but it is ruined by pushy guides and vendors  Right from the get go I had a bad feeling when our driver warned us about the guides. Guides should be free with a discretionary tip, however our guide (who physically snatched our tickets off…
Sacred: The Monkey forest is definitely one of the must-go places in Bali. The forest is located right in the heart of the Ubud area in Bali.   The forest is a small closed area with lots and lots of trees, monkeys, very old sculptures and 3 temples - Pura Dalem, a shiva temple, Pura…
Kuta: Kuta beach is perfect long walks. The sunset there is amazing most days and there are a lot of places to learn surfing. Very good for beginners. Sadly, there is no shady spot to lay in at the beach, because there are surf schools, food shops etc. under the palm trees.
Mount: Kintamani is a village on the western edge of the caldera and a great place to see Kintamani Volcano and Mount Batur (one of four volcanoes in Bali).
Grandmas: We arrived at this hotel at 2 AM after a long day at the airport and were very pleased with the welcome we received by the friendly reception even though it was an ungodly hour to check in. Their rooms were absolutely clean, the bathroom nice, and the overall decor of the hotel was very youthful and lively. My favorite thing about the hotel would have to be the location - located at the corner of one of Legian's busiest intersections was really helpful for us, especially in finding options for dining. One thing the hotel could improve on was probably the external lighting for me because it was a bit difficult to find the signage for the hotel at first, but overall, it's definitely a good hotel for short stays.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Me and my family spent two nights here on a family trip. Rooms are spacious amd luxurious appointed (Sensatia Botanicals toiletries is always a plus). Bed was comfortable but I have to ask the engineer to put the AC not in the Auto Mode because the Hotel SOP. Maybe the receptionist should have told the guest first at the check-in proscess. The breakfast and the afternoon tea waa excellent! Love the foods! But less Indonesian foods. They also have their own private beach with 120 stairs if I’m not mistaken. It was pretty and quiet. Overall it was excellent.

Besakih: We went here in the morning, so no crowds. Sellers, as everyehere, try to sell you stuff. Wear your own sarong, at Besakih they are very expensive.
Sacred: Fabulous to see how animals and humans can live together in harmony.  The people see the monkeys As sacred and leave them alone.  In return the monkeys are not afraid and allow you to see them up close - even the tiny babies
Kuta: Cool place but a bit annoying because everyone is trying to sell you something - ideal for learning to surf
Mount: If your goal is to see the sunrise and views at the top then pray for clear skies. If you are up for a good early morning walk (in the dark) and later a downward climb then go for it. Christmas Day 2019 resulted in a great trek up and down but the sunrise photos are…
Grandmas: Comfortable and clean room. Bath room is nice and clean. Room size is okay, not too large but also not cramped. Located near the center of touristy area in Bali. Price is on medium range. In my opinion, a good offer.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Stayed here for 2 nights in April 2019. Staff were fantastic and the hotel was great with good quality breakfast and pool facilities. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Uluwatu.

Besakih: This complex of temples is spectacular to say the least, but it's a fair drive from anything else, especially if your coming from Kuta like we did. So we just combined this with a trip to the hot springs in Mount Batur which worked out very well.  Our guide told us the locals…
Sacred: Always enjoy monkeying around with these cheeky animals! The forest itself is full of fascinating statues and temples and so green and lush. Watch your possessions carefully as the monkeys have nimble fingers. There is also a great cafe nearby you shoud visit Cafe du Monyet...…
Kuta: This was my first experience of Bali and every time we told someone we were going to Bali they all said how amazing and beautiful.  Bali itself is, but I would not recommend staying in Kuta, it’s like Blackpool for the Australians!!!  It did put a damper on my stay in Bali but…
Mount: Climb a volcano was always on my bucket list and I think this one was a good choice. Hike wasnt really hard, about 2 hours. On the top you can see magnificent sunrise view. I didn't like only the crowd on the final part (I was before season on Bali. i can't imagine how many…
Grandmas: It was not my first time staying at Grandmas Plus Hotel Legian. It used to be a good, comfortable and nice hotel a few years go. During my stay this time of the month and yer, I was not pleased because TV Cable did not work at all, it was not easy to get accessed to WI-FI, the bathroom was dirty and smelly.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Everything about the Radisson Blu Uluwatu was amazing. Staff was so helpful, friendly, personable, went above and beyond. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. The amenities and restaurants and spa were perfect. If I am ever back in Bali, I’ll be staying here. Until then I’ll be telling everyone else I know to stay here!

Besakih: The temple is nestled at the foot of Mount Agung, the tallest mountain in Bali. The trip there is uphill and getting more crowded during the season of traditional ceremony of the temple. One needs to wear sarong and climb the stairs to see to beautiful temple on top. Beside the…
Sacred: The old temples in Bali are so artistic and beautiful. They have a lot of monkeys that are not in total captivity. The staff are nice and are always attentive to guests.
Kuta: It's a nice beach for learn surfing , and it's clean.  I hope government will improve the facility on the beach
Mount: 1.	An early morning hike in the dark is suggested for the sunrise views. The best season to do the trek is from April - July. Avoid rainy season, as trekking becomes difficult.   2.	It’s a medium level hike (moderately difficult can say) and will take you nearly 1.5 to 2 hours…
Grandmas: This hotel perfect for group, the room is quite small only for bed and breakfast. Wifi is free in the room. The place is near with entertainmet place in legian street, also many mini market beside the hotel to find things you need. Distant to kuta beach around 300-400 meters.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: I went there for honeymoon with my husband.Since at the airport when the driver pick us up,we felt thay you welcomed us at home.There are so many things that made us surprised at first.All the staff there are very polite and friendly.They are also very responsive and quick helper.We are lucky to stay at the hotel.

Besakih: The temple is so far way in the heights. But still so beautiful. The official enterance fee is 60,000/person. but the tour guide tricks you and asks for high donations after he teaches you through the praying ritual on some private temple. Actually at the enterance a local tour…
Sacred: Having ventured here 25 years ago I wanted to take my kids for the experience. It has certainly changed from the crude forest where you bought some bananas and the monkeys come running at you. A beautiful visitors entrance and lovely timber walkways take you through the forest.…
Kuta: After a hectic trip of Bali a day before flight were in Kuta,planned to spend last day relaxing in this beach which was walking from our hotel. We arrived around 2 pm and stayed there till sunset.There were beach beds and few hours who were renting them,after long bargain got 2…
Mount: We set off from Ubud at 2.30am, arrived at the base of Mt Batur at 3.45am and began the hour long hike up the volcano. I have medium fitness level and had to stop every 10 mins or so to recover. It was very challenging to the point that I actually had an EIB episode (exercise…
Grandmas: Cozy room, good service, delicious breakfast (ala carte) and very worth price. The parking lot is small. If you want to come with your ride, better you come with motorcycle. There are only 2 lots for car parking.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Pros: Beautiful and modern Lovely, friendly staff. Very accommodating.  Breakfast was sufficient, with comfortable al fresco seating. There are lots of pastries, donuts, juices and cereal. The cooked section is a little limited. The dim sum didn’t look appetising enough to try.  Pool is lovely, with trees dotted within the pool. Made for a picturesque pool side scenery.  The poolside menu was great.  The local restaurant ‘Artichoke’ in the evening was also tasty. Good mix of Asian and Western dishes.  Environmentally friendly eg the room ac automatically turned off when the balcony doors were open, complimentary water in the room was in glass bottles, they do not sell water in plastic bottles in the restaurants and all straws are non plastic.  Daily treats in the room were a…

Besakih: I've been in Bali for close to two weeks, visited a few temples and was enjoying my stay, until I arrived at Besakih temple. The temple itself is nice and it's something to see. The local guide's mafia and other scammers is something else. I was arrassed the moment I arrived…
Sacred: We had the most amazing experience with our guide Putro. He was friendly and helpful, he even carried our backpack for us. Thank you Putro for making oir day trip so amazing. Leon & Madeleine from South Africa
Kuta: We stayed at Grand Inna Kuta the perfect location on Kuta Beach. Always bargain with the vendors for best price. Legian street famous for nightlife daily. Dont forget water shoes for the beach.
Mount: Loved our walk to the top of Mt Batur.  We hired a guide who escorted us to the top where we had fantastic views.  Awesome to reach the summit of a volcano and see gases being emitted and some wild monkeys as well as a stray dog or two.  The walk was somewhat challenging but not…
Grandmas: i booked for 3 ppl room and the room is quite spacious unlike the budget hotel ive visited. the room is clean, the staff is nice and friendly, the wifi is fine, the breakfast is also good. overall, its worth of my money :) and most importantly is in the legian, so its really easy to find nice bars, to shop, and to relaaax
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed for 9 nights as a package through luxury escapes.  Good value for money, meals on site are really reasonable.  Friendly staff and clean rooms.  Would definitely stay at Raddison again.  We had about 6-8 massage vouchers as part of our package however we only had the ability to use 1 as they had no bookings available over our 9 night stay. I find this hard to believe as our next hotel is fully booked also and I managed to get a booking the next day.

Besakih: Went with Guide , place is far from Legian where we were based , about 2 hours . Temple is huge against the backdrop of Mount Agung . Unfortunately for us the day was cloudy and the mountain peak was drowsed with white clouds , bummer ..  Temples could be more well maintained ,…
Sacred: Tones of monkeys! Amazing place! Don’t look them in the eye!! And women be careful during your period time. Other than that amazing)
Kuta: Nice beach to walk along in the evening. Very tidy and good views. Water can be rough but warning flags are shown.
Mount: This was the first time I’d ever hiked up a mountain... it’s was hard but so so worth it, our local guides (we had 2 because we were a group of 7 - aged between 14 & 45) were amazing and caring, I would not have made it up or down without their help & support!   The hike is…
Grandmas: This hotel is located on Legian St which is really close to Kuta beach and lots of local shops. The staffs were really friendly and helpful. We were even greeted with a very nice  conversation by one of their receptionist. My mom enjoyed that. This hotel is also close to a lot of restaurants or local food. It was a nice stay.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Great value for money and location in Uluwatu Bali.  You can walk to the beach easily, or enjoy the great pool central to all the room.  Many activities to enjoy not far from the hotel in Ulu....  The photos represent the hotel well

Besakih: It is a huge beautiful temple that not many tourist go. It is the mother temple so it is the most important temple for them on the island. It is very nice and with great views. With your entrance fee you have also included a guide to explain you everything.
Sacred: The walk through the natural rainforest is worth the cheap admission price alone. The monkeys were not interested in us during our visit. Allow up to 1 hour to wander around the Sanctuary.
Kuta: I used to hear bad reviews about Kuta beach saying that it's dirty. But when I went, it's cleaner that I expected. If you plan to sunbathe and rent a sun chair, don't settle for the first price they offer you. When we were walking along the beach asking for price of sun chair,…
Mount: The drive to Kintamani where Mount Batur is located is very enjoyable and scenic. The view of the Mount Batur will also depend on weather conditions at times. If you are lucky, you definitely will get one of the best view of the Mountain along the lake. It is worth every penny…
Grandmas: We stayed for one night after arriving in the late evening and before transferring to Ubud . The rooms aren't huge but they are very clean and have a good bathroom, t.v. , mini bar and tea/coffee making facilities.  The bed was really comfortable and there is also breakfast available.  Great location and super cheap prices.  Would definitely recommend for short stays.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: My husband and I came here for the day as we bought a day pass. We both thought this was a great deal. It was about AUD 18 per person and it included access to their facilities I.e. the gym, a yoga class, the beautiful big pool, pool side lounge, pool towels and 10% off food.   It’s a really nice resort so chilled, great facilities and the staff are very attentive and accommodating.  We also went to one of the restaurants onsite called Felini it’s really nice Italian food.   I would definitely recommend. I just can’t comment on the rooms as we didn’t stay.

Besakih: Visited yesterday, paid 60K each and declined the services of a guide. Walked round most areas only the one area where there was a ceremony on. As most have said these are on every day, and add colour for us tourists. The price of drinks and toilets are steep. It appears the…
Sacred: Forest is so good also you feel your in movie of monkey I like it this experience so so much and I like old style and culture
Kuta: The beach itself is beautiful but the locals who are trying to make a living that don't take no for an answer ruin it. We were there for about an hour and the same 4 people hounded us continually until we left the beach. All we wanted to do was buy a few drinks at one of many…
Mount: You always need a guide to hike mount batur, you have to prepare yourself because the way up there are very hard, need to use tracking pot
Grandmas: Went to Bali for a short trip and choose Grandmas Plus Legian as a place to stay. I stayed here for 3 nights and it was nice. With a strategic location, you don't have to be worry because there are a lot of mini-markets, cafes, bar, restaurants to visit!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The room was very spacious and updated because it was new. Service was great, staff was very attentive. Location was good since it’s close to Padang Padang Beach and the hotel has shuttle, but not the best location if you’re looking for great restaurants or shopping.

Besakih: Almost imposible to visit alone if you do not have a specific guide with you... but having a guided tour will just make you to waste your time going to areas that maybe you are not interested in, and hearing many times the same information... cause  even guides do not have too…
Sacred: I would say this is a must see in Ubud - the sanctuary is well maintained with staff who are happy to talk about the monkeys and how they are cared for. It's a close-up experience with some great photo opportunities
Kuta: This is one of the must visit areas  Great for sunset viewing   If you go please look out for Blueys bar.  Cold beer and excellent service
Mount: An awesome activity, average fitness required, good walking shoes, warm jacket, a headlamp is useful and start from Ubud if you can (shorter driving times). Check the weather forecast. The view is spectacular. We prearranged guides through our driver (Bali Tours Ngurah Alun) and…
Grandmas: a nice price conscious hotel small rooms but with adequate facilities with a good breakfast. good care, service with friendly staff. good location Nearby the beach. good location within walking distance to the beach. With its location on Legian, this is centrally located, with everything within walking distance. Location on Syminjak is shorter at the beach and here are more international tourists.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: This hotel is very spacious, luxurious and comfortable to stay with a family. Price is affordable, considering the hotel design, size and location in the elite complex of Uluwatu. But location wise, dont expect a short walking distance to the beach, it took much effort to walk to Impossible Beach and that beach isnt really worth it compared to the track on the way there.

Besakih: Besakih Temple, also called the Mother Temple, is located on a small height at eastern part of Ubud which relates to Brahma, Vishnu and Mahesh.  The temple complex is huge and you have to negotiate several steps to go around.  The Government authorities have regulated its…
Sacred: So many monkeys and they are not afraid of people so will come really close. The setting is very beautiful and a nice walk through the forest too.  Only issue is with tourists who like to tease or harass the monkeys with no respect.
Kuta: We've been there to enjoy drinks and watch the surfer. The guys there are very friendly and helpful. But there are too many old woman offered for something and very pushy. We got a very bad experience with the old woman which is for us it is quite rude. Hopefully it will not…
Mount: First off I'll premise this with the fact that I am not an experienced hiker - However, my partner loves it and when we decided to go to Bali, it's something that she really wanted to do so I agreed.   It completely exceeded my expectations. The hike is by no means difficult,…
Grandmas: I booked a room for 3. A friend told me beforehand to check the parking policy because Legian street is so crowded and have no space to park, turned out they provide a free valet service for every guest. The room itself, even though a little too small for 3 adults, but tidy, and has all the necessities needed. We didn't pick the breakfast option so we have nothing to say about it. Only note is, the service is a bit slow. It took overnight for a hairdryer to be delivered to our room, and like 20-30 minutes for our car to arrive (assumed the parking lot is pretty far from the hotel itself). But the staffs are nice, reception is open for 24 hours (we got a McD delivered at 2 AM and everything is fine).  Would recommend for the best option to stay in Kuta since you can walk to the…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: you, yes you! if you reading this review, trust me! just book this hotel and you will be blown away with everything! we wish we can stay longer! Radisson Blu left a such great memories for me and my GF during our stay in Bali. such a true Balinese Spirit in hospitality.   thank you for looking after us! will come back! 10/10

Besakih: A large complex of Hindu temples, set near the holy Mount Agung. I was reluctant as have been harangued here 30 years ago. But much better now. We paid for entry tickets, Rs 60,000 each for foreigners, reasonable. The guide was so good I tipped him Rs 50,000 for two. The complex…
Sacred: Fun place to walk around, the monkeys are very skiddish compared to other monkey forests in Bali. Would not recommend bringing anything in (the monkeys will even steal water bottles!). Look out for the super small baby monkeys hanging on their parents, it's so cute! There is an…
Kuta: the beach is clean but too crowded.if you want sitting place then you have to buy beer which does not come cheap! you get cheated on price. best thing is to stand or walk and enjoy the sunset!
Mount: Many tourist give this beauty a skip- but its highly recommended to visit this beauty and witness blissful sunrise!! To start with , a relatively easy hike to summit this beautiful live volcano , though you need decent amount of endurance levels to summit this a bit faster . Our…
Grandmas: It was a comfort 4 nights trip in Grandmas Plus Legian. All staffs are really kind and helpful. Overall we felt satisfied but, we needed one more trash bin in our room, because they only provided one in the bathroom.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: The Radisson was amazing! Overly helpful and friendly staff. Rooms clean, spacious and very comfortable. Pool was beautiful and food great. 45min drive from the airport and 1hr from Kuta, but we had no need to go! Everything we needed was in Uluwatu, lovely restaurants and some shopping.

Besakih: It's a beautiful temple that is really in need of care to maintain its beauty. Hope Balinese take a cue from Cambodia. The beauty of temple is marred by garbage and number of kids and vendors selling their stuff. Wish we could enjoy it more
Sacred: Beautiful place with more than 1000 monkey living in a free environment! We enjoyed seeing them interact with one another, eating and playing in their little bath! A truly beautiful experience. Best to go in the morning when it's not as busy. Entry price is also cheap.
Kuta: Kuta beach is a good place to learn to surf...although we were ripped off hiring a sun bed 200.000 for two hours the owner definitely see us coming, once bitten twice shy never got ripped off again.
Mount: My husband and I signed up for the sunrise trekking while in Bali. Neither of us had ever climbed a mountain before but from the reviews and also the operators we were expecting a resonably challenging walk up to the summit. Some of the operators mentioned that one could wear…
Grandmas: It’s not super luxurious or anything but it’s certainly more than budget! Everything is clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great, but the menu is limited so if you’re staying for more than a couple of days you might get bored.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: What a gorgeous resort! Our room was beautiful with spectacular views from the wrap-around veranda. Service from staff and the variety of food/drinks was  great and the spa treatments were so luxurious! If you are looking for a high quality resort in a quieter location, this is the one!

Besakih: We had a short vacation and we only chose 3 places to visit. They are almost in the East of Ubud. And Besakih is the first temple we visited. It also called Mother Temple. It located in big area, bigger than I image. Very nice with unique architech of Hindu. Ticket price: 60.000…
Sacred: Beautiful natural setting to watch the monkeys play and interact in a clean and well maintained venue.  The monkeys are well fed and looked after.  Great little nature walk.
Kuta: Hey, have known Made and his Mum for over 8 Years, who service the beach area for chairs/massage, these are absolutely beautiful people who care your enjoyment upon your stay, look out for there position on Kuta beach, you will not be disappointed, (Mardi Bar) he will also take…
Mount: I will highly recommend this trek as we thoroughly enjoyed it. Also we went through Krishna Bali Trekking Tour as suggested by a friend. Arpa (our driver) and Rasia (our guide) were amazing and provided great service (pick up from and drop to the hotel, and guide plus…
Grandmas: Given the triple bedrooms. Room was big and clean, just the aircon cooling function a bit slow, it might take longer time to get cooler. Location is good, easier to get mini mart. For breakfast, it is not buffet style but limited choices for breakfast yet.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: This is the perfect spot if you need to unwind. The hotel is beautiful, facilities are excellent and the staff are exceptionally friendly and professional, helping in any way possible. The breakfast variety was great and the Blu burger ordered as room service was delicious.  If you're looking for excitement and vibey surroundings, this is not the place as its a bit far to walk. But it's a world on its own, perfect for lounging by the pool, relaxing on the amazing day beds and sipping delicious cocktails.

Besakih: We have visited the temple on september 2nd. The things you can read her are right, BUT I am definetly convinced, that a visit is worth it. The temple is really amazing, if you don't have to argue with the guys there. We had a beautiful stay there without any stress. Here is our…
Sacred: It is iconic to Bali spend one hour taking pictures so long one does not have connections with the monkeys it is safe
Kuta: Not the most beautiful beach of Bali. The sea is a little too rough to take a swim. Good for surfing, walk and watch the sunset.
Mount: We went to the base of the mountain near the lake. Its a amazing view. Can take a lot of photos. Sunrise and sunset is very good from this location.
Grandmas: The hotel is located in a strategic area, it’s just around the corner of Legian and Seminyak Street. By saying that, the space for car parking is also very limited here. They also provide free bicycle rental for the hotel’s guests.   I really like their lobby and restaurant area. The restaurant is very unique, with all those amazing hanging photos plants! The breakfast is just ok, I would say it doesn’t come in a big portion (we can only choose from the menu list).   The room is also not spacious aka small. It has safety box and mini refrigerator though. My problem with the room is that they don’t have enough electricity socket. They only have 2 near the table and it’s not enough, so I would recommend you to bring extension if needed. Also there’s no socket in the bathroom. But…
