I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: As an Interior designer, i consider myself having pretty high standards for hotel, and i've been to many beautiful hotels in the world. Rightly so, Radisson blu uluwatu is one of the best place that i have ever been and friendly rate for such an exceptional hotel with high quality materials such as imported marble, veneers, solid wood. Honestly, I am so happy i found this place. Beautiful lobby with breathtaking view, nice fancy, romantic restaurants and also kids club/activities during the day. Overall I had the best stays in Uluwatu!!! and i would definitely recommend this place..

Besakih: Sits 1,000 metres high on the south-western slopes of Mount Agung, You will witness a cluster of temples and shrines, each having their own story and uniqueness.
Sacred: Good place to visit with family and just for everyone. Entrance is 80.000r. Has just 30mins to visit, it closes at 18:00
Kuta: we went to see the sunset and loved it. we had some cold beer at the local bar and the massage ladies were very cute as well.
Mount: Visit mount Batur  and Lake to Enjoy Natural of Caldera, you should try to reach in morning and swimm at Hot Spring,and enjoyd the lunch in one of the restaurants opposite to the mountain to enjoy views of Mount Batur,most if the restaurant are buffet with a local food.
Grandmas: i was sceptical at this hotel at first time because of its cheap price, but when i checked in all the bad thought was gone. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room are clean and comfy (comfortable bed with many pillow), and the most important is they served the best ala carte breakfast. You should also try their restaurant, they served delicious italian food.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: I almost don't want to talk this hotel up too much, otherwise lots of people will go there and it may not be as relaxing!!! I have been going to Bali for many years, but it was my first stay in Uluwatu. I stayed here through a Luxury escapes deal and was a little apprehensive as not sure what to expect. It blew my mind, the Hotel is beautiful, the staff are amazing and the Food and service is the best I have ever had. definitely recommend it...

Besakih: The temple is amazing and the guide was very interesting. But take care, this place is full of scams. For information we paid 60 000 rp for a full visite accompanied with guide (including entrance). Take a sari with you in order to have access to the temple.
Sacred: The park is well organised and clean. It is easy to walk around and lots of info how to walk and behave against the monkeys.  The monkeys seams very ok and live their lives and interact now and than with visitors. They are not scary but funny. The guards are keeping the visitors…
Kuta: lovely long beach, great to watch so many people use if for surfing, swimming, body boarding etc, must watch out for the flags tho, as the water /waves can be VERY strong and a numbe of times we saw people get taken out by a wave. Great to see the life guards patrolling so well.…
Mount: You can see the valcano from kintamani. But it was not active and they will not allow if it is active. Can see the valcano mount from the view point and buffet lunch offered to relax and enjoy this place and take some pictures for remembering.
Grandmas: stayed at Grandmas Hotel Legian on januar it gave us a good impression, FO staff always eager to helped us, can feel the real hospitality when i was there. will staying at grandmas hotel legian for our next trip.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Great value for money, fantastic rooms and facilities, best breakfast ever, secluded location, high prices in the hotel restaurant, lack of trust in customers. Communication with the staff could have been better even though everybody seemed to be very nice and friendly.

Besakih: Worth visiting for those interested in history, architecture, and Hindu religion.  All temples are open on the full moon day, as told by the guide. The entry ticket includes the guide and a rental sarong that you need to return on the way back. You can carry your own sarong. The…
Sacred: .....this is one place you can see them close up, feeding, relaxing, playing and getting friendly with one another.  You are asked not to approach them, feed or try to pet them for a reason.  You are in their evironment, so leave them to it.  You will see odd ones outside the…
Kuta: This beach is big and perfect for surfers. You can go in the water still if you don't want to surf and swim but be careful not going too far due to the waves and current. It was a bit hard to find where to swim because surfers come to the swimming area between the flags. I…
Mount: Awesome view and if you get there early very quiet and peaceful. Worth the trek up if you are staying in Ubud. From Kuta it would be a long drive.
Grandmas: the location beside aston hotel legian, around shops n rental of motorbike n tour, the hotel in the corner, near commonwealth bank and link atm, padang resto, hotel is non smooking hotel from lobby until  the bedroom, the room is simple and the shower bathroom also simple, nice n chic hotel without smoke of cigars
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: We stayed in a studio suite at the hotel for 5 nights, it was really big and had a perfect terrace where we could see the ocean.  The hotel is very modern and everything feels new, the pool and breakfast was outstanding. The service at the hotel was really good, everyone in the staff really tried to do their best for their guests.  When thinking about what to improve:  Cleaning of the room time is between 9-17, for me that is to long I want it at the latest 12. But after talking with the staff they helped us with that.  There are a lot of great beaches close to the hotel, the hotel have free transfer to Padang Padang but that one was a big dissapointment for us. A transfer to for example dreamland beach would have been much better. Impossible beach wich you can reach by the…

Besakih: Well worth the trip for the fantastic temple. Women and men must have covered legs and you get a sarong and a guide for your ticket. You don't have to buy one or apparently tip the guide. Beware of all the hawkers. Toilets are cheaper in the temple than outside. We did tip the…
Sacred: I highly suggest to visit this place! I loved it.. The scenery it's unique the staff is amazing and the monkey's are very interesting and playful
Kuta: Woke up each morning, walked the beach and watched the many surfers hit the waves.  Sent photos to my son just to make him jealous!  The beach is clean, well maintained and relaxing.    Fantastic sunsets while sitting on bean bag chairs and sipping Bintang beers. …
Mount: It was a fantastic experience! We climbed up for around 2 hours (hard tour) and had the most fantastic view of the sunrise. The transportation was not acceptable. The mini van was too small for the amount of people and the interior was not working (seat belt). The driving is…
Grandmas: #NAME?
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: It was an unplanned but great visit. The place was so clean and quiet. My room was big with my own terrace. Nice and comfortable bed. The staff were so helpful and friendly. A good breakfast buffet. I will come back to this lovely hotel again and book more than one night.

Besakih: My husband and I were lucky enough to find a great driver to take us from Ubud to Tulamben at a very good price. We wanted to stop off at some of the sites on the way and he helped us out with this. The first place we stopped was Besakih Temple and our driver helped us to get…
Sacred: This place is so cool, I’ve never seen anything like it before and it’s just so amazing to see these monkey’s play and even interact with you on their own. A must visit.
Kuta: Great beach. Walking distance to a few shopping malls. Convienient to hotels arount Kuta. Lots of fun
Mount: This message is for ones who don't want to support mafia and use their right to go without the guide. The long story short: not possible. Tried to hike from Toya Bungkah. Hid the bike in another place, tried to sneak but they noticed me. They approached me on a motorbikes, group…
Grandmas: the best for its price. Clean rooms, comfortable bed, modern decoration, kind people, excellent service.  Lack of balconies or big windows to dry out your clothes/shoes. (neither a hair dryer)  In the best place in Kuta Legian
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Great location for surfing Padang Padang with family. Close to a number of our fav beach clubs too. Services could be a little better but overall good value based on a number of previous trips to Bali

Besakih: The temple is breathtaking, I loved it. One of the best on the island.  I think ceremonies are fake... they say that everyday there is a ceremony for something to prey for (tourists?) and accidentally they started walking in the stairs when some big tour-bass arrived. Curious.  …
Sacred: its nice place to look at but its luck if you see monkey playing , or you should by banana for  Any monkey to pick it up from you .  notice ; you could be stolen from monkeys
Kuta: If staying in Kuta very easy to find, beach very big, plenty options for drink and food, fairly clean and tidy, considering the volume of traffic.
Mount: The views of Mount Batur was the highlight of all the Bali attractions we attended in the Ubud area over a four day period.  Luckily on the morning we visited, the clouds were high and we had nice view.  Unfortunately, the vendors don't stop pestering you to buy their souvenirs,…
Grandmas: Good room (clean and nice), yummy food (love the croissant burger), fabulous spa (OMG, must try!!), perfect location (near Kuta beach and lots of restaurant/cafe/bar/club), and most of all, thumbs up for the hospitality and service (<U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D>). I will be back for sure. Keep up the good work!!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Was an awesome place to stay with good food, awesome room and fantastic attentive staff. Only thing that could have been better was if they had a tour desk with more assistance to book day trips but other than that it was one of the best places I have stayed at. Highly recommended

Besakih: Go there early. If you arrive at around 9, you will be alone in this beautiful place and enjoy the silence, before the tour operators arrive.
Sacred: I really enjoyed being with the monkeys in their cool jungle environment.It was much better than I expected.
Kuta: We went there in the afternoon. It looked nice on a shiny winter day. People were surfing (the waves are not much big). We sat on the sand and spent the time till evening. As the sun started going down, number of people was increasing in manifolds. By the evening, the place was…
Mount: Visited Kintamani Village and had a stupendous view of Mount Batur. An enormous beautiful giant  - best way to describe.  Although you are not allowed to go close to the top, you can hike or have a view from nearby places.
Grandmas: This is my first time to stay here.  The room sizs is not too big, but i think its not a promblem  The staffs very kind, and the service i think thats good.  Near from the beach.  May be i'll be back here for my next trip
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We just returned from Bali and, after traveling around, this may have been our favorite hotel of the trip.  I’d definitely recommend this hotel for a quiet, upscale oasis and home base in southern Bali.  The rooms are very spacious and well appointed and the pool is amazing with lots of places to hang out while slightly submerged (often necessary in Balinese humidity).  The staff were very friendly and remembered our coffee orders each morning for breakfast.  The breakfast and Indonesian restaurant were delicious as well (we didn’t try the Italian).  While you do need to drive to get to beaches, the hotel runs a shuttle so it’s fairly easy to get around.

Besakih: BUT, the monopolizing and extortion by the "village Elders" ...  For example:  1) to use the motorcycle to go up 3 min drive up the mountain: IDR 10k each way;  2) a Guide: "Free but you may give donation." (and no, you cannot ask your tour driver to be your guide)... 3) you can…
Sacred: The green around and a pleasant place with monkeys around. It feels good to see where we all had come from   . You will find many active monkeys which are even ready to pose with you but it's definitely at one's own risk. It's prohibited to disturb monkeys but I saw feel people…
Kuta: Kuta beach is a very pleasant place visited by tourists besides Kuta beach is also famous in Bali there we can see white sand that is so beautiful and the scenery is very beautiful and cool especially at night
Mount: Beautiful and gorgeous view of Mt Bator. Worth the long journey from Seminyak to Kintamani for this view, in Bali..
Grandmas: Booked 1 night here last minute to just store our bags and shower in before departing at midnight. Was perfect for what we needed and the staff were accommodating. Very basic but filled our void!! :-)

Radisson: I’ve stayed 5 nights at Radisson Blu Uluwatu and was the greatest time!  The staff is very nice and they are ready to help 24/7.  The room is nice and big with a beautiful view! Everything is really clean and comfortable. The hotel has 2 restaurantes and 2 bars, with great food and reasonable prices.  The location is the best! The hotel is near to the best restaurants, spa and beaches. It’s 5 minutes (by scooter) to Padang Padang beach and 13 minutes to Dreamland beach, our favorite! They also have a shuttle to some beaches and temples. I really loved the hotel and would definitely recommend to everyone!

Besakih: I visited this temple at about 20:00. There was total silence here and the temple was already closed. But the priest allowed me to come in. I never thought that this place was so calming. It is a good place to meditate. I will surely come again one day, in the morning of course.
Sacred: Enjoyable time to stroll paths to see monkeys doing what monkeys do! Beautiful temple in middle of sanctuary along with very old water features. So funny!
Kuta: Yeah overated - Kuta beach was busy and you are continually hassled by the locals to buy this and that. Personally I have no plans to return as the kids were overwhelmed by the attention, my 9 year old especially. I appreciate this is there livelihood however I want to be able…
Mount: We went on a mountain trekking which was arranged by the Hotel. The road we went was bit bumpy still it was one of the best hiking experience you can get in your life. We left the hotel around 2.00 a.m. around 6.00 a.m. we came to the top of the mountain (It only takes max 2…
Grandmas: If your after a cheap hotel this is it, room and bathroom were quite small (but we just needed somewhere to sleep) hotel staff and security are friendly. Hotel is right on the corner and just a short walk to the beach and plenty of shopping just right outside the hotel. Ps breakfast isn't a buffet it's a set menu- we ate breakfast across the road at a local cafe.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Good hotel for a memorable trip. makes a memorable vacation. A pleasant experience and a relaxing environment. Good food, good room service and Spa Facilities . A relaxing quite place. I would definitely coming back and stay this place

Besakih: Entrance fee is 60,000 rp , followed by a 20,000 rp flower package for blessing, tipping for the local guide and then he demands a min. 160,000 rp (10 euro/12 usd) 'donation' for the temple. Our guide got quite rude and angry when we had little money to donate...We struggled to…
Sacred: It’s a well laid out and organised sanctuary - lots of monkeys seen in their natural environment. But if you are short on time, and/ or have older kids, could potentially give it a miss.
Kuta: I visited Kuta for two day to relax before heading back home to the states. The area is not the best, but the beach was pretty cool. The waves were crashing and sunset was awesome. There's moremerchants than needed with somerestrtuans for dining or relaxing in the shade.  If…
Mount: We were fortunate enough to book a private trekking tour to Mt. Batur with Bazir. His father picks you up on time at your home and drives you to the bottom of  Mt. Batur in a very nice and air conditioned car. He was very helpful and friendly so the long 1.5 hr trip ended up…
Grandmas: The location is closed to Legian beach, and the room is clean and quiet. The hotel does not have a swimming pool.  The pool is joined to the other hotel next to it, but it's okay. There is a small refrigerator in the room.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else. I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Everything was perfect during our stay. Both restaurants are very nice. Very good breafast too. On the cliff just a 10 minute walk to the surf spot Impossibles. Awesome. Compared to other hotels in the area, great value.

Besakih: The temple has its majesty and you can really feel the energy of this sacred site, particularly if you go to the last most uphill temple ( where the imposed local guide didn't bring you). It is very peaceful. However, you have to forget the disgusting harassing local folks just…
Sacred: Enjoyed my visit there. Fascinating to observe monkeys going about their lives and interacting with each other. Do drop by. You won't regret it.
Kuta: Nice open beach area. Ideal for surfing as waves are ample enough for it.   Swim with caution as the waves are strong.   Sand is good.   Water temperature is a bit chilly for my taste. (I prefer the warm temperature of beaches in the Philippines)
Mount: A friend who’s also a guide (Baga - contact me if you’d like to use his service ) took us up Mt Batur To see the sunrise.   We started our ascent around 3:45am and got to the top Around 5.   There are many ways to get up there.  Some Route easier than others.  You must use a…
Grandmas: Very nice clean hotel with you all the amenities. Staff very friendly and helpful.A small tip goes a long way to see a cheerful happy smile on cleaning staff. Massage service offered here and breakfast was excellent as well. Enjoyed my stay in Legian
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: When I and my girlfriend decide spend our holiday in here. I never regret,because the room was awesome, pool and bar so amazing,and also with the Spa . 24 hours rooom service? That's insane I love it, the food was fantastic I love when i got my dinner at Artichoke Restaurant. Staff very kind to us. Thanks to Angga always give us the best seat when we got breakfast and always give us advice when we gonna visit some where in  Bali. Thanks to all staff make our first visiting Bali is the best experience! Your Hotel is dope . I think I'll come again next year

Besakih: We visisted the temple in our last day which happened to be the Hindu weekly celebration. The temple is huge and nicely designed with wonderful colours. The local guide will explain to you everything about the prayers and offering.i found it interesting to know about others…
Sacred: I would skip this on a trip to Ubud. I had been warned by a few folks not to go because it was so touristy but I wanted to see the temples since we were staying in a hotel nearby.  Not worth it and actually dangerous.  You cannot go inside the temples, they are always closed and…
Kuta: Just like normal beaches in Bali . But kuta is one of the most popular Beach in Bali . Clean beach , we enjoyed the sunset  Good for surfing and another activity But we got annoyed cause lot people offered us surf board.  But overall is good place to enjoy sunbathing or just…
Mount: Yesterday me and my family (my husband and sons (9 and 14 years old)) did trekking to Mt. BATUR. This is the wet season in Bali and I affraid that this activity will not be so exited as it will be in summer. Ah, I wasn't right. Thanks to our guide Bazir (+62 87760381082) He was…
Grandmas: Center for many places, located in local shopping Kuta, near to beach, good food. very clean place. friendly staff, low price, easy to travel nearby places and more ways of transportation.less price more amenities.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Very kind staff, great locationn and very good facilities. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families, couples, friends and solo. The principal reason that I recommend this hotel is the staff. One of the best staff that I’ve ever seen

Besakih: This temple has the most expensive tickets but there is no entry to all the temples inside. You just have to stand outside and peek inside. Best thing is to avoid this place. There is nothing.
Sacred: We were staying in Ubud so took a walk to see the monkey forest. Apparently money is being invested in the area and it looks quite something as you approach the entrance. The monkeys are essentially wild within the forest area and although lined with fences, there is nothing but…
Kuta: Kuta beach is great for beginner surfers who might not be ready for the waves somewhere like Padang Padang.   You can rent a surfboard for an hour for IDR$50K (AUD$5) or you can get a lesson for an hour for IDR$100K (AUD$10) from any number of vendors along the beach.   The sand…
Mount: Mt batur is one of active vulcano in Bali smaller than Agung but really awesome to see sunrise from the top ,located in Bangli regency took around 2 hours drive from Seminyak ,Kuta ,Nusa dua.60$ all inclusive hotel transfer two time breakfast or 70$ for the best package free…
Grandmas: The location is really great. Just walking distance from the ground zero and Kuta beach. The room is average size for 2 people and breakfast is also good for budget hotel. Please stay at 2nd floor for more comfortable room. 3rd floor is quite noisy because next this hotel, there is pub.

Radisson: Thank you so much .this hotel was fabulous .service amazing .food excellent .staff amazing cleanliness fantastic .pool area amazing .you don,t feel you are on top of anyone . what more can i say .i highly recommend  this hotel ..

Besakih: We had a guide / driver for a day and asked him to drive us to Besakih Temple as every book talks about this site. As he was not part of the mafia-guides controlling Besakih he could not join us.  At every step, at anytime, we were solicited to receive "free help to visit but…
Sacred: See how the monkeys live and play. I woud really recommend it if you are on Bali. Beautiful park, all organised.
Kuta: Beach probably good for surfers, you can even rent there a surf. But for other people it's not good - you have to be on the sun, because everywhere in the shadows are sellers with their stands. They talk to you, trying to sell you something. It's not possible to just lie there…
Mount: We decided to be adventurous for our bali holiday so we booked the Sunrise Trek of Mt Batur through ubud sunrise hiking. 2.00 am wake up call after only 4 hours of sleep. At 2.30 am we meet our driver and hop into an SUV. We paid 30$ each for small group 4 people in all. The…
Grandmas: This is a very nice hotel, friendly staff, the location is in the heart of legian.  I stay 3 days in this hotel and it was my birthday. The hotel staff prepare suprise for me at breakfast time, give me a birthday pancake and they gave me bucket of sun flower. So lovely.   Thankss so much. Keep up the good work
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The hotel is just amazing. Got mixed impressions with reviews, but after being there can say two words: Excellent Hotel! Location is great, food outstanding and spacious rooms with great cleaning service. Would be great to have it on the beach, however there are not many options for such location in Uluwatu. Thanks for making my visit memorable. One remark: please watch out on laundry service, I had some issues...

Besakih: There are countless things to do and places to visit in Bali. When I went there I saw to it that I would have a chance to visit its Hindu temples to catch a glimpse of the local people's spirituality. I know that there were thousands of temples on the island, which is the only…
Sacred: Loved visiting this place! The monkeys are definitely right there with you, in living color! If you have anything sparkly on or backpacks with zippers, watch out!
Kuta: Eventhough the place is crowded but we still can feel the wind and the sound of the wave.  If you in a budget, you better bring your own cloth or big scarf
Mount: I’m an avid smoker and lover of the booze and it was a very chilled hike. After reading previous reviews I was under the impression I would be facing something that would give Mt Kilimanjaro a run for its money.  But it was much easier than I thought, the pace is slow because of…
Grandmas: I slept like a baby as the room is so comfortable. I loved how they put a small wooden bar section next to the bed, it gives a very calming vibe during my stay at Grandmas Legian.   Everytime I go and stay at a hotel, bathroom section has always been my biggest concern. But Grandmas hotel, for a very affordable rate, has an exceptionally clean and comfortable toilet.   I also tried the Spa downstairs right at the lobby which happens to be one of the top 3 spas in Legian, had a 90 minute massage and fell asleep throughout the session.   Will definitely comeback!

I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I felt 100 % comfortable in this Hotel! It’s the first hotel in bali, which looked as on it’s photos! The staff is more than friendly and the facilities are new and modern designed. Furthermore, the rooms are very big and clean. The breakfast buffet offers everything from local Indonesian food to European breakfast options.  I will come back :)

Besakih: Pura Besakih is undoubtedly Bali's most important and beautiful temple. It is a pity that its reputation is being ruined by numerous tricksters who are out there to deceive the unwary tourist. Our trustworthy local guide could not accompany us inside the temple complex because…
Sacred: The first ten minutes will get you to plenty of monkeys... the next 60-90 a lot more of the same.  Interesting to see (but up to a point).  A subset of visitors manage to behave more like monkeys than those with tails, doing everything the signs say not to do.  Guess what?  The…
Kuta: The beach was lovely. Lots of people around. Plenty of places to eat n drink. Didn't like being harrassed to buy local goods.  Would've loved to have a good look around the markets on the beach, but just got harrassed.
Mount: I booked my tour through Get Your Guide sunrise mountain tour! We started our hike up at 4am equipped with a hiking stick and a head torchlight, with our tour guides Widi & Adi. Both of them were young, patient and very experienced with Mount Batur. The beginning of the trek…
Grandmas: Stay there for 3 nights,  The room was okay, really worth for price given. Staff was friendly, big thanks to night reception Nicho for the great assistant.  Location just steps away from the legian main crowd.  Personal input will be for wifi internet need to be improve, and also towel that soon need to be replace.  Overall great stay.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We booked a 7 night stay at Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu through Luxury Escapes. We upgraded our stay to the studio suite. Part of the Luxury Escape package was airport transfer. This was great and very convenient especially since we were arriving in Bali after 11pm. Upon check in we received a drink on arrival. We were then escorted to our room, which was so helpful as the hotel is so large and we would have certainly gotten lost. The room was absolutely huge, with a king bed! We were surprised to a message and cake wishing us a happy honeymoon. The room was very clean and very modern. We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning at the Artichoke restaurant. We always had a wide selection of both western foods and also traditional balinese food. The cakes and pastries…

Besakih: Bali's Mother Temple Besakih is a truly exquisite site with several adjacent Puras or Temples that are all wonderful pieces of architecture. However, what may ruin the experience a bit (it did for us) are the many sellers of so-called obligatory offerings and paid-for guides…
Sacred: This visit had been recommended by friends and was one of our first activities in Ubud.  Overall it is a good place to spend a few hours without having to travel to nearby forests.  They have staff looking after the safety of visitors and fauna and the monkeys are used to having…
Kuta: I live around the Kuta beach. Discovery Shopping Mall is a fantastic connection between my hotel and the beach. If you take the Discovery route, the part of the beach you arrive at is quiet and not that touristy at all. Along the way, you will be approached by surfing coaches. I…
Mount: This was one of the best experience I had in Bali.   We set out really early to get to the volcano by 4am. We started our trek in the dark with torch lights (don’t worry it’s not that scary!)  You will have a guide with you and you’ll see and hear other hikers along the way. The…
Grandmas: As always  when we're in denpasar regio we stay  at grandmas hotel. After we pick-up my brother from  the airport we started our Bali tour from grandmas where spend some days to get ready. Thanks to grandmas. Great place to be
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: My husband and I stayed at Radisson Blu Uluwatu for 2 nights. Our room was amazing and we were even upgraded for free! The room was spacious and had everything we could ever want. Comfortable bed, balcony overlooking the pool and the beach and the bathroom was amazing.   The restaurant at the pool served amazing drinks and food. The breakfast was contentinal but literally had everything from a build your own omelette bar to donuts.   There is a walk way that will take you to Impossible Beach-not for the faint of heart, but we had a good little hike and great beers at the beach.   Downsides is it is rather far from the main road, no ATM or money exchange on site. However they are a fairly new hotel and still figuring out what people need. Overall, we had a great stay!

Besakih: The whole temple and the views with a mountain on the back were really pleasant, but all the local people were horrible. They trying to make money on everything! You needn't any guide because he was telling all the time the same information that I knew anyway and you needn't to…
Sacred: 2nd time i visited monkey forest and I enjoyed it even more.  Don’t wear anything loose like glasses or jewelry. They’ll sometimes climb your back and if you have a bag, they’ll open it and steal things from it. Walk around the area and just enjoy. If you have food, they will…
Kuta: The beach is beautiful but there are rocks and shells on the sand and in the water so its not easy to walk in the water.
Mount: No. It’s not an easy trek up. Loose rocks and steep ascend in sheer darkness are not exactly the best combo for a relaxing morning hike!  But you’ll be rewarded with a breathtaking sunrise once you completed the ascend after 2 hrs.   The first part was easy on tar path, then…
Grandmas: The hotel is in a perfect location. The staff are so friendly and for the price it is an awesome hotel. The breakfast is nice, was expecting buffet but it is set menu, Jesica was always there if you needed something during breakfast. If you sit outside for breakfast it takes longer to get your breakfast. But overall it is a great hotel and i would stay again.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Unfortunately due to a delayed flight I wasn’t able to actually sleep in the room I had booked but..I did get a tour of the facilities & was able to enjoy my included breakfast.  Breakfast spread was substantial and what you would expect staying in a hotel of this kind. Soup station, egg station, pastries etc etc.   The pool is big and has a central long deep area (1.25m) and shallow areas to each side for kids to enjoy.  The rooms are spacious and if you are lucky you might get an ocean glimpse.  You can access impossible beach at low tide but but check out monkey etiquette and be aware they are steep steps. You can also access the beach area from the pathway beside Anantara hotel.   At the end of the road & turn right are some lovely little cafes

Besakih: must see big temple with transport surprise... keep your hand on your wallet.....everybody wants some money even after you payed entrancefee ..
Sacred: Lots of Monkeys, it’s a pretty cool walking around this park and there are temples inside the park as well, it’s  worth the visit I think it’s a must do if you’re Ubud
Kuta: The only purpose of this beach is a surfing. Wave is too strong to enjoy swimming. A lot of surf agencies are reaching out tourists.
Mount: Must visit place in Ubud to Enjoy Natural views of Mount batur and lake batur. you should try to reach in morning so the weather is cool and have lunch in one of the restaurants opposite to the mountain to enjoy views of Mount Batur
Grandmas: So we arrived quite late and that was ok.  Checked in to our very small room and Tetris styled our luggage so we didn't fall over it in the middle of the night.  The room was very small by Asian standards with hardly any light and the bed pushed up against one wall meaning I had to crawl in and out.  Now the motel is in a good place but, and here is the but, it is one of the new breed of boutique hotels with very small rooms and no pool.  Arghhhh. Didn't see that on the booking list.  We could use the pool next door but that wasn't really ideal.   Now the whole problem became apparent when my poor husband couldn't get his wheelchair through the bathroom door.  This led to a discussion with  management who were fantastic and moved us to the Siesta Motel.  Marginally better but if…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The hotel was good value for money, and would def come and stay again! The rooms were clean and spacious and the bathrooms very nice - the staff - as it is normal in Bali - were superb! Also very kind when they had to say No to something.  Food portion and taste in the restaurants could be improved - I found that all the local dishes had been Westernised, and hence did not enjoy them - and as for the Western dishes (salad like dishes) they were just very very small (and not a starter).

Besakih: As the saying goes: "once there was a way to get back home."  and in this case , especially to Balinese, Besakih, considered to be the ultimate premiere sacred place of pilgrimage on the magic isle. It is interesting to not that according to traditional Hindu-based  religious…
Sacred: Great place with beautiful temples, Indiana Jones feel like! And bunch of monkeys all around! You need to go there!!!
Kuta: Kuta Beach is one of Bali's busiest beach It’s about 6 km north of Ngurah Rai International Airport..
Mount: A hike of 2 hours takes you on top of Gunung Batur to a height of 1700 metres (5600 feet) from where you have a fantastic view over the whole caldera. Climbing in absolute darkness to see the sunrise was quite okay with good head lamps. Close to the top it got really cold, windy…
Grandmas: with idr 270.000 , trust me, this hotel is the best .   great location minimalist building clean,  free soap, shampoo, toothbrush, mineral water and towel they have motorcycle rent for idr 75.000  nice bed nice stay thank you grandmas
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Wonderful hotel/resort! All the staff were so friendly and helpful across all areas, service was fantastic! Food was great at all restaurant options and a generous happy hour across 2 bars! Pool was great with lots of chairs and seating options. Spa is also lovely! Would definitely stay here again. Thanks so much :)

Besakih: We visited the temple with a guide who provided plenty of information about the temple. We were however mobbed by everyone trying to sell us things soon as we got to the top of the hill.  Would have enjoyed it more without all that. That's Bali these days I guess!
Sacred: Nice day outing at the monkey forest. They were not aggressive like Uluwatu and a good walk in the forest.
Kuta: Beach was great and has medium to high waves perfect for surfers and even beginners like me. They also offer surf board rentals and instructors. They also have a schedule everyday where they release baby turtles into the beach.  Sunset was also a very astounding view to…
Mount: Mount Batur tour is one of the must visited sights seeing activities in bali. We took lunch at the amora, Bali restaurant which has a wonderful view to the volcano. Worth the long journey from kuta beach area.
Grandmas: really well located hotel in the middle of iconic Legian street, comfort room, thank you for your hospitality, all your staff work professional. love the food, love the architecture, totally recommended <U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F><U+2764><U+FE0F>
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Excellent place good food and friendly staff clean room and pool very good and breakfast awesome  bed so comfortable it’s really good spa we had treatment excellent service we will come back sure next trip thanks Radisson  team

Besakih: You buy a ticket and you are obliged to take a guide with you !!!! DONT DO THAT. Its fraud. The whole environment of Besakih is full of people who are trying to get more money of you. I think maffia is controling Besakih. Very dissapointing !!!!!!!
Sacred: Visited the monkey forest with my sister and we both really loved it! Sure, you can see some monkeys without paying the entrance fee but just hanging outside the forest but you miss the best bits. It’s fun watching the cheeky little monkeys playing togeher and we were worried of…
Kuta: Kuta beach the most popular one in bali everyone hung out for a sip of beer or swimming.the highlights of kuta beach is the sunset you never find anywhere south east Asia the most beautiful sunset like kuta beach, the sometimes it will be crowded in evening but there planty of…
Mount: Its quite a hike up there but worth the view and beauty.  The views are mesmerizing in the early morning. Be sure to wear full length sleeves as it could be chilly there. Also you need good trekking shoes to make it at the top without problems.   Note : You can do complete trek…
Grandmas: Our stay (5 nights) was very comfortable at Grandmas Plus Legian. Hotel was clean, staff was very responsive and friendly. The only minus we were able to identify is the tiny hair dryer that the hotel borrowed to us, since we were 3 ladies with long hair it was quite a torture..but still this hasn't affected the overall great feedback we had for this hotel. The spa of the hotel (Rehat Spa) is a must visit while staying there!!
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Great place to stay. Pictures don’t do it justice... also very quiet. Breakfast was was also good with many options. Just wish they kept the pool open later than 7pm. Close to everything, cool restaurants and shopping.

Besakih: We visited the temple at 4:00pm, perfect timing if you want to avoid the crowd.  The visit was worth the journey despite the annoying - so called - guide that escorted us from the ticket office until he "appointed" a true guide. If your coming from Nusa Dua, you can make a stop…
Sacred: It was a complete immersion in the Indonesian forest and it was fun to see the monkeys bathing in the fountain or being able to push on the sink's knob to drink tap water! Be careful, if you kneel down to take a pic they will jump on your shoulders! Anyway, there are guards…
Kuta: We enjoyed the walk on the beach and also the cold beers while watching the sunset. Everything here is just lovely.
Mount: Probably the hardest thing I’ve ever done in my life! There is a shortcut track (which we did) and it is incredibly challenging. There is a lot of loose rock and steep inclines. Not sure if the other way is better but once you get near the top it’s extremely hard to get your…
Grandmas: Pay for 3 nights but stay 1  Staff was friendly  But hotel toilet abit slime some area  Hair dryer 1 big hotel only got 12 for so many rooms  Requested many times only got it.  Staff reason was guest requested didn't return  Then I told them you everyday clean room cannot take back the hair dryer you know only got 12.  For guys ok don't have.  But with lady with long hair ?  So decide to change place.   Hotel was central area near beach walk mall  10 to 15mins walk.  Breakfast was good. <U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D>  If management improve on the room toilet and hair dryer problem all is good.

Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Radisson: I stayed at Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu for 3 nights in the end of my solo-trip to Bali. The hotel feels very luxorious and modern. The outdoor space around the pool is fresh and clean, and it’s always a calm feeling in the area. The room was clean and nice, but the whole hotel feels kind of impersonal. The view from the balcony was wonderful. There are 3 restaurants in the area and they all had good food and several choices for a vegetarian. The service from the staff was always very good and I felt very welcome, especially since I was there alone. Two small beaches just a short walk away. They also have free shuttles to Uluwatu temple and Padang padang beach every day.  I’m very satisfied with my stay. 4/5 points because of the impersonal feeling.

Besakih: I think is the most important temple in Bali, and I was impressed. The landscape background is beautiful, and the whole complex is very impressive because is very old and they still use for praying.  Is a must in Bali if you want to visit temple !
Sacred: The monkeys are not trained and very dangerous. They snatch things from visitors. But the forest is very beautiful and soothing. So it's a must have in the itenarary.
Kuta: We took some surfing lesson and enjoyed ice cold beers. The beach is clean and packed with tourists. Sunset was beautiful
Mount: After reading a review about a local guide, we decided to take a private tour and contacted Mr Bazir (+62 877 6038 1082). It is a family operation. His father picks you up at 2/2.30 am in Ubud and then the son is your guide up the volcano. Bazir did a very professional job of…
Grandmas: Stay here we can go around Kuta - Legian...quite comfortable...clean....n with renovation they have a quote...n nice ornament in room. This hotels bring my good n sad memories on my life with my love one.. Now there is also reflexiology place beside the bella pizza. N very crowd... Hopefully keep this nice
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Radisson Blu Uluwatu was an amazing resort, even better than photos. The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and cleaned regularly with a turn down service (even noticed until near the end of our stay they change the treats each day). The pool and views of the ocean were the feature of the property. Recommend for a relaxing break away from the hustle and bustle.

Besakih: Hard to me to be fair about this temple because after 5 min there I've been scammed by a local guide. We almost had a fight because I replied to his verbal attack. According to him white people like us are greedy and should not go the temple.  Temple was nice above all if you…
Sacred: Went here with our daughter (18) and had a great time with the monkeys. A handler even fed the monkeys on our shoulders to get great photos. These are wild monkeys and should not be played with but at a distance we found they will not hurt you. We were told if the monkeys got…
Kuta: What a lovely location to see the most beautiful sunset. Loved the bars which are set up daily which offered you a chair to sit on. No sunbeds available on the beach. Massages offered which were lovely - think most of the ‘bars’ had women there offering massage or pedicure. Had…
Mount: Took a tour for the sunrise trek, was picked up at our hotel in Kuta around 1.45am.   The driver will buy some bread and stuff along the way to be brought up along with you during the trek to enjoy your breakfast at the peak.  Afterwards, he will drop you at the starting point…
Grandmas: Incredible hotel... Best values best service and best meal for breakfast. The staff very helpful.recomended so much. With the cheap rate from other. You should have to try to come to this hotel. Thank you grandmas

I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: It was a great hotel with a lot of useful facilities. They had great breakfast, a shuttle to take guests to Padang Padang beach, a wonderful swimming pool, clean & spacious rooms, and so many more! The staff were also great.

Besakih: I am surprised to see this is badly reviewed. For us, this was one of the finest temple experiences in bali. The complex is wonderful, the landscape background great and the best of all..not crowded! We landed there at the right time for a ceremony too and really felt totally…
Sacred: My first time in Baliii .Really sacred monkey haha <U+0001F606> many monkey and nice natural good weather for take a nice picture <U+0001F970><U+0001F618><U+2764><U+FE0F><U+0001F340><U+0001F412>
Kuta: My experience at Kuta beach wasn't great, honestly. Extremely crowded and filled with locals trying to fleece you. I felt it was super busy and not a place where you can actually relax. Seminyak or Legian are definitely better options.
Mount: We have three children aged 10, 9 and 6 and even though we have climbed mountains in England we were a little bit worried about the climb. Everyone says it is easy in Bali but they also say everything is 5 minutes walk. We were a little skeptical so looked up as much as we…
Grandmas: Room is super clean and quiet, bed is super comfortable... strategic location.. 5 minutes walk to kuta beach .. along legian street... many pubs restaurants shops within walking distance... i love their breakfast.. 5 star taste.. keep up good work!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We had a Great stay, it is a fairly new establishment. With quality amenities. Loved the gym and it’s equipment, a little small, but it’s a hotel gym not a fitness centre.  Quality shops and restaurants that are a short walk out side of the complex on the main road.

Besakih: Revisited the temple to take my niece.. beautiful but immediately had bad vibes about the guide. He turned out to touch us both inappropriately... then we were hounded to buy offerings, which we did, we were taken to pray and then our guide insisted we put money as offerings...…
Sacred: It’s a beautiful gentle jungle walk watching lots of playful monkeys. Children would love it. You are encouraged not to interact with them as they can be aggressive but you can easily walk amongst them.
Kuta: Sadly, although we are enjoying being able to walk every morning as we are staying opposite the beach, it is a very sad sight to say the least. There is a Lot of litter of all types strewn across the beach, from cigarette butts to large drink bottles. Unfortunately it is due to…
Mount: We were picked up from Ubud at 2:30AM to start our hike. We arrivied at the starting point and they provided us with breakfast (pancakes and tea). The hike started in darkness and only the provided flashlights were our source of light. The hike took us about 2hours (arrived…
Grandmas: We stayed at Grandmas at the beginning and the end of our Bali round trip and it is really a great hotel! Not much to add than what was already written and can confirm that the rooms are clean and tidy, good location and comfy. Rooms have a fridge, kettle and coffee/tea plus toiletries in the bathroom. A tad noisy from the main road traffic and recommend a room in the higher floors but otherwise no complaints - full marks!
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: I booked for a 3nights stay then eventually added one more night and im glad i did it. I arrived in the morning thinking i have hours before my check in, but got lucky they check me in early. Superb services from conceirge, room services and people in the restaurants, though I forgot all your names I always remembered your faces. Room was just so nice and cozy, veranda overlooking the pool, glimpse of the ocean and the mountain made so happy for my 4 nights stay. Room service is just so speechless they clean my room twice in a day with a chocolate to top of it or some cookies. Loved the amenities in the room like the speaker in the bathroom, cutie bag that i can carry around. Small touches can make me smile during my stay. The spa is so relaxing and the people I meet there…

Besakih: Get to the place after a 2hr drive and was taken to a counter to pay entrance fee. Didn't look like an official counter at all. Was then told I had to ride on the back of a motor scooter up a hill to get to the temple. Didn't like that at all. But didnt want to walk the long…
Sacred: Gorgeous place to spend a few hours. Monkeys were adorable, happy and most entertaining. If you have time, put this lovely spot on your to do list while in Ubud.
Kuta: Great vibes, tables and chairs available when you order your drinks from a local on the beach. Decided to have a mani pedi done by a local lady on the beach, this was a first for me. Once she started, her fellow hawkers came to us as well.  Not a fan of the random hawkers…
Mount: My sole aim in wanting to climb Mount Batur was to experience a sunrise above a sea of clouds, which normally forms there. The path is easy to follow and not to steep, as long as you of of average fitness. Unfortunately however, due to the practices of a local cartel which run…
Grandmas: I was surprised with the room, really small and it doesn't looks like the picture in the website, although it's clean. Not enough space for parking car area. Breakfast was quite good. Location is really closed to the Legian, Kuta and Seminyak Center.
