Radisson: Relaxing and wonderful stay at the hotel. Great customer service and facilities. The food was delicious and the day spa was 5 star. Highly recommend for a relaxing holiday and family friendly. Rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Besakih: The biggest, oldest and most important temple of Bali. We were warned about the people trying to scam you but it was not that bad. The kids loved the short scooter trip uphill and when we arrived we were swarmed with women and children trying to sell us offerings and cards. We…
Sacred: A different experience. Lovely environment with lots of monkeys. If you are carrying food you have to be very careful & I would recommend not to take any eatables with you as the monkeys will attack the bags with food. Had a Lovely walk through the trees. A must to visit while…
Kuta: Beach is average.  Lots of offerings on the beach dog poo.  Not a very great beach for swimming.  Sunset was great tho
Mount: The view of this volcano was incredible, the guide helpful from start in the dark early morning, he prefer light breakfast banana sandwiches cooked by volcanic steam. Really recommended this experience when you holiday to Bali.
Grandmas: Room/bed/pillows were very comfortable.  Very clean and no smell in the bathroom Aircon worked well Great breakfast (not buffet) Really friendly staff, ask you at every opportunity if everything is okay with your room and any complaints are followed up on quickly. Really fast internet compared to what i got elsewhere in Bali A bit of noise from the road/downstairs so like most hotels best to bring your ear plugs Only stayed here 1 night at the end of my trip but wished i had stayed here for longer.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: While my wife and I have travelled extensively, we had never previously been to Bali. Our 40th wedding anniversary needed something a little special and a deal from Luxury Escapes had us staying for 5 nights in a very large 3rd level room overlooking the ocean. The quality of the room and bathroom are 5 star!   The resort is relatively new being about 18 months old with the development being cloistered around a 10,000 sq m pool. This is a true resort with 2 high quality onsite restaurants and a number of bars. The poolside bar provided delicious food and beverage throughout the day with truly exceptional service; the staff are amazing. Special mention must be made of the Italian themed Fillini restaurant which serves food and wine of an international standard!  While we intended…

Besakih: Very busy with locals praying when we visited. Made it very Special to see hundreds of people bringing offers and praying (in the pouring rain). Large complex of many different temples. Just walk around. Ignore the people that see u Need guide. U do not. Free sarong at entry.…
Sacred: This experience was just gorgeous.  It was topped off by our personal guide “The Cheeky Monkey” who knew just how to get the perfect shots and have them crawling all over you.  Real up close and personal experience.  Delightful
Kuta: Nice beach, looks good for surfers, would not recommend swimming , if you go will see what I mean. Nice to walk along the sands as usual plenty of hawkers and beach bars, be prepared to be hassled almost continuously, they will not leave you alone
Mount: The hike was difficult for an moderately Active adult/teen. There are motor bikes to help you up for extra if you cannot make it up. The last 15 min you are trekking a steep, rocky path. But the sunrise and views at the top are breathtaking and can’t be missed.
Grandmas: My wife and I spent 3 days in this hotel during our 1 week tour in Bali. I found the hotel decent, comfortable, affordable and accessible. The rooms were clean, housekeeping is excellent. I found the interior so relaxing. The white and green walls are just pleasant to look at (in my opinion). Free breakfast was excellent too. Overall, the service was good. The staff were hospitable and are always ready to help anytime. I would recommend this hotel to those who want to spend short stay in Legian to have fun at night and on the beach. I look forward to comeback to this hotel in the future....
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: I needed a hard earned getaway between changing jobs. Best thing I ever did. The resort was amazing, food best in the area and the staff could not have been more dedicated and hospitable. I would highly recommend to anyone.

Besakih: To be honest we preferred some of the other temples we visited but I gave this a four star because regardless of aesthetic preference if you want to learn about Balinese culture whilst you are there you must visit this temple. It is probably the most important temple on the…
Sacred: Beautiful gardens but be careful, most of the monkeys are fine, but one tried to eat me! I guess I was in his house, but something to be mindful of.
Kuta: A very long Beach in Kuta, nice view of sunset, water is shallow so good for playing , also waves are bigger after a point so good for surfing.
Mount: We visited the lake below mt. Batur. We really wanted to go see the sun rise and do a trek but traveling with a 4yo makes all that challenging. However, do it if you can and have the means to do it. It s an amazing experience and the view s breathtaking. It brings a certain…
Grandmas: Right on Legian Street but a little bit far from the disco and clubs, so can sleep well. Rooms are not big, but you can find all you need during your stay: AC, TV, fridge, coffee maker, safety box, private bathroom with toiletries. Breakfast is really nice, I stayed 2 night and tries the American breakfast and the egg on the bun. The staff is really helpful and nice. I'll come back.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: My wife and I just returned from a week at Radisson Blu. We were there for a romantic break and to re-connect our marriage, as well as to celebrate my 50th birthday. The trip was a total success in every way. We have been to Bali at least 10 times previously, and this was the best trip yet. Some would say the location is isolated, I would call it picturesque and serene. Easy walk to convenience shops, money changer, ATM, excellent local cafes. Otherwise wait 5 minutes while the friendly reception staff call a metered taxi to take you further afield. Traffic can be busy and can take around an hour to the busy Seminyak area. Totally satisfied with the resort, the staff, the comforts, the breakfast, the pool. I also believe this resort offers value for money when compared to others…

Besakih: 60000 idr entrance fee and if you are polite to the so called guides and say you don't need their help that is what it will cost you. Borrow a sarong and yes everyone has to wear one, walk the hill (free bike lift if you can't walk it) and you appreciate the approach. There are…
Sacred: The best surprise we've got when we wolked around the big monkey forest and their temple, was meeting the big bats and how friendly they were. Even if the 5 macaco monkey families (more than a thousand members),they were living on that place fot a long Time, and being benereited…
Kuta: Busy beach all day - maybe not perfect for swimming (waves),b but certainly for relaxing and observing. Sunsets are beautiful and it's disappointing there are not 1-2 places where you can sit down to enjoy a cocktail with direct views of the ocean (plastic chairs are available,…
Mount: This was one of my must dos for Bali and I’m so glad I did. It’s a very early start but well worth it for the views and the sunrise. We started the walk at about 3:30am and the first part is tarmac, from the end of the tarmac to the very top took us just under two hours. I have…
Grandmas: The hotel place was good. Near from Kuta Beach and airport. Easy to found minimarket and ATM.  The room so clean The staff also nice. They know anti mainstraim destinantion destination in Bali. Will stay there again if i go to Bali
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We only stayed 1 night, but the food was terrible for the 2 meals we had. Superfood Salad by the pool was 95% lettuce with just a couple of bits each of the assorted superfood items. Pizza to go with it was like a poor quality frozen one. Dinner at the Italian restaurant later was just as bad, Carbonara was not made authentically (it had cream instead of egg), pasta was hard. The risotto was also hard. The bar also has not atmosphere.  Nice rooms and breakfast was good, but this hotel really needs to improve its catering to hit the standard it is going for, especially considering there are limited other food options close by.

Besakih: A magnificent architectural gem. The temple is one of the oldest Hindu temple in Bali.  The hillside location makes it attractive and offers great panoramic views across. Traditional and cultural norms needs to be adhered to as with all Hindu temples in Bali.
Sacred: An extremely beautiful place. Extremely clean and constantly getting swept and cleaned while being there. Very friendly staff.   Just a warning something everyone should inform themselves about at the start is what do you do when a monkey climbs you and then starts biting. What…
Kuta: I actually enjoy coming down here towards sunset time to enjoy a beer at one of the many beach bars and enjoy the banter with the locals. Gets very busy towards sunset , many beach sellers stroll the beach too , many places to get food and drinks as well.
Mount: We did this trek and they described it as easy. FAR FROM IT. Very steep and uneven surface. Takes about 2 hours to get to the top. But once there so worth it! Very incredible experience to do for sunrise couldn’t recommend it enough! We then went to hot springs afterwards which…
Grandmas: Very good price for the room around 275k rp/night without breakfast. The Hotel and Room are beyond my expectation, they let us early check in and all the services are good. The room is small but its fit what you need but maybe not for family with kids you can walk to pantai kuta around 10 minutes and all along the streets are full with shops,minimarts and small cafes  Will back again for sure
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Our family - grandparents, parents and very young children all just adored this place. Loved Uluwatu and the local vibe. Loved the hotel, the staff, the food and the amenities.   We had a great deal thru Luxury Escapes but would go back regardless.   You can walk up the track to local shops, down the cliff face to a small beach (Impossibles) but don’t take the kids, hire a nanny to give you a break, swim or lounge around in a very flash environment.   Take a local taxi to look around or the free hotel shuttle to Padang Padang Beach and Uluwatu Monkey Temple. PS Padang Padang is beautiful, clean and safe although the monkeys can be tricky on occasions. There is a bit of a walk down the steps and thru a rock crevasse but think how good this is for you.  Lots of people seemed to be…

Besakih: After we finished all the business we had a guided one-day tour to Besakih Temple. The so called Mother Temple is the biggest cluster of temples in Bali. After a 1.5hr drive from Nusa Dua.we arrived and enjoyed the cool weather in the mountains, a nice change. This massive group…
Sacred: Great fun for the family. Well priced for the experience. The views were spectacular. We just took one small bag and kept our hands out of our pockets and the monkeys did not hassle us. People with backpacks, brightly coloured clothing and camera bags etc. hanging everywhere had…
Kuta: Its not the best beach in Bali, it's okay if you want to just relax but it's not the best for swimming. Nice coconut water to drink and there is also sweetcorn stalls that are really yummy.
Mount: We did this tour from Ubud (can't remember which company - there are loads on offer). You should absolutely haggle with the operators on the price. Go picked up from right outside our hotel which was great. At 03.00 I  the morning which was no so great  but if you want to make…
Grandmas: Overall good. Humble staff even we are not foreign tourist. So close with monument bali / skygarden. Low price for backpacker  But for towel a little dirty.  Nextime i will come again to grandmas hotel.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Good location, nice breakfast, during the stay get good service except when the check in needs to be improved again. A little less pleasant experience in terms of bathtub water. Overall good and a pleasant experience.

Besakih: The pagoda like architecture of Bali's most sacred Hindu temple is very interesting. Like other temples in Bali, non-worshippers can only look around from outside. One can get a great view from the top.
Sacred: At first we thought we not going to see any, but just keep walking... and also mind your bags.  These cheeky little monkeys can open zippers!  Very cute seeing so many mothers with tiny babies ( which means they are happy cheeky monkeys)  They can also jump into you and you have…
Kuta: This is a really long, lovely beach great for walking or running along. Throughout the day there are lots of surfers and plenty of surf schools and individuals who you can hire a board and rash vest from.  The beach is clean as the traders pick up litter every day. There are…
Mount: Our small tour group visited Batur volcano and had lunch at a restaurant overlooking the mountains.  The volcano structures are very interesting.  The first recorded eruption, we were told, was in 1804; but indigenous people obviously observed eruptions for thousands of years…
Grandmas: We stayed for three nights at Grandmas Plus Legian. Price/ performance was beyond our expectation. The budget hotel was mostly pleasant due to the surprisingly complete amenities, staff’s hospitality, cleanliness, cool design, and its close proximity to the beaches. Unfortunately, the noise was a big problem for us at Grandmas. Still, having stayed previously at the similarly priced POP! Hotel, we believe our money was well spent.  Room We stated that we would be staying during our honeymoon, and so we were initially given room 509, which is located at the highest floor, has a romantic decoration, and a view to the rooftop pool of Mercure hotel. Our room was clean and compact, with a comfy bed, surprisingly complete amenities, excellent quality furnishing, a desk, mini fridge,…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Relaxing hotel for couples. I was there for 3 night with my girlfriend and it was amazing. the rooms are nice, brand new. the pools i huge and was not full, mostly empty. the Food and Bev outlets are also good to consider for breakfast  & Lunch, we did not have dinner. Location is good as it is close to mayor attractions in uluwatu.

Besakih: this temple complex is amazing - we were there when there was a ceremony, and as non believer you have to stay outside of the temples - still then it was grand!
Sacred: We heard from everyone that you have to go to the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary.   It sounded like something out of snow white- I would have a monkey come and sit on my shoulder and I would snap a picture. But once walking in and seeing a monkey open up some man's backpack and…
Kuta: My kids always have fun at the beach. This was no exceptiion. Got my 7 and 11 year olds a few surf lessons while we were there. Both girls found it enjoyable. We enjoyed playing in the waves and swimming around. Hardly a waste of a 6 hours over 2 days that we spent there. Lots…
Mount: Hike to the top was a great experience - recommended for when you visit Bali. Easy level hike, 2hrs to the top in midst of the night, sunrise view is beautiful.
Grandmas: We only stayed for 1 night and both talked about how fantastic our experience was. Would definately stay there again but for longer off course. Staff were kind and helpful. Rooms were funky, practical and clean  and  the hotel itself was beautiful. Great location, only downfall for us was no pool.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We stayed here for our honeymoon in March 2019. The staff were very attentive and the hotel was immaculate. Well designed large rooms with all amenties, amazing bathrooms. Buffet breakfast was among the best we have had anywhere, extensive choices. The other restaurant on site Filini was great. Very nice pool thay was always quiet. Made use of the gym on site too. 10/10 would recommend., we will be coming back!

Besakih: For anyone that visit Bali, this is the must visit destination. The history and the rich of culture of Bali & Hindu religion.  It is MAGICAL!!!
Sacred: Costing just a few rupiah to enter, you'll find the place full not only of monkeys, but people, however the whole sanctuary is big enough that you're not quite falling over each other.  It's all beautifully maintained with pathways swept, fences intact, and plants well looked…
Kuta: kuta beach is so clean and calm for a relaxing swim and a glass of beer or a coconut. lovely place to visit when in kuta
Mount: Very prominent volcano site in Bali. It had been active in recent past. One can either enjoy the view of vast dark lava fields and gigantic 1700 m tall Mt.Batur from a place called Kintamani or can hike to the top. I enjoyed my trip to kintamani and would definitely hike to the…
Grandmas: Clean , Tight space , excellent service and great Breakfast . Loved it . The staff particularly friendly . I would have loved a shelf wardrobe non the less it was all good.The Location was great as well , right in the centre of activity . walking distance to the night clubs market etc .
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Loved everything about this resort. Service and food and accommodation was amazing. I recommend this to wedding couples and couples in general. The pool is amazing and the view is breathtaking when you stay up high.

Besakih: Have read some of the terrible reviews here and must say we had a totally different experience. We had a driver who was our guide so experienced none of the hassles mentioned here. The photo boards give a good sense of what happens when there are ceremonies there, particularly…
Sacred: I love this place very much. Been there for 3 times. The lobby reception is splendid. Staffs are friendly to everyone. The forest is well managed
Kuta: Kuta beach is a beautiful place to visit and hangout,it's wonderful waves will mesmerize you,and now since the plastic ban, the beach is significantly cleaner, although a plastic cup washes ashore every once in a while. And the never ending sunsets you can watch at Kuta beach is…
Mount: I joined an organised trip as part of a mixed group of 6 people who were a nice bunch from different parts of the world. I negotiated a price with one of the tour agents in Ubud for 350K IDR the day before. Pick up from the hotel was at around 2 a.m. We then stopped for a…
Grandmas: The room was clean and cozy, enough for 2 people.  Breakfast was great, yummy juice and friendly staff everywhere.  I really liked the plants hanging down in the dining area!  Air condition was working, enough possibilities for chargers were there.  The spa next to it was nice as well.  good value for the price!
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Radisson Blu was a great place to stay in Uluwatu, the rooms are really clean and well kept, the pool area is also very well maintained.  Staff are extremely friendly, they take time to get to know you which is lovely. Very professional. The shuttle service to Uluwatu temple is also a great experience. Would highly recommend.

Besakih: Standing inspite of the volcano, in original form. Walk around and take in the architecture. Do not believe the stories about harassment by locals - we had a good guide, who accepted what we gave. Tickets allow you a free guide. Will take 2 hours to go around.
Sacred: We really enjoyed the sanctuary; the monkeys are rally taken good care and love in freedom; yo can see them in their natural Habitat. It is a large property so we really enjoyed walking and learning about the monkeys behaviors. They even have their own cemetery and one thing…
Kuta: Seem to read a lot about the state of this  beach. I do accept that during rainy season it's a little different but at this time of year the beach was spotless. Absolutely NO rubbish whatsoever. Beautiful to walk along to Seminyak. Interestingly it is at Seminyak where we…
Mount: We are fit and experienced hikers in our early sixties but still found this climb quite challenging and the toughest we've done. It's a short hike in terms of time of around two hours but the steepness and the extremely rocky surface makes it quite a challenge. Almost the…
Grandmas: its a good budget hotel with all the basic amenities. Breakfast is good. Day staff was  more helpful than the night staff. Spa is good and very much affordable. And you also get discounts at nearby hotels. they provude complimentary bicycle also
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Best value for money ever experienced, perfect hotel for relaxation on Bali. Quite good location in Uluwatu with great nearby restaurants if you dont want to have dinner at the hotel every night. Staff was very kind and truly wanted us to enjoy our honeymoon.

Besakih: Besakih is the biggest and holiest of the island's temples and is surrounded by breathtaking and scenic rice paddies, hills, mountains, streams, and more. I recommend you all to visit this temple if you go to Bali. //Mats Samaras, Stockholm, Sweden
Sacred: To walk around the forest and see little monkeys frolicking around, not in cages and free to do what they want, it’s definitely a must do in Bali. The coffee shop is also a must have at the end.
Kuta: The street hawkers and stall holders are a lot more pushy in Kuta than close by Legian, and in Seminyak they are even more laid back. Kuta seems to have lots of tourists that are your quintessential bogans. Too loud, too large, too rude. Kuta is okay for a drop by, but I…
Mount: Had lunch at a restaurant & then walked up to get the views, had a local guide so fairly easy. Good views although it was a bit hazy.
Grandmas: I've just spent 2 nights here, although the rooms are small they are adequate for 1 person would not like to squeeze 2 people in. The air con was leaking when I arrived and this was promptly sorted. My reason for only leaving 3 stars is on my checking out I requested an Uber to take me to the airport. When my Uber arrived another taxi driver sent him away. Regardless of the Taxi Mafia in place in Bali if I want to use Uber I will and will not have anyone dictate to me what I can and cannot do. The security outside did nothing until I made him get involved. As the hotel security customers should be of priority not taxi drivers who want to rip off tourists.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Love our time here  Wonderful  friendly staff  I wouldn't rate Artichoke restaurant but everything else was superb. Definitely go to the Italian restaurant, every dish was magnificent. We will definitely be back.

Besakih: The temple is definitely not worth a visit. The temples and structures dotting the place are pretty ordinary. All of them can only be viewed or seen from "outside" or from a distance. There are a few which can be accessed if one wants to perform prayers in it, which comes with…
Sacred: Having been to the monkey forest approx 5 years ago it seems to have lost some of its authenticity and become more commercialized. It’s still a fun place to visit though. Go early to avoid the crowds!
Kuta: The sunset was the best thing to wait for in this beach. The locals were far more adamant on making a sale compared the people in Ubud and other quiet places in Bali.  Is disappointing that renting “seats” amounted to plastic lawn chairs and not actual beach/lounge chairs. At…
Mount: Did the sunrise trek, left Ubud at 1.30 am, breakfast about 1 hour later with lot of other trekkers, about 45 mins later we met our guide at Mt Batur who was excellent we were given a flashlight to start our 2 hour trek. Walk starts of easy, then it's all up on a loose rock…
Grandmas: Grandmas Plus Legian is fairly large and a strategic path at an affordable price, making this hotel worthy of consideration. The hospitality of all employees becomes a PLUS value.  But, the room size is small, and the bed is not too comfortable.  Unusual windows can only be used for air circulation and sunlight without being able to see the scenery.  The door of elevator too quickly, it make shut me up twice.  Water Tag packaging 1500ml was paid. and front desk staff did not provide room rules information properly.  However, the hotel has a friendly and helpful staff. It makes me comfortable.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Staff very friendly, place very clean. Excellent short experience overall. The only downside was probably the amount of steps to go to the local impossible beach, and then find it very small, and not very clean. The hotel offers a shuttle to another beach, which I didn't have a chance to see, so don't know if that's better

Besakih: it is a shame as it looks like a nice temple and really as a religious place should be treated with more respect by the locals than somewhere to just scam people. I don't even know where to start with the place, the price anyway even if you just end up paying that is 4 times the…
Sacred: Must visit place! As long as you follow the rules you will be fine. There are many staff around every corner and feeding is very constant. The monkeys are very active and are all around!  NOTE: Don't bring food into the sanctuary, the monkeys will literally open your bag and…
Kuta: Very nice, sandy beach in Kuta, Bali. Liked it very much. sand is nice and generally clean. Good place for surfing, swimming, etc. activities.  Liked everything. No dislikes.
Mount: Mt. Batur trekking is a great alternative activity to chilling by the beach and it also help burning off the extra calories on indulging on delicious Balinese food and gelato. The hike was between easy to medium (we took the “tougher & steeper” route yet quieter as recommended…
Grandmas: booked it online cause 30 min before I checked in rooms I stayed in was small but everything I wanted was in there.  price wise great choice and clean amenities were eco-friendly but the towel was old. staff! didnt see much of them. location wise: near to Kuta beach and from there to the airport was only 20 mins in cost IDR 65,000 on blue taxi meter it didn't reach more. best part: complimentary bicycles for hotel guest, free internet.  would recommend for budget friendly travellers
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Stayed here over Nyepi because it was a dog-friendly hotel. Everyone was so nice to my high maintenance toy dog. The staff are exceptional and were quick to attend to our request to move rooms so we can be closer to the smoking area. I was surprised to find out that we were not allowed to smoke in the open space balconies in the room, we can only smoke in the designated smoking area which was down near the pool or in the parking lot. Food was a hit and miss but I think this was due to Nyepi where maybe most of the f&b team are on public holiday.  Everything else was perfect for us, but I dont think I will be returning due to the inconvenience of having to go down to the smoking area.

Besakih: Pura Besakih, Bali’s Mother Temple has a commanding view on the slopes of Mt Agung, almost 1,000 metres up the volcano, it is the largest temple in Bali.  There seems to be no conclusive date of when it was built, however it is first mentioned in an inscription from 1007.  It is…
Sacred: 80k entrance fee was well worth paying. Lots of monkeys walking around and enjoyable natural scenery within the centre of Ubud. Shame about the litter everywhere though.
Kuta: Amazing sunset and nice to walk or swim. There are many people selling many things but it was okay. There is little parking for cars
Mount: we'd a lunch with a view of the mount. I really enjoyed the view though the lunch was so so. If u'r not a trekking person must visit this place to have lunch with the view. you'll really enjoy this.
Grandmas: It was hard to fault GrandMas on their hotel. It was everything you would expect from a budget hotel, except it had amazing customer service and even better breakfast (make sure you get that included!!) The only down side was that the shower looked as though no one had cleaned the screen of walls in 6 months and the bed moved very easily off the wall. it is literally on the busiest street in Legian and anything and everything you could possibly want or need is right at your door step. its about a 10 min walk to the Kuta nightlife scene and shopping is possibly easier than breathing from here.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Amazing hotel, great location, fantastic service at an affordable price. Would highly recommend this property when in Uluwatu.  The rooms are stunning, definitely book a panaramic view room.  The staff are very well trained and the pool is stunning.

Besakih: During our previous holiday in Bali 2 years ago, my wife and I had visited many temples in Bali, but we did not visit this place due to distance and location. So, we decided to book a private Day Tour to visit this place among other places, as it is called "The Mother Temple" by…
Sacred: This was much better than expected after reading so many horror stories! We followed the rules and the monkeys kept to themselves. The grounds were well looked after and the temples beautiful. I'd reccomend for anyone wanting some beautiful scenery, relief from the hot sun or…
Kuta: Best beach to learn how to surf and see the sunset and enjoy some cold beer. The sand is soft and clean. Great time
Mount: did this trip in the late afternoon...take something warm as the temperature drops dramatically from about 3pm and can get quite cold..complete contrast temperature from sea level...enjoyable viewing...hawkers up here are persistent and can become a nuisance as they will not…
Grandmas: Very accomodating with friendly n ready to smile staff<U+0001F917>. Although it was a small room,  Its have everything basic things we needs. The room n toilet are very well maintain n clean. The Spa located at the 5th floor is affordable and vey good. Just  5mins walk down to the beach. Nearby shopping belt n minimart.  Well done to the staff of Grandmas Plus Hotel. <U+0001F44F><U+0001F44F><U+0001F44F>
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We (2 adults, 1 child 13) stood for 3 nights only. The hotel is quite new with a modern style (Radisson like).  + complete annementies, large bedroom with balcony, large bathroom, excellent breakfast   - Food overpriced, no direct access to the beach, pool only 1.25m deep

Besakih: It's quite a big temple spread huge area. It claims to have small temples of each god. The views are quite beautiful and picturesque. The downside are local guides and temple entrance fee. they charged quite a fees for the entrance and local tour guide. The local guide also…
Sacred: We expected to see a few monkeys but gees, I think we would have seen around 100+ on our stroll through the park. Babies, families, pack leaders and Mums.  They just go about their own business, although one took issue with my partner’s orange shorts. See pic. The minute he…
Kuta: When I visited in the morning the vast expanse of sea seen .aeroplanes taking off as airport is close by.  Many canoe and motor boats were parked on beach. Good facilities for variety food .fruits and tender coconuts.the sound of the sea waves and cool and calm atmosphere in…
Mount: My wife and I got up at 1am to experience the Mt Batur volcano at sunrise.   The trip from Seminyak took a couple of hours and can not be avoided.  There were lots of people doing the walk. We arrived at the car park, met our guide and off we went.   There are lots of opionions…
Grandmas: The location is really strategic and easy to found when i used online taxi. The room is clean and comfort for stay. I stayed here for 7 days, and i almost tried all breakfast menu, and my favorite menu is Energizer.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Fantastic new hotel with huge and spacious rooms and bathrooms. All the comfort from a modern hotel in the southern part of lovely Bali. The beds are incredibily comfortable, the linen super soft and the pillows very fluffy. New hotel with all the necessary, a great Spa and a convenient gym. The pool is super nice! The service was top and the food in Filini (Italian) and the breakfast at Artichoke were top! I will be back for sure!

Besakih: The temple was beautiful but be aware of the rude local guides there. The grounds are incredible, please go with your own guide so you do not get into trouble when you arrive there. This temple is a grand complex of clan temples and shrines located in the high altitude of the…
Sacred: Must visit in Bali and kids will enjoy here to the fullest. We visited here again after four years and was definitely more crowded than our last visit.   Do keep any of your food item inside and no small item out of your bag. I had a green dettol sanitizer bottle hanging from my…
Kuta: This is a must see place.  The sunset is very beautiful.  Be mindful that if you don't see a beautiful sunset, sometimes it is due to low and thick clouds.  Try another day.  Have a beer and they will provide you a chair to sit and enjoy the sunset.
Mount: It’s an active volcano that doesn’t feel active As there is nothing active about it no ash or smoke. Without it it’s just a small mountain although didn’t do the trek as was with my toddler but the view was good from the restaurants opposite to the mountain but not breathtaking.…
Grandmas: I'm staying in Grandmas hotel Plus Legian for 3 days and it was very nice! I like my room a lot - small, but you have everything what you need :) And clean! The best location - close to restaurants, shops, bars and very nice beach in Legian.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Faboulous hotel, great pool, private impossibles beach, amazing food breakfast west and indonesian, wine and coktails, service and staff outstanding. 5 minutes shuttle bus to padang padang.  Couldnt have asked for a better holiday.

Besakih: The Mother's Temple complex actually has many temples, some large public temples, some smaller family temples. It is worth taking a guide and asking to see as much as possible. The whole complex is well kept and the only drawback are the souvenir sellers. Worth a visit to feel…
Sacred: I cannot recommend this highly enough! Peaceful forest and canyon setting with easy paths and excellent views. As if that wasn't enough...MONKEYS!!! They are everywhere, roaming around freely. This is a sanctuary for them and they clearly own the place. What's yours will rapidly…
Kuta: We went for early morning runs up and down the beach, which was nice.  Sand is relatively clean.  It is a bit crowded during the day, but not overbearing.  All in all nice beach.
Mount: I can't recommended this guy for your Batur trip, he is on W/a +6281337443553! We did hike to Mount Batur last week, without him I can't made the top in time! Wajib just amazing guy, he helped us from half way till to the top, he also support us to made the top before 6, finally…
Grandmas: Best welcoming staff i experienced so far, room is simple but clean and cozy, would love to come back <U+0001F600> highly recommended for european as it's fulfil the european standard <U+0001F44D> not to mention the location is perfect for the first traveller, sorrounded by shops and restaurant, do try the italian resto at the corner of the hotel <U+0001F44D><U+0001F44C>
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We have just stayed at the Raddison Blu, Uluwatu for a week.   It was an entirely faultless experience: 1. The facilities and building were beautifully designed and impeccably maintained to the highest standard. 2. The staff were trained to an international standard: unobtrusive, extraordinarily helpful and kind. 3. Our young son has significant food allergies - all kitchen staff and restaurant staff had been briefed before our arrival and were able to advise us at all times which foods were safe. I cannot stress enough what a significant difference this made to our holiday experience. This information was shared across all shifts. 4. Our room was stunning. Modern, clean, well designed and a pleasure to spend time in. The staff converted the sofa into a perfect toddler bed for…

Besakih: This temple is a must see. It is not only very big but has a very important story for Bali.  We went with our own guide and it was perfect. But if you go alone it will be difficult with all the 'local' guides that want your money. The sellers are also very pushy. It is the only…
Sacred: Amazing scenery and the monkeys are ace to watch, nice path to walk along and you can go in the the forest more however a few steps, monkeys do take things from your bag so keep them closed but other wise they don’t really both you, would recommend to go as it’s just beautiful…
Kuta: Amazing view at sunset. Good place to have a couple of beers and relax before dinner. The beach does get incredibly busy around 5/6 ish before the sun fully goes down.
Mount: I hiked Mount Batur with couple of friends, we started at 3.30 am to hike and reached the summit at 5.30 just few minutes before the sunrise. The hike is very easy. Would go back for sure!
Grandmas: the rooms are clean, quiet, good staff ever helpful. will be staying here each time we visit Bali  Whilst there is no pool or recreation area, we do not require this as we are an older couple and go to Bali for the shopping and the trips, where you can be collected each day from your Hotel and brought back later at a very reasonable cost. Most of what we need is in a block radius of the Hotel so walking to where we want to go is our preference.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Our holiday was a wonderful experience the hotel is new, clean and very well designed.  But the real bonus was the quality of the staff - they are brilliant! They managed our needs with three small children and five adults effortlessly.  Nothing was a problem they went out of their way to ensure our holiday was a memorable experience.  The head of food and beverage booked restaurants for us when were were struggling to get a booking and recommended restaurants in Europe for our upcoming trip. It is clear the fine leadership provided by the senior staff has had a major influence on all staff. They truly understand customer service.  We will be back!

Besakih: This complex of Hindu temple is beautiful and huge, climbing many stairs to go up there. Go with a guide so you are not get troubled when you arrive there. Everywhere you look from the top is beautiful. Heaven! We were both very enjoyable.
Sacred: Great place to spent day. But please don't feed monkeys, they can go crazy about food, otherwise very funny you can have laugh
Kuta: Great spot for a walk long the beach or just chill, have a Bintang & watch the Sunset. It gets packed & locals are selling stuff or even get a massage.
Mount: Get up there early for spectacular view of Sunrise. Pretty easy hike and recommended for beginners. Start around 03.30 am in the morning and do it during dry season (August - October).  Bring proper running shoes and the last 100 meters to the top is a bit sandy, cover your face…
Grandmas: We stayed in the hotel for a couple of nights, we surely recommended. Cheap price for what you get. We booked our room through Internet and it was very easy.... Great Internet quality and great service
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: This resort is next level luxury. The pools, the bar, the rooms, the restaurant - all amazing!  The breakfast was great, had everything you could imagine and chefs to cook eggs to your liking.  Kids room was pretty basic. Beauty spa and masseuse were great but a bit pricey as to be expected at a resort. The hotel have a complimentary bus to the monkey temples and the beach daily. Just be careful though they didn’t have enough seats for all the passengers on pick up and there was an argument about seating on the way back. Taxis in the area are very expensive, try negotiating with them. Other Spas and food are within reasonable walking distance.  Staff were all lovely and accommodating and could speak English quiet well.

Besakih: 2 hrs away from the city, it is a peaceful place. We are allowed to pray with flower or canang(?) that we bought from seller down the street. We must politely decine the local guide love to see the crowd and enthusiasm of the balinese hindus people when the great ceremony come.…
Sacred: Definitely worth a trip. Kids loved it. Couple of hours walking round depending how long you stop to watch the monkey's up to no good.
Kuta: Very busy beach that’s usually pretty packed by mid morning. Gets cleaned up overnight so it’s a good spot, great for swimming and learning to surf. Near a lot of the big touristy hotels.
Mount: The view of the volcanoes around Mount Batur in Kintamani, Bali, Indonesia was awesome. I and my family members loved it. I went with my mother, wife and 2 sons. The place from where the lava did flow had become barren. The volcanoes are dormant now. But the wind around the…
Grandmas: I stayed here 4 separate occasions.   The rooms were always clean and tidy. Comfy bed. Excellent shower but small bathroom.  Have the refridge and deposit box.Strong wifi.  I recommend this hotel if you had plan to go around Kuta and Legian.   Great location and I will come back someday.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Our stay at Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu was pleasant. We really liked the place. It was nice and quiet, exactly like what we wanted gor our honeymoon. The room was amazing, staff were very helpful and the restaurants were really good. The only issue we had was the room temperature. I really couldn’t figure if it was a problem with the hotel air conditioning system or it’s a setup issue, but the room temperature was flat 24 all the time which was really hot and uncomfortable.

Besakih: This is one of the favourites place I've been when i was in bali. The uniqueness of the design, they have so many temples in there. And u can take a great picture!!!! And please don't forget ur sarong, its a must.
Sacred: We visited the monkey forest January 2020, our experience was really good and exciting, the monkeys are well looked after and the park attendants very good with the tourists and monkeys.   The monkeys of course can be temperamental so you must be careful and not go too close…
Kuta: Kuta is identical with its clean white sandy beaches ... with good sea waves .... very suitable for beginner surfers to play surfing ... from Kuta beach you also can see the sunset ... become the center of Bali tourism,  Kuta is famous throughout the world
Mount: Had an excellent time trekking up Mt Batur. Our tour guide was amazing. He was very patient, knowledgeable and such a gentleman. Constantly making sure our group was doing ok and helping us up and over obstacles. The sunrise was amazing. Nothing but extraordinary! Our tour guide…
Grandmas: The hotel location is strategic between the crowd like market, restaurant, bar, and the Legian beach. The staff were friendly and standby 24hrs. The room and amenities as a budget hotel also clean, comfortable, and complete.  Only the towel even though clean (they changed it everyday) but quite dull. Overall I will be stay here if I go to Bali next time and I will recommend this hotel to my friends.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Front line staff are hardworking and customer focused. They are there to provide extra service for you. Overall, my holiday has been memorable due to the hotel environment. I will highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends

Besakih: Where to start....we added this temple to our itinerary because it is the mother temple but I really wish we had read reviews on this before we went. It is an absolute rip off I have never felt so uncomfortable! The entrance is supposed to be 35,000 rp each but they insisted…
Sacred: It was a lush forest area with a temple complex. Loads of monkeys everywhere. Worth a visit for an hour or so.
Kuta: A lot of rubbish and no sunbeds tide was a long way out and very dangerous won’t be back to Kuta shall try a different resort
Mount: There are some fantastic views from here the panorama is well worth the visit, can get busy as it is one of the to do things in Bali we did the day visit and not the walk up although I believe you can if your energetic
Grandmas: Have been stay here several times, and the clean, cozy and minimalistic bedroom was just perfect. The staff was really helpful, and easy access to go wherever you want, either seminyak, legian, or kuta.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: This hotel is quite new, it’s very clean.  The room is spacious and  the bed is comfortable.  The pool is large, but the beach is not directly connected to the property. You have to walk a bit to reach the beach.   Breakfast is alright, nothing special. Limited selection.   Worth every penny (paid around 1.8 mil rupiah incl bfast) not bad at all.

Besakih: The temple is amazing and has beautiful views, however this visit was hampered by pushy touts trying to sell tours, they make up stories that you need a local guide to enter the temple, which is a lie, you can go everywhere, only in the most sacred parts of the temple are you…
Sacred: I was not keen on a visit since we encountered aggressive monkeys a few years ago but it seemed a lot nicer, I think stopping people from feeding them has calmed them down.  I saw no aggression at all which was very different from last time.  It’s a beautiful walk up and down…
Kuta: The surrounding place near this beach is excellent. Lots of spots & joint to freak around. Perfect for tourist to explore and experience something different & exciting.Which makes it worthwhile to visit Bali.
Mount: We went to go and see mt batur on a day trip. It’s a decent drive (approx 2 hours from seminyak). It’s a great view and definitely worth the trip if you make a day of it.  We also stopped into Ubud which made it a good day.
Grandmas: Clean, quiet, and the staff was very nice.  The climber vines outside our room window made for a cool, calming stay.  A five-minute walk to Legian Beach.  The breakfast looked nice (we did not sign up for it) and there was no swimming pool.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Radisson: We had 5 beautiful and relaxing days at the Radisson Blu and words cannot describe. Brilliant, staff were awsome and so friendly (always remembered our names). Room was unbelievable, views of the pool and sea views were awsome. To the Manager Diego (a fantastic man) what an awsome job you are doing. Meals are brilliant, and if you went hungry it was your own fault. We will be back and by word of mouth, many more people as well.

Besakih: No wonder it's called mother of all Temple in Bali. Such a huge temple but was disappointed with the guide who had no information on anything I asked!! And inside the temple I felt there is a lack of proper maintenance as there are huge cobwebs everywhere. I was little…
Sacred: We absolutely loved our visit to the sanctuary and were very impressed by the standard of it. The monkeys look content and well.cared for and there are many guards as well should.you feel.threatened.  A great visit
Kuta: Kuta Beach is a long stretch of sand from Kuta to Seminak and beyond. The town end is the preference for swimming. Further along the water is quite rough and used mostly by surfers. The beach is a favourite spot to watch the sunset- from 5pm on. The main drawback is the many…
Mount: It goes without saying that the trip was worth it—the view, the climb, the company. The pictures capture the scenery but fail to gain even a glimpse of how my heart swells when I see the sun rise over the mountains. That said, I am very disappointed in the guides who are…
Grandmas: Upon my evening arrival sat Grandmas, I was immediately impressed by the vernonia climber vines that suspend from above the pergola. What a great idea for a façade, I thought, as I realized the hotel location was right in the center of Legian. This leafy look, with vernonia that drape hotel windows, is an immediate welcome.  But the real masterpiece of this surreal place is the amazingly lush courtyard past the lobby area, which boasts a mini garden as centerpiece.  My room, one of 111 nicely decorated double, twin and triple rooms spread out on four levels, was small and cozy, with great wall decorations and designers elongated windows. Rooms are the perfect size and have all the necessary amenities like work desk, safe deposit box, flat screen TV with satellite channels, tea…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: First of all can I say that the post written by Corinne below is  a complete fallacy and should be totally ignored.  Clearly some people have nothing better to do than to post derogatory comments.  This hotel is awesome and the staff are as good as you will ever see in any five-star resort in the world.  Breakfasts are amazing the restaurants are fantastic the pool area is beautiful and relaxed and the rooms are well appointed clean and cool.  This is a great place to stay in Bali but certainly I would recommend that you do hire a motorbike to get around as the resort is a little moved from the beach but certainly no more than a couple of minutes on a bike.  I love the Radisson Blu

Besakih: Google+  Web  Foto  lainnya  Kotak Masuk  (tanpa subjek)  <U+FFFC>  rosa cempaka  kepada saya 0 menit yang lalu  Detail  Located on the slope of Mount Agung, very high, and cool weather, it took around 1.5hrs from Jimbaran. It is very interesting sightseeing point and all the temples…
Sacred: Great way for both adults and children to experience the monkeys . Be careful about loose hanging bags and water bottles as monkeys can be curious and aggressive. Will grab your shopping bag/ sunnies/ loose hanging items. Suggest to have only a crossover / bag pack . Keep…
Kuta: Not surprise due to public beach, Dog poop is everywhere and need to really watch a step.Beach boy are so welcoming however their keep forcing to rent surfing board and some other thing like massage etc with ridiculous price.If you’re hygienic person this is not right place.
Mount: While taking extra lessons with Kadek Local Bali Tours, we went to Mt Batur <U+0001F60E> If you're in Bali, make an effort to visit Mt Batur. The place will be quiet after 5pm. Cheapest place to get souvenirs ! Bargain to get best price and not to buy on first offer because as you walk…
Grandmas: Always feel wery welcome by the staff. Nice simple rooms with secure doorlock. Good options for brekfast. Location is wery good for my daily driving with motorcycle. Feels wery safe and secure. Wish there was bether ventilation of the rooms.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Very awesome property,  well maintained and due importance given to even the minutest details which makes it stand out  from the rest. Very healthy and tasty food, and  vast  variety of items to choose from. Ambience in  the rooms are too good and jell with the surrounding which is silent and relaxing. well

Besakih: The mother temple in Bali,now already good management,just a little bit inconvenient inside because too many children will suggest to buy somethings from them.
Sacred: This was a great experience and lovely to see the monkeys in a natural habitat rather than ring fenced.  Circular walk around the sanctury made the trip easier to facilitate.   Good facilities as well
Kuta: Love Kuta beach we chill out on the pillows at get juiced it’s the top end away from the resorts area.  We do t like that you have to pay to use the toilet but it’s only 30c (aud) and they are not very clean. It’s vibrant and alive till late at night lots of places to have a…
Mount: Early morning hiking to get sunrise from top mount batur, so wonderful view sunrise with lake batur that so nice! The trekked not so difficult but you always must be careful and follow the guide!
Grandmas: The treatment was relaxing <U+0001F60A>  It is a cozy and beautiful place in the heart of Legian Kuta. And I met friendly staff and therapists Will exactly come back and tell my friends about the Rehat Spa!! <U+0001F603> thank u <U+0001F603>
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Very big nice furnished rooms. No indian foods in breakfast and lunch Far away from Airport. Travel time takes 1 hour Good for relaxing holiday. Not suitable for activities or sight seeing  Go for suit rooms

Besakih: This is one of the biggest temples in Bali and is quite beautiful but be careful when you get here as there are a lot of people that try to hassle you saying they will give you a free tour of the place but demand a tip later.There are also some people who approach you asking for…
Sacred: Okay so we were there with a 5 year old and 2 elderly parents. It’s a monkey sanctuary... so there’s monkeys... many many of them. The place is beautiful with amazing trees and impressive sculptures. The monkeys will make you laugh uncontrollably and yet you need to be smart and…
Kuta: Beach was nice..only thing was people coming every few minutes asking to buy from them or their services
Mount: What a great morning! We were picked up by our driver and arrived at the bottom at 3:40. Quick use of the local squat toilet (take toilet paper) and off we set with a small torch provided by our guide Ketut.  There were 3 rest stops with seats. The second one was at around 2.5km…
Grandmas: Unfortunately I only stayed here for one night - but I would have definitely extended my stay if I could. The staff were all so friendly and helpful; everyone was very accommodating whenever we asked for anything. The hotel itself has a cool feel and the rooms are basic, but clean, modern, and very comfortable. Breakfast was also delicious! (And they were happy to serve us breakfast late and allow us late check out when we overslept after a fun night out on Legian.) I've stayed in Kuta many times now and have yet to find a place with better value. Despite it being a mid-budget hotel, we really felt like we were very well taken care of. I also cannot recommend their spa services more highly - do not miss out!
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: My wife and I had a fantastic 5 night stay at Radisson Blu Uluwatu. The hotel is modern and new and has all the 5 star qualities you’d expect. The staff were amongst the best we have encountered in our years of traveling to all parts of the globe. Muchas Gracias to Diego and his F and B team and a shout out to Agus from Artichoke Restaurant. The hotel’s Italian restaurant Fellini’s was fantastic and the food first rate. We’ll be back. Brad and Lou

Besakih: I went to visit this temple yesterday and although it was beautiful, money was taken off me at any point. The driver who the tour was arranged with was told he couldn't join us and that a guide was included in the ticket price... THIS IS A CON! We took the included ride up to…
Sacred: Visiting the monkey forest is really a great experience if you love animals. Here you are able to observe and take pictures. Be sure to book enough time as it is a big forest and alot of possibilities for walking!
Kuta: I spent my ten day holiday helping the locals clear the beach from the horrifically bad plastic that pollutes the whole of the sea.  Ask a local they blame the islands from overseas.   You can't even swim without plastic getting caught up in your legs.  It was so sad.  The…
Mount: So we are a newly married couple and never out a chance to go out for our honeymoon. This was our first international trip together, but she was very excited about doing all the adventure stuff that bali is famous for and more that it can offers. She did not expect anything…
Grandmas: In  my humble opinion, Grandmas Legian is intended as a half way house between your Bali holiday accomodation and your airport transfer. Early Hotel check outs force you to either pay another night or leave your luggage and shop for hours. Grandmas is cheap, clean, today and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It very central to shops and airport transfers. We have used before and will do so again.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The pool is magnificent until you step into it, its like a warm bath. This resort does not deserve to be featured as a 5-star resort. 3.5 at best. The rooms are appalling, the service inexplicably poor, the facilities in the rooms are old tired, and dirty. The food, buffet breakfast and the like are equivalent to ' pub food' after 30 plus visits I didn't last 24 hours before moving. I am in my early 50s but my daughter is 30 she was more upset and she is a millennium. There is no transport, ocean views are non-existent, its isolated which would be okay if it was a 5 star compound. My gratitude to #SooriBali and #LuxuryEscapes for swiftly organising a change. Reception is bland, room service and cleaning not appropriate, pure laziness. I cannot recommend it at all the video is…

Besakih: Just need to give a warning as my friend found this out the hard way, if you have your period you are not permitted to enter any temples.   The entry price was 60k. Then the 'free guide' said they expect tips and donations. I took one and paid him 100k as he was quite helpful,…
Sacred: My boyfriend had been before so suggested we leave bags etc in the hotel which was nearby. I'm so glad we did. The monkeys are very clever. They will get into a backpack in seconds and pull out what ever they can find and it will be gone. Dont bring food or drink in as they can…
Kuta: not good for food loves as u will not find aything to eat.   quite n peaceful place to sit n read some daam good book.
Mount: Booked a ticket through ubud sunrise hiking online. It was in the early morning when a nice driver  pick me and my partner up. Through the darkness we were delivered safely to a car park where we were met with our mountain guide Nik. He is a certified mountain guide with many…
Grandmas: Very nice staff, centrally located good location. Room clean but small, enough for two person. No wardrobe in the room. Price performance ratio is good. Breakfast good. Security mr. Wayan is very helpful and cooperativ in all matters of contact.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Everything that was featured in the Luxury Escapes package was more than delivered during our 7 day stay. We had a relaxing escape holiday which allowed us to stay around the pool each day or explore nearby beaches or go further afield by using a driver for the day. This is a newish resort and the attention to maintenance and dealing with any minor request was prompt. The morning breakfasts were unbeatable as they catered for Western as well as Asian tastes. The Happy Hour around the pool and the Valentine Day dinner were very memorable. This is a resort for getting away from the hustle and bustle of other parts of Bali. It is highly recommended. We will return in the future.

Besakih: Our guide was very helpful and took all the time to explain the temple parts, symbolism used there and gave us a short overview of the religion. He even arranged for us to get into the worshippers part of the temple, but at the entrance he demanded donation the of $ 40 and we…
Sacred: What isn't there to like about Monkeys playing in trees and bushes as you take a leisurely walk through the forest. There is plenty to look out for especially the young ones. People with Bags and backpacks are of special interest to the monkeys, they love jumping on you to see…
Kuta: Had a surf lesson with Tim. Our 1st time on a board. Tim was very gd and kept us safe. Gd to go early morning for beginners or about 4 in arfo..
Mount: Mt. Batur is located in Bangli Regency, Kintamani District, Batur Village, is about 2hours drive from Denpasar and 1 hour drive from Ubud. The last biggest eruption on 1974. Coming in day time you will see magnificent few of the Vulcano from Kintamani hill and with the Batur…
Grandmas: This is already the second time we come to this hotel. Absolutely loved it, great place, great location and tons of activities to do around. The hotel is greatly located in Kuta Bali with easy access anywhere you need to go
