Radisson: We had a very decent stay at this property. Everything was worth spending. Starting with the property, well if you are a kind of person who love modern facilities, this is the right place to stay. The food was also nice. I vouched for their pizza! The sleeping quality, well I honestly forget when was the last time I had a good, long sleep.

Besakih: Besakih is an amazing ancient structure which shud be visited without fail. Trip to Bali is not complete without visting Besakih
Sacred: We visit Monkey Forest in Dec,it very beautiful rain forest,definitely worth visiting,big forest,lots monkey,cute baby monkey want to cudle them. We have many pictures,well maintend,walk around the forest feel calm,in some path litle worrie to see big monkey,but they calm,the…
Kuta: We visit Bali for 2 weeks in total. Few nights Ubud, Gili t, Taro, Nusa Dua and the terrible Kuta (stayed for a couple hours and left).  We checked out of our hotel the day we checked inc and went back to peaceful and cultural Nusa dua. The hotel was fine although a major party…
Mount: Don't be put off by the early start. This was arguable the highlight of our time in Bali. The views are incredible and we met some great people during the hike and learnt a lot about the area from our tour guide. I forget our tour guides name but she was absolutely brilliant.…
Grandmas: The budget hotel is nice for what you are paying for, cleaning and has everything around near-by. The hotel itself has nice restaurant and spa, so it is really handy once you are back to your hotel to be able to relax and rest in the evening. The restaurant offers very good selection of menu and drinks at reasonable/comparable to any outlets. Condition of the rooms and toilet are not bad either, so I will comeback and recommended friends to my next stay. The location is unbeatable, you can stroll along Jalan Legian or towards to the beach, Catching a meter taxi is not a problem, just wait at the intersection or ask the staff, they will wave it for you. Surely you can get it no time. In term of the sizes of the room, there are not that big but enough to place 2 of our bags. This…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and everything was top notch. We stayed in the room without ocean view and room was very nice. It is a true 5 star hotel. We stayed in some 5 star hotels in Bali that clearly was not a 5 star, but this place was really good. Breakfast was very good and was opened from 6 am which is great considering that many tours start about 6:30 am pick up.  They offer a free ride to the Uluwatu Temple and to the beach. The beach that they take you is very lame to be honest. The impossibles beach that is literally 2 feet away from the hotel (just long stairs down) is so much better. They should advertise the Impossible beach more. You need to go through the back entrance and see the stairs down to the beach.  Also, we were disappointed at the cab prices they…

Besakih: We were warned by our driver that the admission fee covered the sarong hire and pays for the guide.  Tipping the guide is optional only if you thought they were good and this was repeated again when we bought tickets. We had a free scooter ride up to the temple but told it would…
Sacred: Please be cautious and follow the rules. Do not take with you shiny things or food. The place is magical and there are many lo keys climbing trees and walking around. My kids loved it.
Kuta: It was a good experience going to Kuta beach while in bali. The water was so fresh and a bit cold. You can see many restaurants next to the beach and some vendors trying to sell you fresh fruits, hats, scarves, sunglasses, etc. The beach is entrance free but if you want you can…
Mount: We did sunraise trekking with Brazir (+6287760381082) Eveything was perfect. Hike is not much difficult and we did not go up using the main route as others but other route which was quiet and we enjoyed it. Breakfast on the top was good. And the view was breathtaking.
Grandmas: First time in Bali, just get to stay in this 3 star hotel for 4D3N...strategic location made me can go to Kuta beach and Legian beach only for 5 minute more less also to Ground Zero monument (Bom Bali) the room not that big but not too small,  the bath room is small but i think is enough to do what you want, the room is clean and tidy because room service is coming everyday...this hotel is identic with Ant, so many accesories and size of that animal..  Its unique i think... Facilities you get are free wifi, bath stuff, towel, mineral water (added everyday). There is refridge and deposit box too,  for hairdryer you can ask first to receptionist.... This hotel can rent you a bike for free (that make me happy), but for the motorbike you pay the rent. Breakfast in here make me full…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Radisson: Wonderful stay the Radisson Blu. The property is stunning, staff are amazingly friendly. GREAT comfy beds, delicious breakfast, the food at the other reataurants for lunch/dinner were nothing amazing but overall would recommend this hotel!

Besakih: It's beautiful big and massive temple, located in the high slove ot mount Agung with wanderful scanic views.So wonderful and admiring The weather is cold remind us like when we traveled to Germany in spring time.  This is an important trip if you go to Bali
Sacred: Passed through the Monkey forest daily on my way to the yoga studio . While monkeys look cute, especially the babies, make sure you are cautious as they can attack and bite in particular if you hold plastic bags or any food.
Kuta: This is probably the most famous beach in Indonesia and it is one of the top spots in Bali to get some sun, learn how to surf, have a beer while watching sunset, and take a quick dip. It is almost always packed any day of the year.
Mount: This is an experience of a life, viewing the sunrise on top of a mountain. IT takes 2 hours to climb but it is not easy! Let me repeat it is not easy trekking up! but worth it when you are there! Ask your hotel for the breakfast, they will package it for you. Call +62 812…
Grandmas: I've booked rooms here three seperate occasions when having late flights out of Bali. The rooms are clean, the air con is super cold, excellent shower and strong wifi. All for $30aud a night. Best value on bali
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs. Radisson: This hotel is amazing! The suits are fantastic, I could stay on the big balcony all day but the surroundings are so beautiful so We hade to go out! The pool area is super clean and the staff is very friendly!

Besakih: This is very astonishing balinese temple. It's huge beautiful mother temple, located on the slope of mount Agung with admiring views down to the valley, best most world famous. The people there are very friendly.
Sacred: Highly recommend going, the monkeys are adorable and mischievous. Only thing is to make sure that you follow the instructions the member of staff tells you because these are wild monkeys and you’re walking into their habitat.
Kuta: The closest from Kuta area and most visited beach in Bali, Kuta Beach is definitely my favourite beach in Bali. Long stretch of white sand beach, nice waves, with relatively clean area (let's keep it that way for the benefit of all) and amazing view of sunset--really enjoy the…
Mount: Hiked up Batur with guide from "Bali Sunrise Trekking and tour" .  Quiet night hike up for me, camped up for the night.  Jul high season saw thousands of tourists (yes thousands) reaching the summit from 430am to catch sunrise.  Badly worn tracks greeted me on the descent, which…
Grandmas: From the moment I walked in this little beauty I felt at home such a friendly staff with an awesome manager Gede , which he looked after me very well , from compliments fruits in my room to extra towels coffee, and more the staff in the restaurant was more then helpful and brekky was awesome....chef awesome nothing was too much to ask, I will be back and I suggest you guys go to .....thank you Gede,aj ,and everyone see you soon <U+0001F917><U+0001F60E><U+0001F60E>
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: This is a wonderful, relatively new resort. Lots of beautiful timber and marble everywhere. Rooms are big and clean, with a huge bed and great bedding. Great TV with 50 odd channels and a great little clock radio that allows music to be played from a thumb drive. Staff could not be more willing to help with any request. The gym is well equipped and under-utilised. Spa massages were terrific. Huge safe pool with lots of umbrellas for shade. Huge well kept grounds. Discounted drinks several times a day. Drinks, laundry and food very reasonably priced. We loved it.

Besakih: was a great visit but prepare yourself with some hike on the stairs. Entrance fee was around 60,000 included with sarong on rent as you are not allowed to access the temple with shorts neither for men or women. there is freelance guide to assist you for the explanation of the…
Sacred: Worth a visit as it’s only $80k IDR which is around $8 NZD.  Lots of monkeys that will climb on you and try to steal your glasses, hat, bag etc, funny to watch but annoying if they steal anything! Lol. We spent about half an hour walking a round.
Kuta: What a robust beach with bars shopping character surfing and characters all a broad. This is kuta at ours great a must go experience place.  Lovely stretch of beach
Mount: We booked our tour two days in Advance with "tunjungsuci sunrise trekking". The organization of the tour was bad - we were picked up one hour too late, therefore we started late with the hike and nearly missed the surise. Don't expect too much from the breakfast - we didn't even…
Grandmas: The room is great for the price, location is strategic and staff are very friendly and helpful!   Breakfast is generously-portioned and tasty, but it is not a buffet (choose and order a predetermined set) which is a new concept to me.  The interior decorations are nice. However, do note that there is a limited clothes-hanging space. Also, some rooms that are not facing the sun may get limited sunlight.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. Radisson: The staff was really friendly, the best staff I´ve ever met at a Radisson Hotel. The Hotel was amazing, with a nice pool, nice view from the rooms, really good breakfast. If you have the chance to go to Bali and Uluwatu, you should at least stay one night here!

Besakih: My husband & I visited this temple in May 2017. From the car park we went to buy tickets from the counter. They charged IDR 60,000 per person and gave sarong to wear in the temple as it was compulsory to wear one. From the ticketing centre our guide said that we need to walk 2…
Sacred: Very good place, alot of shadow so you can visit it in the middle of the day! A lot of monkeys, they can be annoying and even try to steel your equipment, so be carefull! but still it is very nice
Kuta: Nice happening beach for relax and play. Its on kuta and surrounded by malls,shops ,bar . Traffic always there.
Mount: The trek up to the summit is not difficult. Mount Batur (1717m) is not a challenging trek and has 2 options to trek up. Easy but longer and a little challenging but shorter ascend. We were a family of 4, with 2 boys aged 10 and 12 and doing our first family trek up to a mountain…
Grandmas: The hotel has accomodating staff, clean rooms, near Kuta and Legian beach, malls and restaurants. I remember they accomodate us for our early check in and gave us welcome drinks. I will still stay at Grandmas Hotel when i return to Bali.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: I went for honeymoon to bali and this place though a bit of outskirts for the explorers this place is very far from the centre, even night life is at distant but for the people like me who loves to stay in serine place should choose this place. The place is green and serene with the very friendly staff who makes ur stay far more comfortable.

Besakih: Quick tips: Wear your sarong (men and women regardless of shorts or long pants) prior to stepping out of your vehicle. At all the temples I visited, the vendors didn't approach us as even they seem to know nobody needs 2 sarongs.   Be firm and say no to the "free guides" unless…

Kuta: The beach was dirty with lots of dogs and faeces.  As soon as you step onto the beach you are harassed to rent some under par chairs by many locals.   Left the beach and went to the mall area behind.  I can see why the pools in Kuta are more popular.
Mount: We are couple went trekking for the first time with Ubud Sunrise Hiking private tour ( 45$ each) , which was an excellent place to watch the sun come up. Our guide said the final climb was quite difficult and slippy, as the ground can be a little wet before sunrise. If you do…
Grandmas: I had a most enjoyable 10-day stay here. My wife's a golfer, and while she decided to go for a golfing weekend with the girls in Australia, i took the opportunity to go to one of my all-time favourite holiday destinations-Bali . As I was alone, I decided to stay at 'Grandmas' hotel, on the corner of Legian and Melasti streets......a great central location for shops, restaurants and Night-life if that's your thing I had a lovely, though small room on the 5th floor. It was clean, had a TV and Wifi access. For the price (A$33) it was excellent value, with a nice little breakfast as well! The staff are all very friendly and helpful, at all levels of the hotel, and it was a great pleasure to meet the hotel manager (Gede) as well The only thing that's missing in this hotel is a pool.…

Radisson: Spent 5 nights on my own over CNY period and it was just what my soul needed. Between the pool and the Spa I did not actually leave the grounds my entire stay! I had taken a last minute Luxury Escapes deal and it was great value for $$

Grandmas: rooms are okay but the bathroom too smelly and unconfortable especially when you bring a baby. quite surprise because the hotel dont have pool but the access quite good, can walk to shopping and 20 menit walk to kuta beach.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: The premises were just wonderful. The rooms were beautiful and clean, the staff friendly, the gym fresh and nice and the food was excellent. The pool area was also nice. The hotel area was big enough to feel privacy at all times.

Besakih: We had always wanted to visit this temple as it is known as the Mother Temple. We set off early as it was about  2 and a half hours drive from Kuta. When we arrived at the car park, there were vendors who came up to us to buy sarongs. We told them no as we knew that sarongs were…
Sacred: Amazing tour i monkey forest. Sweet and sneaky monkeys all around. A great visit for me an my friends.
Kuta: Great beach from airport with a mall on it . Quiet by airport side few chic hotels to stop have a drink , walk toward main town beach vendors selling all usual souvenirs , chairs & brollies with drinks vendors , surf or just watch , dogs playing & surfing , long beach busy or…
Mount: Honest review of sunrise hike; This hike is vastly OVERHYPED. It's a nice sunrise, you can see the volcanos and volcano crater and lava fields and you can even see the milky way when you walk in darkness which was awesome.   There were LONG queues up there. We were overwhelmed…
Grandmas: Good and nice hotel, The room is not so big, but is okay. The interior is nice. Love the concept of the architecture. Good Value, near ATM also. The Breakfast is delicious and the staffs are friendly.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: This hotel has excellent service. The location is also good. The rooms are nice and spacious. The decoration was sophisticated and the atmosphere peaceful. Everything was also very clean. I would recommend this hotel for anyone!

Besakih: As a tour guide,I have always tried to keep the reputation of all tourism places in Bali in order that they are attractive to anybody so there will be more tourists coming and make this place more popular in the world.but just because I get sick of the local people who harrased…
Sacred: Even for the ones don’t like so much this type of turism, I suggest to take one hour to visit !  It’s a nice walk around and into a temple based in the forest which you will meet sympathetic monkeys (no fear, if you follow the rules they don’t will borrow you) and have a walk on…
Kuta: We recently stayed at the Hard Rock hotel so this beach was on our doorstep and it’s beautiful  You do get people selling stuff all the time but you do on most beaches around the world. It has lovely sand and the sunset is just something else. Plenty of beach bars too.
Mount: Once you get to the area go for lunch facing Mount Batur, there are plenty of restaurants with a great view. We then drove down to the hot springs and were so pleasantly surprised. 7 different pools with an incredible view of Lake Batur. Do not lose your wristband though or you…
Grandmas: After a couple of nights in Seminyak, we moved to the Grandma's Plus Hotel in Legian, not far away but in a whole other section of the popular stretch of Kuta. Streets lined with shops, boutiques, bars and restaurants awaited us, this section was far busier but proves a big draw for travellers of all ages who want to relax or party on their holidays. This hotel is designed along a similar theme of jungle greens and staff welcome you in to the towering structure through a leafy pergola. This hotel is set around the restaurant where breakfast is served, with huge, high ceilings and trailing vines dangling from the rafters, it's a beautiful place to start your day with a delicious breakfast included with the room price. You can choose from an Indonesian breakfast to Eggs Benedict…
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Maybe it's because it was just freshly opened when my friend and I stayed there (in august), but we had the worst stay ever. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are very nice, but everything went wrong on the experience side. Living in Bali, we booked this stay to relax, we ended up behind stressed and mad all week-end.  First i leave my scooter in front and they act as if they didn't want to go park it, for a luxury hotel it's a bit surprising. Then they put me in the wrong room, i had to wait 30 minutes trying to explain to them before they realised their mistake and finally changed my room. I paid a way higher price to get a sea view, that view is a joke, you bearly see the sea up from the trees right in front of it, it's only marketing I was very very disappointed as I spent more…

Besakih: It was great huge and beautiful temple. The architecture is amazing. Located was on the slope of mount Agung and the weather there was cold. It's incredible.
Sacred: Before going we heard a lot of negative reviews about monkeys being aggressive but we had a very wonderful time. No incidents, had a lovely walk and enjoyed our visit
Kuta: Lots to see and do here lots of recreational things to do water sports abound here easy to catch a ride to and from. Great places on the beach to eat with great fresh seafood I don't think anyone will be disappointed with a day on the beach here!!
Mount: First time in my life I had to wake up at 2am and go climb a mountain. But it was all worth it. Picked us up at 2.30am and started trekking at about 4am. Tour guide was helpful even though we were slow. Up at the mountain peak, the view is breathtaking. We enjoyed the sunrise…
Grandmas: I have been using this Grandmas Legian for almost 2 years, 5 times already. Its a very strategic location in the other corner side of Legian, away from the crowds but if you want to enjoy night life like pub you can just walk 10 minutes to the heart of Legian where pubs and bars located. The location also strategic, away from traffic jam of Legian at nite.  My last visit, i was interested with all the quotes you put on every room wall. This time i change 3 rooms and find different quotes for each room. I like those so much.  Clean and AC is good. Bed so comfortable. No Complaints. The other thing that really make this hotel Plus is Refrigerator. I can shop for Fruits each nite and store in the refrigerator where other hotels might not have it.  Thank you Grandmas for your best…
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The high level of friendly and professional service started from the moment we arrived at the hotel and continued through to check-out.  The rooms were spacious and well appointed, especially the bathroom and the large, comfortable bed.  Breakfast was a highlight, offering an extensive range of options to choose from to start your day.  The luxurious and large, modern pool was perfect to enjoy a soothing swim and often was accompanied with a refreshing beverage available from the staff anxious to ensure your stay is peaceful and relaxing.

Besakih: It is one of its kind! The temple takes you back in time, far beyond a racional assesment of it's religious meaning but it gives you that insight how it must have  been centuries ago with vivid traditions that are still alive. It's reacheable with a use of a motorcycle.  A one…
Sacred: The park features a variety attractions. Besides hundreds of monkes in natural envirement, you momkeys running around ancient Hindu Temples, Buddhist temple, water falls and brooks.
Kuta: This beach is one of the great places  to visit in Bali. Sittin on the beach having a drink and having a swim at your leisure.  Plus the service there from everyone to get your drunk is great
Mount: Wow! What an amazing morning we had hiking up Mt Batur- it’s safe to say that our hike was made especially special by the outstanding service we got from our guide & his amazing family. (Incase you’re already sold on this adventure contact +62 877-6038-1082 - Bazir - there’s no…
Grandmas: Fresh clean and great value for money, there is no pool but I didn't want one and only issue is noise is easily transferred from corridors into rooms especially slamming doors. Other than that great rooms and great friendly staff in an extremely convenient location.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We are so disappointed with the service that they gave to us start from check in, room, as well as the breakfast. We booked deluxe ocean view room thru Radisson website, when we checked in, the room was without any view even blocked by the roof, the air conditioner was not work properly the cleanliness of the bathroom was terrible. We asked for changed room but the room was not available. Breakfast was so bad the fruits was not fresh, all the foods are tasteless. We requested to shorter our stay but they didn't allow us and they didn't want to return our money until now with the reason of prepaid booking. I asked to talked with GM hotel but he was not on the property and even I asked for the GM e mail address they didn't want to provide for us. Very unprofessional how they…

Besakih: The entrance is Pura Penataran Agung where all the major ceremonies in Bali take place at. A stairs up from Penataran Agung is Gelap Temple, which I adore the wings gate so much. Unlike the meaning of "Gelap" (Eng. dark) in Bahasa Indonesia, the word "Gelap" is taken from Kawi…
Sacred: It’s a great outdoor place to visit and see the natural environment habitat for monkeys. Added attractions inside are ancient temple and fish pond and sitting arena.
Kuta: The beach is beautiful, many tourist enjoy the sun. But the seller the push you to buy was disturbed our relaxation.
Mount: Did this hike this morning and the sunrise and view from the top was incredible. You also see the super imposing Mt Agung and another beautiful mountain on the island of Lombok.
Grandmas: We stayed here for a couple of nights in December Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, we originally planned to leave on Christmas Eve but we loved it so much we stayed an extra couple of nights, managed to find this hotel after a recommendation from a local and at such short notice it was great! The hotel check is was fine as the staff were very friendly and welcoming, we left our cases in a back room whilst our room was being cleaned. The rooms were very modern and very clean! Nothing to fault about the rooms, they have TV  and free air-con which was a godsend, at that time of the year when the humidity is just bearable! Our first night was Christmas Eve, as we was getting ready for a night out there was a knock at the door and it was the staff dressed up in Santa outfits wishing…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: We stayed at Radisson Blu to be closer to the uluwatu beaches, after an extended stay in the Nusa Dua region. Whilst there are many Pro's to the resort & its surrounds, ultimately these were outweighed by the many material Con's.  PROS: relatively large rooms, close to hidden stunning beaches with unrivaled waves & surf.  CONS:  - The hotel design is genuine safety hazard - the corridors are exposed to weather elements and become flooded whenever it rains. You can barely walk out of your room without running into puddles regardless of which floor your room is on. - Walls & divisions between rooms are not thick/soundproof so you can hear mumbling from next door & creaking noises from the ceiling) - There is no indoor/covered entertainment area with pool table & board games etc…

Besakih: This was one of the many temples that we saw in Bali. It was unique being on a mountain and just how big it was. Right after we bought our tickets, it was nonstop heckling from women trying to sell us sarongs and offerings. I know that it's like that everywhere in Bali. The…
Sacred: Lovely place to see heaps of monkeys, can be a bit crowded at times but just gotta find you're own quiet spot. Monkeys are playful and not at all aggressive, only to each other if at all.
Kuta: I had a relaxing walk down this beach, you can see people surfing and its family friendly. The beach was clean
Mount: We booked our tour directly from our Airbnb Host who has contacts with agencies. It was our first ever hike on a volcano and it was tiring for us as we are not very fit people - my Husband has just recovered from cancer and he wanted to try something different from our daily…
Grandmas: Super cheap and actually very impressive. I stayed for one nighy before heading over to our Villa to meet friends. The room is a tad bit of the smaller scale but barely even relevant or noticeable, considering what for what you pay for it. The design is super cute & bed is actually really comfy. The vines hanging all through the centre of the hotel was definitely a Wow moment for me. Definitely give it a go - I'd recommend it over plenty of other hotels which are double in price!!
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We stayed here for 10 nights and encountered a lot of issues with the resort and the area itself. I've given a short summary below. We did raise our concerns to the hotel and to the radisson group but the feedback/complaint has been ignored with no response from them so far: Area: - Very expensive, hipster area. We payed similar prices to Australia at the local restaurants. There is no good balinese food around - it takes 1.5-2hrs to get into seminyak or to go anywhere from this location due to traffic. We didnt do any trips because of the amount of driving required to go anywhere.  Hotel: - Beautiful hotel but lots and lots of steps everywhere. Minimal lifts and not very pram/disable friendly. We spoke to some older people and they really struggled. - Kids club is very basic…

Besakih: Amazing place beautiful, grand but perhaps not on a day in the middle of an annual celebration. I think everyone on Bali was there that Sunday, the crowds were astounding, the taxi took hours in gridlock just to get near the place. Entirely my fault for bad timing, our driver…
Sacred: Uma mata cheia de macacos e esculturas. Paisagens interessantes, vale uma visita! RP$ 80.000 Very interesting visit. A forest full of monkeys and sculptors! Nice views and unmissable place in Ubud!
Kuta: Walked from beach of Bintang Bali Resort to the Kuta Beach. Theres chairs for rent to hang around the beach.   Nice to see surfers. There’s nice waves. Lots of people suntanning and surfing.   When i went, theres fishing competition along the coast and kite flying competition.…
Mount: Hike was pretty doable . Not difficult! I would say a good pair of shoes help alot. And if you exercise frequently this shouldnt be a problem. Certain parts of the hike might be steep and difficult but you can get through it. Just beware of the rocky and slippery path.You need a…
Grandmas: I love the hospitality of their staff since i arrived untill check out, they informed me everything in detail such us about breakfast price and tour explanation.  Yes it is a small room but its cleanliness totally like a five stars hotel. I also love the interior, the promotional picture is really representative.   Would be better if there any discount for massage and cafe if you stay there :) And next time pls dont forget to refill shampoo and soap,  because i was bathing in the spa so fortunately i didn't need it in that time.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Amazing resort for our honeymoon. Quieter time as it was the rainy season. Best buffet breakfast ever! Wonderful staff! The hotel is beautiful and near lovely day bars in Uluwatu. Thank you Radisson Blu

Besakih: Then you might not be allowed access to areas you otherwise might....on the other hand you get to see a glimpse of balinese culture....my wife shed joyous tears at the enormity of it all and was touched by such a vast disply of faith...some will call it a tourist trap and it is;…
Sacred: All ways worth looking at monkeys so much fun the park is nice not to expensive and if your in Ubud why not
Kuta: Was a basic beach but plenty of beers on the beach any time of day. I'm spoilt for beaches in aus so wasn't that exciting for me but I did happen across releasing the baby turtles <U+0001F601><U+0001F601><U+0001F601><U+0001F601>
Mount: Overall the climb was worth it--especially if you're an active person.  But there are a lot of people that climb at the same time in the morning to take advantage of the sun rise.  I would have preferred to hike later in the day to the sunset sans the crowds.  But still worth it.
Grandmas: Recommended stay for budget traveller. Nice and cosy room and walkable distance to the most happening Legian Road with lots of restaurants and shops. Added point to the complimentary bicycle ride by the hotel, I enjoyed my ride to Kuta Beach. Definitely will back again
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Get a surprise by providing us with the steamer which they actually doesn’t have it . Very good service and quick response . Even the restaurant I ask for certain fruit they try to find it for me . All very polite with smile and fast response .

Besakih: Had the chance to visit Besaskih during a large festival. It was fantastic!  The admission price of 60,000 IDR is OK - one pays the price, puts on a sarong and is allowed to go around the temple without a guide. It used to be a big hassle - guys wanting to be guides, all trying…
Sacred: The sacred monkey forest true to its name, looks sacred with all the temples, and the forest too. A walk inside feels like forest with all the monkeys. Nice place to spend a couple of hours.
Kuta: Nice place to watch the sunset. Good place to learn to surf and bodyboard. Make sure you take your rubbish with you.
Mount: We are relatively healthy and sporty 35 year olds and while the hike itself is not particularly difficult, we were somewhat overwhelmed by the sheer number of people (we are talking a few hundred). It seems like this track is a massive money making scheme where you are only…
Grandmas: Many restaurants around also money exchanger shop. This hotel place on the end of Legian street and there are many shop on this street for shopping.You need to walk for 5~8 minutes to Kuta   beach. Very convenient
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: This less than a year-old resort is located in sleepy Uluwatu (as opposed to bustling towns elsewhere in Bali), with very reasonable prices for a high-end resort, it was a very pleasant surprise! The property itself is built with a large pool in the center, but no beach access. We booked an 'ocean view" room, which was very spacious with an extremely comfortable bed, lovely balcony with stunning views of the water and the resort. The bathroom was also spacious and everything had an elegant feel.  The buffet breakfast, poolside cafe and finer-dining Italian restaurant were all tasty with good service. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Padang Padang beach with quaint restaurants and stores along the way.  The hotel provides shuttle service to the beach as well as to must-see Uluwatu…

Besakih: If you want an up close experience of Balinese life, go to Besakih during ceremony (ask your hotel if a ceremony is happening during your stay).  This is by far my favorite temple on Bali.  Go first thing before all the other tourists so you have your own special experience. …
Sacred: The Monkey Forest is truly a beautiful place to visit, so many monkeys to see from fully grown (slightly aggressive males) to females holding their babies. My guide was brilliant and gave me some tips - don't look directly at the males, they take this as confronting behaviour…
Kuta: Yes big improvement every one is doing their best to keep the beach clean. Tried the beach food hamburgers at a $1 were really good. Beer nice and cold. Good surf for learners.
Mount: My original plan for my Bali trip this time was purely for diving. But luckily one of my diving buddies met on the trip suggested Mount Batur trekking to me and that gave me the perfect closure of this mini getaway. <U+2028><U+2028>  My guide’s name is Bazir (+62 877-6038-1082), very…
Grandmas: Rooms were very clean, location was perfect for surfing and partying, staff were friendly, breakfast was nice, they had free bikes and price was very reasonable. Recommend to walk in in low season as you can get a better price compared to online booking websites.

Radisson: A great place to stay. The facilities were very good and the staff were excellent. The location is also great with many restaurants and cool shops nearby. It is easy to do day trips from the hotel and the set price taxis were also usefult

Besakih: Artana our driver from United Bali Drivers who is a professional tour guide, drove us around again yesterday. He is so great we asked him to contact Rai another driver from United Bali Drivers who we had booked for later in the week as I had been having some trouble with my…
Sacred: The improvements at the Monkey Forest are awesome - we were a group of 12 travelling & it provided "surprise & delight" moments for everyone - especially loved the young monkeys playing in the water fountain.  The new ticket booths & entrance area really show the care &…
Kuta: It was a beautiful experience seeing the sunset in Kuta <U+0001F3D6> there were lots of tourists all over the world! Will definitely come back here again<U+2764><U+FE0F><U+0001F601><U+0001F44D><U+0001F44D><U+0001F600>
Mount: My friends and I were picked up from our hotel at 2.30am. Started the hike around 4. 2 hours of hiking. Saw an amazing sun rise. It’s a must do if you come to Bali.
Grandmas: Stayed her for 4 nights and found it a really great stay, the beds and pillows really comfortable,air con super cool,the breakfast had variety and tasted good, we checked out and went to ubud and realised we left our money and jewellery in the safe,we notified them we couldn't get there for a week,they made us confident all would be taken care of no worries,and when picked up all was there in safe,also we had massages that were awesome,some of best our whole time in bali would highly recommend, location good also helpful staff
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Had a excellent stay at Radisson Blu! The hotel offers a range of great Spa programmes (relaxing pure!). The rooms are large and clean. Helpful, friendly and competent staff. The breakfast buffet is delicious.

Besakih: We were not allowed to go inside the temple yet just walk around the temple. It's dedicated to hindu gods and nice looking with the background of highest mountain / volcano in bali. I really enjoined the scooter ride had from Ubud to this place for a very less price. Temple is…
Sacred: Amazing first day in Bali. Seeing the monkeys and walking around the temples. Be aware they can take food. Don't take any food or drinks inside...monkey forest is worth a visit...
Kuta: Today I drove down from Lovina North Bali and it was pouring with rain all around Kuta Beach, surf was great but the rain was horrendous...
Mount: Left 2:30am from Ubud to get to the rim by 5:15am to be treated to an amazing sunset within the 30 mins that followed. The guide, Bazir Bawak, is a true local who lives at the foot of the volcano. We had simple but yummy breakfast before setting off on a tour around the crater…
Grandmas: the location is really strategic, it is only few blocks from entertaining places. the ambience is really cute and you got a very nice elevator, also the room is really unique and artsy though there were ants swarmed on my left brownies

Radisson: I never really do reviews. As a matter this is my very first review on TripAdvisor. I am not usually easily impressed by mixology, however I felt the need to write a review on this gentleman’s cocktail. I will definitely come back for the food, room quality etc. but mainly for this amazing cocktail (Singapore Sling) especially made by Mr. Irawan. Such a good personality and a remarkable mixologist. Thank you for the stay. You will see me again in future. Cheers!

Besakih: Indeed it was the closure of the holidays. The tenth full moon since the new year and after the hundredth full moon. So it was a big event. Which means everyone in traditional clothing going to the temples, big traffic jams and everything decorated for such an occasion. It was…
Sacred: This places houses lots of monkeys, some of whom are quite aggressive.  Make sure not to carry things which the monkeys can grab from you, including mobile phones.  Children loved it here.
Kuta: We had a nice evening walk by the beach. As usual the hustle bustle of Kuta and it’s visitors. We managed to ‘squeezed’ in and make the most out of it!. New memorable moments created ever time and every year that we visited Bali.
Mount: Mont Batur is beautiful monten the hight about 1717 m hight. Several time is erupsion like on 1927. 1963 and the last one was 1994.
Grandmas: Didnt like the room Very closterphonic I could only sleep there had to keep myself busy so I didnt have to spend time there Was clean though No pool either Need a pool in bali  The restaurant in front was good and totally loved the spa below
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: This hotel amazed us at the first time we arrived. In the hidden and sacred place of Uluwatu, we found calmity and relax during our stay. staff is friendly and helpfull, there's a hidden beach acces, pool was great and the food was tasteful. There's also a qibla/praying direction available in every room. It was so helpful for a moslem traveller like us.

Besakih: We enjoyed spending the afternoon here although it was very busy! Was a cultural insight to see everyone dressed up in their clothing for praying whilst the ceremony is happening.   The site is massive, but very beautiful. However, some places were off-limit such as the private…
Sacred: It is a good experience in Ubud.Very huge trees and  small lovely monkeys are there.It is better to go early morning because humidity is too high in this rainy season.
Kuta: We had a special night at Kuta.. It was romantic with the slight windblow. The cinematical wave coming to the shore.
Mount: We didn't climb Mount Batur but we had booked a day tour that took us to a restaurant for buffet lunch overlooking the mountain and Lake Batur, the views were lovely and it would have been even better to get closer to it. Our driver also parked along the edge of the road so we…
Grandmas: I checked in at 02.30 in the morning due to late flight and late supper with friends. I was  really exhausted at that time but soonest as I opened the door of my room, that feeling was gone. I had a lovely room with a quote on its wall "Love will find the way". The room was quite small but very clean, cozy and comfortable. There was a wooden plank shelf tied with sail rope on the wall. There were cloth hanger hung on it as a solution to keep your cloth neat and smooth as they don't have cupboard. The bath room had sliding door with shower box in the right and the toilet in the left. The design was very effective for small space. They got good quality bath room amenities, including soft tooth brush. I usually never use hotel's tooth brush since they were commonly hard and rough…
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Stayed with family and friends (3 rooms total). Staff are helpful and friendly. Good transfer service to and from airport but not cheap.  Good and drinks are reasonably priced especially at happy hour. Spa is very nice but not cheap.  Rooms are nice but aircon inconsistent.  Location is secluded and only advantage is near to Uluwatu temple and not much else.  Shuttle bus is only free to uluwatu temple and Padang beach - they don’t even drop you at main road shops (850 metres along narrow road) and they don’t allow Grab or GOJEK rides. That’s my only complaint. I know management must have their reasons for this but it’ll only cause unhappiness for guests.

Besakih: Balinese people going  to temple in local ceremonial dress . Temple was nicely decorated. Foreigners are not allowed to go when function is going on. Even as Hindu from other country we find ritual different.  Volunteers bit rough so no argument and they say not allowed. Thus,…
Sacred: Great fun but don’t carry anything - not even a water bottle.  Lots of tiny baby monkeys there and not expensive - a must if you go to ubud.
Kuta: A great way to wind down after a hard day of shopping. Hit the beachside bars around 5pm, settle back and watch the show unfold. Most bars have same prices.  All have excellent ice cold drinks, and perhaps access to a nearby warung.
Mount: This climb was definitely harder than I had expected. We wore trainers and had numerous layers which were removed within the first 30mins of the trek. Trek time was a total of 1hr 45 and this included two 5min breaks.  There are no lights while walking and the terrain is very…
Grandmas: Conveniently situated if you need to stay in Legian. An easy walk to the beach (this is not a beach side hotel). This hotel is great if you were here on business or wanted somewhere to stay at a great price, yet still clean and comfortable. Far better than any other hotels nearby. Price comparison is excellent and would recommend Grandmas to you. Rooms are smallish - but adequate and recently refurbished well.  BEWARE EXCHANGING MONEY. There are numerous money changers (small in back of shops and lanes etc) in the area. We very quickly became aware (at our expense) that there is a trick played by each money changer every single time. They count out the money on their side of the counter and allow you to check it. It then gets placed in piles on their side of the counter. You…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Just loved our experience. Faultless. Facilities were excellent, staff friendly and available. Food in Felini restaurant was excellent and not to pricey. Pool area was a dream. Room spacious and very clean. Loved our stay!

Besakih: This is an impressive temple to approach but once there it is limited. Afterall it is a place or worship and many areas are not available for the tourist. It is not expensive but you find yourself handing out a few dollars here for 'obligatory' Hindu offerings and 'volunteer…
Sacred: We had a great time at the forest. The monkeys are obviously used to tourists being around but you do still need to pay attention to what you are doing while there. Follow the rules and you will have an excellent experience.   A top tip would be to get here early, ideally as…
Kuta: I could not believe how clean Kuta beach is now , it’s better than Legian and Seminyak and the nearby restaurants are way better value , was very impressed with Kuta and will deffs return ASAP!
Mount: Fantastic hike, worth waking up at 2 am to do. The sunrise view is worth it! The hike itself has some rocky and steep parts, but not tok bad if you are fit. It took us 3 hrs to get to the tol and 1 hr 45 min to come back down. Keep in mind that we are not the fittest couple…
Grandmas: I checked in here for three nights as a solo traveller at the start of a weeks holiday. The first night I arrived at 1am after a late flight in. Staff at reception were very friendly and checked me in really quickly.   My room was in the fifth floor on the Jl Legian side so there was a lot of street/traffic noise but hey it's Bali and and as a regular traveller here Im happy to embrace it. It didn't prevent me from sleeping.  The rooms are very small but as a solo traveller I don't need a big room. The room was very clean and that is all I really ask for. Complimentary water is provided.   Breakfast was included with my stay. It's not a buffet but you can choose from about six different dishes. I would assume there would be something to cater to most tastes; eggs benedict,…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Stayed here for 5 days and it was a lovely experience. The suite had a wrap around deck with ocean views. The staff was pleasant and unobtrusive. The breakfast was varied and fresh. Other dining options were high quality as well. Modern luxury at its best.

Besakih: Arriving at Basakih when there is a lot of ceremony is absolutely the best time, even if it's crowded. You will certainly get a better experience and understand the Balinese more.  It's organised and not really chaotic. Try to visit with a Balinese person or family so you can…
Sacred: This is our second visit to the Sacred Monkey Forest. Amazing experience and great walk through. Many facilities at hand. We booked a private driver and this was one of our chosen stops. Monkeys will jump on you if you have food or water. Dont panic, walk away and they jump off.…
Kuta: I stayed at Anvaya resort located close to this beach. This is very clean and nice beach esp for bathing.
Mount: Wow wow wow, what an experience, sight of sunrise over bali is breath taking. Will recomend this trek highly. Be warned it is not for the faint hearted. The trek up 1700m+ is very hard work, will test you physically and mentally. At points in the trek it gets really steep, the…
Grandmas: Grandma's is very well located in central Legian. Always very clean. Comfortable. Good restaurants near by. Can get a bit of noise from motorbikes and road traffic plus some late night partygoers. Good for breakfast.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: excellent hotel - peaceful - fantastic staff - lovely big poolreally good breakfast range - dinner menus a little limitedadjacent beach not good for small kidsaccept travel time on busy roads to get to most places

Besakih: We visited the temple as part of a day tour and thoroughly enjoyed the visit, despite the distractions. The view of the temple with Mt Agung behind is spectacular.  Entry to the temple was Rp 60 000 per person, plus the costs of buying offerings to place in the temple. The…
Sacred: Beautiful park to walk through and monkeys everywhere.  The signs are there for a reason and so long as you don’t bring bags or glasses or things the monkeys want to grab they won’t bother you.
Kuta: Very fun place to chill and relax. And lot of things that we could buy. The beach also great. Always thankful
Mount: My first trekking experience. I woke up at 1:30 and the driver was waiting me for pickup at 2 am it takes 1 hour to there. You take breakfast (tea and poor crepe) then 10 minutes to mountain. Wear a jacket as it was cold, also keep sunglasses with you. In the mountain you will…
Grandmas: Great place to stay. Close to shopping, great restaurants and a close walk to the beach. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are clean and the included breakfast menu has great diversity. We tried out a couple of things at the hotel spa and it was wonderful! Nice budget hotel!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: We had a fantastic stay at Radisson Blu Uluwatu.  The hotel only opened in February 2018, and still feels brand new.  The rooms are large and beautifully furnished, all with a balcony overlooking the pool, many with a sea view.    The pool is great with shallow areas perfect for the kids, and it never felt too crowded.  We also enjoy the spa, but felt the rooms were a little sparse.  The two restaurants and pool bar offer decent, reasonably priced food, however often the service was a bit haphazard.  We usually waited 30-40 minutes for sandwiches at lunch time, and waited over an hour for drinks one afternoon, and after several enquiries it finally transpired that our order had been lost...quite frustrating.  We were also a bit disappointed with the quality of the food at the…

Besakih: I read lots of reviews with same idea before my trip, however I went there. Except the value of this temple for religious people for praying, there isn't anything to worse for visiting here. It is just big and you aren't allowed to go inside temple if you aren't there for…
Sacred: This sanctuary was the brainchild  of Jim Cronin, it has flourished under his and his wife alison  to what it is today  If you require assistance for mobility, then you must book ahead for a mobility scooter, 10 and your driving license must be produced, this will be given back…
Kuta: This beach has jogging track and I enjoyed running this morning because still not crowded. And also you can enjoyed the night to hangout in the cafe
Mount: I booked the tour through my hotel and went for the hiking last night. I paid 370,000IDR. They picked me and other guests up at 2 a.m., drove us to a guest house which functions as office for the tour company, offered us a small breakfast there and then drove us to the starting…
Grandmas: We used Grandmas as a stopover before heading to Gili Trawangan. Check in was easy..check out easy. All in all a pleasant 12 hour stay. Noise is the only downside but hey, it is Legian/Kuta..mainly road noise and other guests.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We took all of our family (9 including partners) to the Radisson Blu Uluwatu and had a fantastic time. The venue was great, the pool fantastic and the staff were wonderful - helpful and always friendly. The rooms were large, breakfasts were superb and the food in general was good value and enjoyable. We had a great family holiday. I fully recommend this hotel!

Besakih: The web is filled with warnings on this sight so I was prepared for chaos and aggression. To my great pleasure, I had quite the contrary experience! I went around 10 am and there were only a handful of other visitors at the time. The ticket cost Rph 60,000 and included borrow of…
Sacred: Although a typical tourist attraction, we enjoyed our walk through this park and interacting with the Monkeys. If you are in Ubud, it is worth taking a 30-60 min stroll through this attraction even if created for tourists.
Kuta: Love the beach but it used to be impossible to sit quietly & enjoy the surroundings and sunset because of the hawkers.  Yes, I know they all have to earn a living, but sometimes it wears you down & you just long for some peace.  This visit was totally different, I think they…
Mount: If You don't go hiking on it, probably the best point of view of this volcano is from Kintamani, the village located in the western edge of the larger caldera. Its eruption (29.000 years ago) has been one of the most powerful ever happened on Earth...
Grandmas: As a traveller on a fairly limited budget, this was a wonderful treat! The whole hotel is really well run and the lime green and white theme really embellishes the style of the hotel. The rooms are reminiscent of a Scandinavian design with some Indonesian flare. With such an economical use of space in their "cosy" room it's easy to write this off as a rip-off, but it is not! The bed is massive and extremely comfortable, the bathroom Was immaculate and the blinds open to a view of draping greenery. This made me feel like I was Somewhere in the heart of the jungle despite being in one of the busiest hotels in Legian! The artwork in the hotel rooms is also really homely. In fact the cosy room is the PERFECT room for the solo traveller on a budget, looking for a little luxury…
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Radisson: Loved my stay! I think the hotel is a lovely size, not too big and all rooms are centered around the pool and have a good view. massive pool with heaps of lounge and seating options, great breakfast. The rooms were large and very nice.  My only issue was that I could hear heavy food steps and some banging from upstairs. I don't know if I was just very unlucky (twice since I asked to move rooms) with who was above me, or if the property hasn't been built with enough insulation.

Besakih: Nejvetší a pro Balijce nejposvátnejší chrámový komplex. Nádherné stavby na úpatí sopky Agung - nejvyšší sopky na Bali. Do chrámu je sice vstup zakázán, ale procházení okolo chrámu je obrovský zážitek. Je nutné mít sarong (dá se koupit na parkovišti za cca 50.000 IDR). Ženy musí…
Sacred: There is possibility to see monkeys in Ubud without paying for it. It was disturbing to see how ramgers in the park behave with monkeys. Some toourists also forget that these are wild animals. Overall nice walk in natural forest, home for monkeys.
Kuta: This is the perfect spot to watch the sunset. When it’s low tide it’s great for young kids to splash around. Be aware that it’s very crowded and we saw plenty of vendors selling ice cream and other things.
Mount: Views from the top of the mountain were just breathtaking and definitely worth the 2am departure from our hotel.    This is a must for anyone wanting a stunning start to the day.  There were 10 or so in our group and a couple of guides who made sure we all made it up in plenty…
Grandmas: I stayed at this pre booked hotel for Nine days ....very easy to find ...very welcoming and helpful staff ...but it ends there. The rooms over here are so very small that it is fit to be called a kids room hotel..the rooms are so much of a disappointment...thank God I was not with family and I stayed put here because being an internet prepaid non refundable booking I had no options but to stay ...no swimming pool..no restaurant inside the hotel ...breakfast is ok not really good ...everyday the same no changes ...the person at the gate of the hotel who is actually a security personnel is nothing but a pimp offering you ladies every time you enter or exit the hotel...he does this assuming every solo person staying in the hotel is come here for the same thing....overall not fit…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The setting is very good, and this is a well designed modern resort, perfect for families, couples or singles looking to relax. The view of the sea from my room was breathtaking. The pool area is also beautiful.

Besakih: Before I leave in vacantion I`ve read so many bad things about this temple. Many guides recomanded me not to go because the locals are so rude and annoying trying to make you buy anything. We decided to go anyway and our personal driver was a little reserved about this too.  We…

Kuta: Kuta beach has a lot of critics but I find this beach as one of the beaches in the world ( or all I have seen of it) I was brought up on a beach in Western Australia. I have swam at least at one beach in each state of Australia including Bondi, Manly and Surfers Paradise. I have…
Mount: Very interesting to visit the caldera and see how the people are mining the volcanic rock and sand ( for building) also using the fertile alluvial soil around the base of the volcanos for growing flowers ,fruit and veg, Beautiful volcanic landscape and so interesting . Glad we…
Grandmas: I like the place and will return here. Location is convenient; 10 mins leisurely walk and you are in Legian beach. A lot of places to eat, shop and get good massage around. Staff are friendly. Breakfast is quite a surprise.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: Actual hotel, staff and pool all excellent. Breakfast excellent Food could be better at restaurants, buffets should have not had food already cooked and left in warmers made meat, corn etc tough and dryCocktails definitely need major review.

Besakih: The temple compound was beautiful. They offer a motorbike ride up to the gates which is helpful because its about 1 mile uphill to the grounds. The locals bombard you right away and say that you need to purchase offerings.... be ware, you do not need to purchase anything.…
Sacred: We went here by accident as we thought Google Maps was guiding us through.  There are many monkies and they are quite relaxed around people. Non of them were aggressive but fun to look at. There is lots of staff to ensure the safety of you and the monkies.  Definately worth a…
Kuta: Surfing can be done on this beach, lots of options are available for the same. There is a shopping mall also near the beach.
Mount: My wife and I were perhaps the lucky ones after having friends that have seen nothing once at the top but we had a great view and a stunning sunrise!   The trek was good fun and our guide was friendly and interesting to talk to which helped to pass the time.   At the top we were…
Grandmas: The best part of this place are they have the best executive spa & massage that i never missed to go everytime i go to bali. The restaurant also good. Nice staff! Great experiences! Located central of nightlife in bali!
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: Having travelled through Thailand and Vietnam both my wife and I were ready for a little 'down time'...   We booked the Raddison Blu Uluwatu before leaving Australia through Luxury Escapes.   With the promise of 4 complimentary massages in the Spa, cocktails each afternoon and a huge choice for breakfast each morning along with 3 multi-course meals for lunch or dinner we decided that's where we should spend our Christmas.  The Radisson staff have certainly got a very strong focus on customer service. Congratulations to all the staff there as they made our stay extra special...  Nyoman and Agos became great friends over the 5 days we spent there relaxing. Nothing was too much bother and they always had a beaming smile and warm handshake when we saw them.  We were in Room 325...…

Besakih: We were looking for a very spiritual day -  for personal reasons after a recent family death.  We found that - and there was peacefullness and beauty -it was amazing and well worth seeing.  Stunning veiws and so much history.  Being Bali you were set upon to buy vastly inflated…
Sacred: Nice place where you can see monkeys very close and they also jump on your back sometimes. But be careful because they can be aggressive. The forest is so big and beautiful!
Kuta: They also have surfing, have beach boys who teach. no matter your age. Young and young at heart. Great place to sit drink, surf, talk and have fun.
Mount: One of my best experience in Bali was the hiking and night at the top of gulung bathur. Sleeping under a star in a confort camping. Contact guide "Bazir Bawak" on facebook, he is Nice, speak english and know a lot of stories!!!
Grandmas: Grandmas is perfectly located at the end of the main shopping street in Legian but not too close to keep you up at night. They had a room issue (revamping the rooms) so upgraded me to the larger double room for the same price as the standard. The staff were friendly when I arrived and spoke good English. There is no pool unfortunately but that's the only fault I can say about the hotel.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Great hotel in heart of Uluwatu. Incredible price. Yummy buffet breakfast was included. Pool area was relaxing. Plus hotel offers shuttle service to the beach. Overall amazing experience with wonderful staff.

Besakih: Don't be put off by the organised chaos at the ticket office. Once you get your sarong and ride up the hill to temple complex it is well worth the visit. The views are spectacular even on a cloudy day we visited. The guide was informative. There are lots of steps to climb. The…
Sacred: The name of the park made me think that I'd mostly just see monkeys, which is appealing, but not the most unique experience in Asia. What I saw was a beautiful, lush, green park that felt quite natural as there were some very old trees on the property. I'm not sure if the park…
