Radisson: Took an hour to check in. Boyfriend had a heart problem and they got us to hospital ok but after that they didn’t want to know. Wouldn’t give us a partial refund because we didn’t pay for one upon booking even though we didn’t know this was going to happen then had to pay again for the stay and still haven’t been refunded. Emailed numerous times but they’re ignoring our messages.

Besakih: Besakih temple, the most important and revered of Bali is certainly impressive, beautifully restored,  absolutely worth visiting. But you'll have to accept a certain degree of irritation being there. To start with, the locals are swarming around you like flies, to get you their…
Sacred: Another location with a lot of monkey's to see. It's different then the other ones we have visited in Bali.
Kuta: This beach sometimes gets a bad reputation (hawkers wont leave you alone, that its dirty, etc etc) but its not true - at least now days. If you says you don't want something the seller will leave you alone. There are beach police to ensure you are not hassled and if you need…
Mount: We enjoyed the beauty of Mount Batur and the volcano from a distance as it happened to be around the time of the volcano eruption in the region.  It’s amazing even in wet and windy terrain n a must see. There are lots of little cafes and restaurants that your driver can take you…
Grandmas: I stayed at Grandmas Legian for 3 nights. Each day the consumables (toothbrushes and bottled water) were replaced, this may seem like nothing special but i have stayed at places that dont replenish the water so yes it was a pleasant surprise. I have been to this hotel before and on all occasions the staff have been very polite and very friendly (yes including security, haha).  The reason i am writing this review is because of what happened to me today after checkout. I dont normally leave anything behind and this morning i even reopened the door to the room for inspection to make sure i got everything. The one thing i did forget was my passport which i put into the room-safe.  I had already arrived by taxi at the airport when i remembered, so i hijacked the very next taxi…
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: This is a new modern hotel. Smooth check in/checkout. The room was very expansive , well sized with a sit out.the room has a espresso machine .The bath rooms are neat but tubs has a walkway view, pls be aware. The breakfast was decent , nothing great, but good. They have huge pool are with a gym. No sauna or steam .attentive staff. Overall decent resort , well priced.

Besakih: The temple is a beautiful building, but you can't even get out of the car without being "attacked" by local women renting umbrella and trying to convince you that from the parking lot you have to wear a sarong, and that should be bought/rented for sure from them. After refusing…
Sacred: If you’ve never seen monkeys before being in their own habitat and playing around you this is a great and safe spot to do so. Recommended
Kuta: Great beach. Big enough space even with a lot of people still felt not overwhelming. Great restaurant along the beach. Must go Azul beach club . Real good spot for drinks.
Mount: Beautiful sunrise but to be avoided in August! Hundreds and hundreds of people standing and walking slowly in line from the parking lot to the top of the mountain...
Grandmas: The location of this hotel is great, close to shops, restaurants, bar, chemist. The room was small but enough for us. Unfortunately the toilet was dirty, mould on the shower floor, sleepery, no shampoo.  After complain hotel solved these issues but shower room could be more cleaner.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: The newly opened Radisson Blu in Uluwatu is everything you could wish for in terms of a peaceful, elegant getaway in Bali. Far  away from the chaos of Kuta and environs, this resort is probably best suited to those who have already toured Bali and simply want to stay somewhere quiet & refined with superb views from the clifftops .Staff are excellent; professional, polite & friendly without being intrusive. They certainly do have the promised "can do' mentality.On site restaurants very good. Cocktails and mocktails - brilliant! Breakfast - excellent with plenty of variety and healthy options. Spa facilities are excellent although somewhat pricey. There is small gift shop on site but don't expect they typical resort type shopping arcade as may be found elsewhere. Overall, highly…

Besakih: Also known as Mother of temples ! Was told that this temple is 1300 years old and from brick stone now been made from lava stone . It's a full day trip and takes Atleast 3 hours to cover the complete temple at own pace . We were staying in Kuta and it took 2 hrs 30 mins to reach…
Sacred: We loved the monkey sanctuary. It was fascinating to watch them roam, feed and in some cases cause mayhem!  My daughter loved it. The grounds are well kept and we saw several feeding sessions. No cages? Just a huge forest.  One tip- keep your water bottle out of sight. If they…
Kuta: Busy busy , lots of cool streets filled with hustle and bustle , cheap hotels and great for proximity to the waves - if thats your thang..
Mount: Me and my friends wanted to go up the mountain in the morning and they don't let you pass or they falow you walking and woth motor bikes. They dont let you go without a guide even tho the track is super ease,we went super slow with stops 1.5h. Sporty person need less than 1h…
Grandmas: Excellent service! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and practical. Location was great! Hotel is walking distance near Legian beach and many bars and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to others. Only downside was that we had a few spiders in the bathroom.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: This hotel is fairly new, having opened in February 2018. We had a suite with balcony overlooking the sea (distant). The room was sizeable, albeit sparsely furnished. The small table and chairs and a daybed were on the balcony, so these were good additions, The two main restaurants were generally good, with the breakfasts being exceptional. The only thing missing was a good adjoining beach. We’re in the “elderly class”, and the steep stair access to the main beach was not easy for us. Neverless we thoroughly enjoyed the week and will almost certainly return because of the great friendliness of the staff.

Besakih: As a Hindu Indian I was attracted to all Bali temples when I planned this trip. On my First day itself I planned Besakih(mother temple) which has almost 20 temples at same place. My driver informed me not to take this tour since tourist gets frustrate because of strange…
Sacred: The monkeys are very spoiled here and that is exactly what I like to see. They are happy and thriving and so adorable. I had two monkeys ‘attack’ me but it doesn’t hurt.. they saw my large handbag and wanted to get whatever was in it. I simply shook them off my arms, they are…
Kuta: whats not to like,  friendly people, cold bintangs, massage, beautiful sunsets, just so relaxing, what else do you want
Mount: They dont let you go without a guide even if the track is pretty easy to Do with a torch and Some Shows. They want to get your money for a 5 hours track(there and back) . The price Range for a guide Was 20-50$. The Mountain Looks nice. But the place there is weird and we Got the…
Grandmas: Had a nice stay, good location near a big beach with rental boards, and the staff were helpful to an unknowing traveling family...main street had lots of shops and nightlife is busy with a lot of choices.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: Awesome hotel for price point.   The pool is amazing, room conditions awesome and the buffet is an awesome spread. I would go back.   Hotel is only 2 years old.  We were able to walk to Pedang beach from the hotel!

Besakih: It´s a pitty that in all religions humans have to make as much possible money with ´God`. To pay entrance to see a temple, to buy a sarong or you don´t come in...and to pay some guide to have some information on time...all over touristshops...and little girls who force you to…
Sacred: I love the fact that these monkeys are not caged. They are free to roam around at thier free will. It's not wise to play with them. Nice place to visit
Kuta: It was a packed beach. So many people. Best place for surfing I would say. Specially for beginners cos you get these slow short waves. You can rent surf boards there. Also there were some water activities too.
Mount: My husband and I decided to get up early and see how the sun appeared behind the horizon, perfect decision. It took us 3 hours to get up with a great guide named Jeremy and we stayed for 3 hours as we brought our own breakfast. The view was incredible and those things are worth…
Grandmas: Good budget hotel, nice pool, friendly staff, clean room (only shower cabin wasn't too clean). BUT the room I had was facing a bussy road and it sounded like there was a hole connecting the bathroom with the outside so it was VERY NOISY coming from the road.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Nice to have this hotel in Uluwatu which is mainly a house/villa rental area. Not to many hotels are located around here. The hotel is new so it’s very fresh and clean. The rooms are big and have everything you need. Good breakfast and nice options for lunch & dinner. It’s not as big as other resorts in for example the Nusa Dua area but it makes the hotel have more charm and character. The personnel is also very good and helpful.    The location is good since it’s very easy to access restaurants and beaches in the whole Uluwatu area so if you prefer a hotel rather then renting a villa it’s very well situated!

Besakih: Having lived in Bali for almost a year now I thought we should pay homage to Mother temple before we return to Australia shortly. I hadn't done my homework and our driver had not enlightened us either so it was 'into the deep end' for us.  Rp 20,000 each for entry. Ok. I was…
Sacred: I wasn’t going to go cause once you have seen a monkey up close well....but I was curious nonetheless. I appreciate the sanctuary and the special surroundings of this place.Go but follow the rules. Watch your belongings however cause Monkeys are fast and mischievous.
Kuta: We visited Kuta beach to give surfing a try. The locals teaching from the beach were very reasonably priced and they were ever so friendly and helpful. We were provided with somewhere to sit with shade and drinks vendors nearby if you wanted.
Mount: You should at least arrive to this place to start the trekking route at 4AM and approximately it will take around 2-3 hours depend on how many times you stop to take a break. Sunrise will show up at around 6AM-6:30AM. My trip was on August 2018 during rainy season and the summit…
Grandmas: Location of the hotel is very good, close to the heart of Kuta and Legian street. Room is clean. Very kind and helpful staffs and good taste of breakfast every morning. But room size is too small and no pool
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: Spent 6 nights here just before the rainy season and it was beautiful. The room was spacious and elegant with a great view of the ocean. The pool and poolside is large, luxurious and relaxing. The breakfast is great and will set up right till dinner that night. The staff like most Balinese are so friendly and warm, you feel like they are genuinely happy to help you with whatever! The area of Uluwata itself is quieter than other parts of the island so this hotel completely lends itself to that relaxed vibe. Perfect spot to spend time after 10months of a heavy workload!

Besakih: Pura Besakih was nominated as a World Heritage Site in 1995. There are at least 70 ceremonies or religious celebrations held each year here, as each shrine has its own anniversary, plus the big holidays based on the 210-day Balinese Hindu calendar system. The best visiting times…
Sacred: Very nice and clean place at monkey forest at ubud.. Frienbly by be careful and look the note first about monkeys.. They are just animal.. Enjooy it..
Kuta: We were expecting to see a lot more rubbish, but the was more than is expected so pick up a few bits of plastic and in no time the beaches will be better. The path along the beach you got asked to buy stuff but generally very good once you say no.  Go and release turtles into…
Mount: Gede was our guide for this sunrise trekking trip. It was hell of an amazing experience for me. It was my first time doing trekking on an active volcano. Fear not, it's not really that active. Gede is very fluent in English, and has demonstrated great patience with us. He cracks…
Grandmas: Its a great location in Legian, very close to a good money changer in fact next door. ATMs close by, and a selection of restaurants to choose from. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and very nice to chat too. The rooms are what you see in the photos, a little on the small side, but if your just sleeping there they are great, clean, and have a bar fridge for cold drinks. The breakfast is awesome, good selection.
Amnaya: I have lived in Bali for a while and visited various hotels and resorts, and Amnaya is far beyond any place that I have stayed here, or even anywhere else.  The hotel is beautfully designed, the rooms are immaculately clean, the staff are extremely courteous and helpful, the included breakfast is the best that I have ever had at a hotel, and the value for money is incredible. On top of that they upgraded our room for free. This truly is the best place I think I have ever stayed at.  It is usually not too difficult to find flaws in hotel in Bali. My partner has a keen eye for dirt and an even keener nose for damp and other smells, and this is the first place we've ever stayed that is truly flawless. I take my hat off to the staff and management here for keeping the place so beautiful and clean.  I am never motivated to write review for hotels, but Amnaya Benoa is just so good that I felt compelled to. I look forward to visiting here again!…
Radisson: It was a wonderful week stay with the Luxury Escapes Package (which is the only way we could afford to stay at such an amazing place!). Spa service was amazing, breakfast was one of my favourite times of the day and the local area was easy to walk around. The offer shuttle bus to uluwatu temple and padang padang beach but you can definitely walk down to the beach (i suggest taking the bus first to know the route but it's very straight forward). There is Impossible beach which you have to walk down a path behind the hotel and down a cliff (not as difficult as it sounds) which is a lovely secluded area to relax. The rooms were spacious and very clean, the service was very friendly and honestly would stay here again! They gave us a complimentary cake for our anniversary! It was not…

Besakih: Our vehicle driver had warned us stating that, tour guides will harass you a lot, but we didn't bother. From the time we bought the tickets, every corner there were guides who were actually behaving like thugs and threatening us. We didn't care, but finally again at the entrance…
Sacred: I visited with my 13 year old son. He was disappointed because the previous year the monkeys had been fighting and the day we went they weren’t. But I really enjoyed seeing the monkeys and the wonderful stone carving and the cool in the forest because of the many trees.
Kuta: Massively catered to Aussies and things are expensive here. Nice place to visit but expect to pay more for anything. Beach is nice but there are much nicer ones a little further away.
Mount: We went to see Mount Batur in the afternoon.But would recommend to go on early morning.Its little far from the city.If you are staying near Kuta,it takes 1.5 hrs to reach ,depending on Bali's traffic and narrow roads.
Grandmas: " Pampering Perfection"   The new re brand spa at Grandmas Plus Legian, The 90 minutes massage is AWESOME and the massage, facial and body scrub package was just heaven on earth. The spa is clean, staff welcoming. All in all great service and VALUE.
Amnaya: From  all the hotels in Bali that was the newest. ( I stayed january 2020). It is on budged. The breakfast was a la carte, good choices. coffee was good too which in Bali for European people is difficult to find  nice coffee. I used thw app Grab for food delivery as i wanted to eat at my hotel pizza etc. (Indonesian food wasnt my taste).
Radisson: The Location: It's up in the bukit area, about 15 min away from GWK area. The area is a bit remote, although there are still some cafes and restaurants nearby. It's near Padang2 beach. The neighbouring areas is still undeveloped, and there is a bit of a pig smell from the neighbouring farm. Although it's only evident when you're walking from the lobby towards our room on the right side of the resort.  The Architecture Design: The resort is beautifully designed in a modern minimalist Asian style in the same vein as Alila Uluwatu. The resort is very luxurious, from the room, restaurant, pool, kids club and the spa, everything is superbly design and styled. Clean crisp lines, with beautiful combination of woods, granite and stones. One warning is the common area facade mad(e of…

Besakih: We were looking forward to visit Besakih, the #1 temple to see on Bali. We were visiting Bali exactly for that reason: to see temples, experience the local culture, cooking classes, etc, but that visit left us with a very negative experience. Our driver did warn us to pay the…
Sacred: We are very cautious of monkeys and knew that they can be unpredictable however we are very sensible people. We didn’t purposely go near the monkeys and wind them up or bring any food and if any approached us we would slowly move away. However as we were sitting on a bench two…
Kuta: Kuta Beach ranks pretty low in terms of attractions is Bali, but I think think this is one of the best places to visit in Bali. The Beach is awesome and it is clean. It's popular among the surfers. It has restaurants all around and offers amazing Sunset views. The traffic around…
Mount: Trekking sunrise was one of the most awesome morning we had, 1,717 m trek up Mount Batur. It was challenging, fearful, busy atop but overall just SO beautiful.  Our private guide, Komang, was a hero. He's hiked this trek over 1,000+ times), he cooked for us (eggs on the lava),…
Grandmas: Spent a couple of nights there.. No fuss. Staff good. Rooms  nice.  Very well priced. Well located. In an area that's pretty much handy to anything. Good place to go to if you haven't been to Bali. before. Just simple good location.
Amnaya: Only just opened when we stayed - working hard to impress. Staff wonderful, rooms luxurious and food off the scale - best breakfast I’ve ever eaten with not a grid egg in sight! Utter bliss in the spa suite - choice of massage treatments with choice of oils and choice of teas. Probably best hotel in my experience and unbelievably cheap - though I think this will change. Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: We booked in a Luxury Escape holiday. Had a great view and a lovely room, very comfortable bed with all the amenities. The breakfast was very nice good quality food and selection. We ate at both restaurants and also was impressed the quality and standard of food. The Radisson is close to many beach clubs and other attractions. The pool was large and well laid out would certainly recommend

Besakih: I've just returned home after being in Bali for two weeks. I had done significant research before I went into the culture and religion especially and was profoundly disappointed in my visit to the most sacred "Mother Temple" of all of Bali.  I had previously climbed Gunung Agung…
Sacred: Really worth the visit, stunning place. The monkeys were adorable, seemed happy and free. We followed directions about how to act but we saw several people were not and there just doesn’t seem to be enough guards. Monkeys will climb on you and try to open bags and reach in your…
Kuta: Decided to spend an afternoon / evening watching the incredible sunset Kuta Beach offers.  Plonked ourselves on a beanbag and watch the sun drift down. Was a really chilled way to end a day.  Love Kuta Beach xx
Mount: Amazing!!! It was packed yet so well organised at the same time. Guides time management was perfect and claim wasn’t to tough due to the support of the guides.   Well done guys!!!
Grandmas: It's almost everything I would look for in a budget hotel. Nice service, nice room, nice ambience. I stayed 2 nights without breakfast. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean and odorless, they even serve shampoo and liquid soap in the bathroom. One thing I couldn't found was the place to hang my clothes. Other than that, everything was OK

Radisson: Everything about our stay was pretty much perfect.  Loved the room and amenities.  The gym was great and so was the outdoor pool area.   A big surprise was the food - every where we ate we were always surprise as to how good it was especially Filini restaurant.  Highly recommend.

Besakih: Pura Besakih the largest and holiest temple of Hindu religion. need Guide Please WhatsApp +6281999359008
Sacred: It was cheap enough to enter so not really an issue, but it was a bit overrated. We got to see a monkey with a stolen hat on its head which was fun... and you get to see lots of monkeys and some personality from the monkeys, like very human-like yawns.
Kuta: Watch sunset, spend hours on the rented chair, have a chilled one. Everything you need to relax. It's a good spot
Mount: This is one of the must do activities in Bali. You leave in the middle of the night, and start trekking at around 3 am. You need to be fit to walk up the mountain. Don’t underestimate this! But what a view there was on the top: an amazing sunrise, a smoking volcano (mount Agung)…
Grandmas: Visiting friends who stayed here, the room was comfy but very small. The elevator was touch screen and It is like beyond my imagination to have it in a 3 star hotel like this! The hotel looks green but maybe a friendlier security would help.  I would like to say hello to Aji, the reception guy who was really friendly. Serve us very well, even I was just a regular guest and stay by joined with friend. He was very helpfull and my wife coul not ask more for a tiring day but a friendly human being say a nice thing. Just multiply a bit more staff like him and your hotel will be better. Going to have another booking tonight with my name (not joined lol) and If there is no hitch from the Pulau, I will be arrive this night.
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: The room and families are new and clean.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  The breakfast that was included was very beautifully presented, however some hot food was too salty.  Other than that, we had a wonderful stay for our honeymoon.  Though the hotel is far from other bigger cities such as Jimbaran, the hotel had an inclusive shuttle to Padang Padang beach and Uluwatu temple.

Besakih: before visiting we got a lot of warnings about this temple guides and hostility for tourists from the temple...officials....we were advised about the fact that you could not go without a guide...and the giude is between 60 and 75 euros per person etc...but also we were informed…
Sacred: We left early in the morning to beat the sun, and the forest was beautiful! Macaques were everywhere and we never had a problem with them stealing anything, even though I had read it could be a problem. The monkeys were docile and friendly. I even saw a Komodo Dragon lurking in…
Kuta: If you are into sunsets and waves as high as you, this is indeed a Haven for you. We arrived when the sun was about to set and the beachfront was teeming with tourists. The sights are majestic with the blue skies hovering the beach walk. Comfy recliners are for lease; it's a…
Mount: I contacted Komang via whatsapp +6281239020556 and everything go beyond expectation. Although I loved the view when I got to the summit and enjoyed the thrill of achieving the sunrise hike to the top, it was extremely hard going. Hired a private tour is a great way to do the…
Grandmas: I stayed at Grandmas for 6 consecutive days and it was a good stay.  Although the room was a bit small and cozy it was really clean and everything worked.  Bedsheets, towels, and bathroom were clean with no errant hairs or mysterious stains.  In room safe was useful and I only wished there was a mini-fridge to keep some drinks cool.  AC in the room and cable television were nice.  The wif in the room was fast and consistent.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  Get the breakfast option.  It was delicious, fresh, and filling.  You can pick from a variety of pre-set items and they were all fantastic.  Location-wise: It's only about 300 meters from the beach and there are a number of restaurants nearby.  The Italian Restaurant (Bella Italia) was awesome and is attached to…

Radisson: We stayed about 3 nights in this hotel and the moment we checked in we love the view! The food is fantastic with varieties for breakfast. The room is spacious and clean, the bathroom is excellent! the pool is large and fantastic ! Nothing bad about this property and the staff are also friendly . Met with the GM and his Dog , they are very friendly and we had a great conversation! would love to go back to this hotel again someday!

Besakih: We went to this temple expecting to climb the steps and look around what we understood to be a beautiful, sacred and very old temple. When we got there we were confronted by what can only be described as organised criminal activity from some of the locals. We were ushered by a…
Sacred: We had a great time walking around and looking at the monkeys and temples. Definitely worth a stop in. We spent about an hour there.
Kuta: Stayed in Bali for two weeks during the school holidays. I have visited bali rumours times in the past and often been to the Kuta beach to see the Sunset. During this time I have noted few good and bad things has  happened to this beach. Banning of plastic bags since the 1st of…
Mount: Hiked to the sunset point. We stayed nearby so only had to get up for a 4 am start. Was a bit of a struggle for me because I did not sleep well the night before as well I had the Bali belly. However, I made it up in less than 2 hours as suggested. Our guide was very good who we…
Grandmas: After a long flight we arrived at Grandmas in Legian around 9pm in evening. The receptionist gave us a warm welcome and provided us both with a welcome drink. He then told us all the information about the hotel such as time schedule for breakfast in the mornings, the hotel spa and restaurant location and the wifi passcode for our room. We got the elevator up to the 3rd floor where our room was located and dropped our bags in the room before heading out for a late dinner. The location of Grandmas Legian is very central, with lots of restaurants and shops literally at your feet from the moment you leave the building, so we weren't short of options for dinner. Legian beach is also only a short 5-10 minute walk down the road from the hotel.  The room we were checked in to was a…

Radisson: Everythink was great, view from our studio suite perfect, the food very tasty and there is  a glutten free corner at breakfast time, the pool very large but there is of the bugs lije ant from the tree.

Besakih: This is one of the most beautiful, and  biggest temple in Bali, also described as the ‘mother temple’ of Bali . Unfortunately many visitors describing their visits as ‘rip off‘ may discourage others from a ‘must visit temple’. You just need to be careful, and a lot of hints, are…
Sacred: Staff are pretty rude and disinterested and the whole thing takes less than 30 mins to walk around. Monkeys are actually pretty scary here too - quite aggressive!
Kuta: Nice place to play at the beach. Cleanness is better. To enjoy at Kuta beach, better below 9 am, beach no to much people
Mount: My husband and myself did a sunrise trek of Mt.Batur. We stayed at Batur Green Hill, they arranged a private guide to do the morning trek. It was approximately 2 hours of  up hill trekking.  The terrain is quite difficult because it is volcanic sand and stones. Once at the peak…
Grandmas: The hotel is suitable for budget traveller. But the location is quite far from the nightlife like skygarden. It is located at a cross junction so you will hear the noisy of the traffic if you stay facing the road. There are restaurants and minimarket within walking distance but a bit far from beach and the heart of kuta. I rather pay a bit more to stay at hotel that nearer to the central.

Beach not as lovely as Sanur. Busier than Sanur and more commercialised.
Radisson: After had a party hardy evening on Kygo concert, I need a great weekend stay with my sister. This chic & modern hotel has the answer. It doesn't like any other building resorts in Bali, it gives you a total comfort from their excellent service, foods, stunning view, nice pool, and not to forget  about the interior design. The room reminds me of the classy Nordic design where the great mix of minimalism, simplicity & functionality are met. I will definitely come back & refer this hotel to anyone who search for a stay in Uluwatu.

Besakih: We were warned by our driver as we travelled up the mountain that the locals were aggressive. They tell drivers to wait at their cars - "we'll take it from here".  The shop owners weren't necessarily any more aggressive than ones we'd encountered before and in fact some other…
Sacred: The area is big and quite a walk... fun to watch them and the way they behave while eating,  playing,  fighting with each other etc but need to be careful as sometimes they become violent.  Follow the rules   on the notice board and act smart.
Kuta: Sad decline over the years but good surfing and sun as usual. Spoiled by rubbish and touters but hey, its Bali, thats the way it is.
Mount: It was one of the most beautiful sunsets I have ever seen. The journey started at 3 am and it was a struggle to me to get to the top but hey I made it and I will do it again.
Grandmas: Great hotel to stay some nights at Bali. These hotel have nice atmosphere. But there was a cockroach at my room. Not just a cockroach, many of ants here and bite me till swollen! The service is pretty good.
Amnaya: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Bali, based on quality that exceeded the price, warm homelike atmosphere and facilities to satisfy any healing needs.  Everything is so well thought: every table at the cozy reading corner, the peaceful restaurant where you can enjoy the breeze & study in the afternoon, the beautiful yoga nest where you can stretch & unwind at sunset, BEAUTIFUL tanning place at the pool and perfectly blended colours & Balinese architecture that caress your eye, and the true, genuine hospitality! Oh and comfortable bedding. The intuitive service where you get the lights on right when you can't read anymore because of the dawn, without asking anyone. We haven't met the person who created this property, but we could feel he/she is an amazing person, the feeling you get by living there is incredible. Heartfelt Thank you to the entire team of Amnaya both who we met and who are on the backstage, a few to name: Ceri, Yulius, Ilun, Gisin, Arik, Eka, Adi<U+2764><U+FE0F>, Yande, Gilang, Wijaya, Sri, Yudi, Rigan, Agus, all the amazing public area attendants who sweep the flowers in the garden and of-course the White Pus. <U+0001F90D>    We hope to come back to that amazing heartwarming place! THANK YOU. Maria…
Radisson: Me and my partner stayed for about 9 nights but it was the best we ever experienced. The staff are the most amazing and nicest people, every single one of them. A big thank you mainly to "DHARMA" I hope we remember his name right he was amazing and the nicest person we have ever met.  There's not one single bad thing we could say about this hotel!  We 100% recommend and we will be back for sure. Big THANK YOU!

Besakih: Beautiful temple. Love that tradition is still a requirement in order to enter this temple; wearing a sarong. This is available outside the temple for a small donation. Strongly recommended.
Sacred: We enjoyed our walk through the monkey forest. The monkeys are not shy so do NOT take any white plastic bags or tote bags that can’t be properly zipped up, or else you’d better hold it for dear life. The monkeys just jump right on in and open your tote bags or grab your white…
Kuta: I do love Kuta Beach. The waves are great for body surfing. Hire a chair and watch the surf schools makes for a nice morning.
Mount: The tremendous and phenomenal views we captured at this place are some of our best pics from this trip. The lava has made the whole landscape almost black and the mountain stands tall and majestic in the middle. This was our first time we saw a volcanic mountain and we were…
Grandmas: Great value for money, Agoda price was better than the hotel walk in price. Staff are friendly, complimentary fruit juice upon arrival. Rooms aren't very big but nice new and clean. Very modern and for us the modern room with funky art and interesting decor was a refreshing couple of days after staying at a one star hotel in Kuta. Bed was fairly comfortable, amenities are good, no fridge in room. Great location close to everything in Legian and Kuta beach is only about a 10-15 minute walk away. Would stay here again for sure
Amnaya: Very nice hotel, on good location, nice breakfast. Checkin was a bit problem, but the service after that was excellent. Most of the staff are very polite and always try to make the best. Breakfast was included our roomrate, its really big and fresh.  Will come back again !
Radisson: We picked the Radisson Blu Uluwatu for our first 2 days in Indonesia and couldn’t have been happier.   A stunning new property in the dreaming and quiet seaside town of Uluwatu, this hidden gem of Southern Bali shouldn’t be missed.   Most comfortable sleep we’ve got in 4 months and the fish tacos at the amazing pool are to die for.   Really reasonable rates, amazing breakfast and great spa, yoga and even morning run with a guide.

Besakih: Like many we came to Besakih Temple assuming the worst. Pushy guides, "required" tours, donation solicitation etc. DON'T let this deter you. Your driver might tell you to pay or give a suggest you an amount, HA! Tell them you read this review and know better.   1. At the ticket…
Sacred: This is a well set up venue for tourists with plenty of wide paths and so many monkeys to see! Don’t take in food or drink or they will be after you! A must if in the Ubud region, or from anywhere really.
Kuta: Even if you’re staying in the most amazing resort or hotel with the fanciest pools... it is worth taking the time out to head down to the Kuta Pantai (beach) ... there is a hive of activity and many little pop up beach bars you can sit at... enjoy a drink and soak up the…
Mount: The view from the mountain top, every minute of the 2 hour ascend is mot enough for this majestic out of this world view.
Grandmas: This place is great if you look for the affordable cost and comfortable place in Legian. Located in jalan Legian, only 10-15 minutes walk from the beach and 15 minutes from Ngurah Rai Airport by car. A lot of restourant and bar nearby, so plenty of food to choose. The street are busy but the room are surprisingly quiet. Overall it is a good place to stay.
Radisson: My wife and I stayed in Radisson for 5 nights to celebrate our anniversary.  It was an amazing hotel, clean, modern and beautiful.  The service staff were excellent and had made us feel welcomed and comfortable.  They also helped to arrange flowers and cakes for our anniversary.  Really thankful for that.  The swimming pool was beautiful.  There was a wide selection for breakfast as well.  The shuttle buses was also a convenient way to travel around uluwatu. We really enjoyed our stay with Radisson.

Besakih: We visited this great temple while it was raining. There were hordes of people coming after us once we alighted from our vehicle, asking if we needed umbrella (they wanted to rent umbrellas). It is compulsory we have a guide with us for our group, so we paid 100k for 14 of us.…
Sacred: Abode to the hordes of monkeys, it's not that quiet walk. Monkeys are harmless if you don't bother them. Do not carry anything that catches their attention namely food, wide hats, shiny ornaments etc. Do not startle them. Do not try to pet them. Don't go near a mother with baby.…
Kuta: What can I say this beach is so awesome while sunset. Many people always visit this place to see the golden light.
Mount: Good tour,our guide Jerry was very helpful especially when the climb got slippery. It was very cold at the top but we had extra jumpers provided at the bottom which were necessary and for $15 for two ok. Climb down was good and even though it wa cloudy the views of Agung were…
Grandmas: Our  third stay is awesome, we love Grandmas Legian, staff is friendly, room is comfortable and set up 4 super comfort pillows, we Love it and full amenities including refrigerator and coffee and tea facilities, for the price, it's a great value. The breakfast is limited menu, mixed of Indonesian, egg dishes and Energizer- the one and only healthy breakfast menu. I would recommend to visit " Bella Italia" Restaurant at First floor, Pizza and Pasta is yummy, We will come back and return to Stay at Grandmas for future visit in Legian.
Radisson: We have recently returned home from an extremely relaxing 5 night stay at the lovely Radisson Blu.Everything was lovely from the amazing pool to the beautiful room overlooking the pool and the beach. The staff were all fantastic even though it appeared some were fairly new to the resort. Special thanks to Nova for her delightful service.Breakfasts were extremely good with a fantastic choice of foods.  Poolside lunches were also of high quality.  Dinners at night in both the Italian and the Indonesian restaurants were very good, but not amazing. We went out for dinner on two nights to the local beach club which served spanish food which we greatly enjoyed as we watched the setting sun.  The one hour massage we had at the hotel was extremely relaxing.  The room was spacious and…

Besakih: This holiest of the Hindu temples in Bali is located on Mount Agung about 65 km from Bali airport. Traffic en route may be heavy and later half of the road winds through hills where the scenery is very green and beautiful. It took us close to 3 hours by car one way because of…
Sacred: The monkeys are not timid, literally saw one reach up to try and  attack a few people who were waking by.     The park is lovely itself but be cautious.
Kuta: It's a nice beach where you can relax watching the ocean and an amazing sunset. Huge waves are proper for the surfers , not so good for swimming but good to relax with a drink or a big coconut . Unfortunately there are too many anoying people who are trying to sell their goods.
Mount: Mt batur, completely worth it to wake up early and go hiking in the night to assist at one of the most beautiful sunsets and enjoy a cup of coffee up there. Make sure the weather is clear so that you can see the view.
Grandmas: Affordable clean and comfortable rooms, well serviced, close to everything I came to Bali for. I'd recommend them to anyone seeking the same. I was able to move from Seminyak down to Legian even though I'd booked my whole stay at Seminyak. No problems.
Radisson: Stayed @ this resort with a Luxury Escape package. Rooms are excellent, nice and large with an awesome on suite. We particularly liked the quality restaurants Fellini being our favourite. Chefs and waitstaff were top notch. Big pool with plenty of space. The nearby village was small but OK. Beach access close by with good surf..

Besakih: After a 2 hour drive we arrived at a parking area,not so bad and it cost us about $7 to park,walked across to organise tickets to the complex to be met with a blank stare from a "guide" that suggested a fee of AU$80  to visit said temple,you then have to barter with the guide…
Sacred: For an eurpean guy, is a very nice experience to walk around monkeys, see them into their own home playing, eating, fighting and more! :) The moneys are very smart so, you have to be careful with your backpack because they know well to open a zipper and still anything they can.…
Kuta: Nice beach and plenty of room to spread out. Lots of small friendly beach bars as well. The downside are the very aggressive hawkers that line the beach and the whole area outside of the beach. They constantly harass you and unlike other asian countries when you say no (at least…
Mount: SUNRISE ON MOUNT BATUR: one of the best things in bali! here's how to do it right. DO NOT BOOK WITH A COMPANY or guide, instead, stay at bunbulan hill hostel and have them arrange your trek for you. they will take you on a different route than the million other people doing it…
Grandmas: Definitely recommend! Only approx $18 AUD for 90 minute Balinese massage. Staff were super friendly, you get cinnamon tea and cold cloth to begin, change into throw away jocks, massage, then shower to wash oil off and sit down and have some ginger tea and watermelon!
Radisson: We loved our stay at Radisson. Rooms we big, food was excellent, really enjoyed happy hour!! Everything was perfect, the pool was fantastic. Only slight negative was there was not too many toys in kids club.

Besakih: A must visit place in Bali! The Temple is pretty old and made from Lava stone is situated at  Mt. Agung, the highest mountain in Bali. The views from top of the temple are simply majestic!   Advise - Please ensure that you bring your own sarong, we had bought our sarongs at a…
Sacred: Absolutely in love with this place! If you’re an animal lover but dislike zoos this will make your day! So nice to see monkeys roaming free with not a cage in sight. Watch your belongings though the cheeky devils will rob you of any thing they can get hold of!
Kuta: A great place to sit back, relax, watch the waves, watch people surfing, enjoy a cold drink and/or get a quick message, get your nails done and but some souvenirs to take back home. Or just take same photos for memories <U+0001F4AF><U+0001F44C><U+0001F30A>
Mount: We reached there very early morning to have look at the Mount Batur , the sunrise is perfect with its reflection in the lake
Grandmas: Great hotel for a late arrival into Bali. Clean and tidy and a nice breakfast too. In a good location for shopping up Jl Legian, as I had certain shops to visit. Minimal noise too couldn't hear the traffic!!
Radisson: Wow! Absolutely loved staying here. Was very sad due to flight delays our stay was only for two nights. Room was very modern and exceptionally clean. It came with everything we could have wanted including beach tote and umbrella to use. Pool area and day beds were great with the pool bar just metres away. Breakfast buffet was the largest options I have ever seen at a hotel before... something for everyone with about 5 stations literally cannot see how anyone could want more! Staff were very friendly and pretty good with English. Booked the shuttle to and from the beach which was super handy and only about 10minutes away. Only fault I can see is the sign from the road is quite small and our initial Taxi driver couldn’t find it. Thanks again Raddison Blu will be coming back to…

Besakih: Besakih temple is also known as mother of temple in Bali. Mostly Balinese celebrate their big day to worship in this beautiful Besakih temple.Besakih temple is very big temple. You can spend a whole day just to going around this temple .
Sacred: The monkey forest in Ubud has nothing much to boast of other than the beauty of the forest and the regular monkeys that come to forage into human territory. For those who haven't seen these primates before it's thrilling otherwise nothing special other than the only attraction…
Kuta: water is not good for swimming go to seomwhere like sanur beach for swimming water. this beach is very busy and has many poeple trying to sell you things and waves are huge!! so keep an eye on kids and pets in the water else they might get sucked out a bit and no floats
Mount: My husband and I got great pics of Mount Batur from stopping over at viewing platforms with our driver. We didn't fancy doing the trek.
Grandmas: The hotel is strategically located in the middle of Kuta and is just a few minutes walking to the beach, bomb bali memorial, legian night life, and seminyak area. I don't recommend this hotel if you are traveling with family since the rooms are quite small. It is more suitable for business travel or for those who are more outdoors and just need a clean and affordable place to sleep.  Taxi and Uber is easy to get from this location.
Radisson: I had an excellent stay at this RD BLU. Very professional C/I, helpfull concierge, I was upgraded to deluxe ocean view room which was super spacious with great view. Only thing I was missing, sourdough bread for the breakfast. Otherwise, this hotel is a great value to stay.

Besakih: This temple is located in Besakih Hill. Bring your own sarong and be prepared by reading the reviews before you make the visit. The locals acting as temple guardians will offer you the rent of sarong and the guide that may make you uncomfortable. So bring your sarong. The temple…
Sacred: Great walk in the park with lots of monkeys. Monkeys are cheeky but fun. There are also lakes, exotic trees and flowers.
Kuta: Fantastic beach and place to relax swim or surf. Everything is fabtadtic. You have to come, its great
Mount: Trek is steep Many loose rocks Very sandy  Very dark   More difficult to trek down than to trek up! Remember to have sufficient rest, food and drinks before going up! Gloves , covered shoe, torchlight, Long pants and jacket~   Suitable for those that is fit. Because it is very…
Grandmas: Excellent service, cozy place, very recommended. Best spot Nice food Friendly atmosphere  Very suit to bring the whole family during the trip. Easy to find and not too far from the airport or Kuta beach
Radisson: We had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at the Radisson Blu. The service was out of this world.  The spa, well that was pure heaven. I was there every day.  Breakfast was a buffet, not a favourite of mine. But theirs was outstanding. Nothing they couldn’t provide. So impressed.  My only down side comment would be the restaurant staff could pay a bit more attention to detail when it comes to serving the guests.  I would highly recommend staying here and will definitely be back.

Besakih: I have visited many Hindu temples around the world. I am a Hindu. The visit to this particular temple ruined my Bali experience.  The guides and some crooks acting as a temple folks  want to rip you off and they also intimidate you. You may experience nice Balinese culture in…
Sacred: We had a good time strolling through the beautiful forest in the company of the monkeys who were curious about the visitors but very tranquil. I would recommend visiting, I think it could be especially fun for children.
Kuta: Rent 2 Loungers and Umbrella, $100,000 Rp - There are many entrepreneurs that will do their best to try to sell their goods to you...Cold drinks sold from local vendors.
Mount: We booked this tour online via W/A through Ari ( +6281337443553 ), communication was smoothly and confirmed just couple of minutes. All my inquiry answered quickly and got special deal. Need to make sure you have a good health to do this trek.  Also ensure you have right shoes,…
Grandmas: compact room with full facilities included. the staff are very friendly & the place is warm also. not too big, but not too small.    thank you for your service. we love being here.   keep it up & have fun working!
Radisson: 1. Check in time 10-15 mins, but it's ok for me2. The room is quite large, very clean, all the facilities worka good and new, spacious bathroom, balcony, bluetooth speaker, good wifi connection, and they provide bathroom amenities 'sensatia botanicals' my favorite brand ;)3. Quiet place to stay, very recommended if you looking for a place to relax time4. Breakfast is good for pastries, however need improvement for indonesian food5. Hotel provide free shuttle to padang padang beach and uluwatu temple6. Hotel have gate access, you can walk to impossible beach but you need to tell the receptionist so they can open the locked doors. Would be nice if we can use access card to open the gate7. However we had a good stay in radisson blu uluwatu and definitely will come back here again !

Besakih: This place is infested with locals making a quick buck. There is no official tourist regulation and all prices are negotiable. You should only pay to park your car. Most private guide and drivers avoid this place because of the local mobs who harass the locals and their foreign…
Sacred: Do your research before going first. There are certain things you should NOT DO while close to monkies. You might pay for your mistakes if not careful - as Monkey will bite you (Watch on YouTube)  Dont get too close to monkies Dont bring ANY food with you Dont bring water bottle…
Kuta: Kuta beach:  not really a swimmimg beach, but awesome beach for surfing. Water shoes to be warn on the beach lots of broken corral.
Mount: Awesome view, definitely worth the climb. It's not very difficult to trek up. If you never trek up a mountain before, no worries, take your time and have more breaks in between the climb. Make sure you have sufficient time before the sunrise.
Grandmas: The hotel was overall good. There was a good selection on the breakfast menu and food was always well presented. The rooms are quite small, especially the bathroom and there is no pool or relaxation area, however this is all reflected in the price.. Good stay for a couple of nights. Road can be a little noisy and in my three night stay there was only 1 lift functioning majority of the time. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Would return for a night or two.
Radisson: It was our first stay here and it did not disappoint ! We booked on a luxury escapes package, which was really a good deal. This hotel is new and its gorgeous, it’s spotless and the service is perfect. The luxury escape package included several meals and cocktails and although they were from a limited menu it was still a vast choice. The food was just delicious. Our room was huge and the bathroom just stunning. Plenty pool lounges, we used the spa often ( well priced and really wonderful atmosphere and skill) I was very impressed by the modern gym, so well equipped.   There were some repairs being done to the lobby bar but this did not disrupt us at all. Although this hotel has sea views it has no beach area. We visited some beach clubs in the area, Sunday’s and El Kebron to get…

Besakih: The biggest mistake we made was not reading the reviews before visiting this beautiful place. I can agree with all the negative comments in the reviews.   The Scam begings when you pay for entrance and parking. Once you get the tickets the person will inform you that this will…
Sacred: Always fun to walk around the monkey forest. It's nice walking around in there for 1-2 hours watching the monkey doing their thing. Fun for every age, young and old!
Kuta: Back in the 70´s , Kuta was Bali iconic beach. Sunset and small boutique hotels ...well now it is crowed, noisy and looks like Australia in Bali. Stay away and prefer Seminyak , more trendy and less people although the sunset is as beautiful
Mount: GO Early, to avoid the crowd, dont worry ull meet them all up on the top. find a good and funny guide, he will entertain you while you climb. it is a volcano u dont do that everyday. bring you professional cam with you and your good vibes. it is the best experience ever. do not…
Grandmas: I stayed here with friends. We booked the deluxe room. The room was so clean, and comfy. Although the room size is not that big, but it's enough for two people who brings two suitcases :).  The bathroom is quite small with separate shower but it is very clean!!  The staff there were also nice and friendly. This hotel is located in A strategic location. You wouldn't stuck in one way traffic. It also located near the beach (between walking distance). They also have Italian restaurant there which is good!
Radisson: We had three great nights at this lovely resort. From the moment we arrived we were treated like VIPs, the staff were lovey. Our room was beautiful, view of ocean from balcony, clean spacious bathroom and very comfortable bed and pillow. Breakfast was excellent, lots of choices, dinner was superb. Pool was lovely and drinks at the bar were great, happy hour was fun. Had a couple a massages that were very good. We hired a motor bike for 1 day from the resort which enabled us to get around. Would not hesitate to stay here again

Besakih: I was very disappointed with my visit to this temple.  The whole time i was there i was harrassed continually being advised i wasn't  allowed to enter the temple without a guide due to a ceremony being held. The guide cost would be 150000rp. ($15 aud) It totally ruined the visit…
Sacred: A very beautiful place to visit in Bali. One of the popular tourist attractions. I really enjoyed it. Just got to be careful with your bag as the monkeys associate this with food so they try to snatch it away from you. So best is not to carry anything when visiting the money…
Kuta: Beautiful beach. Lovely bars and restaurants lining the beach walk.   A lot of street sellers, which was a little overwhelming on my first visit to Bali.   Some areas do have plastic pollution from the ocean and surrounding area.   A variety of ocean activities are available. …
Mount: We start climb the mountain at 3.30 am and we arrive at the top at 5am.  It was cloudy so we miss the sunset but when we go down from the top, clouds get away and we could see so amazing landscape.  I recomand it to you, you musn t leave Bali without visiting it.   Our guide was…
Grandmas: I have just had the most amazing one hour Balinese massage. The girls are very beautiful considerate cannot do enough for you From the moment you walk in the door the girls have a lovely friendly smile and welcoming nature.the Rehat Spa is calming serene and relaxing as soon as you walk in the door and walked very relaxed and happy.I would thoroughly recommend this place and will definitely be returning
Radisson: Very nice resort with staff ready to cater your every need. There were 2 restaurants and both were nice to eat it. We had the Ocean Deluxe Room with views of the ocean and pool as well. The rooms were well serviced with an additional night service. The location is remote with little to do for walking distance. Overall I am very satisfied and would recommend this to anyone looking for a quiet getaway for the right price.

Besakih: If you decide to see one Balinese temple on your trip it should be Besakih. Very beautiful temple full of local religion and culture. Absolutely amazing!
Sacred: Visited in December, it was very hot. The place is beautiful but December temperatures were hard to manage with a 2 year old. Plus I felt we were interfering in the life of monkeys.
Kuta: So disappointed with this beach. All they want is ur money. Constantly been approached by people selling things. Water was lovely though.
Mount: Just a beautiful sunrise trek. Words cannot Express how beautiful this mountain is. Book your tour through bunbulan hill hostel.. or better yet stay there.. they make this mountain worth it.
Grandmas: From a the moment you walk in the door, you are greeted with professionalism, excellent Balinese massage for 1 hr, all staff terrific, will definitely be going back.  From start to finish very enjoyable experience.
Radisson: It's an excellent place to hide from the rest of the World for a few days. The hotel is a good place, if you intend to relax at the pool, enjoy local food and visit the spa. It doesn't have a direct beach access and it's far away from other entertainments (close to Uluwatu temple, though).

Besakih: Even with all the people the place is very calm, quiet refreshing after the chaos of other places .  The  Temples,   the lake & the gardens are very beautiful ... You could spend 30min here or 5 hours , it made for a very pleasant trip .
Sacred: Loved the experience. You can get up close to the monkeys but don’t feed them, touch them or look them in the eyes. There are a list of rules so just do what they say. Many great photo opportunities
Kuta: Meski banyak dibuka pantai2 baru, kuta ttp banyak pengunjungnya. Please stay clean here and wherever yoi visit guysss. Please love your nature environment.
Mount: When my partner and I take longer trips we often spend a day - or part of a day - on our own adventures. Hiking a Volcano was not on his list of must-dos. But the more I heard about the morning hikes up Mount Batur the more I knew I wanted to attempt it. The result was an…
Grandmas: Stayed at Grandma's Legian for 2 nights as a solo traveler. The staff made my stay hassle free and easy. They were very quick at attending to my requests. The highlight of the hotel would be the location which is in the center of Legian. This made marts, bars, restaurants and retail outlets all within walking distance. Would recommend and return if I head to Bali again on a solo trip.
Radisson: stayed here for two nights 19-21 October 2018. Cannot not fault this near new resort hotel in Uluwatu. The rooms are very large and amazing and as a self confessed bathroom snob I was in heaven here. The whole resort has a peaceful quiet relaxing feel about it, you cannot go here and NOT chill out completely. The staff are super friendly and cannot do enough to make your stay the best it can be. I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a quieter side to Bali, Uluwatu is a beautiful area to explore and has a real village atmosphere about it.

Besakih: This is reputed to be the first and biggest and most important Hindu temple in Bali.  It's quite definitely the grandest temple and it is large as it is a complex of temples and they all have views to die for.  It's said to be about 1000m high and is located on the southwestern…
Sacred: This is a nice little sanctuary with lots and lots of macaque monkeys around. It's pretty interesting to visit. There are temples inside the sanctuary too. I'm particularly happy that they don't have different entrance fee price for foreign visitors, unlike some other places in…
Kuta: Kuta beach has everything you will need. Food, shopping, relax at one of the many bar’s and kick back to watch the beautiful sunset<U+2600><U+FE0F>
Mount: The whole experience overall was amazing. But when I was going through the reviews before I did the tracking, it was mainly about climbing Mount Batur. What I actually found harder is going down the mountain!! Climbing the not require a fit person as you can take breaks…
Grandmas: My hotel room smelt like mould making breathing very difficult. I asked to transfer to another room, it was worse!! I left after 4 nights (ment to be 7) and booked in at a different hotel. No fridge, no kettle and rooms are dirty.
Radisson: Fantastic new hotel in Uluwatu, great size rooms and great views, good selection of breakfast foods, fantastic big sized pool, great to escape the busy areas of Legian and Seminyak and relax and chill orotund the pool.

Besakih: We had been told the "Mother Temple" would be a sight to see. As it is remote it is not often visited by tourists but it is the holiest place in Bali. Staying in Nusa Dua it took two hours to reach the complex. The long trip calls for a break and many many toilet facilities…
Sacred: There is nothing much to see. It is nice but if you don’t have time, you can skip it. Do not wear hats, sunglasses or anything catchy. Also, make sure your bags are closed do that the Monkeys do not grab your stuff.
Kuta: The beach itself was great. The sand well cleaned and the waves crashing. But then.....do you want a hair braid?....do you want a drink....do you want to ride a surf board...do you want to shoot a bow and arrow (yes I was asked this!!). All this in 10minutes and we had just…
Mount: This is the smaller volcano and worth the sunrise hike. You cannot imagine or downplay the view of you have a clear day. My group was truly lucky to have a bank of clouds below us over the lake so we could watch the sun come up . I could never give justice to the pictures I…
Grandmas: Nice place and centrally located. The hotel is located in Legian and it has fantastic access to shops, money changer, international and local cuisine, and very close to the beach.   Nice clean room and friendly staff. The hotel provides four pillows in each room.
Radisson: My husband & I travelled to Bali for a friends wedding.  We had the most wonderful 5 day stay.  Probably the best accommodation we've ever stayed in.  Breakfast was so good, the pool was relaxing, happy hour was wonderful too who doesn't like 1/2 price drinks and the restaurant food was lovely.  We can't wait to return with our children.  The staff are so professional and very friendly. I guess the only downside is that we were an hour drive from the airport, markets but it was always worth the drive. Will be recommending to friends & families.  Until next time....

Besakih: Again we can only agree with all the negative comments already posted. We had been to the Goa Lawh Temple, where we paid a set entrance fee and hired a sarong - full cost Rp16,000 or just a little over 16 australian dollars.  We stayed for the prayers and everyone was very…
Sacred: *PLEASE DO NOT FEED OR TOUCH THE MONKEYS**  It was lovely to see these animals up close and the forest was beautiful. We had a lovely time strolling along the various paths observing the monkeys.  What was disappointing to see were a handful of tourists showing so little respect…
Kuta: This very touristy beach is overcrowded with vendors of all sorts: souvenirs, jewelry, bike rental,  massage and all other crap you can imagine.  Although the beach is sandy and not too rocky, this is not my type of beach.  There are many more remote places and least visited…
Mount: It was incredibly windy when we went, which brought in the massive clouds (and cold winds) that blocked the entire view, even in the morning. However, on our way down, we saw some tourists hiking upwards, without a guide as the trail's pretty well marked. If you attempt the…
Grandmas: I stayed in may 2016. Room is small. Price is lower. it is located in famous area Legian. Breakfast also good. It is also very clean. Staffs were so friendly. I recomend this hotel for solo traveller .
Radisson: The Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu is a strange fruit and quite rightly fits perfectly into the duality that typifies Bali. In the case of Bali, one is constantly confronted with the most unique beauty and simultaneously with the most unique dangers, beyond tsunamis, earthquakes, volcanoes, to strong down currents, ground liquefaction, scooter crashes, unpredictable big waves, macaque confrontations, etc. The duality that is Bali. In the case of the Radisson Blu, the concierge can be amazing in their considerations of your expectations for traveling to the airport, the beach, or the Uluwatu Temple however, they can be a little offensive in calling you just prior to check out to inform you that check-out is in an hour. Anyone who travels to Bali is obviously a well-heeled global…

Besakih: I attended this Temple with my partner, her daughter and her daughters friend. After travelling to Bali several time before and due to the recent death of my mother, I wanted to visit a temple. The "scam" commenced even before getting to the temple. We stopped at a look out area…
Sacred: Very nice location, lots of monkies walkthrough, wooden paths and geat relaxation visit.  Enjoyed at the most. Be aware not to make eye contact with them, no feed with food and don't wear anything than can be 'stolen' from you by them.(ie: sunglasses)  And the most important, do…
Kuta: Be warned of the MONEY CHANGER opposite a restaurant called Nero Bali Restaurant/ Bar. Very quick slide of hand. Ripped four of us.  Carla is coming my friends
Mount: Although I loved the view when I got to the summit and enjoyed the thrill of achieving the sunrise hike to the top, it was extremely hard going. The guide had to hold my hand because I was finding it difficult to get a grip on the rocks.  Ubud Sunrise Hiking is a great way to do…
Grandmas: Nice clean hotel, sufficient space, friendly staff, great location, nice ala carte breakfast. Conveniently located at the heart of legian, the room size is small but practical for business people. Wish that the breakfast selection variety increase for repeat stay
Radisson: Overpriced! My partner and I regret staying there and wished we spent our hard earned cash somewhere else.What a rip off!!We paid for an upgrade and they put us in a room above a construction site that lasted the whole week we were there. We asked for a refund of the upgrade but they refused and asked us to move to another room which was very inconvenient. They have a good brekky but it would want to be for the price we paid to stay there each night. Highly recommend avoiding this place if you like your money.Room walls are paper thin so you can hear everything next door from cleaners to you know what hahaha couldn't wait to leave unfortunately.

Besakih: Can only agree with all the comments made. They want to rip you off and is the most intimidating manner. Official entry 15,000 IDR per head plus 5000 IDR parking.  Then around the parking lot are toilets everywhere. What looks like a public place turns out to be you need to pay…
Sacred: The park is quite big.. some places remind Tarzans jungle. And the main cute bandits on the area are the monkeys of course
Kuta: Lovely,scenic beach but found it very crowded with umbrellas and seats for hire plus many people. The waves were large and you could see the rips which can easily take people out to sea. Not a beach for children unless heavily supervised by an accomplished swimmer where there…
Mount: The tours start at 2am and you have breakfast and meet other travelers on the way to the volcano. The hike to the 1717 m height is strenuous and especially the last bit is grueling. The view at sunrise is nice and having eggs boiled in the steam of volcano is awesome. The trip…
Grandmas: The location was really good if u are looking for crowd and bar, near to beach about 400 m to legian beach.  I chose room with breakfast   And the breakfast was nice, we can refill the water and juice :)   We stayed for six days, and we are really love it, the staff was really kind and helpful, they change linen and towel everyday  The only problem is the room wasn't  sound proof so we can hear everything but overall i love to stay in Grandmas, and i'll stay there for next trip to bali
Radisson: Just enjoyed a wonderful 5 day break. The property is luxurious and modern , the pool perfect to laze by. Rooms are first class. We had a few minor hiccups with our stay however the staff ensured these didn’t affect our break. Special shout out to Gitta- lovely young lady who is highly professional and competent. Thoroughly recommended.

Besakih: Beautiful temple and very originial and authentic. Tourists are much welcome but this temple is an important part of Hindus' life in Bali. Have a look there, worth it.
Sacred: Very exciting but scary at the same time! The monkeys are unpredictable and will jump on you on any given time! You just have to follow the rules listed around the sanctuary. Great experience
Kuta: Nice sandy beach. Though no kids swim or enjoy the water. There are mainly surfers. A lot of flags are on the shore which explains with some colour code how the currents work. If I remember correctly, then between two red flags the current move drive you away from the shore,…
Mount: Sadly reviews of mafia policing the mount batur are correct. I prefer not to support such methods, so turned back. You could negotiate with them, but they are ugly mean spirited puerile who ended up physically threatening me as I took liberty to Google reviews/prices and read…
Grandmas: Everything was very clean, the staff really nice and polite, always friendly and smiling. Breakfast served in less than 5 minutes and very good too with many choices. Bed so comfortable and always well done
Radisson: Excellent view during the day and night. Food is amazing! Great service as well.... Spend some time here, the room overlooking the pool area and partial ocean view. Breath taking especially in the morning when weather are clear..

Besakih: We were excited to visit this temple as it is the biggest temple complex in Bali. The temple itself is beautiful, although the weather was cloudy/rainy and we couldn't see the sea or mount Agung. The big problem with Pura Besakih is the people. Balinese people are super…
Sacred: Full of people but still shady and peaceful. The monkeys are a joy to watch and the temples and carvings are amazing. Please be respectful of the animals. We are the intruders.
Kuta: We are currently staying just across the road from Kuta Beach and have the pleasure to wake up to the ocean everyday.  The beach is clean and the water warm. There are lots of surf lessons to watch while chilling out. You do get the usual sales pitch but a firm no thank you is…
Mount: Get up at 2AM, reach the location, meet interesting people and hike with them this 2000 Meter high, still slightly active Volcano.  Tips - Wear runners, keep a jacket as it gets really chilly at the summit. Don't stop at the common view point, hike another 200 meters up and see…
Grandmas: less comfort, the price is more expensive than competitors, standard service, internet facilities minimal, standards-paced, hard to find halal food, entertainment minimal, not suitable if a long stay here
Radisson: The staff and management at this hotel are second to none.  The only complaint I have is that the hotel is so nice that I tend not to take the opportunity to explore Uluwatu properly.A special thanks to the staff members at reception and Eka at Filini for yet another wonderful stay at the Radisson Blu in Uluwatu.  Hopefully I can visit again soon.

Besakih: The Besakih temple site is certainly one of the more beautiful religious locations in Bali. However and our driver/guide had warned us in advance there were very unpleasant signs that travelers are beeing ripped of by the local people assigned to operate the admission process.…
Sacred: This a great half day visit to the Forrest. Well worth a trip and walking distance from the centre of Ubud.
Kuta: This beach  shindig the Discovery Shopping Mall can be good sometimes and other times the waves can be fierce. We saw one young lady with a gash to her knee after being in the water  A safer alternative is the beach behind the Lippo Shopping Mall after a short walk down a lane
Mount: We tried to walk to vocano by ourselves bacause we didnt want to buy a guide for a very easy trekking route witch we've done trough before with a guide. Guides costs around 20-100 USD and because they are going very fast we wanted to go by our speed. When we arrived to mountain,…
Grandmas: We were welcomed with a welcome drinks, nice and sweet, then were directed to our room very quickly. I can see the effort the staffs there put in to help us. The room is clean and everything is very well management. The sweet and friendly smile actually made our day after being tired from the trips we been to all day. Thanks for the service, and will definitely be staying here for the next trip in Bali.
Radisson: The first day we requested to make up the room, it wasn’t coming quick, we left for swimming then coming back few hours later by lunch time and still wasn’t clean. So need to call them again. The water in the pool some days dirty, my husband and daughter got itchy from this. However the size of the pool is great, my kids love it. The bar and restaurant staffs were great, they make great cocktails and happy hours of 50% off was a plus. The location is far from the mini market so don’t exepecting you can walk around to the restaurant or shops. However it’s good relaxing place. We went to cliffs house, the view, drinks and foods were awesome!

Besakih: This is a good place with a beautiful temple. But the people always ask you money. We were going there at 4.30 pm. They ask us 15k/person for entry and ask guide fee 200k for 2 persons and then we deal on 50k! Then people an entrance gate will give you a flower(don't take it!)…
Sacred: Beautiful place, but you need to take care with the sunglasses and bags, because the monkeys can steal it.
Kuta: Nice view and amazing collection of restaurants. There are no lockers available so you will have to plan for your belongings if you are going for a swim. Despite that, its a must do attraction in Bali for sure.
Mount: Amazing experience, would totally recommend the volcano hike.   You start at 2 and eat breakfast before the hike and on top of the volcano.  Sadly there are so many people, that you have to wait a lot and can only hike up slowly.  But the view on top of the volcano is amazing…
Grandmas: Great location, not far from Kuta Beach, Quite small room but still pleasant. No car park. Sometime i see kura-kura bus pass in front of the hotel. see more info about kura-kura bus at kura2bus.com  Wish you enjoy
Radisson: Great new resort. Did not have a bad meal, beautiful buffet in the morning and great Italian restaurant at night, even the burger by the poolside was the best I had in Bali.  I’d recommend for couples and families, it has a great pool area and only a 5-10min walk to the main road where you can find great coffee and restaurants. Whilst you’re  there check out sunset at Uluwatu, it’s pretty special.

Besakih: It was true what the other travelers told about this temple. we went there on the way to east Bali (Amed). first we had to pay entrance fee down far before the local guide flocked. They said it is a kind of donation but they pushed to pay certain amount of money. if you don't…
Sacred: Great place to see lots of monkeys that dont try to steal your things! Was taking a photo and a little guy jumped on me and its girl/boyfriend got jealous and bite my arm and slapped me. Solid two piece, He was a Mike Tyson fan for sure! I wont go back... Hahah. But you should…
Kuta: Perfect weather, amazing waves from Beginner to expert and great service on the beach. What more could you want.   Great time to visit in June
Mount: On June 20th, my friend and I hiked up the famous Mount Batur. We woke up at 1am and travelled by car for about 2hours. We went inside a food shop with all the other hikers and they served us coffee/tea and fried bananas then we started hiking at 4am.   The trail was very foggy…
Grandmas: Good hotel room. Cheap. Room quite spacious. Bathroom a bit small but still ok. Water pressure good. Towels and bedsheets clean. Bed and pillows were nice and comfortable. Friendly staff. Great location in intersection.
Radisson: We recently stayed after purchasing a Luxury Escape Package deal. This Hotel is very nice, great rooms, pool was fantastic ( although a little yucky with algae on one day) , lots  of available sun lounges and the staff were very friendly with excellent English. The Deal made our stay great value although be aware that the meals/free drinks are to be chosen from a limited menu only. The food provided however was delicious and the drinks refreshing if a little on the low alcohol side. Massages were excellent as was breakfast.Also be aware that this Hotel is slightly isolated and you do need to walk a fair way for alternative restaurants or  you can grab a taxi but these are not Kuta prices for taxis here. There seems to be a very rigid fixed price system going on here with the…
