Besakih: While Besakih was a temple that we wanted to see, we were aware that there would be the potential for ‘problems’ based on the background research we always do when planning our visits. Basically this boils down to the villagers living near the temple being very greedy and trying…
Sacred: My boyfriend and I loved it, it was so much fun seeing the monkeys. They were very playful and cute <U+0001F60A>
Kuta: With seating and tables available this is a great place to watch the sun go down there are tables and chairs available even bean bags are available in some spots. And if you want to upmarket there are a few restaurants on the beach and just across the road.
Mount: The climb up is as arduous as you trying to resist your favourite KFC fried chicken wing.   Once you resist the first wing, you are on your way to resisting the whole bucket of fried chicken. THE ONLY WAY IS UP.   Guides are all friendly and helpful in helping you to reach the…
Grandmas: Grandmas Legian is nearby to legian night life. And it's close to kuta and seminyak. I like to spend some nights in Grandmas Legian. I wish I could back soon and creat another amazing experience in Bali.
Radisson: We vistored RB on a Luxury Escape deal. What fantastic value.        Had 5 nights, hotel is new and well kept. Staff still learning but very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was varied each day. Pool bar-Rest good , with half price frozen strawberry margaritas all day! 2 hotel Restaurants - Felini and Artichoke had varied menus & wine list, good value by Aust prices. Rooms - large and clean, each day a little treat left. With large patios and sofa Free shuttle down to Padang Padang beach, very popular with surfers. Busy but fun , you need to hire an Umbrella as it's hot. Some challenging steps up and down.  Just a few things - hotel maybe needs to run shuttle to shops- Rest as hotel is a bit isolated. Private taxis expensive by Bali rates. Good idea to go out to main road , and…

Besakih: The management of the temple, which by the way it's not even the prettiest in Bali, are professional crooks specialised in ripping tourists off from the first second. Despite the purchase of the entrance ticket you are violently forced to get a local guide that asks over 100USD…
Sacred: Nice place to be with family in the forests of Bali. Really enjoyable and you get to see lots of interesting relics there. The amazing views of the temple and the scenes of the monkey families very much entertaining. Really enjoyed it all.
Kuta: A nice happening place. Beach is relatively clean. Little crowded. Must visit in Bali.Kids will enjoy.
Mount: Its a long distance from Bali but worth it! Must visit. Either trek it or just see it from a distance...its peaceful and serene!
Grandmas: My stay at Grandmas was marvelous.I particularly enjoyed their level of cleanliness and quietness. When you are at Grandmas Hotels trust me you will pay less but get first class service. I you don't believe this try them.
Radisson: Great location, staff and hotel made for a very enjoyable family holiday. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to take the family away for a sunny relaxing holiday. Only downside is that it is a bit removed from the rest of Uluwatu so not easy to walk

Besakih: It seems like a very holy and traditional temple. It is the main temple in Bali. Local drivers are too scared to even accompany you to the temple cause they are scared of the thugs who run this temple. We stopped to buy our entry tickets to the temple, the very people who sale…
Sacred: i came here with my husband to explore ubud. and i said to him that i want to see monkey, i cam here by motorbike that we rent. here you can find many monkeys and they are so cute.
Kuta: Kuta beach is a commercial beach isn't a complete break from the hectic haggling of Kuta as there are so many vendor along the sand the hassle you.  The pollution unfortunately is still an issue even though the locals are trying to clean up the area and the government is…
Mount: I joined group tour (15 people)for cost 350k rupiah/person. It is cheap and had poor quality service. The guide didn't speak English at all, not one word. He didn't need it though, he just walked and we followed. When you get to the top we spread out and somehow not able to find…
Grandmas: I really liked this hotel because their staff are friendly once from the front office to security , very clean, and the concept of green , in front of many shops that you can visit to buy something, there are lemongrass restaurant and a coffee corner you can enjoy at breakfast . there is a spa which was amazing and you have to try , last thing there is bella pizza which was very tasty . Grandmas the number one you have to try if you stay in legian
Radisson: Great friendly staff.  Short walk to the main road to great restaurants.  Short walk up the road to beach side bar.  At low tide a walk to Dreamland beach is a great thing to do. Taxi people at the end of the drive are very helpful and reliable.

Besakih: I should have listened to my drivers when they told me about the people (local guides at Besakih temple) and why they do not recommend this place. You have to pay an entrance fee plus you need to take a local guide with you. They will ask you to pay $20 or 250,000 IDR for a…
Sacred: Lovely place to visit and the setting is spectacular. Unfortunately a little ruined by the number of people there BUT it is not so much that it ruins the trip/visit.  On an ethical note, it does seem that this is a good place to go as you're not feeding the monkeys junk food,…
Kuta: Great location, coldest of beers/drinks and one of the best views in Kuta.  Danny's the Man for looking after his guests!  Look out for Made "Number 4" on the beach for a great massage!
Mount: A must visit place. Sunrise from the top is beautiful and very peaceful. Just a light sweatshirt is enough. Trekking is not very difficult but can get little tiring for beginner's but the view from the top is worth.
Grandmas: Grandmas is in the hub of legion.. Bars, , shops, resteraunts, and the market right on your door step. The beach just a short walk. The rooms are clean, new, and wonderfully set out, though a little small,  The breakfast is wonderful, with exceptionally friendly service. I will definitely be going back to grandmas.
Radisson: We have just finished our third stay at Radisson Blu Uluwatu, since it opened this year! We keep coming back because it’s family friendly, yet stylish and immaculately well run and maintained with excellent service. The architecture and interiors are tasteful minimally and the hotel is well located for those who want to surf the Bukit area (though a car or scooter would be handy for surfing and going out at night as there are many good restaurants in the area, it’s a long walk to the main road and Uluwatu taxis aren’t cheap). The resort is not only brand new but it’s an excellent quality build (which can be something of a rarity in Bali) and the rooms are luxuriously comfortable, with a 5 star quality fit out that you would normally only expect to find in a big city hotel. The…

Besakih: My experience visiting this temple was not great. 15000 IDR entry fee + 5000 IDR parking fee was collected from me at a check post 2km before temple. At the temple parking lot I was asked to hire a local guide for IDR 70000 because "Some areas of the temple are restricted to…
Sacred: It's one of the main attractions.  Just do not take any food of any kind with you!  The monkeys are intelligent and can be aggressive if they see food or even food packaging.  They love Pringles chips for example.
Kuta: I was expecting to see more here, but the beach is just normal and you can't swim or do water activities here.
Mount: A breathtaking view of batur volcano and batur lake. We enjoyed a delicious Indonesian buffet facing mount batur. Beautiful cool breeze and awesome food. Need to pay 50k for parking at the spot and about 130k IDR each for the use Indonesian buffet at batur sari restaurant. Worth…
Grandmas: Noise from the street and noise from the hallway. The hallway design make some guest hangout outside their room to smoke.   The room design so strange. When we open the door, the bed is the first thing we see.  I have to wait 1 hour to get seat in restaurant when breakfast. Why? Because they don't have lobby area for some group waiting for their pickups. So they hangout in restaurant seat.
Radisson: Beautiful hotel better than 5 star.  Lovely ambience.  Stunning gardens.  Totally relaxing.Didn't enjoy dinner at Arcichoke.  Other than that thoroughly enjoyed everything else.  Excellent staff, caring and kind.

Besakih: At the ticket desk we purchased tickets and were offered a guide. We were told by the man selling tickets we could not go in without a guide. Once we got to the temple gate we were asked to show our tickets and told we could not come in. We said we would walk around the outside…
Sacred: Came here with my partner. It was very cool to see all of the monkeys. We were very mindful of all of the guidelines to avoid aggression from the monkeys. We were standing on a walk way, quietly watching the monkeys. One came up behind my partner, very calmly, and bit her in the…
Kuta: It is centrally located beach at Kuta. Though it is little bit crowded, but the view of Sunset is amazing.
Mount: In trying to climb this volcano prior to sunrise, I had my worst experience in Indonesia. I absolutely refuse to fund the criminal activity occurring at Mt. Batur. There is no fee to enter the site nor is a guide required. A local “mafia” of sorts runs this entire small village.…
Grandmas: I had a couple of treatment at De Nyuh Spa Legian, it was amazing experience, relaxing place and very friendly staff, very great teraphist with a great traditional skill, a lots of space and time for relax. This is one of the best treatment I have had in Bali and definately will come again. If you come to Bali, is not complete holiday without try treatment at De Nyuh Spa Legian.
Radisson: Luxury Escapes amazing package. AUD$999 included 5 nts accom Apt transfer on arrival. 5 buffet breakfasts, 3 dinners or lunches. 10 free drinks, 4 x 30 min spa sessions. Amazing pool. Bathrooms to die for. Huge well proportioned rooms. Only downside is location.  As we had booked 3 days independently for day trips we lost 90 to 120 minutes each day getting onto roads to our daily destinations.

Besakih: Although, we had read about scam and received a detailed warning from our private driver. Nothing prepared us for the frightening experience at this temple. Even though you buy tickets for the temple at the roadblock and are free to roam the grounds if you are properly dressed,…
Sacred: Excellent for a morning walk before it gets too hot.. Lots of monkeys, beautiful temples and walks.. Good value..
Kuta: The traffic near the Kuta beach is Terrible. And a lot of people selling services. But the view is wonderful
Mount: This is not too strenuous a trek but one has to be relatively fit. Also need to be comfortable to walk in the dark as the trek starts before dawn. The view is awesome.
Grandmas: Grandmas Legian is ideally situated to provide access to the party areas of Kuta, the restaurants and bars of Legian and Seminyak and Double Six beach. It's cheap but the rooms are clean.  The hotel has a spa in the basement which is probably one of the best I have attended in this part of town.  There is a great coffee shop diagonally across the road for coffee, juice and breakfast.  The hotel can get a little noisy as it is quite popular with Indonesians from Java.
Radisson: Amazing new property, service was fantastic, the pool was to die for and if you get the chance to upgrade do it the suites are to die for, the sunsets every night Folsom our balcony!!! We didn’t want to leave

Besakih: Hi guys. Besakih Temple, known as Bali’s ‘Mother Temple’ for over 1,000 years, sits 1,000 metres high on the southwestern slopes of Mount Agung. Besakih is an artistic and unique complex that comprises at least 86 temples which include the main Pura Penataran Agung (the Great…
Sacred: Like a lot of other reviewers, beware of these semi-cute primates.  It's a little unnerving that at the entrance of the park, there's a prominently featured first aid clinic.  The gardens are nice and the entrance fee is reasonable, but I regret having gone.  You can see the…
Kuta: Great spot laying on a deck chair under an umbrella on Kuta Beach enjoying a cold drink while watching the waves. Quite comfortable in the sun with a breeze. Can certainly think of worse places to be. Just remember that you are bound to get hassled by the hawkers, but at least…
Mount: We started at 2 am reached the peak at 5+ 6am. I think we took some time to reach the peak bcos we took a lot of water breaks. DO NOT DO THAT. When u reached the peak there was no toilet and I had to hold it in till we went down which is about almost 2hour down becos it was a…
Grandmas: nice, clean and cozy room, and the location is strategic. The staff is very polite. I can give the money to hotel staff to buy pia susu by delivery. Wifi is great, and the air conditioning works well. I am definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to stay again at this hotel
Radisson: We have just stayed for two nights in this great hotel. It was a last minute booking, as we were in uluwatu already but needed a hotel. Although it was a short stay, we felt so relaxed whilst here.  For a mid range hotel the rooms are fabulous, and the public areas are beautiful. In particular, Ola and the poolside team are a credit to the hotel and never stop working to keep the guests happy.   I would highly recommend as a base in uluwatu, for couples and families alike.

Besakih: It was the worst tourist experience we've ever experienced. First, scammers try to tell you there is a ceremony, so you need an escort - which is a lie. On the way to the temple we were harassed by a "temple guardian", who was very serious about respecting their tradition and a…
Sacred: Nice temples with lots of monkeys. Pls make sure you do not bring or offer food to the monkeys as they may get aggressive. You may spend 2 to 3 hours here as its quite huge.
Kuta: this is one of the nice beach to enjoy the sunset, love this place on sunset time , after sunset many dinner place around also , will make easy to enjoy .
Mount: We just had lunch looking at this view. I am sure it will be quite exciting to climb this mountain and feel the volcanic ash. As per the driver who was driving us, this volcano erupted 5 years ago. Not really sure how much can be relied on this information
Grandmas: Best location, no traffic jam. Valuable price. Although the room is small, but no problem. Because we need only good bed, and good warm water shower. Room and bathroom also clean. and one more thing. VERY GOOD SPA and MASSAGE.
Radisson: We got a surprise three days here due to a double booking and it was so great. The 100m2 pool by Choka, the pool bar and restaurant with service was fabbo. The views, cosmopolitans and food at the tapas bar at the viewing deck were perfect. The amenities are great such as the gym (no need for a sauna here). The haircut I got was excellent as well. The bed was a small island and one of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. The highlight above all this though was the spa. I had the best massage (after a 30min body scrub) from an amazing lady called Afri. It was honestly several levels above expectation. Thanks Guys. Highly recommended to all and sundry.

Besakih: Biggest scam i experienced in Bali. We gave money on 4 different occasions. We were forced to give donations and take a guide. He kept giving the hint to make donations throughout the tour. We just wanted to do our own thing and be left alone. Its beautiful there but not worth…
Sacred: The Monkey look very healthy. Everythink there is very nice an natural eventhoug there are some streets outside the monkeyforest the areal is quite big and they can move arlund where ever the want. Loved it.
Kuta: The first is the luxury resort. Usually 5 star down south. Frequented by the very wealthy, or those who have grabbed an opportunity through bargain sites like ‘Luxury Escapes’.  Then there is the surfer/backpacker holiday sites which predominate Kuta. Hawkers on the beach are…
Mount: We hired a transport and guide service from our homestay in Ubud. We found it to be a bit pricey (300 000rp per person) but we lacked time so it was simple for us to do it this way. It’s a very easy hike and packed with tourists. Yes the sunrise and the view over other volcanos…
Grandmas: Located in Legian, this hotel is at the junction of the bustling streets, with Kuta in one direction and Seminyak in the other. Recommended for its price & convenience, but not for those who are looking to spend the whole day in the hotel room.
Radisson: Fabulous new resort.  Pool is amazing.  Food at both Italian and artichoke restuarant is exceptional.The corn and prawn soup was so good I ordered it 3 nights in a row and asked the chef for the recipe!!The lower floor room was within easy reach of both pool and restaurants. Great view of the whole resort.  Will definitely stay again.

Besakih: As others have said, you can be put off the whole experience before you even enter. We had to pass three different sets of Mafia "temple guardians" each of whom told us there was a ceremony underway (there wasn't) and we could not access the temple unless we hired a guide. We…
Sacred: Here they have kept 8 different species of monkies.  They are well fed hence they are not aggressive. You can take a round of it within 10 minutes if it doesn't interest you.
Kuta: Beautiful sands, an idyllic bay and some really good waves for surfing. Also, to really confirm its status, absolutely gorgeous at sunset.
Mount: I have come there twice, first when I was on the second semester in the college, and second one is  a few weeks ago. I never been dissapointed come there. the golden yellow sunrise, the beautiful view. for me, the best view in on the nort-east. in the east you can see Mt. Agung…
Grandmas: I stayed here for 4 nights with my friend, I really love the themed and the interior of this hotel ! The room is rather small, but we're okay with it. I like the breakfast, there's not much variation but it's delicious. The staff is friendly and the wifi was fast enough.. Will come to this hotel again if I go to bali <U+2764><U+FE0F>
Radisson: I have seen some negative reviews of this hotel and I can honestly say after a lifetime of travel that this hotel is excellent and that these reviewers were either having a bad day or would complain no matter where they are.   The hotel is new and architecturally terrific.  The rooms are incredibly stylish.  They are on trend, large and with plenty of storage and room to move.  There is extra and comfortable seating inside and out with a generous balcony. Our room  717 overlooked the pool. The bed is huge, the bathroom large and the cable TV free.  The staff are super friendly, speak perfect english and are always helpful.  The bars are great and with happy hour and half price drinks 5-7pm who can complain.  Watch out for the Long Island Tea ..... they don’t skimp and you will…

Besakih: I am rating 5 of 5 for the beautiful temple... and -10 for the aggresive scammers! Government apparently doesn't care, so I recommend you skip this whole thing until the authorities finally do something about this problem.
Sacred: Glad that we have been here for our little ones so that we don't have to do this again. The monkeys of course can be a little intimidating entering their territory and we did witness one tourist get scratched from a monkey after she tried to touch it. Ensuring you have your…
Kuta: Obviously, I've been to better beaches where with fine white sand and cleaner beaches but I do love the sunsets here. But Kuta Beach can be very crowded with too many locals touting their wares. And if you are at the busy end where the beachfront resorts are, the beach is…
Mount: We reached this place somewhere in afternoon hence didn't find the place very impressive. This place is best visited early in the morning or during evening. Though the mountain view together with lake view looks pretty good.  Definitely a good place for clicking some nice shots.
Grandmas: My friend and I were happy and over the joy staying there. The service was excellent. We booked for a double bed-standard room. We got the room that exactly like in the picture. Everything was great. Your breakfast was awesome. We checked out at 5.30 am, March 27, but the breakfast was beyond our expectation. Actually, I have asked the frontliner about the take away breakfast last night. He confirmed that the take away breakfast will be only the simple menu, which is bread. But it turned out awesome. We both got American Breakfast and some bread and toast too. Woohooo. FREAKIN AWESOME.
Radisson: Wonderful new resort in Uluwatu next to Padang Padang beach. Very peaceful and quiet resort. Spacious rooms. Plenty of space around the pool daytime, and nice poolside bar/Restaurant. Very friendly staff all around. However, staff is not yet fully up to speed with recurring minor mishaps, delays, misses. (Fun example, over the course of a week “sunny side up”-eggs were delivered in five different ways...)

Besakih: This was by far the worst experience I've had in Bali. You think the people trying to sell you things in the markets are relentless? Try again. These "temple guardians" actually harassed me to the point of feeling like a terrible human being because we didn't want to "respect…
Sacred: Forest in the middle of the city, surround by good nature, springs, temple, implementations of Tri Hita Karana
Kuta: As our hotel was right in front of the beach road and we can easy access to that beach we often visited Kuta beach. My favorite time was during sunset. So beautiful!
Mount: Mount Batur the most beautiful thing I’ve seen, we stopped at a Resturant had the best view ever sorry don’t remember the name of the Resturant it was a buffet style they had a terrace looks over the lake and the mountain I didn’t want to leave the best weather ever, not sure…
Grandmas: Its a nice budget hotel, good location - a lot of bar and restaurant around. Room is simple and basic, but clean, good size for a couple. Breakfast is a la carte which is quite good.  The staff is helpful and friendly. The hotel also has a spa which is nice and cool setting. Overall this a great place for its price.
Radisson: Being newly opened, they had a promotional package for a 2-night stay. The dinner included was exceptional. The hotel still has a new feel. Rooms are large and the bed is comfortable. The service i experiences was very good. Genuine, friendly staff. I am definitely heading back!

Besakih: It's quite a 2 hours trip, from Sanur, maybe more from other locations, but it worth the trip.it's big, nice views from the top, and really nice history. Be prepare to be scammed by local 'guides' and vendors with the prices. If you not good with bargaining, reconsider the…
Sacred: A nice park, though serving as a natural monkey habitat. Can't call it exceptional as we had freely-walking monkeys in our hotel, as well, so something usual in Bali. Beware that some of the animals might be aggressive,  but overall friendly and accustomed to men presence.
Kuta: I don't like the beaches, the water is not clear, the beach is not clean.this it is too crewed for couple. i visit this place with my boyfriend but we love to stay in seminyak more because that beach is more quiet and few people. The romantic atmosphere can be made.
Mount: I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone, however if you have mobility or physical issues. I wouldn’t try this as it’s pretty tough even for people who are moderately fit.   Firstly you will be taken to the tour operators base for a quick breakfast (banana pancakes and…
Grandmas: satisfied, this hotel services are quite good. they have a good facilitate too, good environment and good SPA. I think I will go there again if needed a budget hotel for stay in a very short period of time.
Radisson: We were pleasantly suprised after staying here, after reading reviews we thought it might not have much atmosphere but that was just not the case. We were 3 29 year old girls looking for a nice base to spend the day and come home to whilst we explored the local area and this was perfect. Pool is immaculate and sophisticated and happy hour at the pool bar was our best time of the day! Our only comment would be that it would have been nice to have a buggy service to take you to the end of the drive way if you wanted to visit the local area as the walk is around 6-7 mins.The staff were amazing, particularly Ola and Aria who were so friendly and we loved seeing them every day. Thank you for a wonderful 5 days :)

Besakih: If you wish to enter you need to hire a local guide. They quote 650.000 rp per couple.  PLEASE DONT PAY THIS MUCH! We paid 250.000 as recommended by our tourguide. The guide was not informative, helpful or friendly and rushed us through. We were not allowed to go to many places…
Sacred: This is a forest for monkeys <U+263A> Hahahaha if you love wildlife this is a must. You will see rainforest and a lot of monkeys <U+0001F602> You must be careful with your belongings as the creatures here are very smart. One of them jumped off to our bag and tried to open it. And he almost open…
Kuta: Kuta beach is like any other beach nothing special or great. You can sit and chill at the beach. But there are better beaches compared to Kuta beach in Bali
Mount: We enjoyed the sunrise on mount nature and this was incredible. After hiking 2 hours you reach the summit that was literally just above the clouds .
Grandmas: The grandmas hotel is very simple and clean hotel, the room is very nice but small size for triple bed. the staff is very friendly and helpfull, thank you ms luvi restaurant staff for your service. i will come back gain.
Radisson: We had a great stay at this hotel.  Top class amenities.  Service was amazing.  The breakfast variety was good.  The buffet food changed slightly everyday so there was always something new to try.  We all had massages at the spa and the amenities there was brilliant also.  Not to mention the actual massages we received.  The lunches and dinners were similarly good tasting.Overall a top class hotel in a quieter part of Bali.

Besakih: This is the worst rip off i have ever seen, and i habe been to India. It starts when our driver has to bribe the policenan waiting at the ticket office so he wouldn't start to investigate the car and delay our trip for one hour. Next is the sarong rental. We were able to…
Sacred: We recommend this unique place where monkeys have plenty of space and freedom to live their own lives without being bothered by the visitors. A must in Ubud.
Kuta: I was told the beach would be covered in rubbish but it wasn’t at all, it was beautiful and clean and The Beach Boys were so friendly and accommodating, I sat with them on many occasions and made a couple friend I will keep!  Loved the turtle release on the beach, wish I could…
Mount: This is a moderate climb and if you are of a reasonable level of fitness you should be able to complete this. There are some steep bits at the end but if you have basic mountain climbing experience you will be fine. If you have any mobility issues you will find this very…
Grandmas: I didn't stay at the hotel however did a walk in for the spa treatment, which is downstairs under the hotel in a nice cool, dim setting which is clean, relaxing and very ambient. They have a special in the morning from 10-1pm for 95,000 one hour. We didn't take this offer but took a two hour deal with massage, body scrub and facial for under au $25 which included taxes and no other hidden cost. we payed first and were served hot cinnamon tea and given a face towel to cool off. they then took us to a seat where we had our feet scrubbed and sandals put on us and directed us to our rooms. rooms were curtained off for privacy and very professional. Massage was amazing almost wanted to sleep.  After the  treatment we were served with more tea and sliced watermelon. I even went back…
Radisson: Lovely hotel, great service.  Hotel provides shuttle to beach and temple which is useful.  Rooms large and comfortable.  Highly recommend if you are staying ini Uluwatu area.  They have happy hour at 5pm!  There are 3 restaurants to choose to eat in and a lovely spa.

Besakih: I have been visiting Bali for nearly 20 years, so every time an old friend visits for the first time we do a 3 day tour, which includes Basaki Temple.  If I am lucky enough to go with a local Bali friend the experience is first class.  However if you arrive with just a "driver"…
Sacred: This was so much fun lots to see and lots of monkeys everywhere. Was a bit nervous at first but then it turned out to be perfect !!
Kuta: Thank You to Suda our driver for taking us to have a wonderful dinner in the beach. Foods were sooooo goooddddd. I recommend Suda & Edy Smile
Mount: Fabulous view of both the mountains and lake. Unfortunately you are constantly bothered by locals trying to sell various things. However you do not need very long to see everything, but you have to pay on the way in to enter the National Park which unless you are doing more is a…
Grandmas: The spa here is simply exceptional. I rate it as one of the best in Bali for massage and luxury. The staff are friendly and the place is immaculately clean. Very professional service. A must if you want to indulge. Prices are more than reasonable and very affordable.
Radisson: My two night stay at the hotel was very enjoyable. The hotel is clearly very new and the design is very modern which I liked. The pool is large and family friendly - there was lots of families making the most of the pool and having lots of fun!   Our ground floor double room was very spacious and the bed was extremely comfy! The bathroom is modern with a large shower and bath - the shower water temperature was not great and the water pressure was very poor on the shower main head. The breakfast at the hotel was good and I was spoilt for choice - the service at times was pretty slow and there was often dirty plates left for some time on the tables.   The location of the Hotel is fantastic and they offer a complimentary shuttle bus to a local beach and to the Uluwatu Temple - I…

Besakih: The temple is nice and generally worth visiting. What really turned us off are the obnoxious so called guides and people that wanted to sell you offerings at overly high prices.   The best you can say is that at least the guide told us a lot about Hindu religion and its…
Sacred: Loved walking here seeing the monkeys "monkeying" around and taking pictures. One hopped on my back but did not harm me. Mainly because I am a wildlife enthusiast and did not react in a way to panic the animal. Do not engage or feed them, always maintain a safe distance and…
Kuta: Very nice beach for swimming and surfing, clean and friendly with small bars / warrungs dotted up the coast. It's also very close to larger reateruants and the mall.
Mount: We had a lot of fun doing the hike up even though the weather was not great. It was cloudy but there were some brief breaks that allowed us to see Abang, Agung and Rinjani. Very beautiful and surreal being up on the volcano.  We had Tindih as a guide and he was awesome. He made…
Grandmas: The legian Grandmas hotel, had friendlier staff which understood english a little better. It was more central as it was on the main strip. 10 minute walk to nightclubs in kuta, 5 minute walk to legian beach and 10 minutes to Kuta beach. However, as not mentioned, Legian Grandmas, Does NOT have a pool. Great , nice room for the price. Wifi was generally working well. No Balcony
Radisson: Nice ambience, great food and the resort is well laid out. Staff were friendly and very helpful. It's well catered for families and couples. The room was relatively big, gave the family plenty of space to be comfortable. Enjoyed the 50% cocktail specials.

Besakih: The "Mother' temple of Besakih, is a terraced temple set in the northern parts of Bali. The temple boasts traditional beautiful split gates with a stairway accessing the upper levels. We were accompanied till the top of the temple by our guide. The main prayer courtyards are not…
Sacred: We don’t have monkey were we are from so this was a really fun experience for me and my friend! The scenery was fantastic and there were so many monkeys. I didn’t have to look for them, they were everywhere. I really recommend this if you only have a few days in Bali.
Kuta: Kuta is the famous place in Bali. The longer beach for watching beautiful sunset. And you can play surfing if you like. Recommended to come before sunset comes. And you can have a dinner in the road around there. So many restaurants and bar open until midnight.
Mount: OVERALL Absolutely amazing and fantastic experience (!) and worth to go but you need to be prepared.  GET THERE With authorized guide ONLY! Don’t try to go on your own. Guide know the road go and back, you don’t and it is not easy.  TIME of THE VISIT They pick you up at 1AM from…
Grandmas: Nice hotel with a green interior. I like the green concept because is make me so refreshing. Very simple and clean hotel with a good price and closed to the beach. Recommended hotel for backpack traveler.
Radisson: i stayed here for 2nights, celebrating my wedding anniversarycheck in time was 2pm, i was there by 1.30 and Agung was helping us alot for checkin time, nice guy, help us to completed our need and demands from checkin and also introducing us all the hotel facility they have.all the staff here work very hard to  accommodate everyone request and need, they greet u with smilewas having problem with my aircond in the room, they dont take so long to come up to ur room and fix the prob with in 15min!!Good job guys!the bed was so comfortable!!dont feel like waking up early heheherelaxing and enjoyable stay here at Radisson blu uluwatu, nice breeze in the pool area, u can just sit back and relax in the pool with doing nothing! so great!oh, they have free transport to padang2 beach the…

Besakih: If you want to be tricked one more time thats a place for you. If you dont want to pay extra - aggressive 'guides' will make your visit memorable in a very unpleasant way. Also - I have no idea who's sending these little girls to sell postcards in the temple, but these kids look…
Sacred: Well worth a visit to get close to and observe loads of monkeys. Beautiful setting and walking distance from city centre.
Kuta: Had to visit the famous Kuta beach on a first visit to Bali. Unfortunately we really didn't enjoy it there, it's just wayyy too crowded and the hawkers will not leave you alone. They ruin it for the folks with their cool little bar set-ups. The beach itself is suprisingly clean,…
Mount: Batur is a dreamland volcano the best thing to do there is go in a restaurant and relax and hear it's history it erupted in 1995 and there is a black spot on it. it's really good you should visit it .and not only batur is good the lake is also very pretty and small  houses…
Grandmas: Walk in rate with breakfast about $46/ night AUD and the room was very clean and although room size is small was very inviting with good tv and plenty of channels. Breakfast was nice and bathroom had most amenities you need and also very clean. Location is close to everything. Staff I encountered were amazing. Bella Italia restaurant at the hotel does awesome pizzas and great food. Will definitely stay here again.
Radisson: Chose Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu hotel because of location (near beach and Uluwatu temple), new property, and price.  Super breakfast buffet.  Very friendly staff.  Appreciated free shuttle to beach and Uluwatu temple!  Fantastic pool with plenty of seating.  Very nice spa.  Reasonably priced food, beverages, and spa services.  Traffic (if you're headed to Seminyak/Kuta/Airport areas) can be painful...crowded and lengthy!  Entrance from main road is not well marked (property is next to Anantara hotel.

Besakih: Beautiful temple! You need to wear sarong to visit the temples. We reached at the time when there was a ceremony going on. We saw locals in beautiful sarongs carrying ceremony offerings in the baskets.
Sacred: We visited the Scared Monkey Forest Sanctuary and enjoyed every moment. The monkeys were very friendly and adorable. If you are in Ubud, this is a must-visit.
Kuta: Amazing beach but nusa Dua is better. Water is not very Clean but good waves for surfers. Good location and many restaurants opposite.
Mount: This was 2nd time to  kintamani and mount batur lake.i usually take hot seat at lake view restaurant and enjoy volcano and lake with sip of fresh fruit juice or milkshakes.this time due to cloudy weather tip of volcano cant be seen.
Grandmas: Nice hotel, good location and friendly staff. Very comfort stay. I like the breakfast. No pool but it's not necessary. Love the hotel very much. For sure I will be back. Thank you Grandmas for the EXCELLENT SERVICE...
Radisson: The highlight of our most recent Bali trip!   The staff were fantastic, the pool and grounds were beautiful. The gym had a lot to offer for a hotel gym and the room was impressive.   Sad to leave but my partner and I will certainly be back! Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Besakih: Besakih is a beautiful temple. The views are amazing and I loved it.  However, the people (locals) intimidating you are the worst experience i have had in Bali.  My driver had warned me and said not to be afraid of them, but it still made me very upset. I was surrounded by 8 men…
Sacred: Great fun visit seeing the monkeys up close in their own sanctuary within a dedicated forest. No safety issues, just be sensible and don’t touch them or annoy them: they are very relaxed around people and used to the tourists! The Park Guidelines are everywhere and the Monkeys…
Kuta: Kuta beach is a famous beach of Bali . Its famous for sunset view. Shopping area is also nearby. Very nice for unwinding with family and friends. Recommended . Must see , while in Bali.
Mount: Early morning hike and we were rewarded with spectacular sunrise view! We were very lucky to have a peek at the sunrise as that morning was pretty foggy/ misty.
Grandmas: Best part of the hotel is that its very close to the beach, walk for 5 minutes. Its clean and has wonderful staff, especially the PR girl who helped us plan the trip.  If you wish to stay in a clean, decent and affordable room, this could be a great choice.  There are no windows in my room though but had a class cover.
Radisson: The Radisson was a great location for the wedding we attended, which was in a Villa next door. The staff are very friendly and the service was excellent. Our guests that travelled with us for the wedding thoroughly enjoyed their stay. Strongly recommend a stay here.

Besakih: We visited Besakih Temple with an excitement, and was our mistake that we never check TripAdvisor before we went there. We traveled from Kuta with rental car for almost two and a half hour with very difficult and sharp turn climbing up the mountain. We brought our own sarong…
Sacred: Yes, there are tons of monkeys. And they're naughty and tourists are stupid all around you having things stolen, but there's a lot more to the Sacred Monkey Forest that makes it worth a visit besides cute monkeys. There are incredibly ornate ancient temples dating to the 14th…
Kuta: Worth watching all the locals at Sunset playing soccer on the beach and enjoying life, mixing with the tourists. A cold beer always helps as well
Mount: First of all let me say the hike up the mountain is difficult - you start at 4am and if you’re in Uluwatu or Pecatu area, you get picked up at 1am to make it the mountain in time. Our guide Wayan was arranged through Jegeg Tours. There are several stopping points throughout the…
Grandmas: Pros: Great Value - less than US$ 30 Location - Best In Legian Good Breakfast - Fresh cook to order, Indonesian and American Breakfast Comfortable Bed - 4 pillows Full bathroom amenities Best value spa on site Try - Bella Italia Restaurant for Pizza and Pasta Staff friendly and helpful  Cons room size / small - do not compare to Four Seasons :) No swimming pool  Absolutely...come back for next visit and will recommend to friend for Good value hotel with good location and staff in Legian
Radisson: We stayed at the Radisson Blu in Uluwatu for four nights. The hotel had an issue with the wifi on our first day, but it was resolved the next morning. Also, for those loyalty folks who collect points, you can’t collect points with them if you booked through a third party website. Maybe that’s a standard, but I didn’t know.   Overall, we had a pleasant stay ; the room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The highlight was definitely the complimentary breakfast. It was buffet style and there was a large selection of local and western style foods. If you order room service, the prices are quite expensive. It's unfortunate and I can see why hotels do this, because where this hotel is situated, there isn't much around that you can walk to.   They have a free shuttle that…

Besakih: Recently visited.Did not face much trouble .Guided service was there and it's mandatory for a trouble free temple visit.otherwise local people may disturb over again and again.but the local people didn't demand any donations.they said they have stopped taking it as people are…
Sacred: Definitely worth a visit - only cost around £4-5 per person. The monkeys can be vicious though so be careful of your personal belongings as they will try and steal them!
Kuta: Best place to Lear how to surf and amazing sunset views.  Few minuses tho, loads of locals who are trying to sell some stuff and a bit pricy comparing to Jimbaran beach . Also I would say second most busy beach after seminiyak
Mount: Although it is a very early start if you want to get there for it  well worth the trip. The accent was very rocky and lots of big step ups. We went with Ubud Sunrise Hiking  and they were just professional and friendly service. We walked around the crater then return down. We…
Grandmas: Clean standard room with everything you need. Location is superb with easy access to legian beach, massage place, shopping district and lots of eateries. Staff are helpful. One of the best hotel ala-carte breakfast.
Radisson: The hotel is remote but provides a wonderful stay. Off the beat and track, you will find relaxation and a warm and generous group of people always available to help with whatever you may need. Highly rec.

Besakih: One big tourist trap, first you have to pay entrance fee and if you don't have a sarong yourself they will sell it to you for way too much money. After that they try to push you into taking a guide, otherwise we were not even allowed to go further then to stairs at the entrance…
Sacred: Something that we have never experienced before, recommend it especially if you have kids they will love the experience
Kuta: Had to go down and see the beach after seeing lots of pictures from friends. Was a great atmosphere. was cloudy so did not get my sunset but still had a great time. Few drinks before dinner. Was relaxing even with the people trying to sell there items. I was very surprised as…
Mount: You should use your time to enjoy the beautiful landscape in mount batur, fresh air, nice nature, and amazing
Grandmas: Stay for the second time, the staff was friendly, the facilities are complete enough to find a minimalist, close to the beach of Kuta, Legian and nightlife at Legian street, room 533 was very quiet but the view was blocked by the building next to it. Thank you very much to ms. Luvi, for a surprise birthday pancakes at breakfast.
Radisson: The hotel is brand new and has the most amazing architecture and facilities. The pool is outstanding and the breakfast is one of the best I’ve ever had with homemade yogurts and great pastry. Would definitely recommend and stay again if I return to Uluwatu.The only thing that wasn’t so great is the location. It’s a little isolated and the ocean views only exist from the upper floors.

Besakih: 2 hours from airport, renting motorcycle in a travel tour. 5 local people stopped me in parking space, while I had not finished my parking properly. Each of them offering things to use around the temple, such as saroong, dupa, matches, flower. They mentioned the unreasonable…
Sacred: This is a lovely spot for a stroll around and watching the monkeys interact. It’s only somewhat spoilt by idiotic tourists who do not follow the rules and therefore put the monkeys at risk by giving them access to food they shouldn’t eat and biting into plastic bottles to drink…
Kuta: Too many people trying to sell you things, a massage. A  beach chair was $5 and a coconut $10 ! Other beaches are much better but it depends on what you are looking for...
Mount: A must sea when you are going to Bali. Vulcano where you can go for a sunrise trek. Go and see for yourself
Grandmas: Clean standard room in a unique small building hotel.. sitting area with a touch of green hanging plants surely makes you wanna stay longer The room is very clean and comfortable. The housekeeping staffs did the cleaning works best, The front officers are also friendly and helpful and the security always say greeting if met some people and always answering
Radisson: New Luxury Resort suitable for all ages. Friendly staff and great facilities. Deluxe rooms were very modern spacious. If traveling to Bali for the first or many times I would recommend. I shall return.

Besakih: Beautiful temple complex. Make sure you can walk and climb stairs. Cost the most to see as everything and to pay and you are not aware until after. Was asked for US20 for each person for guide fee! Ok the guide sort of knew his stuff but still steep. Buying the sarong is ok, you…
Sacred: Very beautiful place with lots of monkeys that are totally in their environment. Many posts say to buy bananas but DON’T. They have signs every where not to feed monkeys.  Monkeys are busy playing chasing and fighting amongst themselves that they don’t seem to care about all the…
Kuta: Kuta beach is hardly 1 km from kuta main market, this is a good beach but no ater sports available on the beach, sunset is very aswm.
Mount: Need to do it when low season, Mass tourism and 500 000 RP at least.Not very difficult to do.Choose a place to stay, and then get a local guide to go at night. During the day it is too hot.Take a jacket for the wind, do not overdress.Choose a long trek to enjoy the place.Maybe…
Grandmas: Hotel staff were very helpful, always good to have a chat to. The rooms were cleaned everyday, no pool in the Legian hotel which was a little disappointing also a small bar fridge would have been good. overall the place was good.
Radisson: Stayed for 5 nights through Luxury Escapes.  The resort itself is in a quiet area away from hustle and bustle.  For those that surf it is in easy reach of impossible beach.  Ten minutes walk to other restaurants including Drifters cafe which was amazing.  The two restaurants at the resort are good and not overly priced by australian standards.  Breakfast is also very good.  The pool was fabulous, with plenty of deck chairs and cabanas available throughout our stay.  Spa was really good and the girls lovely.  Rooms were large and cleaned daily with a very early turn down service.  Staff were all very friendly and pleasant.  Did take one shopping trip into kuta for half a day.  You must get local area taxi, which the hotel organised, Cost $20.00 on return we caught a blue bird…

Besakih: the temple is nice and showing interesting cultur but some annoying locals pushing tourists to pay for guidance. I will never come back !
Sacred: As the name says it - forest filled with monkeys. Mischievous ones. Make sure you don't bring bottle water else they'd be so curious and will get it from you. Always keep a safe distance.   It's nice to see that they are all well fed and look healthy.
Kuta: I would really LIKE TO LOVE Kuta Beach. Contrary to popular belief it is clean with beautiful white sand. There is a canopy of shady trees giving relief to those not swimming or sun bathing. There are numerous vendors providing seating while selling beer, soft drinks and ice…
Mount: We had booked our trek with Bali Sunrise Trekking and Tours and were picked up at 1.30 am. On reaching Batur we were provided with torches. The trek started by 4am and we reached the summit in 1.5 hours. To be honest the trek was far more difficult than i had imagined. We were…
Grandmas: Good location to walk around kuta. The staff was friendly. The room was tiny but clean and super comfy. Strategic place, its surrounded by good bars, cafes and also the clubs. Will come back again one day
Radisson: I would not recommend this hotel, didn’t like the grounds, could be anywhere in the world, nothing Bali unique about hotel. Spa very expensive compared to other hotels. Gym very poor space and very little equipment. Very obvious language barrier with staff and very slow service.

Besakih: 1. You need a sarong. Buy or rent. 2. You do not need to stop at the Tourist information booth located at the bottom of the hill on the right. Just keep walking up the hill. 3. You do not need to give a donation.  4. The locals will tell you that there is a ceremony taking place…
Sacred: I do try to stay away from overly touristy attractions and I have seen a lot of monkeys in the past however, we had friends in town who really wanted to go to the Sacred Monkey Forest so we headed over.  The entrance fee was $80K per person. The sanctuary is larger than I…
Kuta: Nice beach unless the bothering of the salespersons , rough water in case you are not a good swimmer it’s unsafe, should be a perfect swimmer , but really amazing view, sun, drinks, has it’s own mood!
Mount: A crazy morning - getting up at 2.00am with the goal Mount Batur for sunrise. We hired ubud sunrise hiking for the sunrise tour. We found they offer the most reasonable price exclusive tour. The guide was not only helpful, but timed the climb well. We were up on the mountain top…
Grandmas: It's one of those hotels that is very value for money. Nothing fancy, nothing pretentious. It's near the beach, has lots of food around (within a 10 minutes walk) they don't have a breakfast buffet table but they have 3 different types of breakfast to choose from, from Asian to international. Of course, the Asian dishes was the best. Plus, there's an awesome coffee place nearby called The Cofe Corner also near pizzaria just beside that building. Their staffs are friendly and really helpful. Did I mention they have really good spa services on down level. :)
Radisson: Absolutely loved my stay at the Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu. The suite was huge and comfortable. The gym was also fully equipped, and the pool was large and inviting. Appreciated the discount as a Radisson Rewards Gold member, as well as the welcome amenities provided. The staff were attentive to our needs, and very forthcoming when fulfilling our requests. An overall excellent stay!

Besakih: Definitely a must to be visited. And please avoid comments always complaining about money taken out from your pocket for guides and parking. This should not occurs the beauty and the majesty of the site. Pura Besakih actually is a complex of temples located on the slopes of…
Sacred: If you love monkeys, this is a must. They are absolutely everywhere and it becomes quite obvious that you are in their domain because you must follow their rules! The best bit, in my opinion, is the spring temple which has this beautiful stone bridge and lots of old trees. It…
Kuta: Kuta beach is very crowded all the time by local and foreigne visitors. In this beach you can find people from many countries, as well as from many provinces of Indonesia. In here you can enjoying surfing, swimming, and sun bath. There are many restaurants and bars close to the…
Mount: Such a gorgeous sunrise trek up to Mount Batur! I booked via Wa +6281337443553 with Bali Sunrise Trekking Tours in Ubud with a guide and a couple.  The trek easy but the I found on the way up some it extremely difficult and needed help form our guide, luckily I have experiences…
Grandmas: i stayed in this hotel for 4 nights for business. a Budget Hotel and good for single traveler or couple. strategic place but lil bit hard to find car park.  Their staff is very helpful and friendly  try to massage in this hotel but the therapy skill just so so.  near by lobby hotel, there is nice bar/cafe and they have a nice food. it good to hangout there ;)
Radisson: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and was great! Everything is beautiful, the staff very nice, the breakfast delicious. The only bad thing is that they don’t have an exit to the beach but the pool and area is very attractive and nice to be.

Besakih: I visited the place during Gulangan celebrations (second week of September). The visit started as normal buying the entrance ticket still on the road for about 30k in local currency. Before heading to the temple I was escorted to the information desk and explained about the…
Sacred: A relaxing way the spend the morning wandering through the tranquility of the forest. It’s AUD8 for adults and AUD5 for kids under 12.
Kuta: this beach is not the best one but definitely good one for surfing or if you want meet new people. All staff on the beach so friendly and we got many friends from another countries.
Mount: We booked this as a trekking/hiking experience.  Basically car picks you up at around 2:30am. Have a tea and a snack U get to location 1:30hrs later. They provide torches. Male sure to wear warm cloths and shoes. The hike starts at night One hour on asphalte and one hour rocky…
Grandmas: This is a great budget hotel, good value for money, very helpful staff, The rooms are small but well appointed, great beds and big soft pillows, this is an exception to other cheap hotels,  good aircon, the onsuite bathroom is small but adequate. The bathroom could do with a good clean, a bit grubby in the shower stall. It is not a resort hotel no balcony or pool but for somewhere to sleep comfortably great value. Well located to shops, food and entertainment, just a short walk to the beach. We have stayed twice now and will stay again. We visit for business and it suits us well.
Radisson: My week in Paradise at the Radisson Blu Resort - What did I love:-  the pool, the gardens, those beautiful frangipani's, the amazing food (you must have the chicken breast and the chocolate chocolate at Filini's), the cocktails, the Spa (so relaxing) and our room was huge with the biggest softest bed.  And the staff - it is the staff that can really make or break a holiday and the staff at the Radisson Blu Bali Uluwatu are all beautiful, friendly, helpful, and very professional - nothing is ever any trouble We will definitely be back xx

Besakih: This temple is very beautiful and will show the beauty of culture and religion. It was a nice experience! Don't mind the people selling stuff after you will leave the temple, that is everywhere the same story. Nice day out in Bali!
Sacred: Esay to get to and a fair entry fee. Lots of monkeys who given the chance will pinch your belongings!  It is nice to see that the monkeys are well fed and cared for and even those with handicaps - one blind and one missing limbs are segregated off to keep them cared for
Kuta: It's the most famous beach in Bali. You will find a lot of restaurants and bars in the area. A good place to go relax and chill.
Mount: Hiking Mount Batur at sunrise, is a very advisable thing to do while in Bali however I would not say is a MUST.  The hiking starts at 4AM, and we found out that we were not alone. Hundreds of torch lights can be seen accross the  hiking track. During the hiking we would be…
Grandmas: i've been in Grandmas legian for 2 weeks,some room was perfect,some a bit disturbed by the noise of the construction site next to.good prices for a very good location,the breakfast menu is very nice!!!
Radisson: I know, you booked a luxury escapes tour cause it seems like a really good deal and then wonder what it's really gonna be like ? Well we are halfway into our holiday of 7 days and I feel obliged to let you know what we think. We have been to Bali a lot and chose this place because we are a little over kuta legian and seminyak. The Radisson blue is new and absolutely gorgeous the design is amazing,whoever designed it well done! Rooms are Huge and well appointed. It's big but has a small luxurious vibe which makes you feel special. The staff are great, not in your face , the food is good (2 restaurants )the spa is the best I have ever seen and do great massages,the pool is like a oasis with palm trees growing out of it. The area around the hotel has lots of little beaches ,(gotta…

Besakih: It was the first temple we visited during our trip to Bali & I had high expectations given that it was the mother of all temples in Bali but it was kind of a let down. I guess it was the whole experience that was disappointing. Upon getting down from the car in the parking…
Sacred: A great morning for all the family up close to the monkeys.  If you respect there space a really enjoyable morning.
Kuta: My husband and I went for a quick walk after eating towards the beach and came just as the sun was setting. Yes there's a lot of people at the beach. But the mesmerising sight silences all of the sounds around. The best sun set at a beach I have seen out of the 20+ countries…
Mount: A trip to Bali is incomplete until one visits Mount Batur, Kintamani.  Like the dramatically cinematic cliffside vistas along the rugged southern and western coasts of the Kuta Selatan peninsula, the panoramic views from the rim of the volcanic crater are stunning &…
Grandmas: I didn't expect the hotel to be so nice after staying 5 nights in local bungalows and not so nice hotels in Bali. But Grandmas Hotels blew me away. The location was good with a beautifully designed hotel. It's clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The spa is very professional and cost efficient for its quality of service and spa.   The room was chic and very comfy. Tv was included with a program and many English channels!! Safety deposit box was an added bonus!!   I would HIGHLY recommend staying here!! (But it is a little further from the party scene if that's what you're in Kuta for)
Radisson: What a great hotel ! Everything from the terrific helpful staff, the food in the two lovely restaurants, Filini and Artichoke, and cocktails and massages almost every day. The room we had was on the 2nd Floor, had a lovely view across the sea, was large with comfortable bed and clean and well lit bathroom. It was serviced every day, and we loved the space. The location at Uluwatu is near the beach serviced by a shuttle from the hotel, not far from the Temple, which is a great experience and down the road from many small restaurants and cafes if you feel like a walk.  It was my 70 birthday, and the Radisson surprised me with a cake and song, and made the day very special.  This hotel is every bit a 5 star experience.  Thank you to Bjorn, Lee, Nando, and Arya who made our stay a…

Besakih: This is probably the most beautiful temple among the temples in Bali as it is located at the foot of Mt. Batur and is the largest. Visited early morning with our private driver but we have already been warned that in Besakih, one must rent a sarong unlike in other temples where…
Sacred: The forest was cool and the monkeys were funny and cute. We walked around and saw many monkeys. It was a crowded with visitors but it was nice
Kuta: The beach isn’t called Kuta Beach, but it’s in Kuta, Bali. There are quite a few fishing boats on the beach which makes a great spot for pics. We arrived the night before Nyepi, which is a Balinese Holiday. We highly recommend visiting during the festival. Nyepi is a holiday in…
Mount: At least you need to be fit to go up there. Even if you are not that fit, make sure you are able to control your balance and endure some of rocky, stiff, slippery surface and some big steps. A good trekking footwear and a good torch, best would be the one that can be attached to…
Grandmas: The street noise can be annoying and perhaps the addition of a small fridge in the room Personal so nice and looking to help, everything good. The price is amazing for the location. ..close to shops and great restaurants
Radisson: A very pleasant ambience. Pool area was very inviting and staff very obliging. Being away from the crowds has its benefits and disadvantage. The rooms were spacious. Would have preferred better access the Impossible Beach.

Besakih: Unfortunately we haven´t read all the reviews before trying to visit this temple. It´s just ridiculous and humiliating. You pay the entrance fee. You have to buy or bring your own sarong (nothing bad about this). And after all of that you are asked to pay for a guide or a local…
Sacred: Before entering the forest sanctuary, make sure you pay close attention to any orientation provided by the staff as well as various signs presented. You wouldn't want monkeys to harass you right? Always be mindful of your surroundings as the primates would be appear everywhere…
Kuta: Can be pretty crowded but has an amazing vibe! I usually take my beginners students to this spot as the waves are perfect to learn basic skills. Conditions can also be pretty good for any level!
Mount: You get a breathtaking view of Mount Batur and the Batur lake. Must visit. Its so scenic. We could also see smoke bellowing out of Mount Agung that had recently erupted.
Grandmas: I stayed here with some friends and it was a really good hotel rooms so modern and so clean much better from other places at the same price in Bali. The restaurant out is also good could be kind of expensive but worth. Laundry prices are expensive but if you need it you could have it done just on the opposite side of the hotel.
Radisson: Booked this accommodation via Luxury Escapes.  Hotel exceeded our expectations.   Pros Quiet location Close to surf spots Modern clean rooms Conscientious staff  Amazing breakfasts Large sparkling pool with plenty of room for relaxing Lunch and dinner menu options impressive Architecturally inspiring  Cons Only one and this relates to check in. We spent 2 hours in the lobby waiting for our room. Was initially assigned a room and advised it was being cleaned due to late check out.  After an hour, I enquired again only to be told our assigned room had an issue with air conditioner. Therefore another room assigned, but another wait.  Finally escorted to newly assigned room only to discover it did not have views of Indian Ocean (first world problem, I know ... but something I had…

Besakih: The temple is beautiful, can't deny this. But the behavior of the locals around the temple and how much they will bother you for money is unimaginable. After paying the initial ticket (in the street on the way to the temple) you should ignore all people who try to sell you…
Sacred: Well taken care of monkeys that are just hanging out in their habitat for our viewing...they are everywhere, not aggressive, and living their best lives! Do not miss this in Ubud!
Kuta: One of the best beaches I have ever been on, it gets a bit busy as the sun goes down but it’s not a priblem
Mount: It was semi difficult trekking. Need to make sure you have a good torch- best would be the one that can be attached to the head so hands can be free. Also ensure you have right shoes- there are many stones on the sand so it’s very easy to slip especially when you are trekking up…
Grandmas: Been in bali 2 days and been there both days.  First for  hair cream treatment and today a massage for my husband and me.  Professional.  Great ambience.  Amazing staff. We will def be back for a few more massages before we leave!
Radisson: Excellent hotel beautiful rooms very clean friendly staff only had one issue with check in, it took nearly 40min Most guest I assume travel hours with taxis, planes etc, personally I spent 10hrs in travel time 40min to sit in a lobby is abit much, maybe a comp drink at the bar while they sort there crap out would have been niceOverall very nice hotel

Besakih: As many others have said, it's beautiful but at the parking lot you are again checked for your tickets and then bullied if you don't take a guide. We managed to have our driver take us the way up and to get us a very nice young guide for 50k which was fine to us and he also knew…
Sacred: You had me at monkey!  This was my favorite thing we did in Bali! The monkey’s were a laugh riot to watch. For the most part they could careless that you’re there. So you can get right next to them for amazing pix.  They’d go flying past you chasing each other. One monkey…
Kuta: One of the most clean beach in Bali. Relax there looking at sky and clean water. If one like board surfing, its fun to do in high tide.
Mount: Engage Wayan at +6281246382362 for my sunrise trek to Batur a week ago, it was mazing trip we did. Since reservation through WhatsApp till the end of trip was happy.   The sun rise very beautiful and also the guide Wayan very nice guy. There are a lot of people offered service…
Grandmas: Grandmas legian hotel I came across when looking for a good value hotel . I heard the location was superb and people were professional and super friendly . After having tried all 3 hotels I couldn't agree more . The hotel is very service minded . Very friendly personnel and great value for money . Location is within walking distance from everywhere . Other grandmas property's are also amazingly situated and great value for money . Recommended for people who like to relax and experience truly Indonesian hospitality
Radisson: The resort was beautiful, the staff were excellent and the food in the restaurant was excellent. Highly recommend. The food and drinks are reasonably priced and excellent quality. The rooms are large and spacious and clean

Besakih: The temple itself is a nice place... BUT... First you have to pay an entrance fee of IDR 15000 and a parking fee of IDR 15000. Then they tell you, you need a sarong. When you want to enter the area, they tell you, you are not allowed to, you need a local guide, who charges…
Sacred: My friend wanted to take a photo with the monkeys here in the Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary.. As we arrived at this place, they're like 4-6 couples taking their Pre-Nup shoot here wearing their traditional Balinese Wedding Attire. At first first I was a bit scared as this…
Kuta: For surf and sunset is great place, but be aware beach is not clean is smelly and dirty lots of plastic (but this is everywhere in Indonesia) You can find better beaches in Bali.
Mount: Ok, before I go any further, let me just place this disclaimer: It was relatively easy in my opinion. A regular person in good health with an average physical fitness would be more than capable of attempting this climb.   Now, down to the review. Yes, you have to wake up at 2am,…
Grandmas: The location is good just a bit noisy during the midnight even though my room was in the 5th floor. The room was small but is clean and very suitable for solo travellers. I like their breakfast, especially the set of egg Benedict. The only problem is the construction works in the next door that probably will disturb you after 9am onwards. But overall is still worth of money if you are looking for budget hotel.
Radisson: Unfortunately this place has been a  bit of let down. There are So many other more cost effective places to stay with better views in the area. we expected much better from the Raddison brand. Apart from a huge miscommunication with our room booking, we where asked to change rooms at 10.30pm at night and wake our entire family up in the middle of the night, the service was below parr.  The breakfast staff are very friendly but forgetful, and the MOD needs to learn customer service 101. I’ve worked in the hospitality industry and hotel chains such as the marriott, the staff need more training, especially with handling complaints. The experience could have easily been a 9/10, but missed the mark unfortunately. It’s still a new hotel so please try harder and as the staff to LISTEN…

Besakih: It was an unforgetable visit to Besakih Temple. 55 temples all together. As we were told this was the oldest, largest and most holy temple in Bali. Highly recommended to have a guide even if it cost 100.000 IDR per person. They give you the hole story and take all time you need.
Sacred: Excellent spot where literally hundreds of very tame monkeys are running around playing with eachother. Unlike other places in Bali where the monkeys are highly aggressive, here they regularly feed the monkeys which makes them very tame a friendly.The temple itself is a fun walk…
Kuta: I avoid kuta and legian like the plague. It's the unclassiest place on Earth. Just avoid it. We came to go to waterbom and left immediately after.
Mount: Truly enjoyed the trekking to the top of batur and back down. Watching the sunrise was beautiful. Might have tiring along the way but it was really worth the view.
Grandmas: If you looking for a budget hotel in heart of Legian, I’d recommend to stay at Grandmas Hotel Legian. The location is strategic and near the Beach. Although the room is compact, it’s a full range bathroom amenities and cozy. The good thing is  bed very comfortable and set up with 4 pillows. Our room is including breakfast, a mixed Indonesian and continental set menu and cook to order foods. I have experienced the spa treatment, Balinese Traditional Massage, a great treatment and professional therapist at De Nyuh Spa, located at hotel’s basement.  The price is not expensive, service is great and the food is simply and tasty. With no hesitation to come back and recommend GrandMas Hotel Legian to all guests.
Radisson: Terrific hotel. Beautiful rooms with great views. Plenty of spots to chill by the pool or large balcony to room to relax on. Possible to walk to nearby restaurants and beaches or a short car ride.Staff all very friendly and spoke English well. Option of two restaurants at resort and both were delicious.

Besakih: I wish I have read all the reviews before visiting the temple. I went there with my husband and we had a horrible experience, we were charged for our sarongs (which is fine although all other temples don't do that), a very arrogant "temple keeper" asked us for our tickets and…
Sacred: Happy to see the positive changes made to this little piece of paradise. The monkeys are being treated with respect (I'd previously witnessed staff encouraging tourists to feed the monkeys with one tourist giving a monkey Coke). Now the monkeys are being kept safe from harmful…
Kuta: Quick trip onto the beach today. A Bintang in the heat was appreciated. Look for Tony Tattoo in front of the Mecure hotel for Henna. Very talented.
Mount: We used "getyourguide in Bali"  book our tour. Everything was seamless from start to finish. The pick up was on time by Putu who can be contacted on +6281239664605. We were then dropped off at a pick up point below the mountain and guided to the top by Widi, a 20 yr old local…
Grandmas: The room not too big but nice and clean according with the price. They serve simple b'fast but expensive price for additional b'fast. The location not to far with shopping centre and can reach by feet. I just stay for 1 nite but enjoy to stay.
Radisson: Whilst the hotel is new and has nice amenities, the staff and procedures were lacking. Most staff seemed confused which resulted in many many phonecalls and door knocks during our stay. The hotel generally lacked ambience/vibe.

Besakih: The temple site itself is beautiful and rich in history.  I'm not one to normally gripe about hustlers in locations where earning your daily bread is a struggle...but I see this feedback as a way for these people to ensure long-term tourism not only for their site, but for…
Sacred: I loved monkey forest and actually ended up going twice. If you visit please remember they animals are wild and unpredictable. They will steal any loose items (hats glasses etc) and one tried to opened the zip on my handbag so be aware that they are sneaky <U+0001F609><U+0001F602>
Kuta: Great place to watch sunset. Our hotel in Nusa Dua was on opposite side, only for sunrise. So we went to Kuta to watch the sunset and we enjoyed the location/
Mount: There are many sunrise hikes available from Ubud to Kintamani and a roadside booth has been set up to relieve you of some rupiah for the privilege of entering the region. I visited Mt Batur with a driver as part of a longer day. The views of the active volcanoes of Batur and…
Grandmas: Either my purposes visiting Bali for pleasure or business... I can't find any budget hotel with better location than this Hotel...  Friendly staffs and crews made my visit always memorable...  FUNtastic job guys...keep the great phase...
Radisson: Really enjoying our stay here. It ticked all of the boxes in that it was very close to surf breaks (Impossibles is just a 2min walk away), wasn't crazy prices but was a 4/5 star experience for our young family. Would recommend to others.  Tips:  1. pre organise transport as it is a ways from other cafes. Drifter cafe at the end of the road is a great option very close by.  2. Walk to Anatara resort next door for a sunset drink by their pool (epic views).

Besakih: We arrived and played the 30.000 RP to enter the temple area. Already when you show your ticket the person starts to tell you about a certain line you cannot cross without having a guide, we politely declined and started walking. Then a young guy came and proposed us a scooter…
Sacred: Must visit spot in Ubud - cool to see the monkeys up close and also a big enough park with interesting architecture.
Kuta: Surf haven in Bali. I enjoyed strolling several kilometers of fine sand. It was simply spectacular. Grab a chair, order an ice cold beverage of your choice and relax the day away under the shade of trees. Swim. Stroll. Chill. Relax. Sigh. Swim. Stroll. Chill. Relax. Sigh. Repeat…
Mount: Nice place for trekking..but local not allow trekking without a local guide...if u include mount batur in trip..go early as possible...sunrise view from here is nice
Grandmas: I really liked this hotel, the rooms are clean, comfortable, nice food, string wifi, and friendly waitress, easy to check in and out, the strategic location of Kuta beach. if there is a pool would have been more enjoyable. Maybe i will back to this hotel. Recommended.
Radisson: Short 5 night stay was arranged via Luxury Escapes as a birthday present. Loved the resort and the staff. A bit far from action really, but great for a relaxing break. Comfortable beds, modern rooms, beautiful breezes.

Besakih: We were charged an initial entry fee and then hassled by numerous sellers trying to sell us sarongs. These are actually free to borrow.  We were then bombarded by a group of loud arrogant men trying to charge us 200 Rupiah per person for a temple guide they said we had to have!…
Sacred: It’s nice to walk among the monkeys and watch them tease each other from time to time. Follow the officers instructions and warnings carefully because monkeys, by their very nature, can steal what have in your hand and what’s in your bag very quickly
Kuta: Fab beach to chill with beer under trees with sellers. Also to sunbath and watch surfers riding the big waves Plenty of shade if wanted
Mount: We have followed some instructions from french baliblog to plan this small treck. We've been riped off ! We've paid 700,000 Rp each for a 1 hour transfer Ubud - Batur + guide. The guide was speechless et not friendly. This is a hike you can do on your own easily but the local…
Grandmas: Room was very clean and comfortable, free basket of fruit on 2nd day and great wifi. Staff were very friendly and the hotel was beautiful overall. Room is on the small side so if your a little claustrophobic then this might not suit you.. Upgrades available. Place would benefit hugely of it had a pool!!
Radisson: We recently spent 5 nights here. Great meals, drinks and spa package. The hotel and grounds were perfect and the food was excellent. The staff were very attentive and friendly - they were the high point of our stay. This is a great place for a mid-winter break.  The only negative is the location - it is not particularly easy to access other areas of Bali, but if you are looking for a rest and not much sight seeing it is perfect.

Besakih: My prereviewers are unfortunately correct. The locals exploit the mother temple to the point of absolut annoyance. When you arrive at the parking lot people accost you to take a guide. Personally I think it is sensible to have a guide for Besakih. However they demand crazy fees…
Sacred: Was definitely worth a stop.  The monkeys were entertaining and the Flora was old Growth Banyan trees.
Kuta: Kuta beach, who doesn't know this one beach, well know people, this is Kuta beach which is famous for its beautiful sunsets, because its location is really easy to visit without having to do a tracking this beach is never quiet, from local tourists to foreign tourists cornucopia…
Mount: This was a highlight of our trip to Bali. We were collected at 1.30am from our hotel. We opted for a private tour so had our own guide for the walk, which cost $70 USD each. This seemed to be fairly standard pricing from what we could gather. The walk itself was in complete…
Grandmas: Fantabulous staff, clean rooms, great location!  Only issue was the choking of the bathroom sewage, but the Housekeeping staff came by to rectify it immediately. Thank you! Would be great if hair dryers could be provided as well!   Other than that, lots of love to the staff at the reception for recommendations on where to change money (rates were really good!), buy a SIM card (much cheaper than at the airport!) and dining options.  Breakfast was great too, and of great value! Thank you for the awesome stay! Send my love to Adyu and the gentleman who checked me in too!
Radisson: Staying in this resort is quite an experience. This is a perfect resort for staycation. I can just stay in the resort and having a pleasant and relaxing holiday without going anywhere because of their excellent amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who are looking for relaxation.   Room is very spacious, even their basic room is very large. With bathtub and organic soap & shampoos. I also like that each room has their own verandah/balcony. It's really relaxing to just read book after a pool time in my own private space. And the pool is marvelous and expansive! I think it's about 1000 square meters or something. Plenty of space to relax in the sunlounge or cabana.  This resort is really beautifully design, sort of a mix of contemporary style but feel warm…

Besakih: Yes! It is a beautiful temple in a very beautiful place. But they just grab money from you. Cheap! Really cheap. We are hindus from India. We know A to Z about hinduism compared to the people here. We know how to follow and what to do when you go to a temple. We don't need any…
Sacred: Monkey forrest is a beautiful place where you can wander for hours. The paths are pretty well kept. Please don't bring drinking bottles because the monkey' s WILL get them from you.
