Kuta: We had a great day just relaxing here after 2 weeks of travel! Waves are awesome at surfing , even though I sucked at it I stopped.enjoyed it. Be sure to ask around for prices . Lovely to lay back and drink cold beers after and chat to some locals , although the sales people can…
Mount: My husband and myself went on this trek. It was wonderfully organised. We were picked up from our hotel right on 2:30 like we were told. Drove for an hour in a nice car with pillows. Once we arrived we were greeted by our guide who took us for our trip. My husband didn’t find…
Grandmas: my room are very clean and cozy place for take some rest.. nice place and comfort for me and my partners. that would be interesting moment when we can play at pool but the hotel didnot have it.. i will back as soon as possible..
Radisson: This is a new hotel which is really beautifully designed. It was fantastic value for money and we think this was due to it being relatively new as it was probably only at 1/4 to 1/2 capacity. I would love to see what it’s like fully booked as it would improve the atmosphere somewhat around the pool and perhaps adding some music however I LOVED our stay here. The pool bar was fairly busy at happy hour and we went for dinner at filinis which was lovely- recommend the seafood linguine. We saw people doing the complimentary yoga at 4pm which looked great and a friend used the gym which was well equipped. The spa never seemed to be open so I can’t comment on that.

Besakih: What a shame. What could be a lovely experience has been ruined by money grabbing 'guides'.  Our driver told us that in no way should we accept a guide, we paid the initial small entrance fee and were accosted at various points by scammers telling us we couldn't enter without a…
Sacred: Well laid out and if you follow the path the visit should last about 1 hour. The monkeys here look very fit and seem very content in their environment. We recently visited Gibraltar and the macaques there are much more aggressive and aware of people whereas the monkeys here are…
Kuta: Nice beach for a stroll. Long beach with nice sand. Surfers abound so that’s something to watch. Lots of drink vendors about if you need a seat. I enjoyed the bbq corn from the vendor just outside the beach, along the main road. Not rating the beach higher as I didn’t manage to…
Mount: This hike was a lot easier than I had expected. Going up with my friends took us a few hours but really it was nothing too physically challenging. Reaching the top at sunrise might put a bit of pressure in terms of timing and waking up early but the view is just incredible. Be…
Grandmas: Great value for money, good location, very good breakfast, room size not big but big enough for the 3 nights i stayed, bed nice and comfy, only thing lacking in room is there is no fridge, staff friendly and obliging, location good!
Radisson: We stayed at the RadissonBlu in August with our three children. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. The location was peaceful and marvellous if you want get away from the busy crowds. The restaurant food was well prepared and had a good variety. Our room had breath taking views over the ocean and waking up to the sound of waves was fantastic. Overall we loved our stay and returned home feeling extremely relaxed.

Besakih: After seeing the comments on trip advisor and going there , they are indeed real thieves , after buying our tickets at 15000 IDR per person (entrance fee) , we went and bought sarun there (we could bargain for prices between 50000 and 100000 to buy and 15000 for rent) , than…
Sacred: I am not a big fan of monkeys because you never know what to expect from them. They are cute and everything but as you are walking be mindful and make sure to have all your belongings near you otherwise you might lose your sun glasses/phone/snacks/bag. :)
Kuta: This very long beach stretches over quite a few miles , all the way to Legian and Seminyak , and maybe further...  But it's just a beach...!
Mount: I booked this hike on a whim at the suggestion of my traveling companion. It ended up being the most tiresome yet rewarding part of our trip. As someone who neither hikes nor exercises on a regular basis, the trek was strenuous. The path has multiple narrow, steep points with…
Grandmas: The strategic location, close to Kuta beach, many of which sell food and shopping as souvenirs. from the side of the hotel, the rooms were nice, the facilities were very satisfactory, there is a wifi connection quickly, so one with a restaurant and spa massages.
Radisson: Highly recommended pick this hotel as your choice of stay in Uluwatu.   Hotel design is beautiful, extremely clean and service is  fantastic. The bed is also super comfy that made vacation feels perfect!

Besakih: The temple is very beautiful and peaceful with a great view on the top. We did a hindu prayer and after the prayer they put holy water and some rice on our forehead for the blessings
Sacred: The park is clean, the monkeys cheeky and at times slightly aggressive but no fear- there are guides here and there to make sure people and animals remain cool  RESPECT the guidelines! to many tourists ignoring bottles hanging from bags Things in trouser pockets Dont have…
Kuta: Very dirty beach it was are first time to Bali so disappointed rubbish everywhere will never visit Bali again. We where so looking forward to seeing Bali we loved Thailand so much excepted Bali to be more beautiful and alot more expensive
Mount: Mount of Batur is one of a destination in Kintamani Bali. The mount is not too high, but in the top you can see beautiful view. You can see mount Agung and mount Abang. And of course lake of Batur. Beautiful place.
Grandmas: We staid at the hotel with our Habitat for Humanity group recently before we headed up to Lovina to complete our build.  When I'm traveling, I typically chose higher end hotels to stay at, but this one was chosen by Habitat.  I was a little worried when I booked a couple of extra nights, and the room was only $25 a night, but once we arrived at the hotel, I was really impressed with what you got for that money.  The hotel is right on the main street connecting Legian, Kuta, and the other towns in the area.  There are more shopping and dining options then you can count right out your front door.  The beach is also just about a 5-10 minute walk away.  We opted for the room rate that included breakfast, and I thought the food was fantastic.  The rooms are basic and small, but they…
Radisson: We holiday’d at the resort in July escaping the Melbourne’s winter on a 10 night Luxury Escape Package!  We arrived in very late due to delays at the airport and the hotel was waiting for us to arrive with a refreshing welcome drink. Our first impressions of the resort were amazing, our room was big and had a fantastic ocean view. The breakfast buffet was exceptional, the variety and spread of culinary choices was great...it made our mornings get off to a good start! We also dined in both the on-site restaurants Artichoke and Filinni, the food was exceptional and I’m still dreaming about their Cannoli’s... Resort staff were very friendly and accommodating, they made sure that our room was always clean, stocked daily with beautiful spa toiletries, water and coffee pods for our…

Besakih: Hidden way a far nearly 2-3hours drive from the busy city of Kuta, there is Besakih Temple, which is known as the largest temple in Bali.   The place is cooling as it is high above average ground. If you will need a place to calm yourself with a peace of mind. You could come…
Sacred: I'm traveler like to explore surrounding instead of shopping. How can we escape this.  The main point I want to share is not because there are a lot of Monkeys. Well, Malaysia had it too. But this place is full of art and well maintenance.   You might have to go in early morning…
Kuta: The beach was clean and safe. It's a long beach that stretches for several kilometers. You can rent sun loungers and surfing equipment at the beach. There are several options for surf classes at the beach.
Mount: I did this by booking with a tourist desk in Ubud (not sure which provider) it was cheap. I was picked up late, 3am, but had been waiting since 2am as this was the pick up time I was told. Be aware that Indonesian time is very relaxed!  We were driver for about an hour to the…
Grandmas: Stayed 5 nights, most comfortable bed and pillows we've ever had while travelling.  Room small but clean and more than adequate. Breakfast was included. several options, tried them all between the 2 of us, all were of a high standard. All staff were very friendly & polite. Convenient location 5 min walk to beach & lots of dinner options close by. Overall nothing negative to say, would recommend and would return.
Radisson: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 2 nights for the start of our honeymoon. The room was spacious and clean.  A variety of amenities were included in the room. There was also a balcony that we could go out to which had a view of the ocean and the pool. Breakfast was included and had a large variety of foods. The special juices were an added bonus. Staff at the hotel was friendly and polite. We tried the spa and it was very relaxing! Just wished it wasn’t so cold in the spa room. Would definitely come back! Thanks so much to the staff at this resort!

Besakih: I am really delighted that my friend and I made the trip to Besakih Temple. The energetics are amazing indeed and the views are spectacular. Warning though Mt Agung is usually covered by clouds so not totally visible. But you can tune into the energies there. Besakih is known as…
Sacred: It is a great stop on the way to Ubud.our driver recommend us to visit this place.The monkeys are cute and it is a great opportunity to get up close and watch them monkey around with large Forest,well maintend.They are friendly and calm if you are calm,dont bring the food
Kuta: It’s not a bad beach but you get more locals trying to sell you surf lessons, souvenirs, or beach chairs more than most other locations.  It’s cheaper for some of these services than the ones close by like a double Six. However, seems there are more sketchy people too. I said…
Mount: We did this trek on our 20th wedding anniversary and it was absolutely epic! Our driver from our Villa in Candidesa picked us up at 2am, waited for us while we did the trek and then dropped us at our next hotel in Ubud, stopping at the Tegallalang rice terraces on the way..…
Grandmas: I have stay at Grandmas hotel legian or a night to to explore Legian's night live, for the price at US$ 33 for 2 person with breakfast is a great deal, room is compact and had everything, pillow is comfort and clean. Location is the the heart of Legian and within stone through to bars, restaurants and shops, check in process very efficient and need a IDR 50K for key deposit, and A'la carte breakfast is awesome choice, I have tried egg benedict and croissant is too die for, is not a massive breakfast menu but simply, yet classy for it's league. Grandmas is simply great choice, NO DOUBT and won't regret,
Radisson: The pool and room were beautiful. Free shuttle to beach and local temple are very easy to use. Spa is nice and the resort felt safe. It’s set back from the main road so it’s a little more difficult to eat meals off resort unless you are okay with a short walk.

Besakih: It's not so much that the temple that is a put off its the people that operate the business. Some tips: You don't need a guide! The local guides threaten you if you don't avail their services. Just walk past them no matter what they say or how close they get to you. Most of them…
Sacred: Enjoyed a morning wondering around the forest area. Watching monkeys roaming around the compound. Morning was relatively quiet but got busier as tours stopped by. Nice opportunities for photos as many statues dotted around and temple inside, even a temporary cemetery within.…
Kuta: I am a returning patient who has been trying to get in touch with the hospital to make another appointment. For three weeks l have made repeated attempts to make an appointment to see Dr Roy and no one has contacted me back (thanks for nothing Kate). This includes numerous…
Mount: The sunrise is enchanting to watch .. surely a must do if you are in bali..   It will be a bit crowded in the top.. something you will have to live with but still far worth it is what I would say  ..
Grandmas: I stayed at grandmas for 2 nights and loved it! The room was simple but had everything we really needed and was very clean. The wifi worked very well, and the staff was the friendliest I have encountered in my month in Bali. Breakfast comes with some rooms but didn't with ours but it was only 50,000 rupia for a full meal including tea or coffee and juice so we are their both mornings. The location is great as well lots of shops and restaurants not too far away.
Radisson: Fabulous restaurants, great massages, terrific pool area, warm and friendly staff, great views, best bath towels, a treat of a coffee machine in room, with a surprisingly relaxing feel for a Resort-style hotel.

Besakih: Amazing temple, lots of steps to climb but so worth it, Amazing view when you reach the top 1000 feet above sea level.
Sacred: We had a good time here, a great way of spending an hour or two in Ubud and a must see if visiting.   The monkeys themselves were fascinating to watch and don’t pay too much attention to you as long as you don’t have any food or try to touch them. The younger ones tend to be a…
Kuta: Scenery : Nice  Location : Nice   Still remember that the day after hiking Mt. Batur is free and easy day.   We have shopping time at near by kuta beach to buy some souvenir for friend and family.   Kuta beach is a long beach. Along the beach, there are local to serve the local…
Mount: Mt Batur, the active volcano is a treat to the eyes. As you reach higher altitudes, the temperature begins to dip and suddenly having experienced the scorching heat beachside, the nippy weather is a welcome change. Adventure seekers can trek into the night which is usually…
Grandmas: Best Budget Hotel, Excellent Service Budget Hotel, Minimalist Room but Cozy Place for relax and living, All Staff are welcome and friendly, for location our can walk to the beach, shopping, try seafood or a local food..recomended for living arround kuta area.
Radisson: Super friendly and welcoming with our two small children. Very clean as you would expect from a new hotel with none of the problems other reviews had claimed. Assuming the hotel has  rectified these and provided our family with a fabulous experience.

Besakih: Great temple. Have been there several times since 1989, however this year left a totally bad taste in the mouth.     1.We bought the entrance ticket at the counter we were warned by the police not to accept flowers offered at the temple         which came as a surprise.  2. At…
Sacred: Nice grounds with over 300+ monkeys living amongst the temples.  Fun to watch them and worth checking out.
Kuta: Famous beach in bali. Super crowded at sunset time. Hotels all around beach.expensive to buy drink or food near beach need to walk more far away if want cheaper.
Mount: I like natur and mountains (and I don’t like heeps of tourists). I was 4 months in NZ and hiked a lot. People told me that there will be many people on Mount Batur for sunrise but nobody told me that there’s a line of people from the bottom to the top. It was a bit annoying that…
Grandmas: Best budget hotel. Good location in the heart of legian, surround with many shop, 24hours convenient store, cafe n restaurant. Very easy to find public transportation too. All staff n receptionist are welcome n friendly.
Radisson: Firstly with the positives, the hotel grounds are beautiful and when you first pull up you do feel like you’re staying at a very special hotel. The rooms are also great, they are very spacious and are regularly cleaned.   My issue with the hotel and why I don’t feel like we received value for our money is the service of some of the staff. The hotel isn’t cheap, and when paying the kind of money the hotel charges I would expect a certain level of service & I don’t think we got that. We previously stayed in Ubud at a similar costing hotel where they literally done everything & anything for us. I didn’t get this impression at Radisson Blu. When in the room the only option to contact someone is through their “one touch service”, and it wasn’t very helpful at all. The first dealing…

Besakih: We went there in the evening when there were very few other tourists and many locals. The temple itself is quite impressive and worth the trip, but: - make sure to buy a sarong beforehand as prices are high on the spot - at the parking exit there are some locals that try to make…
Sacred: Great experience for all ages. Lots of family monkey groups. Beware of your bags and water bottles. Water bottles won’t last more than 10 mins.
Kuta: It is a beautiful Beach but Police presence was not there at all and a lot of people playing cards using vulgar language and smoking everywhere which made us feel very uncomfortable. Didnt go there a second time. Legian Beach was much better.
Mount: this adventure is really great, we had to wake up around 12:30 AM so they will pick us up at 1 am, then we had to drive for like two hours, then we took a breakfast, and then start climbing for 2 or 3 hours, till we arrive to the top of the volcano
Grandmas: Smart and cozy place for living. Minimalist room concept but comfortable. The hotel location is in legian street, there are a lot of restaurant, market, cafe, etc around the hotel. Recomended for living around kuta
Radisson: Fantastic resort. Staff in all areas were amazing polite.  Closest beach is Padang Padang which can be walked to via beach at low tide or take the courtesy bus from resort. It is on a cliff so it is a lot of steps and a good climb back up. Breakfast had so many choices for all fussy eaters and coffee there is the best I’ve had in Bali. Italian restaurant on site has beautiful meals. Pool is super big and has plenty of choice positions to put your feet up. Cocktails are good. Great place to recover.

Besakih: The temple is very beautiful but be careful about 3 things 1- there is something called SAROUN which is a traditional cloth which is compulsory for you to visit the temple 2-if they told you there is a big ceremony today so you have to have tour guide they are just telling you…
Sacred: I've been here before but our friends hadn't so we enjoyed the walk through the forest and found the monkeys very entertaining.  It's also very clean and lots of staff around .
Kuta: Ok ,so Bali is a very nice place ,if you asking your self about a cost I will tell you that 200$ per a day should be ok ,if you are not a hard drinker . Motor bike rent should not cost you more then 6$ per day for a big bike (nmax) . If you wanna a rent a driver to drive you for…
Mount: If you areup for some adventure and trekking, get your good shoes on and bring a sweater, and climb the mountain with a local guide! I personally recommend the sunset - no early rising and waaay less people on the top :) Book it with Jero (Mount Batur Sunrise Tour, he has good…
Grandmas: I just leave the hotel on Monday (Oct 2015,26). The very first impression for me is a service, not only front desk officers but security guards too. Their service is GREAT !! the officers help me a lot about the information that I would like to know such as how can I buy Sala, an Indonesia local fruit, they just not tole me the name but they also told me the way to go there. Some people may think that this is what a good staff should do, but I feel the willingness from them when they help a tourist who needs help like me.  For the room, you have to use key card to access in the room and operate the electricity. The room is not too small for two person. The bed, pillow, towels, floor, and bathroom is clean and new. There is enough space to place my bag, hang my clothes. They also…
Radisson: I visited the resort with my mom in August 2018, just a few weeks after grand opening of the hotel. The hotel has a great pool and very spacious rooms with balcony. Breakfast is rich, served both in and outdoors.  To the beaches you need to take a motorbike, we walked 6km to dreamland beach, but the walk wasn’t in a pleasant area - I don’t recommend that. Cab back was 75k. Padang Padang beach is 15min walk and the hotel also provide shuttle to this beach and to the uluwatu temple.

Besakih: The temple is quite beautiful even it is not that great. But the so called guides who harass you at the entrance were really aggressive and didn't explain anything. He left us half through the visit. Really disappointed! But the view remains quite nice!
Sacred: The monkeys have rabies. Yes the forest is pretty, but it’s not worth the risk. Personally I nearly got bitten and was terrified enough.  Do not take your children here. Monkeys are wild animals, and shouldn’t be surrounded by all these tourists.
Kuta: Full of activities which you can do here. You can sun tan, swim, learn to surf, beach volleyball, water sports and etc.
Mount: We started from our hotel on the legion street at about 0130hrs and by approximately 0300hrs we started our trek.  I must tell you the trek was not one of the easy one as the distance you cover  and in the amount of time is no joke...its like we running to reach the top of the…
Grandmas: Clean, room was small but reasonable, comfortable bed with 2 extra soft pillows. Location is excellent and staff members were helpful always had smile on their faces. Rooms had lots of ants (do not leave left over food in the room) and check your bed before you lay in it. Otherwise worth of staying and breakfast not much choice.
Radisson: It was memorable moment stay in this resort. For the first, it's a new building with nice big pool and great architecture! We love to stay in our room, lovely parquet floor, nice bathroom, comfy bed and the best part is amazing view from our balcony! Our room is on the top floor of this resort, huge space of balcony with small gazebo and made well couch!  The service was sensational! Big thanks to Ms. Mirna to gave some recommendation places around the resort. She was paying attention with what our needs, from the beginning until checked out process, she was very helpful!!  The location it self, it's a bit far from main road, but what you need again if this resort offering everything that you need during you;re staying there. Shuttle bus to the beach : Checked!  Warm and hug…

Besakih: If you enjoy the Balinese culture and their Hindu religion, then this is a must. Have wanted to go there during my last few visits and finally made it. Just make sure you have someone on hand that knows the temple's (and the surrounding temples) history. There is a lot of beauty…
Sacred: This was our second visit our first in 2016. You have to pay to enter the Forrest. You are no longer able to feed the monkeys unlike 2016. Where you could purchase bananas to feed the monkeys.  There are guides throughout the Forrest. You still see plenty of monkeys. You are…
Kuta: I was told Bali Kuta beach is very nice place for relax and hang out. When me and my family reach there sitting on the beach admired the scenery, we were disturbed by the local hawkers constantly hard selling their surfing service. I know they need the business, but they are…
Mount: We were picked up by a driver at our hotel between 02:15 and 02:45 (Ubud area) and picked up another passengers. We then stopped at a small coffee shop on the outside of Ubud where we were offered a hot drink and waited for another bus to arrive (although this wasn’t documented…
Grandmas: You will get a chic, clean & comfortable bed room at Grandmas Legian..It is enough space for ending your day in Bali for you who wants to have an economic price. The hotel location is excellent..surrounding with many shops & restaurants. Suitable for young couple traveller without children..or if you bring children, you should booking more room..xtra bed is not available.
Radisson: Can not fault this place it is new an awesome place to feel relaxed. Staff were friendly and helpful and the food was great.. pool area is beautiful. Close interesting walking down beautiful cliff tops  to a beautiful beaches cant wait to visit again. Highly recommend.

Besakih: Stunning views and really gorgeous buildings. It is around 500-600 metres uphill from the main car park but in my opinion worth the walk. You have to pay 2000 rupiah to use the toilets there.
Sacred: The Monkey Forest is located south of Ubud Center, approx. 15 minute walk from Ubud Market / Ubud Palace. Entrance tickets are rather steep, 80k for adults and 60k for children.  The park is well facilitated with clear pathways, warning & information signs and directions. The…
Kuta: I loved walking along Kuta beach, the sunset was amazing and the atmosphere although full on from the locals wanting you to buy sunglasses, pendants, watches etc from them it was still fun to be a part of the bartering process...by the end of our stay they knew us all by name…
Mount: amazing sunrise with views of Batur lake and a panorama of the eastern part of the Island.The slope of the volcano is covered by black lava which is continues deep into the caldera.
Grandmas: Considering how affordable Grandmas is I was super impressed! They have a spa, didn't check it out, but a great offering. Breakfast included in daily rate and it was decent! Italian restaurant attached to hotel is amazing! Some seriously quality pizza if you are craving something other than Indonesian. Rooms are clean and modern, but very small. But if you are on a budget it's a legit spot to check out that's clean and safe :)
Radisson: Stayed for 4 nights recently and really enjoyed it. Staff all very helpful and the room and property was beautifully maintained.  The pool was amazing just lacked a view of the water (which is visible from the lobby)Food wise wefound the artichoke resturant not as good as Filini next door, and the service was friendly but a little slow! Location is a little far out and down a very long driveway but was a only a 20 min taxi to other popular beach clubs like OMNIA and Sunday’s. We enjoyed being out of the hustle and bustle as we had recently stayed in Seminyak. Room was lovely with big comfy bed, rainhead shower and bath. Overall was a great experience and would definitely come back in the future.

Besakih: Beware. Everyone tries to rip you off here, don't settle for less than 100k IDR for their mandatory tour guide. When they bring you to an alter and start praying for you, tell them you don't want any of it, and if they ask you for a final tip just say no and leave. The temple…
Sacred: Take your time to enjoy the walk around the monkey forest and enjoy interacting with the cheeky monkeys. Easy walk on well maintained paths. Beautiful gardens and temples to see.
Kuta: We landed in Bali on 16th May 2019 and we had planned for lot of things to do in the 7 days we planned to stay in Bali. Having never lived in a beach town and hardly ever visited the sea side I was thrilled to stay right in a hotel right opposite the Kuta beach. One thing i have…
Mount: Definitely worth the trip. The sunrise is incredible and the view is spectacular! Monkeys are at the top too! Booking with a guide I would say is best. The way up is pretty intense but lots of spots to rest along the way. The way down is hard as the rocks and sand gets very…
Grandmas: The hotel is located on a strategic place, with small price but comfortable and clean room. The staffs are kind and helpful. I chose the non breakfast room, so I can't comment about the breakfast there.
Radisson: View is little restricted due to location but you can easily access beach via short walk or shuttle....staff are excellent and breakfast was full of choices...do grab a torch and wonder the area and local shops

Besakih: Terrible does not cover it. "They" have desecrated a beautiful temple and made a mockery of religious meaning. From what I gather, "they" are some sort of local collective or council, that has set up a perfect racket to tap every last Rupia from tourists. This starts with the…
Sacred: We visited as part of a private tour, it is well presented and plenty of monkeys!! The monkeys are friendly a fun to watch, the forest is well signed and easy walking, well worth a visit
Kuta: The beach is well maintained all things considered, but the sheer number of people, the noise and the constant interruptions by hawkers, make this a less than relaxing place to hang out. Not the beach paradise that the tourism posters would have you believe.
Mount: The drive to the place is Through The villages and hence interesting... On reaching there we had sumptious Indonesian lunch at Chintamani restaurant... We didn't visit the volcano site ... rather climbed up to the rooftop of nearby building to have a Clear View of the volcano
Grandmas: The room is compleet and clean. The beach is walking distance away,and again the staff is verg nice.if you want or need in front of the hotel you can rent a motor,mobil or book a trip,also you can bring your laundry there.
Radisson: Hotel is excellent. However keep in mind that although the hotel description (Expedia) that it is offered “complimentary shuttle within 5 km and a beach shuttle”, the service is limited to Padang Padang beach and Uluwatu Temple; and you have to book 24 hours in advance. Heads up and always double check an information given by the staff. For example, on the check in, I received a shuttle timetable written that “no reservation required “ which is not accurate. So I ended up losing the shuttle due to the 24 hour booking rule.

Besakih: Every step will cost you, and since there is nothing else near you might start paying as you go, and by the time you realize it's not worth it you wasted too much already. First you pay to go in the national park, then you pay parking, then you have to rent something to cover…
Sacred: Worth seeing, but be prepared for crowded paths. And follow the official safety guidelines; you do not to be bitten by a wild monkey, do you?
Kuta: You walk down this beach and get offered everything drinks to sarongs. It's not the nicest beach in Bali but it has been cleaned up quiet a bit over the years. Major sellers down here, even if you just want a nice quiet walk on the beach, this is not the place to be.
Mount: This was the only disappointing activity I did on my 3 week Indonesia trip. It's totally overpriced (there's a mafia behind it and they will become very aggressive) and you'll end up hiking the mountain with crowds of other people (read: a line of people climbing up to the top).…
Grandmas: We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks, great central location, 200 metres from the beach. Very central at the end of Jalan Melasti. The rooms are clean, as are the bathrooms. Great customer service, and restaurant/bar on site. I am returning to this hotel for a second trip to Bali and would recommend this place to my friends.
Radisson: Stayed here last night with my partner, wasn’t sure what to expect as the Radissons in England where we’re from aren’t much to go by. The pleasant surprises just kept coming throughout our stay! Got to reception for check-in and the staff were lovely. The hotel buildings and surrounding areas are so sleek and modern, everything well-maintained. Everywhere we walked was clean, the floors, walls, surfaces in common areas and also in the actual room were all spotless. Pool area and restaurants were beautiful and relaxed. The room was very spacious and came with plenty of amenities: wide range of toiletries, beach bag, one touch service for ice etc to your door, a large, varied, and good-quality breakfast, free hotel transport to nearby tourist sights, to name a few! The shower was…

Besakih: The temple itself is beautiful, especially visited during the morning hours, before the crowds start to show up.  Unfortunately, even at the morning hours the touts are there to trick you to buy different things (guide, sarong, etc) because "you are not allowed in the temple…
Sacred: As an animal lover this place was great! the monkeys are in a very comfortable in that environment. For being "wild" they are pretty friendly with people. Be careful they will snatch your items if you are not careful
Kuta: Kuta Beach is being well looked after at the moment. It is great spot to come and see some street stalls and sit at one of the little beer stations - we LOVE Mr Egg's. Seats are provided and the atmosphere is generally buzzing. A great location to watch the sun go down and get…
Mount: We dined as we enjoyed the views of this volcano. There are very fertile areas, areas of black volcanic sand and a fantastic looking lake. The views are well worg visiting for.
Grandmas: The rooms aren't large but very clean and tidy. The staff are excellent. Very polite and helpful. The location is great. It is on the corner of JL Melasti and JL Legian so ideal to either head to Kuta ( leasuirely walk) also head off in the other direction to Seminyak.  If you need a taxi to get to restaurants out of the area, the most I usually have to pay is about $5 Australian. (That is for an approx. 20 minute trip)  Good place to stay and a big thank you to Luvi Dinata, one of the lovely staff.
Radisson: Agree with many of the reviews - great food, lovely staff etc - but no one has mentioned the elephant in the room - although you could easily fit 5 of 6 elephants in the room they are so big!  No I mean the fact that you actually have to stand in the shower cubicle to turn it on and there is no way to avoid the deluge of cold water drilling a hole in your head before it warms up!  But don't let that put you off. Everything else was first class and with the Holiday Escapes package which included breakfast, three lunches or dinners and two free drinks every day it was excellent value. Would absolutely recommend to people looking for a kid friendly (you won't get them out of the huge pool), stress free resort for a few days.

Besakih: Beautiful place!  You will need to ware a sarong and buy an official ticket to enter the place.  Have in mind that you can CHOOSE to have a guided visit or not.  If you feel a harassed keep walking towards the temple while saying NO firmly but smilingly... There is few…
Sacred: This place for sure is a must see in Ubud, totally exceeded my expectations. Great stone work everywhere, monkeys all over the place and a nice and clean forest to walk through. I just loved it ! I will be back some day, 100% recommended. NOTE: Please remember to DO NOT feed or…
Kuta: On the beachwalk you will find ice cold beer and cold drinks.The sellers are great fun and they park a chair under shady trees right on the beach.Going rate is 2 USD.
Mount: The sunrise trek on Mount Batur offers wonderful views on its surrounding landscapes and Mt Agung. The trek can be a little challenging depending on your level but remains relatively short (ca. 2h to go up). Would definitely recommend it.
Grandmas: The room we stayed in was apparently deluxe.. it was tiny and had very little privacy. The bathroom door was nearly see through; like, who wants to worry about their partner seeing them take a dump?... The room could be seen into from the hallway and the room opposite to us. So forget romantic naughty times here..  There were very few amenities and the amenities that were available were not replaced daily. We had to call to ask for them for replacement water, shower gel and toilet paper. The T.V also cut out one of the nights we stayed and did not come back on till morning.  At night, all you can hear is the traffic from Legian Street; it's really loud, more than you would expect from a hotel and hear loud tourists voices echo through the usually loud hallways. Don't expect much…
Radisson: Perfect pool, perfect breakfast, Nice rooms, Nice staff! We really enjoyed our beautiful room at radisson blue. We definitly Will come back to this hotel. Also Nice that they have a Great spa with a Nice shop in the resort.

Besakih: Entrance Fee are 15.000 Regular Price. But you need a guide. Big LOL They ask 25 Euro or Dollar what a shame!!!!! DO IT ON YOU OWN. At least he get 100.000 but I think 50.000 would be enough. You need of course a sarung 10.000.  As Tourist you accept it.  Then they sell Offering…
Sacred: We went here in the morning hours.  Not too many visitors, so we had enough time and opportunity to see these little bandits.
Kuta: Good beach with clear water. Definitely visit there. Surrounded by good restaurants and market. One can easily enjoy the beach and food. View from beach is very nice.
Mount: No one tells you how hard this is until you are midway and dying !! It’s a good trek but one needs to be fit to get up to the top to see the sunrise on time. The terrain begins easy and then gets steep and full of lose rubbles which makes it hard to climb up. It’s also hard to…
Grandmas: Third time I have stayed here .it is central to all Kuta ,Legian area , staff are very friendly and now has a nice restaurant out the front door . Directly across the street from Commonwealth bank with shopping and eateries surrounding the hotel a five minute walk down Melasti street to the famous Kuta beach ... Price under $30.00Aust dollars a night ...hard to beat
Radisson: Short story: we had a great stay, and would like to come back!   Our room was spacious and clean, with view towards the ocean. Comfortable beds, pillows, even the bed sheets felt luxurious. Lovely bathroom with tropical and regular shower heads, large bathtub and soft, large towels.  Beautiful and thought through interior, both our room and the hotel itself. At night, the lighting and trees/plants surrounding the hotel gave a really nice atmosphere.  Nice pool with different types of sun beds. Staff frequently asked if we wanted more drinks or food.  Shuttle van to the Padang Padang beach was very practical as well.     Breakfast buffet was great. We especially loved the made to taste-omelette and pickled assorted vegetables.  At night, we enjoyed a glass of local red wine at…

Besakih: I had heard about the temple from different sources. Now that I've read some reviews here After having visited the temple I would have better Done that before.  The temple itself Is Kind of impressing. I would recommend visiting it in the evening hours where the Sun Is best for…
Sacred: Very well kept, clean, respectful and enjoyable opportunity to get up close to macaque monkeys.   Just remember they are not domesticated and you need to respect their space. Too many tourists trying to get selfies too close and getting themselves into bad situations.   Show…
Kuta: Kuta Beach is one of the prime locations in Bali and foreigners favorite beach. It is usually crowded and I usually dont like a crowded beach. There are many good beached around Bali and would suggest you to go there. But since, most people stay in Kuta, you can give this a try…
Mount: We arranged a private sunrise tour with our driver who arranged with a guide from the local area (I was told the guide must be a local). We left 30 mins before all the other tours started which was great.  There wasn’t too many people at the time which can cause a traffic jam…
Grandmas: I stayed here for 5 nights recently.  The place is immaculately clean which can be hard to find in budget hotels.  Rooms are small but well equipped. No pool however beach is 5 min walk.  Excellent excellent excellent
Radisson: We booked this hotel 3 hours before we were due to check in as the earthquake caused us to change our previous plans. The staff were extremely welcoming and the room is fantastic! As others have mentioned, the bed was the comfiest bed I have ever slept in and the curtains are black out so very peaceful nights sleep. The breakfast buffet is amazing! With so much choice and a wide range of drink selections too. We also ate in Filino the Italian restaurant one night which was expensive for Bali however was well worth the price for the food! The pool area is lovely and clean - not a blade of grass out of place! The bathroom facilities are also brilliant and toiletries are provided and smell amazing! Yes, the service round the pool is a little slow, however the bar is a 30 second…

Besakih: Be aware of this temple, if you can just avoid coming here. I and my boyfriend came here on Sept 3, 2016. From the entrance some guys stopped us and ask to buy tickets, the entrance tickets were ok IDR15.000 or EUR 1 per person, then they started to threaten and trapped us. In…
Sacred: Monkeys. Everywhere... In the trees, on the roof tops, crossing the road, in your back-pack... everywhere.   Worth the admission price if monkeys are your thing. Recommend you heed the warnings from the staff - these cheeky critters will not hesitate to climb you like a tree in…
Kuta: Best Sunset View Ever, I got to chill out at Starbucks Kuta Beach, sip a chocolate coffee ice blend whilst chilling on the kuta beach check out sand fat bikes and horses riding around.
Mount: Was contacted Ari via WA +6281337443553 that passed by my cousin Michael, this was one of the top experiences we had in Bali during recent holiday. While the hike is a little bit tired by hiking 2 hours in the pick dark, luckily I have awesome guy Ari who leaded us us safety up…
Grandmas: The price is so cheap, so I didn't expect anything. But when I see the room, I was quite surprised. The room is very small but it's very clean and nice. Bathroom is also nice. I suggest you to choose the twin room because it has more space in the middle rather that having a double bed. The hotel itself is quite nice and clean. Location is great, near to Kuta, near to Seminyak. One thing that is not good is the noise coming from the road and the hotel isle.
Radisson: We were due to travel to the Gili islands but due to the earthquakes had to cancel, we booked this hotel one hour before arriving as it was a reasonable deal on Expedia. We were SO GLAD we did!!!! The pros: 1. The resort is brand new and it looks it! The grounds are immaculate and constantly being tended to 2. the rooms are fantastic and it was the best bed we have ever slept in! They are huge, great bathroom, excellent coffee facilities. The maid would leave a different treat each night such as cookies, candy etc  3. The pool area is wonderful and we enjoyed spending our mornings reading & relaxing.  4. The inclusive breakfast was the best we had during our 1 month trip to Bali!  5. Good location for discovering beaches like impossible beach   Cons: 1. They charge for bottled…

Besakih: With our balinese guide, we have learned the history of religious and clan temples which are unified in a amazing site, majestic and gigantic. The one to see !!!
Sacred: Entrance fee Adult 80K & child up to 12 $60k. Lovely to see monkeys in everyday life. Rangers/staff are around to provide information & ensure safety if you are concerned. Steep steps down to creek area. Worth a visit 1-2 hours.
Kuta: Nice beach - close to everything.  Good for water sports, chilling out & beach time. There are many vendors selling all manner of items on this beach - but most are happy to move on once you say No to what they are selling.  You can usually find yourself a nice spot to relax in…
Mount: First up, there are several variations on this tour catering for what you want and how much you want to spend. You can have a personal small group, +/- breakfast overlooking Kintamani, +/- visit to coffee plantation +/- walk around the full crater or budget larger groups.…
Grandmas: Worth your money value. I have stayed at Grandmas Legian many times and never dissapointed. Daily housekeeping, clean bed, showers, aircon and many satelite tv. Walkable to the beach to watch the beautiful sunset, walk to the main bars and clubs and man delicious restaurants. All the staff are always welcoming and helpful and always smiling and laughing.
Radisson: We stayed for five wonderful nights for our honeymoon. The room was big and spacious, the bed was comfortable and the balcony had just the right amount of privacy. The wifi was amazing, but the tv would lose reception fairly often (we were sick the first couple of days so lots of relaxing). The shower is amazing, the hose has so much pressure - it was sad to leave it! Strange large window looking out onto the walkway that you could see through, had the blind down the entire time. Good size bath with nice bath salts. Only major issue with the room was soundproofing! Could hear the people next door, and lots of footsteps above us which was pretty loud and all hours of the night. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, I don’t usually appreciate plants/gardens but I thought they…

Besakih: The temple is beautiful, but filled with fraudsters ... they are like no religion.. All if possible avoid this place!!!!!!!
Sacred: Worth while a visit allow about one and a half hours  We had no problems with the monkeys they kept themselves to themselves.
Kuta: This is a nice beach once you get past all the people harassing you for a surf board or taxi service on the way in. I’d recommend just bringing some towels and sit down by the water where you won’t be asked to buy much stuff, also I asked one of the local people there how much…
Mount: First off, I'm not a very experienced hiker. Before my travel to Bali I did some easy tracks in the French Jura Mountains or in the Swiss alps. But even for me this hike was a joke. There is a clear track marked by tons of rubbish, which makes it easy to find your way up.…
Grandmas: Location is very convenient, walking distance to the beach and shops, bars, restaurants. Upon late night arrival staff of the restaurant/bar in the corner outside was sitting around and smoking and thought it is a nice welcome to greet me (single female) with comments like "hey darling" asking me if I need company and whistling at me. Absolutely unacceptable and I already wished I could just turn around and stayed elsewhere. Security didn't bother to tell them off. Only when they noticed I actually enter the hotel they stopped. I felt very uncomfortable. When arriving, check in was quick but no one offered me assistance with my two bags and I just got pointed to my room and it was obvious having difficulties carrying my bags. Bedroom was fine and clean but the bathroom…
Radisson: My husband and I have just spent 5 blissful nights at the Radisson Blu in Uluwatu with our three little ones. We have been blown away by the level of service, hospitality, quality of food and kindness of all staff. We also indulged in several massages, which were divine. While all staff deserve a mention, Agus (restaurant manager) and Anton (food and beverage manager) went out of their way to ensure we all had a memorable time. Our kids loved hanging out at the bar too, watching in awe as they whipped up delicious food and cocktails. All of the bar staff were incredible with the kids too - so friendly and funny. The only suggestions we would have would be to offer at least one activity each day in the kids club (locally inspired) and maybe put glass balustrading up outside the…

Besakih: Temple is amazing but it's a shame it has turn into a business machine. So many guys hang around pretend to be an entrance official checking your tickets. They just want to get you to pay so they can take you on a tour around the temple complex. They will say that you can't…
Sacred: I understand why a lot of the reviews on this place are harsh. These are wild animals in an uncontrolled environment so obviously there are potential hazards in interacting with the monkeys. That being said, I’m so glad I had the chance to experience the sacred monkey Forrest.…
Kuta: Not the nicest beach to just hang out, sun tan and chill.  Vendors are out in full force on Kuta Beach and are very persistent.  I found it quite annoying actually...you have to tell them “No Thanks” several times before they move on.  The sand isn’t that nice either.  But it’s…
Mount: Mount Batur is an active volcano in Bali. The first documented eruption of Batur was in 1804, and it has been frequently active since then, most recently in 2000. The substantial lava field from the 1968 eruption is visible in the photograph.
Grandmas: Cleanliness was so great,housekeeping doing their job so great, receptionist working so fast, nice small room,just problem with phone signal if you stay inside of the room, while you stay inside you should turn on the wifi,they didn't provide smoking room
Radisson: Service was great- breakfast was delicious with friendly staff ! Large variety for dinner menu. Some rooms have got ocean view and the inside of the room is very clean. The location is not too bad (10 min drive from shops and restaurants) . Close to beach clubs .

Besakih: You need a sarong to enter this temple ( as with every temple) can rent or buy before you enter it's grounds.   It's an amazing tour along as you have a guide who gave us a brief history of how people come about to becoming a spiritual leaders, how these temples were build and…
Sacred: Our Driver named Made Rai was an excellent driver who doubled as a tour guide for the entire day .He even payed for water on our trip when ours was finished .After spending the day with him we knew so much more about Bali and the different tours we did in Ubud .I highly…
Kuta: We went to Kuta Beach on our final day in Bali to see a beach on the west side (we were in Sanur on east side) and since we were there during the day, there was none of the craziness that’s usually associated with Kuta during the evening. Although the beach was red flagged for…
Mount: Not something we see in Australia, so it was nice to hike up and experience it. It’s a solid hike, and a bit cold at the top. You almost forget that you are in Bali. Beautiful lush green surrounds. Lots of market gardens all around. The big lake looks beautiful, especially from…
Grandmas: The room is clean and the breakfast is good. Nice and friendly staff. Hotel location is perfect as I have to attend a conference in another hotel about 15 minutes walking distance but can be somewhat noisy at night.  However, the only complaint is that it does not have ironing facilities. They should have an iron available especially for business traveler.
Radisson: We just had 4 nts at Raddison Blu and loved our stay.. don’t usually go to big hotel chains in Bali but their was a good deal going so we jumped at it. Not disappointed at all. Room was big comfortable with Nice verandah and lounge. Breakfast was amazing. Staff were wonderful they always remembered yr name . Angus was always making sure we were happy. The Italian restaurant was amazing too. Chef Jerome was most accommodating in making sure we had the pasta dish we wanted which wasn’t on menu.. so good we went back the next nite.  Lots of comfortable day beds spread around pool area too.  They did have nice music being played around pool area which gave a lot of ambience now..  we could have stayed longer and found it hard to leave..

Besakih: I visited Besakih over 15-20 years ago with my family, where the place used to be swarming with tourists, absolutely gorgeous.. Now the temple looks like in need of real maintenance, moss and lichen growing on the stones, and hardly any tourists around.  They charge an…
Sacred: A must see and enjoy.  You enter their dominion and make sure you mind your steps and movements. Read all the warnings. And treat animals with respect and care. That's all.  Can do it on your own. Absolutely. No guides needed. The forest is packed with staff who are on every…
Kuta: Kuta Beach is close to Hard Rock Hotel and many other Hotels within walking distance!!  Many Access points to the Beach. Mostly clean...trouble free beach. Some VEndors on way and on beach with soem food available too. Not bad for day to take in a good Beach and soem Sun Rays!
Mount: We elected to do a sunrise tour where we watched the sunrise from a viewpoint overlooking lake Batur and Mt. Batur, then hiking up after everyone that had hiked up in the middle of the night was coming down, it was the right decision for our family!!!  We absolutely loved the…
Grandmas: Easy check in and check out. Room and toilet are clean and comfortable. There are twin/double room and triple room. Staffs are kind and helpful. Breakfast is delicious and there are 6 main menu which we can choose. Its great that the location is near to Kuta beach and among many restaurant and shopping street.
Radisson: Great place to stay! So clean and the staff were amazing. Being able to surf most days was a bonus also. We will definitely  be back to explore more of Uluwatu. Food was also amazing and fresh. Special touches like chocolate on the pillow were most welcome!

Besakih: Beautiful temple and views but a car entry fee, you have to buy sarongs which they try to sell at £5 each, They charge an entry fee to the temple per person! They force you to have a tour guide and make you pay $10 per person for one tour guide. So lets say there are four of you…
Sacred: Not a bad thing to do. It's cheap and close to Ubud centre with about 300 monkeys. You can walk there or go by scooter.
Kuta: Nice for enjoying beach , waves, sunbathing and surfing For chill nice to play  Running My kids always like to enjoy And sunset beautiful
Mount: My pickup was perfectly on time, and the trip north is fast and with a Bali driving specialist. After you receive your food and safety awareness speech with an introduction to your guides, off you go. Be prepared for pure hike. The guides are aware of everyone in the group and…
Grandmas: Friendly staff, nice hotel, but a bit noisy in the morning, as my room just beside the road side. We check in the middle of the night but the staff still greet us nicely. I like the interior, very cozy and simple.
Radisson: Myself and my partner stayed here for a night in August while visiting Uluwatu. Overall we had a good experience however it could’ve been improved.   Pros   The rooms are large and luxurious and the outdoor layout was very nice.  Amazing burgers at the pool and the best breakfast buffet I have had to date - it had everything!   Cons  The pool is massive and has potential to be a great outdoor space. However, there is one bar which is quite far away with little service from the staff. When service did arrive it was very slow which is frustrating. The pool was very quiet, making it quite awkward to talk. A bit of music would have made a huge difference.   The hotel was newly opened and this was quite evident. The juice bar was not open and the occupancy seemed low.

Besakih: I visited here while i following my local host where i stayed in the ritual of ngaben. to reach this temple for praying, you need to visit one temple below that i forgot the name. the amazing thing is that this temple fits perfectly with the mount agung as its background. im…
Sacred: Nice place to enjoy with the monkeys. A lot of monkeys. Very nice park with lot of big trees, better visit early in the morning, quiet and not too warm.
Kuta: If you visit Bali alone, like i did, Kuta beach its your place :) Friendly locals offering surfing lessons, beer, chairs and funny conversations :) great place for hang out!
Mount: I must admit that I had been too lazy to check much about the trip beforehand. I had just heard it is an easy trek. For me, definitely not so. See further down. It takes 1.5 hours to get to the first point, and another 25 minutes to get to the peak. The sunrise is beautiful from…
Grandmas: We stayed here as it was central to what we normally do when in Bali. It was close to money changers, laundry agents, Gloria jeans coffee house was another regular place visited by us. We are older people and found it very central and easy walking to whatever we wanted to do. The staff were extremely helpful especially when needed after a fall was had and staff from the hotel came down the street to help us back to the hotel.
Radisson: We always love the Radisson Blu and the same was the case for Uluwatu.  As the hotel is brand new everything is pristine, fresh and stunning. Loved the open air layout.  Pros: The super buffet breakfast was amazing and so much selection, rooms were great value and immaculate, big pool and plenty of loungers  Cons: It was weirdly quiet and it seemed like it wasn’t fully functioning yet e.g the juice bar by the pool we were keen to try was not open, the spa was not staffed when I went in and there is very little ambience around the place - almost needs a bit of music. We found ourselves almost whispering by the pool as felt awkward talking.  Service is SLOW and rare by the pool. Unlike other hotels we stayed at the waiters didn’t come around much to take drink/food orders - we…

Besakih: After I read all the reviews, I must say I was expecting worst   However , whoever didn't get a sarong , make sure you buy it for 50,000 not more as they start with 300,000  We paid tourism fees at the beginning , then we go to big the sarong and then we make a donation to the…
Sacred: We really enjoyed this place. Plenty to see aside from the funny little creatures. Temples, amazing trees and even burial grounds. In fact a grave was being dug while we were there, which was oddly interesting to see and read about.
Kuta: Nice beach, pretty clean, good surf, lots of cheap surf hire places, though quite alot of sellers with their bangles and trinkets that pester you on the beach and sometimes stick around ages even when you have said no thankyou 5 times already!!
Mount: What an easy and challenging trek in one go.... amazing experience with the group that was randomly put together as I was alone from my hotel. We had a couple who carried an year old baby and a five year old boy. They were so inspiring to see. While our guide was super friendly,…
Grandmas: Room and toilet are clean, beautiful and comfy. Great hospitality and service. Breakfast is delicious, especially the fried rice.. Yum! Strategic location, a lot of reataurants and spa near hotel. Also near Kuta Beach. Will definitely stay here again next time I come to Bali. :)
Radisson: New hotel so very peaceful and quiet. Beautiful designed and well laid out, lots of space. We stayed in an ocean view deluxe room but even one without a view would be great as you can walk around the hotel easily to see the view, especially from the bar in the lobby. We had the 5 night Luxury escapes package which was perfect. Not a lot to do around the area unless you’re into surfing but you can walk 15 minutes up the road to different cafes and warungs. Staff so helpful and welcoming. TV dropped in and out but that wasn’t a big deal. Beautiful sitting outside at night around the pool enjoying a cocktail and a meal.

Besakih: The reviews are right, local people hassling you and conning you. So many other beautiful temples in Bali.   Try going to Bratan, Taman ayun, Klungkung or Khehen for a quieter experience without the hassle. Sorry about spelling.
Sacred: I’ve never thought of myself as a person scared of monkeys, but this place really tests your limits. The animals are absolutely adorable and ya wanna just snuggle them, but then they get close to you and you no longer wish for snuggles. Do NOT bring bags when you visit as the…
Kuta: Good beach with cleaniness. There was shopping and art centre around. So many restaurants too were there around.
Mount: Thank you Mount Batur Sunrise Trekking for a memorable and wonderful adventures!  I contacted Gede, the owner, via email and WhatsApp and he was prompt with answering my questions and providing details of what was included and not included with price of the tour.   I was…
Grandmas: The location of the hotel is ideal to go anywhere. Stay in this region as it is cheaper than on Kuta beach and its just 10 mins walk to beach. You are able to get food around this area and walk to sky garden where all the Pubs and Clubs will be for about 15 to 20 mins?
Radisson: Stayed here for the first time, We had a room with oceans views would defiantly come back again. The staff were very good, I left a camera in the room on check out and the staff contacted me and returned it to me.

Besakih: Glad that we read before and were prepared for the rip off attempts. The temple offers lovely views but the experience is all ruined by shabby locals who sell their own Gods and religion to earn some bucks. Only instance where we hated Bali.
Sacred: We enjoyed watching the monkeys as they can be quite ornery or loving depending ;D What was most interesting to me was the beauty of the trees, temples and statues, especially the temple down below by the river. The roots of the trees hanging down creating curtains across the…
Kuta: Kuta beach is average as far as beaches go, there is allot of brocken coral which is a bit hard on the feet, there is no shade unless you buy a drink from the locals which you can then drink under their umbrella and sit on their chairs, you have to pay to use the bathroom, been…
Mount: I brought my 7 yo daughter to experience her first mountain hike and was really glad with the decision. The hike is excellent for my daughter with a perfect combo of easy trek and challenging climb.  I had an excellent guide recommended by our hotel (volcano terrace bali). Gede,…
Grandmas: Very good location... Near beach and not too far from airport.. My family enjoyed the breakfast here.. They really liked the natural design resto in grandmas legian,.. Staffs are nice and helpful... Even though the room is small, overall it's the nice place to stay.....
Radisson: Great new hotel, lovely staff, and good breakfast. Would have loved to be a bit closer to the beach. Uluwatu is however a bit quiet. It’s hard to get meter taxis here, since most of the trips are fixed rates.

Besakih: Very grand temple, it is one of the important temple of Bali as well. Mount Agung forms the backdrop of this temple, good for phototaking at any angle. Sarongs and a guide are needed as well, both are charged with a fee. The guide will use his best of knowledge to communicate in…
Sacred: You know what you’re going to get just based on the name but it’s still a treat. It’s amazing that right in the middle of the city there are a thousand monkeys in a natural habitat just being monkeys.  If you put yourself in the right place, they will get on your head, pick your…
Kuta: Kuta is a hot spot for a reason, whilst it is very busy - it literally has everything. Great food & drink. Cuisines from all over the globe. The beach at your doorstep and surfboards available for hire at your fingertips. My favourite is the sunset, it doesn’t get old! Here is a…
Mount: we booked a ticket along monkey forest street in Ubud. There were 19 people in the group and sadly 5 people were very very slow and almost give up in the middle way!! This meant our guides had to help them and for several times we had to wait long minutes until we felt very cold…
Grandmas: The location of the hotel is good, it's strategically located on Legian road, where you can walk to Kuta within 15-20 mins along the shopping streets, couldn't really find any good restaurants nearby though but if you walk to Kuta there's plenty over there.  The room is small, as expected because of the location and price, breakfast is ala carte based on the menu given but drinks are bottomless.  If you need extra pillow or towel you'll have to pay extra, IDR100,000 for one if I'm not mistaken. The hotel is situated on Legian road so expect some noise at night but thanks to the FREE EARBUD!
Radisson: An experience that I can remember for a long time. Friendly service and beautiful relaxing atmosphere with the view of the amazing Indian Ocean. Good foods big room and a standard that for sure to improve.

Besakih: Visiting the "Mother-Temple" is for sure worth it, but be aware it can easily end up in a rip off. We paid 10000 IRP as an entrance fee to be allowed to drive up to the parking lot, there we had to rent Saroongs for another 15000 per person. After that we've been guided to…
Sacred: What a lovely and cool place to be. The monkeys run freely in the area “semi-free ranged” as they are so called and it’s just a nice day to sit and watch them play and frolic.  Remember to keep all items to yourself or in your bag though. They are quick! But it was nice quiet…
Kuta: You would not need any extra cost for enjoying Kuta beach, if you are living in Kuta and areas around. Wide enough for sports and activities, secured and safe enough for family activities.  Together with my two sons and wife we spent two of our Bali evenings on Kuta beach. There…
Mount: I would like to thank Mr Bagus Arya and his uncle, Mr Ketut Sudarsana for being our awesome drivers cum tour guides during our stay in Bali. All through out they were friendly, accommodating  and caring giving surprises like getting us free wifi and water bottles in their…
Grandmas: This is a great little budget hotel in a good location. Its close to restaurants and shops plus a few minutes walk to the beach.  The room we had was quite small but as  we were only here for 1 night due to moving on to Ubud is was great. The hotel is quite new so everything is new and very clean. Breakfast was included and we had a choice of set meals to choose from. This was really good as well. I'd recommend this hotel no problem for a few days stay but theres no pool so if you want to lounge around then maybe try elsewhere.
Radisson: If you are looking for a calm and beautiful place in Bali, I recommend you Radisson Blue Uluwatu. Every morning when you wake up, you can hear the waves of the sea and smell the nature because this hotel is located on the cliff of the seaside and has beautiful plants everywhere in its area. The stuff is very friendly. Their smile and will give you a smile too :)

Besakih: This large temple complex is very impressive and beautiful.  There are three main temples (honoring Shiva, Brahma and Vishnu) as well as many smaller temples and family temples.  This is the 'mother temple' for the Balinese and central to worship.  A large funeral/purification…
Sacred: This monkey park was a bit of a let-down as it was basically just a small compound with nothing much to see other than monkeys. The few temples that were in the compound were not open to public and there were no information signboard to read and understand more about the…
Kuta: This was our first visit to Kuta Beach. It was beautiful, clean and had a good vibe. The water was warm and clear. We enjoyed drinks at some of the local bars and I tried my first fresh coconut water. It was delicious. The only downfall I would say was that the people looking…
Mount: We left our villa (in Kuta) around 1am and started the hike at around 4am and managed to reach the summit by 6am just in time to see the sunrise. It can be a relatively challenging hike if you have not exercising regularly. The view is amazing and it is very cold up there, do…
Grandmas: You get what you pay for. Basically a ibis budget hotel but it's clean and comfortable so can't really complain. The value for money is good and it is in good location to the beach, nightlife and shops. There is no outdoor pool which is a shame but it's to be expected as its so cheap
Radisson: Just had 5 nights at the Radisson. Had a great time. Hotel was beautiful. Really friendly staff.  I think it’s as good if not better than the luxury 5 star hotels in Nusa Dua I.e. Ritz, Sofitel etc. Food is exceptional. We even had an impromptu cooking class from head chef, Jerome. He was incredibly generous. Will be back next year for sure!!

Besakih: We hired an official guide to learn more about the temple and to be harrassed less. Unfortunately, our guide spoke only little english, had little to tell and even asked us to double our tip at the end of the tour, despite having already paid the official fee for both him and…
Sacred: Very affordable, very relaxing scenery, and the monkeys are very interesting to watch.  Monkeys are for the most part pretty calm but a monkey took my daughter's water bottle and another tried to take my hat so be aware of any loose items.  Right downtown ubud so very accessible…
Kuta: Its a decent beach if you don't mind hustlers in the shade and tourist all around. Not for the type that wants to enjoy genuine culture.
Mount: Even if you know, that you can climb on Mount Batur without guide, they don’t let you go. We wanted go at the morning, at 5am, but they stop us - six guys, not friendly at all, even oposite, I mean agresive guys, and no possibility to pass them. Entrence is 100.000 IDR per…
Grandmas: The location is the keypoint. It is located in the heart of Legian. You could go to the beach in a walking distance. There are lots of cafes and bistros around. Not to mention cute boutiques also.  Very recommended if you're looking for a nice, clean comfortable place with affordable price.
Radisson: The hotel is luxury, comfortable, friendly staff, clean and good facility. Also, breakfast is delicious with many options. Moreover, the bed is so comfortable. Especially, for Uluwatu is the best value for 5 stars hotel. I have been in Uluwatu 3 times with my wife but for the next trip I will take my child in Radisson blu hotel, which they have all the facilities for kids and adults

Besakih: To be frank, the temple is stunning and not to be missed when in Bali. What really takes away a lot from the experience is the frequent attempt to rip off tourists. After paying the official entrance fee of Rs.  15000 they stop you at a Bo oth telling that it's not allowed to…
Sacred: A lovely large area to see gray long tailed monkeys in their most bawse-like habitat. However, nearly got bit by an infant who wanted the sunglasses perched on my head. Fortunately I was able to shake him off without screaming bloody murder, but it did leave me a bit unsettled.
Kuta: Beach is very crowded, a lot of rubbish, water is for those with decent swimming ability as it is quite choppy. If you are looking to relax, this is the wrong place as every couple of minutes you are asked to buy something new.   Go for the experience, no other reason
Mount: I went on the hike today with my sister and it was not at all what I expected but it blew my mind. It is very challenging and rigorous. Also the tour started at 345am so it was pitch black other than a flash light. Our guide, Jay, was incredible. He knew the trail up inside and…
Grandmas: Its located near legian and seminyak.. Price was average and they have 3people bedroom (1single and 1double bed) They have spa and restaurant (italian) easy access to walk around kuta and legian..  If u stay here better to stay at  3rd floor when i stay in 1 floor its a lil bit noisy at night than when i stay at 3rd floor. But overall its great to stay here  Cheers, @balibackpacker
Radisson: This hotel is the ultimate relaxation. The moment my friend and I arrived we were relaxed. Checkin was great...our package included so many food drink and massage vouchers which were perfect for the week. Staff were AMAZING. super friendly. Super helpful and funny. A shout out to Arya who worked in Filinis. Totally made our night. So funny and his sense of humour was right up our alley.   The pool staff were incredible. They remembered us every day as did the breakfast people.   The facilities were awesome. Look honestly you can’t go wrong here.   If you go the pasta in filinis is to die for.

Besakih: Biggest temple in Bali placed at a very nice location. But we couldn't enter the main temple due to arrogant locals who didn't allow any tourist to cross the temple entrance unless one hires a "local guide" Not worth visiting due to inhospitable people
Sacred: Such an amazing experience to see monkeys roaming around freely - eating, sleeping playing etc this is a must do atleast once if ever in Ubud
Kuta: A very lively beach. Not for solitary strolls or for beach aide activities. Lots of vendors around who constantly call out to you selling hair braiding and Jewellery to beer and coconuts
Mount: Such a gorgeous trek!   I did it with a guide and a couple.  I found it easy but the couple in their mid 20s found it extremely difficult and needed to rest every 15 - 20 minutes both on the way up and down! I am also mid 20s but it became frustrating needing to stop all the…
Grandmas: I stayed here around April or May ( not sure anymore, sorry for late review ) for 2 days so I guess it was still brand new that time?   The room they provided to me was nice and simple, but still like it. But on my first morning staying there I was awaken by the strong smell of insect repellent in my room that made me hard to breath and need to went outside the room to breath . I have no idea where it came from and how it got into my room. On the second morning I still got the smell but not as strong as the first morning. It was weird to had that kind of smell in your room.   When I was staying there, they didnt have their own restaurant to provide breakfast and there was no room service that time. The breakfast menu was super simple, seems like they were having restaurant from…
Radisson: We arrived at the raddison blu and it had only been open for a little while. It is really beautiful, tranquil and relaxing. I felt so happy as soon as we arrived - we being my 5 year old son and myself. The staff were accommodating and friendly. The food was good. The gym was great as was the spa. If you want to relax this place is amazing. Fantastic free shuttles services to the temple and the beach. A couple of points to mention - there is NOT a kids club in the traditional sense of the word. There is a kids ROOM. Which I was disappointed about because I had enquired specifically about this before we booked and was told there was a kids club.Babysitters are only $25 AUD for 3 hours.  The TV channel rarely work however the internet is fantastic. I would love to go back…

Besakih: The temple is really beautiful. The only problem is the locals. They make it difficult if you want to walk around alone. They insist on you having what they call their guides guardians. I went early in the morning 9am and it wasn't so bad. I say if you visit go early morning.…
Sacred: Relaxing day inside park. There is many footpaths around, with monkeys on every corner. Take as many pictures as you can, as they don't repeat it. Worth to see.
Kuta: Nice beach you can enjoy sunset with couple of bintangs or just surf. Board with instructor about 10 usd, Local beer 3 usd. Massage in nearby SPA 10 usd/ hour.
Mount: Mount  and the Lake Batur are famous places of Bali. The view is amazing and there are a lot of tourists. One of the best place to take photos of nice landscape in Bali. Which made our experience even better.
Grandmas: Great central stay for arrival/depature in Bali. Clean, good breakfast and spa facility. Only five minute walk to the beach, which was also a great plus during our short stay. Good food just around the corner and just enough distance from the busy nightlife of Jalan Legian.
Radisson: The raddison blu was so beautiful! It was so modern and pretty. It was strange though, because there was heaps of power outages, and I got stuck in the lift without my phone and the lift dropped and was very scary. I was stuck in there for 2 minutes, not long but very scary. It was stunning, but odd neighbours, who were shouting at each other and came into our room looking for me (12 year old) and asking me to stop crying, even though there was no noise. That is not the hotels fault, its just they were probs on drugs or something. The pool was SO PRETTY and so amazing! They had the nicest staff and the nicest restaurants. Thanks rbu.

Besakih: Beautiful location on the slopes of Mt Agung - said to be the most holiest of holy places in Bali - lovenly referred at "the mother temple/s". On arriving there with our Balinese driver we were rushed upon by children wanting to sell us umbrellas and sarongs, others their guide…
Sacred: We headed to the monkey forest early (they just opened) and this was a good time to go as not many people were there and the monkeys were being fed. We saw little babies, feeding and plenty of monkey action! The walk through the forest area to a temple and a very ancient looking…
Kuta: We walked from Legian beach to Kuta beach and we were shocked at the level of pollution. We were told it was even worse before but it is just appalling and a reminder to treat our planet better. Lots of plastic trash on the beach and in the water, not appealing at all. Kuta…
Mount: This was one of the best experiences I’ve had during my Southeast Asia Trip. We left our apartment at around 2 am in the morning. We booked a tour with a group of 8-11. Its better to go with someone who knows the surroundings as it is very dark. We arrived after 2 hours climbing…
Grandmas: love this place! very clean, room equipped with an international channel tv, fast wifi and the staff are really friendly and informative!:) And don't forget the super relaxing spa and the yummy italian restaurant in the lobby. Totally worth it and will love to come back soon! keep up the good work!:)
Radisson: Great location with easy access to surrounding sites and attractions. Restaurants service amazing food, staff are friendly and very accommodating. Outstanding views of surrounding area, everything you need in one place
